Thank you for provided such outstanding customer service; Enjoyed stopping here all week on my business trip. Reviews: Bevmo is the spot for all of your liquor needs. Great wine and beer selections and their prices are great. I like shopping the end caps for all the promotional deals and featured beverages.; There's not as much variety as  Total Wine, but there's still plenty to keep you there for hours! It was clean, and the employees all greeted me. Checkout person really helped me out. Got me signed up for their club membership, so I got a bottle of wine and the second bottle for 5 cents!; There is a Total Wine and More 6 minutes away from this location, save your time and frustration and just go there instead! They have better selection and better customer service anyway. I went to this BevMo and purchased a Monster energy drink, a Redbull, a cigar, and a Jaeger shooter. Made it all the way back home (30 minutes later) and the Jeager is not in the bag??? Tore the car apart to make sure it didn’t end up under a seat or something during the drive and called the store 5 times to see if they have it there but apparently everyone was too busy to answer my calls…. I will not be returning.; I’ve been ghosted by the gopuff warehouse a couple times .. this is unacceptable.. correct your hours or hire people that work! Wasting good people’s time and money !! Done come here from 9pm-9am almost guarantee you won’t get it … even though they say 24hr … trash . 🗑️; BevMo, it's not a bad place they got a lot of assortments of everything there. I just went  looking for Shasta ginger ale which they didn't have so I left.

Name: Trevor's Liquor
Address: 7340 E McDowell Rd, Scottsdale, AZ 85257, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 7340 (street_number); East McDowell Road (route); South Scottsdale (neighborhood); Scottsdale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85257 (postal_code); 3502 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
First off I would like to say that this place looks amazing and has an incredible selection.
We stopped in for a late lunch and drinks and overall was really impressed! The old fashioned was on point and the charcuterie board and chicken cesar salad was good as well.
My only complaint is in regards to one of the food runners which offered more toast points for the charcuterie board, which we asked our server (who was great by the way) to grab for us. When we got the bill we were charged an additional 4 dollars for them.  If I could only deduct a fraction of a star I would but this place is already pretty expensive so I feel like it was a little ingenious and didn't want it to be anything other than a minor annoyance on an otherwise great time.
Overall I would recommend this business; This is where it all started for them. Great location to get local support. The selection of spirits and beer are great the the wine is good. The walk in Himidor for cigars is well stocked and has great selection as well. The bar area is nice for what it is. Over all not a bad place at all. The service is hit and miss and some of the staff seem lost.; Stopped here while staying in Scottsdale.  They have everything you need, including vacation friendly sizes of most products, a wide variety of beverages, including mixers, even bottled water.  I asked where I could get fresh limes and they had them in the store!  Very helpful salespeople.  Great experience.; Excellent place in the heart of Scottsdale!  They have a great selection of beer, liquor, cigars and they even have food trucks! Awesome outdoor patios with plenty of seating. Came here with a few friends and socialized over some drinks and cigars. Had an amazing time and definitely recommend this place!; The place is awesome. I can't say enough.
Great place to grab a drink and hangout. If you're just looking for drinks to go, this place has a HUGE selection.
Do yourself a favor and check this place out.
Heads up, if you're looking for the pizza you are going to need to head to the Scottsdale location.
This location does seem to always have food trucks outside though.

Address Components: 7129 (street_number); East Shea Boulevard (route); Central Scottsdale (neighborhood); Scottsdale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85254 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Large store with a huge variety of wine, beer, soda, mixers, liquor, and glassware.  They have a growler area where you can fill your own with many varieties of beer to choose from.  The staff is very helpful and friendly.  Prices are mostly fair, but if you know your price points you can get some good deals.  Sign up free to become a member to take advantage of the prices.; Claims to price match Total Wine, but they won’t.

Act I: The BevMo Conundrum
Intrepid duo Sir Sip-a-Lot and Lady Liquorice stood before the towering shelves of BevMo, their eyes wide with anticipation. There it stood—the majestic 1.75-liter bottle of grapefruit-infused delight. But alas! The price tag read $32, which was more than a medieval dragon’s ransom. Sir Sip-a-Lot scratched his head, wondering if he’d accidentally stumbled into a gold-plated distillery.
“Fear not, Lady Liquorice!” he declared. “We shall seek refuge at Total Wine, where the prices flow like a gentle stream of budget-friendly nectar!”
And so, they galloped (okay, maybe staggered) to Total Wine, where the grapefruit gods smiled upon them. The same bottle—$24.99! Sir Sip-a-Lot did a little jig, and Lady Liquorice high-fived a passing mermaid. Victory was within their grasp!
Act II: The Price-Matching Paradox
Back at BevMo, our heroes presented their discovery. “Behold!” cried Sir Sip-a-Lot, waving the Total Wine receipt like a wizard’s scroll. “We demand price-matching!”
But the BevMo gatekeeper frowned. “Nay, noble imbibers!” he thundered. “This is not an online price! You must conjure an in-store price from thin air!”
Lady Liquorice raised an eyebrow. “In-store price?” she scoffed. “Do we look like wizards who can summon price tags at will?”
The gatekeeper remained unmoved. “Only with an in-store price shall the price-matching spell be cast!”
Act III: The Unexpected Twist
Our heroes huddled, their minds sharper than a freshly cut lemon wedge. “**What if we draw a grapefruit on parchment and label it 'In-Store Price?” suggested Sir Sip-a-Lot.; We went in to get some tequila for a party and the associates there were very polite and helpful. They explained the different processes used for different tequilas and recommended on a bottle keeping in mind our budget. They were not pushy just very helpful which I appreciate since I don't know much about alcohol at all.; Straightforward layout, good selection. Prices are a little higher than grocery stores.; What a great selection . Had everything we needed . Great store .

Reviews: I happened to be driving and I came across this store, I have shopped there before so I went in and purchased a bottle of Stella Rosa Blackberry sweet wine, which is always my go too from the grocery store but the Stella Rosa Black bottle is my favorite but they were out so this was my second choice. The next sweet wine is the Hoshi Plum wine which is a sweet full bodied wine with the flavor of ripe plums and it can't ever be a wrong choice. The last purchase is a Sho Chiku Bai, Nigori unfiltered Saki, Silky Mild flavor, to pair along with the Saki I brought Sapporo beer. I will pour a shot of the Saki into the glass that has  some of the chilled beer in it. It pairs nicely with Sushi or any Asian food to make a meal something special and memorable. I love Total Wine and more and all I need now is a wine bottle holder for all the other liquors I plan on collecting.; Nothing like this liquor store out East. It’s one of a kind you have to visit. Has every beverage you could possible want. High end liquor to bargain deals. Beer cooler and lots of choices. The wine racks are amazing with wine sorted by type. Can spend hours just looking. Tasting events hosted by real connoisseurs. Check out faster than the grocery store. Plenty of help to assist with you selection.; Great assortment and employees were very nice.; Clean store, excellent selection, helpful friendly staff.  If you are looking for very, very expensive alcohol they have some. The prices on everyday drinks are ok but for many common drinks, Walmart is a better price.  Kind of a pain to park nearby on a busy evening but they have carts if you need one.; Wow! What a selection of alcohol! From high end to low end. They must have a million (okay, probably not that many) different kinds of beer. Prices are awesome! Love that there's so many choices of little bottles. We bought several to see if we'd buy it in a bigger bottle. Friendly staff.

Reviews: Love this place! We don't have one near where we live, so I go there any time I see one. Love the selection and the prices!; The manager Linda is absolutely amazingly friendly and goes above and beyond for her customers. After leaving the store one night we couldn’t find my boyfriends sunglasses and thought maybe someone had taken them off the back of his hat while we were shopping. We went in and asked for a manager and were promptly met by Linda who understood our concerns and immediately pulled up camera footage to see if we could see anything. We spent about 15 mins looking at the footage and couldn’t tell if he was wearing them when he walked in. She offered to take our number and call if they turned up. After getting back to the car we found them wedged under the seat, and went back in to let her know and to thank her for helping us. She was so friendly even after we told her we just essentially wasted her time because we found them. She didn’t hesitate to smile and make us feel welcome.; Very friendly and helpful staff. They stopped stocking a wine I loved so they special ordered it in for me. Best prices too!; Don’t be mislead by its name. They do have countless wines but all the liquors, beers, mixers are all in one place. It’s such eye-opening experience if you are first time there to be shocked the variety of alcohols I don’t know for decades.; It would be great if they made allocated bourbons more accessible for mid level customers. I'm 3 hours away from the Valley and don't have the opportunity to shop there as often as I like. But, I do spend money when I do. The bourbon selection is above average and the Scotch selection is good. The employees do try to steer you to their brands as much as possible.

Name: Total Wine & More
Address: 8544 S Emerald Dr, Tempe, AZ 85284, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 8544 (street_number); South Emerald Drive (route); South Tempe (neighborhood); Tempe (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85284 (postal_code)
Reviews:
**If you have step children, do not bring them in the store with you**

I saw a TikTok about the pumpkin flavored Buzzball Biggies so naturally I had to pick one up. Of course they’re out of stock, but no big deal, I decide on the mango one instead. Wait in line to pay for it, the cashier asks me for my ID, no problem. She then points at the 11 year old with me and asks “is she yours?”
I’m kinda taken aback and let her know that she’s my step daughter. She then proceeds to call for a supervisor for an ID check.
The supervisor comes over, the cashier says “she’s her step daughter”, and the supervisor looks at me and says they can’t serve me. I say “you ID children????” And the supervisor then proceeds to tell me “well if she was yours then we could, but she’s not.”
I’ve never been so offended. For someone to tell me that in front of her is beyond disgusting.

The Total Wine policy states “ To help in this effort, we don’t allow any person under the age of 21 to enter our store unless accompanied by an adult guardian of legal drinking age*. All parties in a group may be required to present identification. If you appear to be age 30 or under, our team members will ask for identification to ensure we are doing everything we can to prevent sales to minors. It’s our responsibility to our neighbors and the community.

*Please note: In Indiana, individuals under the age of 21 are not permitted in the store”

So if they let me enter the store with her, why would I not be allowed to purchase anything? If I’m allowed in the store with her, then by Total Wine’s policy, I’m her adult guardian of legal drinking age.
If parental rights need to be verified, maybe post that somewhere.
As a step parent, I’ve done and am doing everything to be the parent for MY CHILDREN and I have never been so disrespected by anyone for being a step parent.; My first visit to a Total Wine & More and I was amazed at the inventory they carry! It was fun going up and down the aisles  seeing all the selections to choose from, you name it, they have it. The staff was friendly and very helpful.  I highly recommend for your adult beverage wants,  needs, and discoveries!; First time experiencing racism in America. Sept 27th, around 6 pm PST. I go pick a couple of bottles of wine after 5 mins of shopping around. I come to the counter to pay for it. I am told to wait for the manager to arrive because apparently I was colluding with a friend to purchase more than what is allowed for a single party. Turns out this "friend" is another person of the same race as I, who was talking to another person of the same race. So I guess all people of my race look alike. This manager was perhaps was the most condescending, rude and incompetent person I have ever encountered. She even mocked my protests to my face. The store clerk is witness to all of this. I wonder if she makes the same association with every other races. If people of the same race are in the store at the same time, she will consider them all one party?

I can't believe the gall of this manager to double down on her mistake rather than make a concession that she could be wrong. She falsely accuses me, patronizes me by saying that she knows I am colluding with a friend, talks down to me, mock me and then expect me to be completely calm about the whole thing.

I came back home and curled up and felt a knot in my stomach for 3 hours and even after 24 hours, I am still in a dazed state. This wasn't even overt racism, I cannot imagine what other folks who face racism on a daily basis have to go through.

I am sure your business will run just fine even with my justified outburst in this review and I understand racism isn't illegal in America. I am just disappointed that this will continue to happen. If anyone from Total Wine management sees this post, please investigate it. You have cameras in the entire place, I know you are required by law to keep video recordings for a certain period of time.; The staff was absolutely wonderful and very helpful to me. Have a blessed remainder of your week and a wonderful weekend. Thank you for your care 😇🙏🏻❤️🤗💃🏽.; Great selection and helpful staff! Bourbon samples that steered  me into purchasing the Wolcott Rickhouse Reserve(salesman had to get one of the electric lift carts to get one of the last bottles)...

Name: Total Wine & More

Reviews:
Great liquor store with a good selection of beer, wine and spirits. They offer tastings depending on the day too. You can also sign up for different classes to teach you more about wine and spirits. They even send out coupons occasionally.; SUSAN DESERVES 5 STARS…I love this wine store, anytime I am picking up a wine I make sure to come here for so many reasons but the one I want to highlight is Susan. Susan is so kind, attentive, cares about customers and takes her time with you when you are asking any questions. Customer service like this is hard to find these days! Don't give another store your business Because this place is it!; We absolutely love coming here for the wine classes.  They are all a little bit different, and you get a different experience with each instructor.  Having somebody on hand at the store who can teach you and is also passionate about wine is wonderful.  I always know that when I come to total wine. I will find exactly what i'm looking for.  I love using the app and having access to the rewards system, which gives me discounts in the store.  I feel fortunate to live so close to a great store filled with wonderful people who I have come to know since starting my wine education journey.  They also have free delivery on orders over $79, which can be a really nice benefit. When you just don't feel like driving out to get a case for your next party.  Their delivery people are professional and check I d so I feel like they're responsible which I like.  Thank you total wine for making sure that your employee's training is 1 of your top priorities.; Store is amazing, clean, huge, has a beautiful selection of everything, fun minis, and great pricing.

Meah is an unfriendly and discourteous individual working the register who doesn’t like her job, as far as I can tell.
It’s a a shame the experience can be ruined by one nasty employee.; I visited Total Wine on Monday and had an excellent experience, thanks to Matthew.

Matthew took the time to understand my preferences and offered several well-informed recommendations that turned out to be perfect choices. He was patient, approachable, and clearly passionate about Wine and helping customers find exactly what they need.

Matthew also helped me pick beautiful wine classes and a nice bottle of vodka.

Reviews:
A great store with great prices on wine. We especially love the weekend tasting table to try new wines. The staff is always super friendly and helpful. I feel like we have our own private sommelier.; Refused to sell me WATER. I came in with my boyfriend we were buying WATER and the cashier asked for ID. I didn’t have mine but he had his… she called a manager and they said they don’t allow people under 21 in the store, but there’s people walking around with their kids inside the store as well. I looked up their policy on their website, and this is what it said “ we don’t allow any person under the age of 21 to enter our store unless accompanied by an adult guardian of legal drinking age*” but even though he had his ID and I didn’t have mine, they still refuse to sell us water. So that being said, shouldn’t we be allowed to buy the water considering he had his ID? Or do you just not sell to any family coming in with their kids as well? Or do you just cherry pick who you will apply this rule to?; After attending a funeral for a friend, I decided to do the adult thing and unwind with some tequila. Since Fortaleza tequila is hard to find, I asked for help from the nearest associate. Cole, who was very knowledgeable about tequila and seemed to genuinely enjoy it, chatted with me for a moment before inviting me to sample a couple of his recommendations. I ended up purchasing two bottles that I’d never heard of but that I thoroughly enjoy.

At the cashier, Dakota, who was familiar with both bottles, further confirmed Cole's recommendations. Both Cole and Dakota went out of their way to be helpful and friendly, clearly showing their passion for what they do. I was in a better mood already and I hadn’t even opened my bottles yet.; Total Wine Spirits Beer and More in Gilbert is a must-visit! Marc, one of their knowledgeable staff members, made our wine tasting experience extraordinary. He introduced us to exceptional wines from Europe, and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The service and selection are fantastic. Highly recommended!; We have always had great service here. Now as our purchasing has changed,  we are glad to see a growing inventory of non-alcoholic options. Very friendly staff here!

The cashier ran back and forth from the doors to the checkout like a maniac three times. Then greeted me by calling me "Hey buddy"

And then gaslit me about someone I just saw spinning their tires in the parking lot by telling that it definitely didn't happen.

I was just there for beer like wow.; Be careful buying anything considered "rare" online from this store. Bevmo policy states that they are to hold online orders for 7 days for pickup before they release the product back to shelves. I was travelling for work and ordered an EH taylor bourbon for pickup upon my return. I received confirmation my order was picked and waiting for me. On day 5 out of 7, the store cancelled my order due to "unforeseen circumstances" AKA they sold my PAID FOR order out from under me. Customer service is unresponsive. What a shady way of doing business.; Want to give 5 stars but everytime I visit there's always an issue. Too much to post here but I'll keep coming back for now as they have my favorite beer, Spellbinder in small keg.; Love this bevmo plus I  can always find what I need to find at this location.  Whether it's wine or liquor. Most of the time I will find what I'm looking for. The prices are reasonable and it's a good location. Just watch out for the holiday season as you might find yourself without getting what it is that you need. They also have caviar in the glass counter at the front. Very reasonable price.  Mixes and juices are available so it can be a one stop shop.; I get better service and recommendations from circle k. I went in and took me 10 min to even find a team member that could help me. They couldn’t because they didn’t know wines and they couldn’t find anyone. I found a second employee and waited for them to finish up with what they were doing and then when we were en route to find wines I needed for my event, he stopped to help another customer with a keg and expected me to wait longer. Has customer service went away and it is to never return?  Everyone wants higher wages but do nothing to elevate their service. I was always raised to dress and assume the role you wanted. That went away… we are at everyone’s mercy and it’s take it or leave it. I didn’t get my wine cases as I do count on respect and customer service when it comes to spending money. The seven minutes it took me to drive 1.7 miles to total wine was worth it and more. They had great sales and their service was top notch. I was greeted immediately and someone was able to provide the recommendations for my cases. I will just bypass the closer option and get to total wine.

Reviews: Very large liquor store. I mean super large. Super friendly. Great selection of wine and spirits. Beautiful staff clean. Very helpful with information about anything you want to buy man. This is such an awesome liquor store. Thanks!; I don't drink but this place is so awesome. My fiancé gets the really great information about the samples and buys them happily. Easy to find the specific drinks and explore the rest. Staff has to be treated well since they are so great!; Super friendly staff but not a place to come for craft beer. Majority of what was cold was out of date, over half of the warm stored craft should never be warm stored. Big box beer store, stay away from craft or just check the dates, very disappointing.; Pretty good. Unfortunately, it seemed like they had shifted away all of the black strap rum, So I will have to go to another location to find that. Staff is really helpful and friendly at this location, though. The staff is extremely knowledgeable and most of the drinks have descriptive tags on the shelf to really what the product tastes like. I was in there today asking about different types of beer and the person helping me really knew their beer selection super well. I usually listen to their recommendations and is always a home run. Their customer service is awesome and it's part of the reason I keep coming back. Store itself is spotless super clean very well organized. They even have wine classes and other events there. Before covid, they would offer samples at times. They have a huge selection of soft drinks and Munchies as well. A side note, I can always count on their bathrooms to be very well kept and super clean. As far as prices, there's no need to look anywhere else they usually have the best prices on all the alcohol and beer..

Reviews:
Very nice market. From my own personal experience I think the store could offer better service if they had set deli hours like every other market in the world. 10-7 would be great and I would bet a paycheck that all the employees morale would move in the right direction, nothing like making a sub at 8:55 and having a line back to the end of the building, I feel this is actually a disservice to the customers and the employees as well. Not that my opinion matters, although there is a reason every supermarket, gas station, neighborhood market have actual deli department hours, mainly so they can provide a better experience and a higher level of professionalism and customer service.
This is a beautiful store and in time I'm sure they will iron out all the little details I just wonder how many good employees will quit rather than being run into the ground day in and day out; Cutest little find in walking distance!
Lotto, all the good choices of wines beers and liquor. Plus look at this menu and press coffee and cold brew on tap! Definitely will be back!; The Sunshine Market has been my neighborhood market since I was a little kid! After moving away and then moving back to Arizona, I’m glad to see that the Sunshine market is still there! While new owners have taken over, they’ve kept it a staple center in the Coronado district!; We were here on vacation and this was our “local store” around the corner. You have plenty of choice and at very reasonable price point. We asked for help on booking a taxi service back to the airport….Mandy was simply awesome assisting us. These days people are quick off the mark to complain about service well this “local store” goes above and beyond to help you. Great job👍; Went for a bottle of water, just thinking this place was a typical minimart. However, the small gourmet food section had me pause a minute to actually shop.

Reviews:
This place is awesome! Every thing you will need for a bar set up, party or get together. Great prices! You have questions, they have very friendly and knowledgeable staff! A must visit for literally any wine spirits and more!; This total wine is clean and organized. The staff is helpful and quick to offer a recommendation. They don't look to sell you the highest priced items but they look to provide you the best option for what taste you are looking for. Great selection and team!; This review is saddening. We normally have good experiences going to Total Wine. Not sure if it was discrimination because we're hispanic or simply because the person is filled with hate. We live near this location so we won't stop coming. However we had a bad experience with a staff member named Dan. They're probably late 30's early 40's Caucasian male. My brother had asked for help and the man told him he would send someone over since we wanted a tequila that was locked up. We were waiting for a bit and the staff called Dan was just at a register, they did not verbalize that they were doing anything else or let us know they were still trying to locate someone. We got help from a nice young man who passed by. My brother decided to tell Dan calmly that if he didn't want to help that is all he had to say. Dan got disgruntled and almost yelled saying he had instructed my brother to ask customer service for the bottle but the young gentleman that helped had to go get it. So please improve communication because we are not mind readers. If he in fact had asked for someone else to bring up the bottle he simply could have said so when we got to the register. He did not even acknowledge us when we were checking out. Also please have him be calm because feedback was provided in a respectful manner it was not yelled and no profanity was used. Dan should not work in customer service because you should never raise your voice or yell at a customer especially if that customer did not yell at you. We will come back because everyone else was nice and willing to help but we hope if we do see Dan, his customer service has improved.; The one star is for the employee Dan, a bald headed mid 40's looking older man, stoner blue eyes, that seem like he's had a mid life crisis, or is just unhappy with his life and has just given up on it.  I asked for help in purchasing a 1942 DonJulio tequila bottle, in which Dan said I will send an employee to help, however help never came, and it took the help of his coworker who saw me standing there to offer me the bottle. Once I checked out I saw Dan still just standing there doing nothing but looking at his computer and said to him that if he did not want to help out in the future to just say it and be clear, in which he became verbally abusive yelling saying he had put the bottle to the side, however he did not realize that his coworker is the one that got the bottle and brought it to the register while he just did nothing and lied like I didn't see it. Overall the store is nice and other staff is helpful and friendly. But I should advise that Dan control his temper not every customer will be as calm as me. I will give this store another try and hope for a better experience.; Love the store on Waddell and the 303 in Surprise, AZ. They have spirits I had to order online to get. The checkout was very good. She was so helpful with my account and what I have for rewards.
Definitely going back.

Additionally, the managers are inconsistent and put up a fight when asked to price match, which seems contrary to corporate policy and suggests a lack of training. My wife and I were amazed! (I think our dog was too) She got some pretty good treats from the dog friendly,helpful staff here.

Reviews:
Theft can't be this high.  A customer  shouldn't have to wait 15 minutes to buy 1 item. And then they only have self check out registers; The worst experience! I have a business and we were having a Youth Summer program so we ordered sub sandwiches 1 week in advance. The day of, I called to ensure everything was ok and the deli rep stated the sub was waiting on us. When I arrived, she casually stated it's not here and she didn't have time to make one. No apology! I had 30 minutes to find food for my class and get back before they finished the class.

I called the corporate office and they stated it was up to the store to compensate me. I called the store and they said they will compensate me by GIVING me the subs and I could pick it up the next day. I went the next day and a female manager stated they will take 20% off and they never told me that they would give it to me. She acted like I was trying to steal the subs. Never offered an apology and was rude.

I called the corporate office again, and they stated the district manager would contact me. He called and asked for my side then stated that he is hearing a totally different story from the store. He stated he would like to compensate me with a gift card or something so he will call me back. NEVER received a call.

I would not recommend this store for anything. Extremely unprofessional and rude.; WARNING:  Walmart has fasley accused and wrongfully sought criminal charges against people from all walks of stealing due to simple mistakes and technological errors.  This is based off of news articles that has been published and multiple lawsuits in the US and UK.  The self-checkout technology is not a reliable technology.  If you value your freedom and not to be fasley accused of stealing, stay clear of this store because there are no other options.; My rating is the result of a telephone conversation I had with someone identifying themselves as the 24th Street and Baseline "Store Manager". During the recent renovation of your 24th Street and Baseline location, several construction trailers were parked in the parking spots designated for disabled customers. When I emailed my question as to why the trailers couldn't be parked in the lot on the west side of the building. As a once frequent customer,
I noticed that this lot is least used by Wal-Mart customers.

I received a telephone call from someone stating he was the manager, and that Wal-Mart didn't decide where to park the trailers. It was the decision of the construction company.  Besides, the store provided several temporary disabled parking spaces in their regular parking to compensate for the "disabled" parking spaces that the construction trailers were using. He said that all I had to do was look for the orange buckets (???). He had a cavalier attitude of "What's the big deal!?" Further stating besides the construction company would ONLY be there for two to three weeks.

I explained:

1. The new parking spaces did not meet federal/state requirements. The law requires only one(1) handicap parking space in close proximity to the front entrance for every 25 parking spaces. The new temporary parking spaces were further than the online customers parking and the space designated police parking.

2. Why is Wal-Mart allowing a construction company to dictate where their trailer should be parked and, thereby, where Wal-Mart's disable customers cannot utilize spaces designated by law? Wal-Mart made it convenient for the company you're paying to do a construction job, and inconvenient for your customers who support your business? Make that make sense......

Clearly, Fry's valued their customers. Fry's, directly across the street, had construction and upgrade to their location during the same time period, and the construction trailers parked furthest from the front entrance.

Lack knowledge is not something I would hold against someone, however, his tone of voice and his attitude was the driving force in me writing this review.; I will not go to Walmart ever again
Walmart excepts us to scan our own items then bag our groceries and the prices just keep rising 😳.
It only has two Cashiers and most of the time they are not there. Always short staff, and I usually get my own cart from the parking lot
Very poor service

Address Components: 375 (street_number); West Continental Road (route); Green Valley Acres (neighborhood); Green Valley (locality); Pima County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85622 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Checked in at the kiosk for a vaccination. Waited 15 minutes and then stood in line at the counter to be told when you check in at the kiosk, you also have to let someone behind the counter know you’ve checked in. Nowhere on the kiosk does it state that. Why offer an electronic check-in if you still have to talk to someone in the pharmacy?  Way to keep up on technology, Walgreens.; Was at the photo center on Friday morning and the clerk was extremely friendly. She offered to help well into her break to assist me.  Very much appreciated.; was given misinformation on several times and today was told I would have to drive approximately 25 miles to pick it up at another Walgreens.  When talking to the pharmacy manager at the green valley Continental store there was no explanation has to pqast events and no indication that the manager would follow up.; A CAUTIONARY TALE FOR ALL FUTURE AND CURRENT CUSTOMERS.

On 3/18, my Dr. prescribed an anti-anxiety medication that I was already dependent on and that I needed ASAP, and said I could pick it up that day at the pharmacy. For unknown reasons, the pharmacy said there were delays in getting the prescription. I believed my last dose I had in my possession was for 8pm, so I needed to ensure I had another dose by the morning of 3/19 or I'd go into life-threatening withdrawal and would need to eventually check into the ER.  This made the situation critical.

I called the pharmacy and expressed the emergency nature of the situation, and was told there were insurance-related issues causing the delay. Despite offering to self-pay, that option was declined with no explanation. The technician then spoke with the pharmacist and assured me that the prescription would be prioritized, and assured me it would be ready by 7:10AM the next day, if I was the first customer.

At the time, I believed I would need it by then because my morning dose is 6-8AM. However, due to a work emergency, I couldn't follow through with this plan. THANK GOD I located ONE extra pill at home, which meant my next dose would be 3/19 2PM. Withdrawal would begin by around 8-9PM if I missed it. I'd have to go to the ER to be monitored since the withdrawal is so dangerous. This gave me EXTREME anxiety to be in this situation with so little wiggle room and so little transparency from the pharmacy. But all seemed OK from here. Was it? Nope.

I had a work emergency and could not show up early. But, guess what? It didn't matter anyway, because my script was not ready at 7:10. It wasn't even ready at 11AM.

At 11:15 AM on 3/19, I hadn't received the usual text notification that it was ready. I called and, inexplicably, it was still not ready -
no one could tell me why. This triggered extreme anxiety, to the point where I approached a panic attack and cried.

After calming myself and to avoid full-blown panic, I called the pharmacy again, reiterating the urgency of the situation (which I had done since the first call) and pleading for answers and action. Following a hold, I was told that the script would be ready within the next half-hour (why did I have to plead to get this answer?). I was relieved, but furious they were putting me through this. I was still crying.

I drove there and went inside. I asked for clarification from the pharmacist regarding why this had happened because I needed to make sure it would NEVER happen again. However, his response was dismissive and unapologetic, and said it was "it was not due until today". This was a lie. My Dr prescribed it for the day before. I asked why the tech had told me it would be ready at 7:10AM (which didn't happen) and he just said "the tech does not fill prescriptions, I do, he cannot tell you that". It was clear the pharmacist was just lying and had forgotten and/or not cared.

I made sure to let them know I'd leave this review of my experience and also let them know it was clear why they had many poor reviews and a very low score. After I had my script in hand, I said the to the pharmacist "F*** you very much, and I hope you have a bad day." This felt quite good :) I was already walking away out of the store and he yelled "If you're going to be an a**hole, I will call the police and have you arrested for trespassing". Clearly, a true professional. They had wronged me, not the other way around, and I had a right to express my frustration. He just wanted to be a d***. This pharmacist was around 6'2 with an African accent, just to be clear who this was. So look out.

Throughout this ordeal, the techs showed professionalism and empathy, providing help and support where they could amidst the chaos. They were great, and I made sure to express my gratitude for their assistance in-person. I feel bad they have to to work under such a crappy pharmacist.

I'll never use Walgreens again and had all my scripts transferred to another pharmacy. I HIGHLY ADVISE YOU STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE IF YOU CAN. THEY DO NOT CARE ABOUT YOU.; The pharmacy employees are generally polite and helpful when I visit. Evonne, the pharmacist who assisted me today, was sweet and attentive to be sure everything in my drive-thru order was accurate. The pharmacy team I’ve interacted with works swiftly and is extremely accurate. I don’t have any complaints and I prefer this pharmacy to the one nearest to my home. Well worth the drive for good service!

At this point I feel like I need compensation for a 20 minute job that took over 8.5 hours. Worst place to get service done for your vehicle. The last trip I made had similar problems for my other tire as I was skipped over in the system due to another “glitch”. At this point I feel targeted as other cars were in and out in no time. Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: Ste 108 (subpremise); 925 (street_number); West Baseline Road (route); South Tempe (neighborhood); Tempe (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85283 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I have been coming to this store for many years, since it is the closest one to my neighborhood. Lately a very grumpy, very rude and despotic woman has been working here. Today was the last straw for her mistreatment towards me, her name is Ann, at least that was the name she gave me, since she did not have a name tag on her. I decided to write this review, since I was not the only person who was disrespected with her arrogance, behind me there was another lady and a gentleman, who were also mistreated by Ann and the gentleman made the comment to me that the person serving was behaving very badly. Fortunately there was another lady serving who was very helpful and kind, who helped me to find another store that had my prescription available. Unfortunately I will have to change my prescriptions to another pharmacy, since I do not want to ruin my day by having to deal Ann
her excuse was that she is new to the store,  but that is not true since I have mentioned before,  today is not the first time she treats me with disrespect. I hope that someone gets on her attention before she keeps mistreating other customers.; Store seems clean and most of the staff is fairly friendly, have not used the pharmacy as of yet. Western Union is very quick and easy. The only strange thing is they have so many products under lock and key, even the body washes, have to admit, first time I've seen body wash for sale in a locked glass case. But if your item is locked away, they do have little buzzers by locked items so you don't have to go track someone down to help, which is nice. Could work on customer service at the front end as far as friendly customer engagement, parking lot a little narrow in places, but not a bad location. Will return if need be.; It may be a small store but full of extra values like better service , better attitude from employees and pharmacy area the best, personable.  Management always helpful beyond just nice.; Good customer service, nice environment. Just wish there will be music. Seems kind of mellow and depressing although the customer service was good and friendly. It doesn’t match the Aura of the store; I went in today I love love this store ! My favorite store near me but today I had the worst experience ever with the cashier ! Native looking girl didn’t know how to show respect nor talk to a customer the right way ! I felt very disrespected & walked in with a smile and walked out angry .

Name: Walmart Supercenter
Address: 1607 W Bethany Home Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85015, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 1607 (street_number); West Bethany Home Road (route); Alhambra (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85015 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I've been doing my grocery shopping online then they bring it out to your car when you arrive. It's super convenient and my order sometimes simple other orders are all over the place BUT my orders are always 100% perfect.; Well I was in search for some particular bicycle parts. I hadn't been in the store for at least 5 years and had forgotten how huge it was. I'm pretty sure they have just about anything you could imagine.
Anyway, Lenny a very tall "Greeter" at the entrance was informative and very helpful. Knew exactly where to send me but it was almost two blocks away, LOL.

Only thing that I didn't like was when I got to the section with my bike parts they were in a locked case. A very nice black girl had the key but between her accent and not knowing about various parts or questions I had it became a bit awkward.
She was standing between me and the case so I had to hand her the parts back and forth until I could figure out which ones were the right size for what I was looking for. She was very nice and I think she just didn't realize being between me and the merchandise was just making things more time-consuming.
Unfortunately that's the price we pay in today's society for all the people that don't feel they need to pay for anything.
Everything worked out well in the end and I give the store a thumbs up 👍.

Public bathrooms were available and handicapped accessible. Could have been a little cleaner but it was near closing time. Also a huge free parking lot surrounding the store which is all located on the first floor, everything handicapped accessible.; I was shopping for a few cleaning products. Found them quickly when to pay up front lines everywhere, so I decided to go to electronics to check out. The associate working electronics was very rude, but I thought to myself. Okay, everybody has a bad day. Let it go paid for my things when exiting the store on the grocery side. I should have gone around. Instead, I went through the entrance gates. I worked a 12-hour shift at work and was extremely tired. I push through the gate and apologize to the door greater, and before I could say anything, he started to curse me out. I never cursed at him at all. I admitted that I was in the wrong and apologized for it. I asked my friend if I was rude, and he said I was just extremely, but no. I was not rude at all. People make mistakes, and it takes a human being to admit they are wrong. I did not deserve to be treated that way, and the store really needs to look at their door greater more often and how to talk to people. Every time I go to this store, the associates are very unhappy and look and talk like they want to quit. If people are that unhappy at their job, then why go. This is the worst Walmart store in Phoenix, and I will not be going back. I will drive 50 miles to avoid this store. I will be calling the corporate office in the morning about how this stores associates are unhappy that they are driving my business and the people I know away. Still has not changed. Employees are rude and very unhappy.; Salem keep some of the items in stock. I also went to buy a Bic lighter from the and they told me I could not get it because they were building a gas station what does a lighter have to do with a gas station? There's nothing torn up in the parking lot to make a gas station. I have lighters galore and they're not selling it which doesn't make sense. They should continue to sell the item in the store until that gas station is made.; At Car dept
This girl employee looks like 80’s style is low functional for real!!!!!
She won’t give me the item febreze car smell because it’s come from box locked. She wants me to pay right way. Cleaning dept have same products and no locked box. What is different!!!???
I went front ask for manager. They never come more than 15 mins.  I told employees, you have poor manager.
Good job Tim

Name: Sam's Club
Address: 8340 W McDowell Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85037, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 8340 (street_number); West McDowell Road (route); Maryvale Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85037 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Sam's Club app for scan and go is by far the best thing ever! Cancelled my Costco membership just so I can avoid the crowded lines to checkout. Everything done through the app, no lines and you get your app QR scanned at the exit. That's it. Super quick and easy. Plus you get extra discounts using the app. Love it!; Sams app for tire center needs to be updated. It will let you choose different sizes that they don’t fit even if I select search by vehicle and select manufacturer tire size. I placed an order that took a week to arrive to the store and got a call saying that the tire size will not fit, no problem ! Re-order using the app with search by tire size based on manufacturer manual, took another week to get the tires and after they arrived they call me saying that those tires will not work because they will wear at high rotation or something, really!. finally the gentleman proceeded with setting up an appointment to get the tires mounted. After couple of days my appointment was at 11am so I send out my wife with a simple task just drop of the car to get the tires replaced, well they took more than 4hrs to find out that first they skipped her to get another vehicle repaired and not only that they damaged some of my wheel bolts so they couldn’t replace my tires and send my wife no to buy 1 wheel bolts but 15 !  My wife doesn’t speak English so it was difficult for her to communicate she decided to call me explaining what was going on so we call out the manager Isidro to help her he with high respect and professionalism got to an agreement that he will reimburse 50% of the money for the wheel bolts so they send out  my wife to get them in the same vehicle that they  damage the wheel bolts after a few hours later since it was to hard to get 15 pieces in a single store (they aren’t cheap almost $10 each).my wife came back to tire center they told here that they were already working with vehicle in the dock and that all of them had already removed the tires( which was a lie) so we decided to call out Isidro but he already was off and call out manager Gabriel I try to explain the situation obviously by cellphone and this is what he told me: it is unprofessional to talk to you on the phone and having your wife just walking from one side to the other and not possible to communicate with her, what is that supposed to mean?! Gabriel may need to get a training how to manage and control to resolve different situations like Isidro did. Well my wife and I had enough and decided to go back home it was a long day for her and a disappointment, I end up canceling the service. Took it to Big O Tires. I’m a member+ by the way.
Vehicle: 2018 Jeep Cherokee trailhawk; Went to the food court and it took some lady 40 minutes to get icee it most of us over 30 minutes just to get what we ordered. The black lady was patient but she had no help form the Mexican lady with one eye and when someone asked for the manager some white guy with messed up teeth came over and yelled at everyone to get in line rudely and walked off ignoring the everyone. Understaffed or not they definitely need better training.; I initially visited the store to have a flat tire repaired, a service I have previously received without issue as a Sam's Club member. Upon arrival, I was promptly checked in by Arthur, and everything seemed to be in order. However, when I returned to the store, Doug became my point of contact, and my experience took a turn for the worse.

Doug incorrectly asserted that I had not purchased my tires from Sam's Club and questioned my membership status, despite Arthur having checked me in without any problems. Doug further claimed that the store’s physical computers, running on an outdated Windows 95 operating system, could not locate my record, even though the iPad system showed my information without issue. His tone and demeanor were unprofessional and dismissive, suggesting that the fault lay with the system rather than providing a solution.

As a customer, I should not be burdened with internal system issues. Doug's inability to assist me with my flat tire repair on the same day, coupled with his suggestion that it would take three days to complete the service, was unacceptable. Frustrated, I contacted another Sam's Club location at 83rd Ave and Union Hills, where I received prompt and efficient service on the same day.

This experience has been disappointing and has led me to question the quality of service at the 8340 W McDowell Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85037 location. Doug's lack of customer service skills and unwillingness to assist me is concerning, and I hope this issue will be addressed to prevent similar experiences for other customers.; Like other low reviewers stated, unless you are using pay and go, avoid this store. Customer service is so poor. Including “supervisor “ Raeven who has the nastiest attitude. Everyone acts like they’re doing you a favor by doing their job. My husband also had a negative experience. Racist and rude all over

Name: Walmart Supercenter
Address: 9600 N Metro Pkwy W, Phoenix, AZ 85051, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 9600 (street_number); North Metro Parkway West (route); North Mountain Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85051 (postal_code)
Reviews:
What exactly is the purpose of designating two of your self checkout stations for “Spark Drivers” only? There were literally 60 people in line and 20% of your self checkouts are reserved. You realize this just slows down the entire line, including the Spark Drivers as they are also waiting in the same line. This is helping no one and inconveniencing everyone. Let’s have a little common sense.

And not only that, but you have an obvious backlog and make no accommodation to have any cashier lanes open.

And screw you with your 10pm COVID closing hours. It’s 2024. Also, your cart return racks are all over the damn place and I almost hit one as it was sticking 3ft into the next parking space.; Went to get a fan, and some food .there was only 1 left of WindMachine, so I got it home. Took it out of the box, and it's Flippin broken. It looks as if someone cut off the plastic of the surrounding cage of the blades. It sucks that I can't get to the store to exchange it until possibly Thursday 😕; This place is always very busy. To avoid crowds one should avoid weekend trips or late afternoons and evenings.

They don't always enforce the 15 items or less in the self checkout, and frequently you'll see several checkout areas down for repairs, which can lead to long waits in lines that can get pretty deep.

I use this place basically because their Pharmacy hasn't let me down like Fry's often has. I do have to remind the Pharmacy on the app weeks in advance. The automatic refill hasn't always been reliable, but the staff has been superb at helping me sort out the details to receive my prescription at another location.

I do believe that the staff does the best job they can under the circumstances, and what more can you ask for?; I've lived in this area for a while now. (Been in the greater PHX area for going on 30 years). This is the worst Walmart. I don't like doing negative reviews, but I was here yesterday to pick up a gift and a gift card on the way to a hospital to see a friend. Parking is always a hazard at this Walmart, and once I had what I needed, the lines for the self checkout were backed into the aisles 20+ people. Since I had a giftcard, I wanted to make sure it got loaded so I went to the regular cashier checkout lines which had 10+ people with carts packed full. The lady ahead of me told me the person in the jewelry department was helping people with small amounts of items. I thanked her and went to the jewelry department. I stood behind 2 people and waited 5 minutes for one man to complete his purchase, then another man quickly purchased his drinks. Then the staff switched out and an employee sent the cashier to open another register I believe and I finally completed my purchase. After that, I tried to get out but because the lines were so outrageously long, and I was weaving between people, I ended up on the wrong side of the enter/exit rails and had to ask a staff to open it for me. I asked the staff if they needed to check my receipt but they kind of blew me off, which makes sense since I had one bag I guess.

I will not be returning to that Walmart....; If I could give -5 I would. This location is terrible, I try to avoid it as much as I can but for some reason my pick up location got sent here today so here we are. I waited over 20min for my things to come out. The service is as bad as they get. It is absolutely unacceptable

Address Components: 6150 (street_number); South 35th Avenue (route); Laveen Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85041 (postal_code)
Reviews:
My daughter got an oil change, got home, went to work the next day early in the morning,  drove home in traffic,  smelled gas fumes.  Didn't know what was wrong.  She asked me to check her car,  it had oil coming out of the hood and she noticed it was leaking oil from bottom.  I opened hood.

They didn't put the oil cap back on.

She could have cracked her engine, or caught on fire in 116 degree weather.

I bought oil and a cap and took it back.  The first manager was not going to help,  the next one gave her a new oil change,  tried to clean up the mess.

Just beware. This place is questionable.; Takes too much time getting an item that is in a locked case.
This has happened more than once. One time it took at least 4 employees to get help with getting the item we needed. We kept getting the "runaround".  I finally went to the Service Desk and got some help. I understand the merchandise being locked up.
I don't understand why it takes so long to get help.
My granddaughter has been paying a higher price for baby formula elsewhere because she doesn't want to go through the time consuming hassle of getting the formula from the locked case.; Overall, pretty good. They let me exchange an item which I had purchased the wrong color and brand of without any hassle or extra runaround or hoops to jump through. But, a heads-up: Sunday evening is a HORRIBLE time to go!!! Many popular items are out of stock, and other shoppers bring their entire extended families and seem to just be wandering aimlessly, parking their carts in the middle of the aisles with their screaming kids inside as they browse shelves 50 feet away, completely oblivious to the fact that some other shoppers are just trying to get in and out as fast as possible. In the future, I'll be shopping at like 11am on a Tuesday!!! Hopefully the customer base will be smaller and a bit more aware of their surroundings at that time!!! Lol!; This is a fairly typical location.  I have been here on various days at random times over the past couple of weeks.  This store seems to have more people stocking shelves with carts in the middle of the aisle than other places.  It also takes longer to check out, even when compared to other Walmart stores.  The store is clean and the shelves are mostly stocked.  The staff is friendly.  I would recommend trying another location or brand if time is important to you.  I've been in line for a very long time and have a ways to go.; if i could give this store 0 stars i would. the people who fill delivery orders are quite lazy. nobody ever picks up the phone when you try to contact them and even when they do they are unhelpful and completely rude. Legit had a delivery order with declined items and come to find out those items were in the store and the person filling my order did not want to do their job.

Nice & Clean. It has a different layout, so I was lost the entire time. I had someone go get Undergarments & the associate took them to the register of her choice. While we were waiting at a different one for him to come back with them. We explained the situation to our cashier & she went to get them, but the first associate had a really bad attitude as if we were going to steal them. Our purchase was well over $200. We weren't going to steal $30 underwear. Everything else was nice.; Not a bad store for groceries and other shopping. But if you need help in any department you are in for a wait! The employees who carry the keys and are able to help have to cover multiple departments by themselves! Too much! It's even more hectic checking out now. Half the self checkouts are for members only and you have to pay for the privilege. Kinda messed up if you ask me!; The actual local store has amazing employees however the drivers that deliver for this store are horrible! They lie about delivering items and steal them, don't complete their jobs and delivery because of laziness understanding English and last follow instructions on delivering the items ordered! Please don't get Angel the delivery driver; This location is pretty small for a supercenter. The parking lot is small as well. It's a basic walmart, better at times to go at different times of the day. I went an early morning during the week and it was peaceful and not crowded but what I dislike is how certain things are locked up and you have to have an associate bring it up to self checkout. It's sad how we as grown people can't behave because it resorts to low trust. And with low trust, comes low patience and it makes someone not even want to shop here. I get the reasoning behind it but it's still unfortunate.; First best funny shopping experience ever. Enjoyed shopping with electronic cart 🛒 and survey every sections for this supermarket.

This branch area is not that big but various choices to select for all categories. Bread and bakery smells so nice. Crowed with normal people which a bit disappointed. Tourists and foreigner spotted which understandable what are they come here and looking for.

Most price tag is super cheap.

Special thanks to friendly staffs who keep my purchased stuffs that I forgot for me and don’t mind and we joked about it. The lady who supported to guide the way for me. The young boy who keep an eyes on emergency exit door. So many dumb people including me tried to walkthrough but he didn’t show any sign of annoying but polite to guide to everyone where is the right direction.

So many parking area.  ATM is available inside same as lotto.

PNC ATM is located outside Walmart but around parking area.

Some customers may smelly so beware.

In general, overall is pretty normal,cheap and ofc quality and grade also depends on price as well.

Will visit again to see 👀 rare items

I love this Walgreens! The staff is friendly and attentive. Their system for informed about my prescriptions is very efficient. But today they went above and beyond! I was trying to print very special pictures from my son's firefighter Family Night and was having problems. The photo person redid my botched photos at no cost. I have a CVS closer to me and their customer service is horrible. I'll stick to my Walgreens.; Waited over 20 minutes before the pharmacy tech came to the window, then rudely asked “Can I help you??” and had an attitude over having to help a customer. Just changed to CVS 👎🏼; Whoever is handling the pharmacy on holidays like 7/3 need to be a heck of a lot friendlier. We all understand it’s a holiday and y’all probably don’t want to work, but there no reason for the absolute mess and level of rudeness this am was. The first person, young lady hung up on me, second person looked like they’d rather kill themselves then help customers. Really miss the normal staff and if it wasn’t for them I’d be moving all of my prescription; Clearly someone works here that shouldn’t. Incredibly rude, been waiting for 5 days to get prescription in, and when asked about how long, clearly it was too much for her to say. “We’re really backed up and sorry delay”
Rather, a snide remark to how many people in front and clearly zero compassion. You’re in health care whether you like it or not. Care being key word. Dissapointed, and after this, never coming back; My doctor sent a prescription in for strep throat.

Pharmacist and tech were incredibly rude. Refused to give me an estimated pick up time. I obviously didn’t feel well and the customer service/compassion were absolutely horrific

Would rather cash pay to go to another pharmacy

Reviews: I just want to give a BIG thank you to Danny V. for helping my friend and I put a heavy crib in our car. He was polite the entire time and was patient while we went to get our car. The entire experience was amazing customer service, and I would definitely ask for his help at this Walmart again!!; Worst experience since covid. Nonsensical “store policy” now doesn’t allow customers to exit through automotive side door even if you’re parked in automotive parking lot which is utterly obnoxious, ridiculous and very unsafe in an emergency. Was made to walk all the way around the front exits in 110+ degree heat since garden center exit is also permanently closed just because some idiot decided to not allow customers to use certain exits. If I’m buying things at a store I am allowed to use any public exit available. Whoever is responsible should be held accountable to the highest degree. Will NOT be shopping at this place any more.; Had an appointment for a oil change car was driving fine when I went in 15 min after I pull out my brakes are scrubbing. Come on now ridiculous brakes don't go go from being ok to scrubbing bad that fast it's a progression.; I really like this location it's a little nicer they recently did the remodel so it's a lot more better looking than some of the other locations in the surrounding area. The staff is relatively friendly and it has to be a cleaner store than other Walmart said I go to. I suggest going early to shop for your goods because the afternoons and evenings get really busy. I don't see a lot of riff Raff in there like I do at other surrounding locations. I highly recommend this Walmart.; This is not the place where you want to order curbside pickup. Last time we ordered a pool for our kids and it said pick up available at 11am. We get there and it said out of stock. I get off the car to confirm and they had 3 pools on the aisle. This time we order regular size products but they end up putting everything in travel size and still charged us. Idk if the curbside employees are lacking or their lead is. They need to pick up the phase and straighten up. Hope they give people their correct stuff because so far it looks like they don’t. The other thing if something is heavy ask for help instead of being lazy. Sometimes people really need what they are buying!!

Reviews: Katrina has got to be the worst one in the pharmacy! Such a rude little attitude. My stomach turns every time I have to see her. Please give her customer service training. She needs to not have the huge chip on her shoulder every day at that register. She hates being there! She is rude to everyone! This is the 3rd complaint I've made on her. I have one customer I get medications there that won't change pharmacies. Go someplace else!; The little guy manager that works in the mornings is such a loser it’s weird. I don’t know his name & can’t tell you his ethnicity but he could be mid eastern or some type of latin-ish idk. But the dude has some extreme insecurities & I’ve never even spoke to the dude, yet he always accuses me of “stealing” which is weird because he only accuses me when I’m literally at the register? Literally at the register, trying to purchase items…and I go to that drug store almost every single day & literally spend hundreds of dollars there regularly. I’m guessing he may be just judging me by the way I look? Or there is something about me that makes him uncomfortable or insecure or something. I know pretty much all of the employees there & i was a regular customer. I just personally don’t like the guy, even before he accused me of stealing, I just got a really slimy vibe from him..just from over hearing him crack corny jokes with the employees & just his disposition in general I can just tell he is insecure about something, but I’ve never disrespected him. His voice is very high pitched & it sounds like he may be impotent & small-balled. Because he only has the balls to accuse me of stealing when I’m literally purchasing items at the register, when there is an audience. I think that may just be his little moment of glory so he can feel like a hero in front of the lil dum dum cashier girl, nothing against her, she’s just a little slow. But not as slow as harassing & accusing a regular customer who spends hundreds at your store. Literally no proof, I’m literally spending money at the register, but that’s his big opportunity to show the little girls he’s a hero despite the size of his….manhood. Not a bright guy. If I were “stealing” anything, why the heck would I go to the register & literally purchase things? Sometimes HUNDREDS of dollars!! I just can’t handle little dudes like him. He didn’t like the way I look or something & used me as an opportunity to show off for the dum dum girl. Like come on guy..you’re a manager at WALGREENS 🙄 do you get paid extra to accuse regulars of stealing? What did you gain? Im pretty sure the dum dum girl still isn’t attracted to you. I get that your job is bleak & that’s the most excitement you get on your little shift, but dude, your voice still sounds like a woman & you still spend your life working in a drug store. Bothering regular customers who spend money at your store isn’t impressive & will never change the fact that your job is bleak & you’re insecure. Did you get a raise? Did the dumdum girl seem impressed? Doubt it. You’re still bleak little man spending your days in a bleak little store. Good job though, you lost a customer just for your cute little moment of glory so you could feel like one of the big boys with testosterone. Put some bass in your damn voice next time you try to pretend you’re Superman. I literally thought you were a woman when I heard you. Congrats. Try to stretch that little moment of glory as long as you can..it’s basically the biggest hallmark of your life.; 1/5 stars specifically for the Pharmacy. I’ve been going to this Walgreens to pickup my prescriptions for over 2 years and never had a bad experience until about 5 months ago. Now every time I call I’m getting BAD ATTITUDE & SASS, and complete lies about there being issues with my prescriptions. If you don’t like your job then quit, don’t get every single person a HEADACHE when we are trying to fill our prescriptions at a PHARMACY! I’ve heard “insurance issue, didn’t receive your refill from doctor, no pre-authorization” and XYZ - then I ask HER again and she’s like ok it will be ready this afternoon with SUCH SASS & ATTITUDE - like are you MAD that I’m prescribed drugs lady????!!! Do you NOT want me to refill my prescriptions???? IM CONFUSED!??!?!? From now on I’m avoiding this pharmacy at all cost & the last straw for me was when I just called she said I needed a refill from my doctor I asked her to look again because that didn’t make sense I get hung up, I call back and a guy answers and RIGHT AWAY finds my prescription says there is no problem and come pick it up. WHAT THE HECK!??!? She needs to be fired because she clearly is finding joy in making paying customers practically beg her to refill there subscribed prescriptions!?!??; Kathryn is a awesome chick,she went out her way to get pizza I wanted that they had out of stock in the fridge..I even told her it wasn't a big deal however she found the Pizza anyhow🤌🫴pizza is life; This is to my fellow folks working at this Walgreens pharmacy. You guys are what every pharmacy department should follow. From being so professional to getting things done efficiently for us. If you guys reading this, thank you for all you do for me and my mother. You don’t know how much this means to us. Best pharmacy experiences ever to put on.

I will never forget the outstanding costumer service. The staff is always there to help and Kem is always so pleasant!!! My orders are always filled right away. And they always have my favorite wine in stock. I don't shop anywhere else for my cocktails and beverages.; When I visited the staff were very professional and courteous. I was looking for some beer from a specific brewery that they do not carry but none the less professional. They did have a ton of whiskey, bourbon, and rye that I've been looking for, so definitely a positive place for me to go back to. The only reason for a 4 star is because it's a much smaller store than I am used to. So until next time, stay cool, AZ.; Like all total wine locations the store is well kept and clean. so far the Eccentric has been my absolute Favorite - great price and great taste.

Reviews: Loren, in the Customer Service/Pick-up area was wonderful. Pleasant and consistent disposition with the 2 consumers I observed that were helped prior to my interaction with Loren. I do not typically have to go inside, but this location cancelled my Drive up for some reason, which made me not happy. I did not have time to interface with a manager to point blank ask why, but I was support very kindly by Loren. Again, consistently kind, helpful, and a delightful personality. Honestly, Loren was a gem, so, although, I had to venture in to get my fairly large order it was okay. I was unhappy, though, as the mystery continues, "why does Target continue to give consumers expired meats in their orders?" I have had it happen at another Target as well. It messes up Meal Planning for me.; We went target tonight to get a few things and Felix our cashier was so friendly i noticed how nice and sweet he was with the customer in front of us.. He was such a kind gentleman. . We enjoy this target your employees all seen to.be in great spirits like Felix was.. his smile radiated so bright.. Thank you Felix for being a really nice person.Target is lucky to have you . Forever a customer; I've been coming to this target for years, the staff is awesome namely Joe the cashier, and Jolene the Pizza Hut lady. She's really awesome and totally the highlight of my target trip, she's been making me pizza nearly every week for 2 years. Very friendly, professional, positive, really awesome lady. Great store, great pizza. Thanks Jolene you're amazing; Target at Tempe Marketplace is a fantastic shopping destination. The store is always clean, well-organized, and fully stocked with everything you need, from groceries to home goods. The layout makes it easy to find what you're looking for, and the staff is consistently friendly and helpful. Whether you're doing a quick run for essentials or browsing for something specific, the experience is always smooth and enjoyable. Plus, the location in Tempe Marketplace makes it convenient to grab a coffee or a bite to eat before or after shopping. It’s definitely one of my go-to spots in the area.; Spacious supermarket with various types of supplies to select. Helpful mind service and friendly staffs. Lively cashiers. Plenty of parking spots including curbside pick up. More benefits when become membership. Definitely shopping here again.

Reviews:
This Walgreens pharmacy is by far the least helpful of any Walgreens pharmacy in the valley. They refuse to transfer a script when my 24-hour Walgreens across town will. They hassle me and made me show my ID and gave me a hard time for trying to buy diabetic supplies for my girlfriend. They  wanted my ID, said my script was expired, I asked to buy over the counter. And then suddenly they were out of stock. I don't even know why I continue to bother coming back.; The Pharmacist is very helpful and friendly! Usually a 20 minute wait if you want to wait for the prescription. Whenever I have to wait I end up buying something unique and usually the seasonal aisle gets me in the mood for the holiday! There’s a lot of new diy nails with professional looking nail designs! The store has been doing some updates on the merchandising lately. I only wish that the outside were clean and paid attention to. Lots of cobwebs and stuff in the drive through and I didn’t want to touch the thing to send my money through. Hopefully the building owner or management can operate a pressure washer and make a HUGE difference! It needs to be inviting and clean so people want to come inside and shop! Your business is retail and located in a prime location in Mesa, why not take advantage of it? Thanks!; Larry, Erin And Lisa Are All Diligent, Hard-Working And Friendly At This Location.
Not busy. Great Place To Shop.; Visited the store today.  Low priced sale items.  Very clean.  Maria provided great customer service and the manager was very nice and helpful.; I had a difficult time getting my medication due to Dr's and state regulations but my pharmacy manager kept working on it until I was able to get what I needed at the price I needed.
