Address Components: 857 (street_number); North Dobson Road (route); Mesa Grande (neighborhood); Mesa (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85201 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Came to return merchandise. The store is backed up and they closed customer service early. I called customer care and they can not override the stores decision. I was advocating for myself and an elderly gentleman who had been waiting longer than me. The team lead, Rebecca, stated that she couldn’t help us. No consideration shown for our time or gas to get there. It would have taken 5 minutes to process my return and help that gentleman. I am only stating her name in case corporate needs to interview her about what was happening. This situation was really shameful in my opinion. Poor organization, poor decision making and horrible customer service. I will not come to this location again. I will more than likely use Amazon for all my future purchases because an this in store experience was beyond horrible and unnecessary. Customer Service closes normally at 8pm. I arrived a little before 7pm and the man had been waiting 15 minutes already. We are paying customers like anyone else. The overriding message is that purchases take priority over returns. I am honestly floored that this happened. Its not like they had an emergency situation or medical crisis happening. If you must go to Wal-Mart, I suggest you try another one.; Amazing employees here. From those that collect the carts, the door greeters to those working at customer service.
The MG that hired these people is on the ball.
Trinity at customer service went above and beyond.
I even went online and filled out the info on the walmart.com site about how wonderful Trinity is.
She handled each customer with care. She was calm with the nasty ones.
She definitely deserves something for this. Not many places have good employees like her.
Everyone I encountered was great.
Too bad we can't tip them. It's sad. Those who deserve a tip can't get one. Those that do nothing and are horrible at stores and restaurants deman tips. I wish I could have given Trinity a tip.; Hey everyone! I was pleasantly greeted by a wonderful employee named CJ. She was doing her job amazingly and made me feel welcomed in this wonderful store. She made me feel good and I can't wait to shop here now just because of how sweet she is.; ve done order pickup from this store three times, and EVERY SINGLE TIME it’s been an absolute disaster. I’m done. Waiting 20-60 minutes for an order is beyond unacceptable. People were literally getting out of their cars and walking to the door after being stuck for 45 minutes. Are you serious? Wasting people’s time and gas like that is disgraceful. And to make matters worse, when you finally get your order, the staff acts like it’s a burden to them—as if it’s my fault they can’t get it together. This Walmart is more interested in harassing customers for their receipts than actually running a functional pickup system. Stop policing people at the door and put more staff on pickup so this doesn’t keep happening. Fix this disaster.; Attempted to take my son to the dressing room, as he has hit a growth spurt and needed to buy him new pants that actually fit. While there, between 5-6 PM yesterday, an older associate who was folding clothes in the fitting room said they were closed for the day since there were no employees to work the fitting rooms. The employee confirmed she was working the fitting rooms, but was by herself(it is a one person position). Whether she legitimately couldn’t open the fitting room, or was being lazy, it appeared as if she did not care. She brushed us off, and her tone in response was filled with disgust that she had to talk to a customer. Let me be clear, this review is being written for the one single elderly employee who felt customers were beneath her. Otherwise, the store would have gotten 5 stars. Not in the mood to spend my money when the Karen treats me like I am less than her or bothering her, by asking to use a fitting room.

Reviews:
This location needs a new toilet seat in the women's handicap stall. The toilet seat is broken and hanging on by one screw! Someone with a disability is going to injure themselves on that seat one day!!

I also wish the pharmacy stayed open until 8pm on Saturday. During the work week it might be difficult for some to get to the pharmacy and hold off on picking up prescriptions until the weekend. Making it to the pharmacy by 6pm is sometimes not feasible after carpooling kids around all day on Saturday. There's just a comfort know you have until 8pm to pick up your meds.; I’ve had times that I get a voice mail telling me my prescription is ready and when I get there it is not ready. TODAY 6-8-24 I received a courtesy call from a real person, I think she said Veronica but I’m not sure, anyway she said my prescription was ready and it would be put back in the shelf if I didn’t pick it up by tomorrow. I told her I’d be there today. I went about 1/2 hr later and they said they were waiting for my Dr. approval. They didn’t even apologize, they acted like I made up the “ courtesy call”.; If you’re looking for a pharmacy that runs smoothly and has customer service, this is NOT the one.

Prefacing this by stating I’ll still be using this spot since it is right next to my house. BUT! The pharmacy seems clueless at times, and if not clueless then completely rude! I call to refill, they place me on hold 4x (10-15minutes) just to answer finally with an unwarranted attitude. This is almost every time.

Please get some people back there who know how to treat a customer or retrain ur current workers. I don’t write bad reviews unless it really stands out, and the lady today stood out.; Seriously the worst pharmacy customer service. I called yesterday for my prescription to be ready today and when I show up to get them they have no record of my call or my prescription. I let them know it was urgent and they still wouldn’t be ready for an hour and a half. This also happened last month and I thought it may have been a fluke but seem like a pattern now. Get it together.; Most serious problem: they printed SOMEONE ELSE'S LABEL on MY prescription bottle. Luckily, I received the right drug, and since I looked at the receipt but NOT the bottle (drugs looked like they always did), I didn't notice right away. So I received someone else's prescription info, including their name, their drug info, and their address. A CLEAR HIPPA violation.

The pharmacy dept. didn't seem too upset when we pointed it out, just muttered that they'd been having problems with the label printing for a while (for "a while"!).

More recently, checked in for a vaccine, using the QR code posted at the pharmacy, 30 minutes after check-in (25 min after appointment time), was told not to use the QR code, becase "the app doesn't work very well - you should just come up to the counter." Still took 15 more minutes to get called in for the vaccine (30 min after appointment time, with NO OTHER CUSTOMERS WAITING).

They are apparently chronically understaffed. YOU CAN'T RUN A BUSINESS THIS WAY!

Reviews:
If I could give individual ratings for each employee I would.Raven (10/10) was amazing and went above and beyond to help me find an item on a catering order in the liquor department however Paul (-10/10) who worked in that department walked by me three times and glared, seemingly irritated that I needed help finding an item in HIS department. Paul had to be paged 3 times then once page he never acknowledged my presence in the 15 minutes I spent in that department. Paul never informed me that he was out of the item instead he walked past me while standing at his register and informed Raven that he did not have them item. He then went outside brought his friend into the store and the two of them began laughing and joking while he checked him out.; I’ve been coming to this Walgreen’s for 30 years and I’m sorry to have to leave a bad review. Though the staff are nice, there seems a lack of direction and management. There were no shopping carts available so customers stood in line holding items in their hands with no concern expressed by those working there.; The customer care here is amazing! Everyone is helpful, friendly and just all around good people. I go here a lot and have never been treated badly. Good energy and fast customer service.; When I had an issue with a delivery this morning the lovely store manager went above and beyond to ensure I was happy with my purchase.; I love this pharmacy, everyone has been amazing! I wish I could remember more of their names, but Rick went out of his way to help me.
My insurance lapsed, and my script was going to be $240. He said they had a new app that searches for the best coupons. He got it down to $16!! I definitely recommend this location! Just remembered another name of an amazing person that works there, her name is Tania and she’s been very helpful!

They never have my 90 day count Zyrtec in stock so I’m forced to buy the more expensive one on multiple occasions.

As an employee here, it's quite sad how these coaches treat their associates. When customer see them, they are always friendly and welcoming. When you start working here, they change. It's always hard to work with your coaches here when they always yell at you and make you feel worse when you first start. There's a new guy in meat/produce who I found out is autistic and the coach in that department was being incredibly rude to him. Making him feel he can't do anything right when he just started there. Made him upset and almost starting crying!! They pick their favorite associates and go with the flow without a care in the world. I wouldn't want to deal with coaches like them all the time but if you are someone like me who has bills and groceries to get, you feel stuck in a workplace. I hope the store managers do something about making special needs people feel more welcoming and comfortable with working in a hectic store and stop picking favorites!! My god that's all we have to deal with too with these coaches. Very sad to say. The entire store was cluttered and couldn't find anything.  The eggs section was the worst. My latest find: Marie Calendar dinners. Nice variety at $2.98 / $3.98 a box. On a fixed income, you can't beat it.

Reviews:
Went to Walmart today and needed help with the  auto fuses. It's locked up and that service button didn't even work. We asked the kid in automotive twice for help and he didn't even bother looking for someone or offer his help. Waited about 20 mins and this older guy tried to help but we ended asking another guy that was doing pick up orders. I honestly didn't expect anything more nor less from Walmart.; every single one of their employees will accuse you of stealing or give you dirty looks. on my way out a man spit on my car for no reason. awful experience, spend the extra dollars and go to target instead.; Pretty good Walmart. Usually not too terribly busy when I tend to get out. I like the fact that not everything is locked up, makes it easier to access everything I need without having to wait 30 minutes for customer service to unlock a bottle of shampoo. Asked a guy in electronics if they had a specific TV in stock in the back and he actually managed to bring a 43” TCL out for me. Didn’t just go on a “fake look”. Really appreciated that. Hope it stays that way.; The staff was very friendly and helpful! When I felt lost in the store because I couldn’t find an item they didn’t make me feel embarrassed and I successfully found everything I needed. Thanks Walmart :); No complaints. We had to get extra help in the kids Bike section, and it was super prompt and easy.  Self checkout felt fast and worked well even tho the kids Bike basket was missing a UPC code. The associate in that section was able to search up the item and get it scanned in quickly.

All in all was a good experience, everyone very helpful and able to get in and out with very little hassle despite some unique bumps in the road.

There was a guy in need of assistance. He definitely needed some help to find a 2025 calendar. I don't like to assume but he had some special needs. I seen a guy Manger blow him off and say  look I am supposed to be getting off right now. Then he walked away. He told a different person. This lady should definitely not be working in customer service. She had a nasty attitude to this gentleman. It was a major inconvenience for her to help. He told her what he was looking for and she pointed its that way.He asked for her to take him over to the calendars. The guy was obviously struggling to even talk. She acted like my teenager rolled her eyes and demanded a different person take him. Definitely unprofessional and a miserable person inside. Do better walmart 🙄  why have people that don't do there jobs working for you. If your workers can't be nice fire them. I could understand if this guy was rude. But he wasn't. Make the door the mangmet! He is awesome!!!; Walking in looking for latex gloves passing by the new Halloween candy I see two lady's putting it up and I ask where i can find latex gloves and as the younger lady starts to look it up the older lady's interrupted  and said there in pharmacy if we have them so I go and look all over the little area and don't see any so I took it into my own hands and found that they are in fact not in pharmacy but isle I6 I found that older lady super unhelpful and rude and she should probably be re trained on wear things are and how to speak to a customer; The self checkout people were not nice. The lady was mad and frustrated that she was having problems with so called upfront. What's the point to have self checkout with scan and go if we can't go to a self scan that suppose to be like that. I swear. I'm never a person who would give bad reviews but really today.; Just bought two bags of Mr Rainier cherries (total cost $16.86 + tax), taking care to look carefully for rotten cherries.  I already had to put four bags aside because I found rotten ones in them, and thought the two I bought looked ok.  Went home and washed them, only to find 25 rotten ones - one not pictured because it was so bad, I had to throw it away!

I've included a photo.  I hope Walmart strive to offer better quality in the future!

Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Address Components: 2415 (street_number); East Union Hills Drive (route); Paradise Valley Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85050 (postal_code)
Reviews:
They risked the life of my unborn child!!
I had to get medication to make sure I didn’t miscarry my unborn child. When I spoke with the pharmacist and they said they didn’t have it and couldn’t get the medication until two days later. I informed them I need this medication, my doctors office needs me on it today to prevent a miscarriage. Can they see if another location has it in stock. That I could drive as far as I needed to, to get this medication. She came back about five minutes later and said they can fill it today. I asked if they are sure and they said yes. Came back later, no medicine I was told the next day. It was too late to transfer to another pharmacy. Came back the next day and they said they don’t have it and that there pharmacy said it’s not supposed to be filled for five days. I told them I needed it to not miscarry my baby can they please transfer the prescription to another Walgreens. They refused saying they could fill it. This went on for five days. Five days they refused to let me move the prescription to another pharmacy and five days in a row they kept telling me they can fill it. My husband went down and ended up in an argument with the head pharmacist about the urgency of it. Not even an hour after the argument they had my prescription filled. My doctors office, my OBGYN, when he heard what happened he was very angry at this pharmacy. He said this is the most unprofessional, lazy pharmacy and there was no reason for them to risk the life of my unborn child just so there location can get the money for the prescription. He recommended we change locations because it's not a pharmacy that cares about the people going to it, only the money.
This wasn't the first incident we've had with this pharmacy.
My husband is a type 1 diabetic with an insulin pump. Each pump has its own medical supplies specific to each tester and pump. He got a new updated pump. I had to argue with a pharmacist who believes she knew best  and changed his new lancets and test stripes to the old pump, ones that wouldn't work with his new one. she refused to listen saying "he has this pump and tester" and i kept telling her thats the old prescription, we need the new one not the old one. according to her its not an issue because he has his old tester. My husband had to go back after a 10 hour work day to argue with the head pharmacist why that wasn't okay and why he needs the new stuff. All the head pharmacist did was protect the person who wouldn't listen and refused to fill the new prescriptions. Eventually it got fixed after we threatened to sue them. it was the only reason they fixed it.; If there was a zero star the Walgreens pharmacy would be getting one they never answer the phone I've been on hold for over 30mins and still on hold currently. They don't even answer and say it'll be a moment instead they just keep putting you on hold. Customer service in the pharmacy department is horrible I would change pharmacies if I were you.; I refuse to go here because of the filth that loiters around the building. There is always at least a dozen homeless junkies sitting by the entrance, hanging near the back of the store, etc... you see them bent over on drugs, pan handling, loitering. Its way more than average in that area, and i believe its because walgreens refuses to kick them off the property. I cant my bring my children there, and honestly i dont even like to drive by walgreens because my kids always say something about all the people without shirts hanging around this place.; Literally worst pharmacy I have ever been to. Terrible. No one knows how to do their job and there’s something wrong with my prescriptions every. single. time. never fails. I will never be returning here after today!; I will never use this Walgreens Cave Creek Road in Union Hills pharmacy again. I spoke to the pharmacist this morning and he refused to fill my prescription. I have been using the pharmacy at Greenway and Cave Creek Road for close to 15 years. They were excellent. They are closing on February 20 and have moved everything over to the Pharmacy on Union Hills And Cave Creek Road. I can’t believe how bad the pharmacist is there. He made me feel absolutely humiliated about the medication I am taking. I felt so bad after talking to him. I can’t believe that a pharmacist is allowed to speak to a customer in this manner. I asked him to look at my Walgreens records from the other location. He refused to look at my records. And refused to fill the order that my doctor had called in. I will continue to reach out to everybody. I can to let them know about the pharmacist at this location, Cave Creek Road in Union Hills.

Reviews: This is my go-to in Sumter for bourbon and whiskey. On a previous visit, I bought the last bottle of Rittenhouse Rye, and Barry commented that the last one was finally gone! I asked if he was going to order more, and he said probably not. I told him if he would keep it on the shelf, I would keep buying it. On my most recent visit, there were new bottles on the shelf! Thanks, Barry! Same situation on the wine side of the house; I told Kelly (I think that's her name) about a wine I could only find in Columbia and asked her if she could order it so I could buy it locally. Got a voicemail a few weeks later, after I had forgotten about it, saying the wine I had asked about was in. Same price as what I paid in Columbia! Market Place Spirits is all about customer service!; Excellent service. They always go above and beyond to find that bottle that you're looking for. Pretty competitive prices too.; Very friendly great customer service; Called umpteen stores looking for Green Chartreuse and these folks confirmed by phone that they had it, then actually had it in stock (can’t take that for granted!) and charged a reasonable price. Good customer service, great selection. Will shop here again.; When you walk in, there are two sides. One has more liquor while the other carries more beer and mixed drinks. Both are operated by the same company but have two different registers for check out. It is clean and organized! There was an older lady with glasses on the beer/ mix drinks side who provided great customer service. I even learned about a few liquor brands I never have seen before when I browsed around the liquor side! Def will be back.

Reviews: My husband and I drove all the way from NC and stopped by all three locations. This was our last stop before headed home. Their selection was the best out of all three! The staff are so friendly and helpful! Definitely skip the others with high traffic and come see these guys!; I love this ABC/Beer store.  Bought a hard to find Weller 12 year old Bourbon and their prices are always the best in town ifv you pay cash!; Great customer service and prices best in town.; Came into the beer side yesterday distraught about not being able to help my daughter with her math homework. I was crying while picking out some beers for the build your own 4 packs when an employee named Alex noticed that I was in distress. He helped me pick out beers for my 4 pack and while he was ringing me up he asked if I had found everything I was looking for today. I told him sadly no, I still needed someone to help my daughter with her math homework. To my surprise Alex offered his services to me. I grab my daughter McKinsley-Grace from the car and brought her into the store. Then Alex, my knight in shining armour, got to work. In between helping customers he managed to get my daughter and I from struggling with 4th grade long division to understand 12th grade algebra. I’ve never seen such phenomenal customer service in my life! Definitely recommend Micky Finns to all struggling moms.; Has a wide variety of various liquors ,wines, and beer. Friendly staff that's very knowledgeable

Name: Personal Wine Cellar
Address: 300 Saratoga Rd, Schenectady, NY 12302, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 300 (street_number); Saratoga Road (route); Schenectady (locality); Glenville (administrative_area_level_3); Schenectady County (administrative_area_level_2); New York (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 12302 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I want to start by sharing, Jan and Shelley are kind-spirited, amazing women. If it weren't for them, I may not have kept as cool as I would've liked during my experience here.

Upon making a decision to purchase a bottle of Johnnie Walker Blue, which was marked with a sticker directly on the bottle for $225, Shelley had kindly helped get the bottle from the case, and offered to cash me out. As the barcode would not scan, Shelley asked if it would be okay to manually enter the sticker price to ring me out.Before she could do so, a middle aged, unpleasant man ran over to the register to quickly scrape off the price sticker, while stating the bottle was $255. As I asked why he would do this, another elderly man behind the counter yelled "its a small business" and proceeded by making other rude illegible comments.

Jan must've seen what was happening, and came to assist Shelley with gift wrapping as they cashed me out.  Both were genuinely kind women and remained in the holiday spirit.

Small business or corporation, you should honor marked pricing on your inventory, and treat customers with a little respect and understanding.

I hope these men treat these two lovely women better than they treat their customers.; Great value , better service, quality business. Military and Veterans look no further.

Theses folks are the real deal; friendly, knowledgeable and courteous. Everytime I stop in or order over the phone they exceed expectations. They told me my order would take 30 minutes, it was at my doorstep in under 15 and at $2 delivery charge, that is quality service. I would vote 6 stars if I could.; Personal Wine Cellar is great, coming back from my tour (2020) I didn't know what to expect. They helped me pick, order, and complete my request over the phone, and delivery for $2 (incredible); I'm glad their personal touch and customer service hasn't changed; their quality of service and care, strong as ever. Veterans and service members don't shop anywhere else!; The best local wine store ever. The owner is always there and is all about customer satisfaction. The service to check out is fast and always staffed with enough employees
To handle busy times. The store manager Michelle is very nice and is always on top of her inventory. Prices arare very much inline with the big outlet stores. I get military discount plus they have senior discount also .; When you just gotta do it, and see what happens later, staff was super helpful, allowed me to stay at the front of store , which I think they would prefer anyway, I was able to check out fast with my desired product which was nice.

Name: Linwood Wine - Linwood Plaza
Address: 102 Linwood Plaza, Fort Lee, NJ 07024, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 12:00 – 6:00 PM

Reviews: For those who enjoy wine, the individuality of a wine shop is very important. I have several wine shops that I visit often because of the individuality of their selections. The French wines here are relatively good, and the Chinese premium liquor is also good. However, Linwood Wine's Linwood Plaza branch seems to be poorly managed. The prices are not accurate, and the attitude of the employees is very unfriendly. After the $41.99 wine was calculated as $85.49, and while looking into the problem, I found out that the price display was wrong. So I had no choice but to change it to a different wine. However it turned out that the other wine was also priced incorrectly. It was a chaos. The biggest problem was that when I told the store manager about the problem that there was no reliable price tag, I was even more surprised by the his attitude, saying that the customer did not understand the small mistake and got angry. If you visit this store, please always check the prices. I cannot recommend this store to those who want to buy wine with reasonable price tag. Watch out!; Great store! Staff is always super helpful and friendly. Great selection of wines in the fridge; Completely unacceptable price policy. Overture 175 and Opus one 450. If you go to Hudson wine just one mile away, you’ll get overture for 140 and Opus one for 400.(same vintage). Everything is way overpriced as if they are looking for victims.; Negative employees and over priced..recommend Top Shelf Liquor around the corner !!; Great selection of bourbon and very friendly staff. Prices are also reasonable. Always welcomed in the store. Thanks terry

Reviews:
Hi all.  In the store, on the shelves in the fresh vegetables department there are expired products, such as packaged carrots 7/5/24 today is 7/25. Asparagus price 3.99 it’s not clear what LB or bunch is for, I paid $9 because they sold it to me by weight, everywhere it is sold as a bunch, no one answered my question in customer service, my proposal was to fix it on the shelf so as not to enter  people were misled, they told me they would correct it, but 2 days have passed, and the price is the same and not clear for LB or Bunch.  A whole watermelon costs $5.99 but if I want a quarter I have to pay 1.69 a pound and pay $6 for a quarter just because they cut it, it's kind of a rip off.   The store management simply does not control anything, it’s a shame; Cashiers are outright horrible. The deli department is slow and constantly runs out of product, especially sale items. Whomever is training the staff needs to take a refresher course. (See photo) They claim that there are no substitutions because the manager is not available. They seem to wait until almost something in every aisle needs restocking. They seem not to be able to control theft. Their solution is to treat everyone as a criminal. I finally got tired of waiting for improvement, especially the deli department. They consistently run out of product, and due to shortage in staff, the complete disarray of the department, and the failure of fulfilling application orders, I have switched to the Aberdeen Shoprite. They have product and a full and friendly service.; Brianna ( my apologies if I’m spelling your name wrong) This female has been helpful every single time I had a question . When she worked in floral helpful with any questions with product. Then I see her in self checkout always a help never a frown always a beautiful smile . I continue to go to this ShopRite because people like Brianna .; We ordered catering from their app. It was easy,paid online, and chose our own date and time for pick up.
Everyone enjoyed the food for my son's birthday and said it tasted great.
Will order again for our next event.

We ordered the penne vodka, chicken Parmigian, baked ziti, sausage and peppers, mediterranean salad, and rainbow fruit platter.; When u ask at the appy department for things to be sliced thin they show you the first slice but when u get home the product is cut a lot thicker then they show you is just ridiculous is it laziness or they don't care but complaining to the store or to the corporate office nothing gets done where to get cold cuts that are cut to the way you would like them is the end question

Name: Kroger
Address: 725 Ponce De Leon Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30306, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Vicinity: 725 Ponce De Leon Avenue Northeast, Atlanta
Address Components: 725 (street_number); Ponce De Leon Avenue Northeast (route); Poncey-Highland (neighborhood); Atlanta (locality); Fulton County (administrative_area_level_2); Georgia (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 30306 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I am bit biased on this review because this was the first place I ever worked at after immigrating to the US. I used to late evening shifts. Its amazing to see the transformation after almost 23 years! For a minute, I thought this was whole foods!
Its very well organized, good quality produce and prepared meals, empanadas!; This is a very nice Kroger. It is clean and has a lot of featured sections, butcher, bakery, cheese shop, sushi, and hot food items. They even have a KroBar!! Which is a great way to have a pint or glass of wine as you shop. I have seen this in other Krogers, but to have this right on the beltline is awesome. The store also has a Starbucks. Fantastic parking and security as well.; I had a horrible incident at the Kroger on Ponce that has the bar facing the Atlanta Beltline. I asked the lady cooking outside on the patio if she could turn down the music as it was so loud people where covering there ears, except for a few illegal vendors that were selling next to this employee of Kroger. I spoke to the manager about the volume of the music. The woman cooking outside of this Kroger, who had a small beard, was an embarrassment to both Kroger and humanity in general. Another customer witnessed this Kroger employee screaming and yelling when asked to turn down the music. Even an employee suggested lowering the volume. I thought speaking with the manager would resolve the situation, especially since other employees had witnessed her acting so inappropriately. However, when the manager, an older Indian woman, came out, she said there was nothing she could do as Kroger had authorized it and suggested coming inside as a solution. To make matters worse, inappropriate ads—clearly from a Pandora stream—were playing, and the music was completely unsuitable for children of any age. It’s disappointing to see Kroger being a bad neighbor to those within earshot of this terrible music.; Horrible serve. Ridiculously rude security allowing random stragglers into Kroger but we were rejected because they were “closed.” They were in fact not closed. When asked, she stated that they worked here. When asked, the customers did not work here. Accepting monetary offers to be let into the store “after hours” for alcohol.; Poor customer service in pickup! After checking in on the app, I had to flag an employee down to remind them I was there. The employee moved with no sense of urgency even though 5+ cars had also been waiting at least 45 minutes past their pickup window. The employee NEVER returned and no explanation was given. After calling corporate, only then was I able to be told that my order would be unable to be fulfilled until 10AM the next day. Kroger said they could only offer me $10 store credit for my next order. Why would I order again given this level of customer service? Unacceptable!

Reviews: The girl that helped me, or “tried” to help me at the pharmacy was absolutely terrible. She was rude and disrespectful and didn’t know anything about customer service. I’ve had this issue with the same girl at the same location before. I just had surgery and needed to get meds and wasn’t able to. I went hours in pain because I had to call my doctors office and have the prescription sent elsewhere since I got absolutely no help. I will never be going here again. Thanks for nothing.; I've come to this Walgreens for years to use the pharmacy, usually I can hang through the long waits because they're polite about it. Dealing with Marie today was enough to make me switch. Someone her age and in her position should know better than to slam the phone down, roll her eyes, and throw her hands in the air when someone is asking a question. Terrible customer service.; Worst pharmacy staff ever. Not worth one star. They have you waiting in line inside (and drive through) for 30 mins to an hour each time to be told that they don't have your meds in stock. Always the run around with this pharmacy.; Went in last night to pick up a prescription. Was told that there was in issue with my insurance and I needed to bring in a copy of it so I did. This is not a complaint about the pharmacist that helped me last night but he told me my insurance was expired and that he would leave a note for someone to call my insurance today. Waited this morning to hear back from the pharmacy only to call them and basically got complained at over the phone from the pharmacist today that “they don’t call insurance, I would have to call insurance.” He stated that to me multiple times after I told him someone told me they would call. I get it. I’m just reiterating what someone had told me so either take accountability or don’t but it’s not my fault. I’m just trying to get the meds I’ve been waited over three days for.; If I can do a negative feedback on this Walgreens location I would. I had an appointment today (05/15/22) with my 3 kids for covid test and this old lady with a glasses thought I was the only one so I told her there's 4 of us together and she started shaking her head and rolling her eyes told me she can't do it so I was like what do you mean you can't do it? I'm not gonna come back again and go through the line also I was telling her my wife works at the other Walgreens location she just put the down the phone down right away and doesnt wanna hear anything at all and still shaking her head and it's been 2 hours right now I still havent got our results and its clearly stated and she told me we will get our results within 2 hours. she's by far the rudest employee I've encountered in this Walgreens location. I will never going back again to this place.

Reviews:
Target pickup is the best. I always have a great experience with in-store pickup or drive up. I have never had a problem with order accuracy. Sometimes I will come in the store to browse, but I prefer not to. There are not many open check out lanes when I go inside.; Great products my pick up orders are always done on time. When I come to pick up my orders I don’t wait long at all they bring it right out. I’ve always had good interactions with the employees as well. Always friendly and professional.; I went to target to get a pumpkin  to make pumpkin  pie from scratch  because  pumpkins are a vegetable in the produce  section.  Tried to use my food stamps  and I was denied  to buy that vegetable as it's not considered  a produce  vegetable like the other items in the vegetable  section.  I was able to buy everything  els with my food stamps.  I went to frys and got the pumpkin  with EBT food stamps instead as they consider  a pumpkin  a food item and produce.; This is my closest Target but I rarely go here. Nothing says we don't trust your customers than security dressed like they are in a war zone and many items are all locked up. Sorry, but if I have to go find someone every time I need something from a locked cabinet (which is becoming more & more items) then I will shop somewhere else or online. I like to browse and read packages for contents but now first I have to find someone to unlock a cabinet & then have them stand there and watch me read packages while I decide which one I want. I have literally walked in this store for something specific, saw it was locked up so I just left & went elsewhere where they don't assume every customer is a thief.; They have started playing a very creepy and loud 1984 style announcement in the parking lot about it being monitored.   I'm all for extra security, and they have tons of that here, but that recording in the parking lot is too much.  Big brother is watching you here.

The security guards are a bit over the top too and really give you the stare down when you walk in.  Will avoid this location in the future.

Reviews:
Without me requesting it, the clerk printed off the rebate offer my purchase qualified for and stapled a copy of my receipt to it.

Most places don’t even offer a receipt and I’d have never known about the rebate offer without this store doing that.

I also enjoyed looking through the plentiful bourbon options as well as their discounted items cart.

Staff was very nice and really allowed me to take my time looking through everything.; Just stopped in and was AMAZED by their foreign selection. Picked up a New Zealand, Belgian, Italian, Japanese, and an Austrian! And it's not just foreign. Their Bourbon selection was TOP TIER! Spoke with the owner for quite a bit and she had a real passion for the spirits. I highly recommend stopping in if you're looking for rare and unique products! 10/10; Stopped off the Melrose, MN. exit for a quick bite and fuel stop. Found Spiritz Liquor.  If you like Bourbon this is a must see. Great selection and very reasonable pricing. Alyssa is a hoot and knowledgeable about all things Bourbon.  Alyssa, thanks for your recommendations.; Staff always ready to help and up for light hearted conversation; We knew a friend of ours shopped here and we wanted to get a thank you gift for him.  Alissa knew him and offered us the perfect advice on what to get.  Other staff interaction was friendly and helpful.
Store seemed well stocked with a wide selection.  I would recommend as a good place to shop for your adult beverages.

Reviews:
My first review is below. I've updated this because I like the store and I'm hoping the owner/manager will see it and take some corrective action.

While the selection is still good (for Mississippi), the staff has gone downhill. The one guy I see every visit acts like he just doesn't care, as if customers are an inconvenience. He has no conversational or sales skills and because of his attitude, I often shop elsewhere now. The only thing he said to my wife and me was the total of the sale and "do you want a receipt?" No one offers to lug a case to my car, no one says thank you, no one makes any recommendations, just "no, we don't have that".

Buying wine should be a pleasant experience. This particular employee is driving people - like me - away.

Previous review: "Great wine store. Excellent selection. Knowledgeable staff."; There were 2 liquor stores I could make it to on time after getting out of work late. unfortunately I chose this one that was closed at 9:50 when when I got there and didn’t have time to make it to the other one so no rum cake for the birthday boy. I’m sure he’ll understand that the liquor store clerk didn’t feel like doing his job.; The owner always has the wine I like. Big selection and good prices.
I always shop here!!; he owner wants to limit your ability as a consumer to buy from a wider selection of wine and liquor. He doesn’t want you to be able to buy wine and ship it to your home, and he doesn’t want you to buy it from your local grocer. Why? Because he only cares about protecting his business from competition.; Always a positive experience.   Very helpful.  Staff is knowledgeable and professional.  It doesn't matter if you are buying low end or high end, you are respected.

Name: FULI WINE & LIQUOR
Address: 14 Jericho Turnpike, Jericho, NY 11753, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM

Reviews: Love this liquor store! Great prices, great selections  and wonderful service!; Let me start by saying that google needs to start letting negative stars be a thing. If I could give negative stars I would.  My father in law was a frequent patron of this store. Because of that, he turned into an alcoholic. This store would deliver bottles personally to him at home in a brown paper bag and hide them so his wife wouldn’t see them. We confronted them yesterday after he passed away a couple days ago, and they in turn said that we should have been more educated about the situation. They blamed us!  They should be ashamed of themselves. Please do not patronize this establishment.; I sent a gift to a colleague that was retiring. I practice out of NJ and she is in Jericho. The staff  at Full Wine & Liquor was so kind to not only recommend different Champagnes but to take pictures of gift bags and to add a beautiful sentiment on the card. From the initial call to the delivery of the champagne....excellence; Pricing wasn't bad, within a dollar of the cheapest place around that I normally go to. I've seen others that were $5-6 more; Jerry is very nice, good recommendations and prices are very fair. Would recommend!

Name: Tax Free - Fine Wine & Good Spirits
Address: 10975 E State St, Delmar, DE 19940, USA

Reviews:
I’m not a drinker, haven’t had a drink since 2017. However, I buy alcohol for m’lady periodically and this store is wonderful! Always nice and helpful staff. They can tell I’m clueless and don’t know what I’m looking for and always help me find it. They think I’m a real bimbo in there. I look like a kid in a candy store, but like a foreign candy store. I understand that there’s some neat things, but I don’t know what it is. Wide selection, so much to pick from. And it’s tax free, worth the drive across the state line. Really is a great addition to Delmar, draws the town together. Thank you Tax Free.; Great selection!  Very nice tall young man was so helpful, and even carried my box to the car for me!  Great evening staff!; I personally am a whiskey drinker. They had so many choices that it took me a few minutes to go through & check them all out before I picked one.  Then I went to look for a beer that I haven't been able to find & sure enough they had it...
Guys behind the counter won't let you buy something they don't think you'll like.  I went to buy a bottle & was told what it tasted like & that I should buy the small bottle first to try it.  Glad i did..lol; Best spot to get beer and liquor plus it's the 1st stop in Delaware over the Maryland boarder; Had exactly what I was looking for at a really good price.

Name: Bin 94 Wines
Address: 115 Temple Hill Rd Suite 1100, New Windsor, NY 12553, USA

Reviews: Amazing wine shop!!! It's just beautiful from the moment you walk in. The owner is almost always there and has the best suggestions. No matter what the occasion they have what you need. They have rare and hard to find whiskeys, and their organic wine selection is really good  Their selection and staff is top notch!! Go here today. You will love this place from the min you walk in and I am sure you will go back again and again.; There's nothing like walking into a local business, with no customers, and the two ladies at the register intentionally not greet you. I would expect this of the younger girl, giving her the benefit of doubt but not the older lady with semi curly short hair. The vibe was not it.  Customer service not on par. I even went by the white wines and appeared like i needed help, because I did...and nothing. Guess I will be taking my business elsewhere. ✌️; I will most certainly be back! They had an amazing selection of liquors that are not common everywhere else. I initially went in for one bottle, but I was so delighted with their offerings, I got several! Anita was so friendly and I enjoyed chatting with her as I checked out. She even said she would order a special gin for me! I can't wait for it to arrive. It was so cool to be in such a thoughtfully curated store. Well done!; I went last night to get a bottle of wine (about 5 minutes to close). I spent about 3 minutes in the store and purchased a bottle of malbec. The manager or owner of the store was incredibly rude. She kept stating that the store was closing, not that they were closed. She acted as if she did not want my business. She should work on her customer service skills. She was incredibly rude.; Not impressed.  Bought a bottle of whiskey labeled $33.99 on the shelf.  They rung it up $44.99.  I said thats not the price on the shelf.  They went and looked and it said $33.99.  Then the lady said thats for the other size.  I said well all the bottles are above that label do you have the other size.  No.  No apologies.  It’s either intentionally deceptive price labeling or the people that work there just don’t care.  Either way, i’ll go elsewhere next time, maybe a big box store that can appropriately price products, and be sure not to support this local business.

Thanks for your service David.; The guy that runs this business is very nice and polite. I love the selection of wine and spirits he has and the prices are more than reasonable. Love the atmosphere of the place. My husband tries and stop here every chance he gets.

Reviews:
I was introduced to this lil mom n pops place by a long time local when I was new to the area last fall. I wasn't expecting much when we pulled in.. once inside I knew this would be my go-to stop.
First off it's clean!! The deli is AMAZING!! I go for the broccoli and cauliflower salad🫶 yesterday I stopped to get some and they were out, the cashier took my name and # and said they'd give me a call when she had more, this morning Miss Lori text me and said she had made a fresh batch, and mine was ready. Talk about customer service☺️ got my salad and added a slice of pizza for my lunch box today, what a wonderful lunch it was! "Yummy"
This place and everything they are here, is on point! Everything is so wonderful and the crew they have is over the top spectacular!!
I recommend this place for a GooooooD bite to eat along your travels. (Or anytime)
Thank you all, for ALWAYS being so kind to me💚
Don't change a thing!!
YOU ARE MUCHLY APPRECIATED 🫶; Don’t buy their already made/frozen pizzas. Absolutely garbage. They advise to not put directly on the oven rack, so I used pizza pans. Took twice as long as they wrote in the instructions and still the bottom of the crust was complete dough. Falling apart off the pizza pan. Went right in the garabge. What a joke.; Discovered this place while searching for a particular beer that we just couldn't find anywhere in the GR area...hubby called and they had it. Mark held six 15 packs for us and was super helpful and friendly. When we arrived we understood why they had it, they've got EVERY type of beer, liquor, cordial, hard cider, seltzer you name it! And all the fixings to go with whatever your looking for. Very clean and well organized...highly recommend; The homemade pizza is the best in town. Always hot and ready personal pizzas for the busy workers at noon. Staff is a breathe of fresh air and very down to earth. Prices are appropriate.; This place is the worst don’t go here staff is very rude and treats customers real bad I would stay away from this place spend your money where they actually value customers

Vicky makes the most beautiful bouquets that she personalizes for each individual!; Bigger,  better, and my best visit was the Starbucks... Gabrielle made my caramel,  ribbon crunch the bestest I've ever tasted.  😋 Great job 👏 atleast I know she takes pride in doing her job.  Her service was excellent, and I will only go to this Starbucks inside Kroger instead of the other Starbucks. Thanks Gabrielle...; For carts mostly one has to wait otherwise spacious, good price; It’s my neighborhood store, and it turned into an absolute trash! Can’t tell you how many times items marked as discounted showed up a regular price at register, then you have to wait for staff member to check it out and give you the announced price with no apology. Bunch of items in refrigerators are expired. And all produce in this store is as far from fresh as you can only imagine! I made photos of tomatoes with mold and rotten potatoes today, and the box of blueberries went right to trash can at home. I pointed spoiled vegetables to a girl working next to them but she couldn’t care less. Shame!!!!!; This Kroger is abysmal. First, you're greeted by zero shopping carts because why bother having those on a regular basis? As you make your way through the cluttered aisles, you'll notice that the store's inventory is like a lottery - sometimes you win, but mostly you lose. The shelves and the freezers are dirty and littered with partially open or damaged items. If you're looking for a shopping experience that has more homeless people in the parking lot than open checkout lanes, Berwick Kroger is the place to be.

Reviews:
They have a pretty good bourbon selection. Barrel picks also. Prices seem to be decent. Will continue to stop here on way/back from beach. Service is exceptional every time.; Anup is a total professional! He was highly recommended to use and go through for our wedding and boy did he come through! He had great recommendations for affordable and tasty wine and even gave us a couple free bottles to take home and make sure we liked them. He had a good selection of spirits and beer and made sure we were happy with everything. Unlike other stores, when he realized he had the same beer in a new 12 pack vs 6 packs he swapped them out and saved me money. I eneded up with more beer for less. Anup and his staff are true professionals and at the end of the wedding is will to work with you on the remaining spirits. He also delivers to Swan Cove if you decide to hold your wedding/events there. I would absolutely recommend Best Wine & Spirits to anyone having a function down around Cambridge!; Best selection in town and the prices are fair! Always go to this place! They have the widest selection of bourbons I've ever seen; Glad these guys are in Cambridge—great selection of liquor and craft beer, and though I usually don’t buy wine here, the wine department looks well-stocked.
They are always friendly and helpful.
We’re lucky to have them and the place on Cedar Street also (though overall selection along w mixer selection and the cigars give Best the edge).; Gentleman in his first class answers on my questions and I love that they have a small humidor in there pretty good cigars.

Name: Londo Lakes Store
Address: 8585 Lavere Rd, Hale, MI 48739, USA
Address Components: 8585 (street_number); Lavere Road (route); Hale (locality); Plainfield Township (administrative_area_level_3); Iosco County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 48739 (postal_code); 9214 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
This store used to be called Arlene's by locals who knew the previous owner, including myself.
I'd walk here often still in a swimsuit from the lake all the time as a kid to grab any number of staples and unique goods alike.
Plenty of niche and interesting candy, toys and drinks were stocked for kids like us.
Arlene's water gun selection was impeccable, and Arlene was always greatly amused by and very nice to kids like us.

These days we're all grown, many have moved away in every which direction and neither Arlene nor her husband are with us any longer yet I hear the new owner has done quite well with the hallowed establishment.
If my busy military career ever permits sometime this century I'll try to return and see how well exactly the place is getting on, and how similar or different to decades gone by the building and inventory are.
Thanks for keeping this lovely and nostalgic party store going for newer generations in any case, New Management.
This was a very cozy and longstanding place for those nearby, and I hope you continue to do right by her :); We stopped at this store on our way to the UP after hearing about it back down in the Metro Detroit area.  It didn’t disappoint!  The store was built in the 1950s and Phil, the owner has managed to somehow keep some of the original features.

Inside you will find supplies for your bonfires, snacks, some grocery items, gifts, a walk in beer cooler, and an absolute BANGER of a liquor selection.   He’s got the well known go to’s and a great selection for those who want something different, or looking for something for a special occasion.

The owner is personable and I can tell he is thrilled to be a part of this community. The drive is scenic and I definitely recommend.; Came in on the first day of re-opening and had a nice conversation with the new owner, Phil. He's done a great job with the place and made us feel very welcome. It's amazing to have a place to grab supplies without leaving the paradise of the lake again!; Great store. The owner Phil is an awesome guy. Super excited to have the local store for the family to go to again.; Phil is the best! Local delivery times are accurate as promised. Best in the area. Look them up for all your
needs... Highly recommend!!

I bought these yesterday and they expire this week it’s disgusting that I was charged full price for an item that is already going bad when opened they taste funny and are greasy and stuck to the bottom do better take expiring products off the shelf or mark them down definitely will be checking expiration dates more closely; I was at the neighborhood market yesterday and couldn’t figure out how to use the virtual gift card I had received. The customer service lady came over and then we went over to her counter and with the help of another associate we got it done. Fantastic customer service. I will continue to shop there indefinitely!; Amazing Customer service from your associate Omar he was very helpful in helping me find things and super nice too kid deserves a raise!; Terrible customer service from your associate Melanie this morning. Very rude when speaking to customers. I went in for 1 item, which you didn't have, then get treated so poorly by your associates. Do better; They need to go back to full service cashiers and not all the self checkouts.  Usually only 1 lane with a real cashier.  I am not a cashier!  And recently they got rid of a lot of products we buy regularly.  The remodel is supposed to be a good thing - it's NOT.  Might have to start going elsewhere. UPDATE 5/5/24.   1 CASHIER on a Saturday!!!   Seriously???   You pretty much have to use self checkout or stand in line 30 minutes.  SMH

Address Components: 18501 (street_number); North 83rd Avenue (route); Glendale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85308 (postal_code); 0501 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Probably only my 2nd time at this Sam’s club location. Very clean organized and as always Sam’s club did not disappoint as far as selection goes. Found what I was looking for and then some. I love the Scan and go option on their app. You simply scan your items as you add them to your cart and pay on your phone! Huge time saver!; Undercooked BLOODY rotisserie chicken. AGAIN. This is the 3rd time this year I got under-cooked chicken from the Glendale Sam's Club. Somebody is going to get sick if this keeps happening. It's very disgusting and dangerous to not properly cook chicken. Sam's Club needs to review their rotisserie standards as soon as possible. Sam's club has lots of elderly customers who can become very ill from salmonella poisoning.; Today I got to Sam's Bakery to pick up a cupcake order.  The team at the bakery couldn't find my order.   I pulled up the receipt and realized I made a huge mistake.  I placed the order for the incorrect location (near home instead of near work).  I didn't have time to drive to that one then back near work.  The woman at the bakery suggested the pre-made cupcakes out on the floor but they were not ideal for the baby shower I was supposed to be at in 30 minutes.  She was so kind and said if I wanted plain white whip she could make a batch for me.  She offered sprinkles giving me the color options.  I told her then and sharing here too "Breanna, you are the best person in the world today!"

Thank you for saving the baby shower! (I picked up the other order after work...cupcake for days!)

Sam's Club has a shining star on their team! ✨️

Thank you Breanna!; Today, I went to Sam's Club and was thoroughly disappointed with my experience at the cafeteria.
After waiting in line for 15 minutes, I was told they didn't have whole pizzas available, only slices. The employee seemed unconcerned and unapologetic, which added to my frustration.

I expect more from Sam's Club, especially considering the membership fees and usual quality of service.; This is my first time visiting Sam’s Club with friend who has membership after 15 years membership of Costco. There are some items different from the nearby Costco but majority of the goods are the same. They definitely have more toys for kids and pool time. Their cupcakes and cheesecakes are amazingly tasty and much better than Costco.

The most notable part is the giant blue-and-white wall painting sign to guide your shopping which is intendedly missing in Costco to seduce you wandering around to spend more. The store has similar layout like Costco with huge shelves, but the aisles seems narrower, especially, the areas nearby cashier, I found hard time to move the shopping cart when facing another shoppers. And the store layout is not as organized and neat as any Costco.

One big surprise feature Sam’s has is the scan-and-pay self-checkout by App feature to skip the line. Overall, I won’t switch to Sam’s club or pay extra to get additional Sam membership because of the differences.

Reviews:
This is the worse pharmacy I've ever been to in my life. They lied about my prescription for 6 weeks. They told me it was my doctor and my insurance companies fault. I finally got in touch with my insurance company who said Walgreens have the authorization number for weeks. Dave a young man said he promised he have it in two days to me. Gave me his word. He ordered it but the wrong amount.  The girl who was rude said she'd call the insurance company to see to get that amount authorized. She hung up on me called me back said frys had the prescription and it was already filled waiting she lied. So fry's will order it in for me. I've never had this problem with fry's and will never use Walmart again. Whom ever the pharmacy manger is. Is terrible at their job. Poor training and accountability.; Would NOT recommend this location for ANY  pharmaceutical services!!!

HERE IT IS Day #3 and the prescriptions called in by hospital STILL HAVE NOT BEEN PROCESSED.

They should have been ready before leaving hospital,  since it is heart medication!!!!

Worst stocked Pharmacy in my life.

Hopefully,  you don't die waiting for your medication to show up.; Read whole review....The only way to give a review was to give 1 star. Went to Dr, I'm sicker than a dog and went to Walgreens to get prescription filled, waited in line 40min just to be told to come back in 2hrs. Waited 2 1/2 hr went back and waited in drive-thru for 50 min just to be told to go inside and my prescription would be ready. Took another 15-20min. Don't know how many people that I infected.; I have been enduring this pharmacy for over 3 years, sense I moved out to this end of town. The pharmacist is very rude and treats you like your business does not matter. I am having all my prescriptions moved to another pharmacy. I can not endure this anymore. When I told them I was leaving they said quote: "do what ya gotta do". The rest of the store is nice. Beware of the pharmacy, I have heard this has happened to many other customers. Hopefully Walgreens gets smart and gets rid of the pharmacist.
Update, they did get a new pharmacist. Much better service.; I waited in line at CVS and couldn't get any help, so we came to this Walgreens and the employees went above and beyond. Not only did they take the time to help me find what I was searching for, but when the checkout line got very long, an employee shopping at the store stopped what she was doing and clocked in to help out. My cashier took the time to make sure I used my rewards and was very friendly. I can't imagine the pressure they are under with staffing shortages, so it was so impressive to experience the caring and professionalism. The store was clean and well stocked.

They have a large selection and their employees are knowledgeable and friendly. A great place to go if you like to be treated like family!; Ryan,Lisa,Joel, and Will are good employees. Matt the owner is not good. Says inappropriate things to employees and customers (especially the women). Stay away from this place. This is all in my opinion of course.; I have purchased liquor and beer here on several occasions. I have always found the knowledge and locations of their products acceptable. However the service level and friendliness of their staff leaves a lot to be desired.

Their prices are reasonable to everyone else in the market. The convenience of their location is generally why I shop at their location.  This just may change if I can't even be greeted in a friendly manner when the store is completely empty.; Been going here for years and all the workers are really nice...I just had an experience where I guess they hired a new person. She asked for ID (which is totally fine) the one I have is expired by a day just waiting for the non expired hard copy to come in the mail. Never had anyone card me before and if they did of course I had it just in case. It's clearly me and I'm 30.  I just wish all the staff was on the same page because my sister comes in there with and license has been expired for over 6 months and they excepted that, that's what is bothering the most about the situation, and my sister was just up yesterday (2-10-19) once again they excepted the expired license. Definitely lost a 4 year customer, not that that matters anymore.; It's a liquor store. You can buy liquor.

Name: Sam's Club
Address: 1459 N Dysart Rd, Avondale, AZ 85323, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 1459 (street_number); North Dysart Road (route); Coldwater Plaza (neighborhood); Avondale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85323 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I shop at this location about three times a week, and overall, it's a great experience. The staff are consistently helpful and friendly, always ready to assist when needed. However, the food court can get quite busy, especially during peak hours like lunchtime, so I'd recommend avoiding those times if you're in a hurry. On the plus side, the self-checkout with the phone app is a game-changer – it's quick, efficient, and makes the whole shopping process much more convenient. A solid location for frequent shoppers!; Please use PRECAUTION while eating food out of the food court. The sitting area is never cleaned, tables are always dirty and floor full of trash. The soda machines are a health hazard and full of mold around the spout of the ice dispensers. I was shocked to see that and can only imagine if the outside has mold the inside of the soda machines must be much worse. 😳 They are always short staffed in that department.
The health department should definately be called and sent over to inspect because I for sure saw alot of health code violations that need to be addressed.; I am a current Costco member and have been purchasing at Costco for many years. After having several not so pleasant customer service experiences with Costco lately, I decided to give Sams a try.....and I was truly impressed.
The Sams system is much more advanced and fluid than Costco's. The app, for example,  allows you to purchase and scan your items without the need to have to check out at the checkout lines. Costco app does not do this. They are also not completely and utterly strict when it comes to membership. There is no "walk of same" exit in which you have to wait in line to get out and have someone meticulously check your card to make sure nothing was "missed". Now if you decide to check out, the self-checkout system is way ahead of its time than Costco's. Self checkout at Costco is a hit and miss and the scale is generally always asking you to place the item and often you have to have an employee come and push it through. This is NOT the case at Sams. At Sams, you don't even have to take anything out of your cart, you scan it right in your cart and done! Amazing! There is no weighting of items, there is no counting, you just scan, pay and go!
Now, I see some one-star reviews from people about the checkout and I honestly, have no idea why they are only giving out one star. My best guess is that they expected to checkout with a person and had to wait. I am sorry for those people, but we are in the 21st century now, everything is going automated so it is time to get used to it. The goal now is to see who has the better, easier and less annoying automated system and so far Sams is way ahead.... Costco has some catching up to do.
Setting up membership was also pretty easy, and there is no picture taking, you just setup your membership and get your physical and/or electronic card and that is it!
We also stopped by the Vision Center and the customer service there was outstanding. They were extremely friendly and very helpful while at Costco, I just feel like a number. They do the job they have to do and that's it.
When it comes to pricing, it is very close almost by the dollar, but several items I saw were about $1 or so less than Costco while few others may have been higher. However, one of things I noticed was that Sams has a lot more variety to offer. Looking forward, I think I am closing out my Costco membership once it expires.; I visited this Sams Club on 4/15/24 around 5:30pm their busiest part of the day and they only had one cashier stand open. I stood in line for 30 minutes. Terrible customer service. Whoever the manager was today was not doing their job. I won’t be back to Sams. I never have this problem at Costco.; Let me just start off by saying that I only use Sam's club because that's what my work pays for. It's sucks. Sam's club doesn't even compare to Costco when it comes to service and how they take care of customers. Sam's has 1 or 2 lanes to checkout with cash you have to stand in line for 30 mins just to check out. Employees standing around on their cell phones chatting it up with each other while we have to stand in line is unacceptable. When you ask if they can open up a new lane they tell you they can't do it unless my manager tells me to. Be better and do better!

Worst walmart ever I went to go buy wipes for my daughter due to hear being hyperallergic to all wipes besides one brand and the last wipes which was in the 2.38 section and was labeled as same kind and everything they wouldn't sell me it and it range up as a different brand etc they wouldn't listen to me I had to show them the lady even void it and wouldn't switch  to correct one I showed them the spot I grabbed them said FF 100 wipes was same brand and everything which all they had to do was change price so customer service didn't come first and even called over 3+ people which I was then not happy with the situation I'm by myself and was circling me at self check out  ... this is why the customer service will never change at Walmart they don't do there jobs ...would pulled up voided transaction to see it was rang up wrong price and wouldn't switch it  also .. also said I tried ringing up my diapers what was already paid for and was a total different price for wipes like the voided transaction what u never wanted to look at will not lye !!!! ... hope you all have better Customer Service!!!! This is horrible.; This store was fantastic!  Cashiers!  I say again, there were a few cashiers!  I was in Heaven!  This is the store that is Walmart.  I don't like the complete self-service = the worst!  I highly recommend this store.  It's clean, smells good and employees are so nice AND helpful!  I wish I had a store like this close to me.  Enjoy!; Eron went above and beyond to help me find something I needed today. I really appreciated her time and effort, thank you so much!!; Well, it's Walmart and they did not disappoint. Went in for a bike for my wife. They had 2 sizes. We needed the small. Medium was on display. Was told to order small one for pickup. Arrived for pickup... They wheeled out the medium one. This was after specifically confirming we should order it and we could not just get it on the spot.
Cancelled the order.
Went to a different store for her bike.; I had the worst experience in the Auto Center. I needed to replace my car battery and the employee did not even attempt to help my determine which battery I needed. He just told me that they were in the aisle. There was no way to reference which battery I needed in the battery rack. I had to look it up on my phone.  Not a very good way to provide service to a customer. The next time I need to replace anything car related, I would rather pay extra to go to a car part store that is willing to assist their the customers.

#Update. 7-28-24 I've been banned from this store. Guess they didn't like this review**

The employees are so nice the managers are hit or miss either supper friendly or a complete incompetent troglodyte.  80% of the merch is great, but please, for the love of God, do not buy anything frozen from this store. They let everything thaw out. I know the company policy is no frozens out for more than 20 minutes, but I'll see ice cream on the floor for hours. And i find soft merchandise all the time. Save your body the sickness. If it's frozen buy it somewhere else. Everything else at the store is pretty great. Oh and I just remembered don't eat anything cold made by the deli. Look at pics for details; Love this Wally! I suggest all new residents of Tucson make this their main grocery shopping experience! So much fun. The staff are super nice. And... they have a ridiculously huge CAJUN section at this one location!! I'm serious, chère; SOMETHING NEEDS TO BE DONE. Store should be revamped. Out with the old in with new. These employees are rude and always just point to where things are located instead of doing their job and showing the customer. They’re too busy chatting it up about the local store DRAMA. Half of this store doesn’t run properly, management is slimy and rumors are they’re all sleeping with each other. Place was even set on fire TWICE by a homeless person because they treat people so poorly. THIS PLACE NEEDS A SERIOUS INVESTIGATION BY CORPORATE; Did you know that Walmart drivers that deliver groceries utilizing Spark choose to not pick certain items to deliver to you? These items will be available in store and yet they will not be delivered to your doorstep. My driver said my item was not available and the substitution was also not available. I took it a step further and went to the same store that my delivery driver shopped from and the items were very much readily available so why is this happening?; This store needs to be revamped it needs to have its employees removed and replaced by better ones. Store is never stocked. Employees always standing around talking to each other or out side on break.. You will see at least 9 of them on break at the same time outside. Shopping carts are always broken. 1 employee tried to acusse me of stealing just cuz she didn't know the items name.

Reviews:
No stars. New pharmacist are extremely rude . Say one thing than say something entirely different. Then so I asked again how many pills and what prescription is that is ready for pickup. Than phramacist telling me I’m wrong I’m not . Just trying to clearly what meds Walgreens has ready the price and how many times I take this new medication. Both new employees got rude with me so I told them please put back meds I go somewhere else. This is a medication involved my health . Nothing to mess with. Why is Walgreens always hiring new employees and not train them properly? Walgreens should either hire and train employees better. Customers deserve better. Thus not the 1st time this has happened here. Please do better by customers; Store is great! But BEWARE of the pharmacy -- Very disturbing that I get medicine that I DON'T NEED and that pharmacy tech will argue with you about their failed auto-reminder/auto refill system.  HORRID service.
I've been a customer there since they opened, getting many prescriptions for my mom when I was her caregiver and through my own cancer journey.
In the past 2 months their system has gone crazy, sending me refill reminders for meds I did NOT order which is very disturbing. I called Customer Service and they said I had to talk to someone at the store level, transferred me and I get the same horrid person each time I call and a supervisor is never "in the building."
Confirmed with my doctor as well, the office did NOT receive a refill request for the med I received when the person at Walgreens insisted that I had been the one who ordered it, I told her it must have been one on auto-refill that she didn't remove when we spoke the other day, the 4th time I've called about this problem with their failed automated system that she's defending.
Today makes my 5th phone call for the same unresolved problem. I know I'm just one person, but I'm moving my prescriptions to another RX service.; We were in the El Mirage area on vacation. Our prescriptions were coming due. The Pharmacy Dept. contacted our home pharmacy and got our prescriptions transferred. Worked out great! Thanks very much for your help! 👍; I have been coming to this pharmacy for years and each time I go the service is worse and worse. The attitude from the pharmacy technicians, Vivian in particular, is absolutely ridiculous. She is very condescending and rude. Customers should not have to put up with such behavior. I called and asked to speak to the manager only to be told he was filling in and there wasn't much he could do. I did the survey that was attached to my receipt and asked to be contacted. It is a week later and I still have not heard form anyone. In reading other reviews it seems that there have been other complaints about Vivian and clearly nothing has been done. My family will be taking our business elsewhere.; I stopped into Walgreens before going to work, dressed in my work  attire(scrubs). I noticed I was be followed and watched by a store employee. Being woman of color, I figured I was being racial profiled.  The employee that was following goes by the name of Jason, come to find out he is one of the store managers or supervisors.  I  will not be shopping at this location again.  This is the worst racist store ever
