Reviews:
This Walmart has everything needed for river… swimsuits… good selection
Basketball shorts for men—- a WHOLE WALL.. coming from California, it was nice .. we got all
Our necessities for the weekend.; Bought a “new” air mattress to use for a family friend to sleep on for a night or two while visiting and I opened the new box to find this. 8 patches, large stain that smelled of piss and tuna. The rest smells of cigarettes. There’s tons of nasty spots on it and near the pump is greasy, looking with tiny bugs. Threw it outside as I’m scared of what’s on it and don’t want that in my home. We will be taking it back. Just nasty.; Friendly staff. Quick pick up. My dog loves to go with me to the puck up section and staff are always friendly to him to. Just wish they were still able to give out dog biscuits again. He misses those on his Walmart trips!; There was a lady there-Samantha. My boyfriend and I were talking while ringing up our groceries. We scanned everything and even showed ID for age restricted item. We started walking out following re-stocking our cart. I hear someone say ma’am a few times and it’s Samantha telling me I need to pay for my food. It was all of $50 worth of food so it wasn’t like we were racking it up trying to get out quickly. What makes me write this is that she was treating me like some kind of criminal. I come to Walmart a lot and I see her constantly. I’ve never had an issue with her, she just looks like she doesn’t want to be there. She rolled her eyes at me and I just told her it wasn’t done on purpose. You don’t need to act like that over a mistake. This really upset us how she treated us when a lot of them recognize us and it was straight to judgement without any true assessment. I’m aware walmart sees that a lot but I work in service and I don’t treat others that way.; This store usually has everything I’ve needed in stock. Always wind up buying more than need.  Trying to control. I sometimes use walmart pick up. To prevent impulse buying it has helped. Pick up people are quick to bring my order out once I’ve parked.  Employees have always been friendly.

Name: Walgreens
Address: 1514 E Florence Blvd, Casa Grande, AZ 85122, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Reviews:
This pharmacy is beyond slow. With stage 3 arthritis in my spine, it is very painful for me to stand for over 45 minutes waiting in line inside.  My choice outside in the drive thru is to wait 25-45 minutes in 110 degree weather in a hot vehicle.  Have a separate line for pre pay folks so we can just pick it up without waiting for hours and hours of our lives on you. I can never get the lost hours of my life back from waiting at this place.  By count, walgreens owes me 3 days of life they stole from me!; Recently went and picked up my pain medication after surgery and was prescribed 2 different pain meds. The pharmacist that ask if you have any questions instructed that I could take both pain meds at the same time. I decided to look into this on my own and found out that the fda does not recommend combining these as they counter react with eachother and cause slow heart rate and shallow breathing. Luckily I had enough commonsense not to do what the pharmacist instructed as it could of been fatal.; Normally I would say my interaction was fine. However, a month ago I needed to pick up a script my doc had sent in for a biopsy I needed prior to having surgery.  I went to the drive through not realizing what the med was.  As I waited for the script to be sent through the drive through tube, I heard a voice. The voice was through a public microphone from the pharmacist.  " What do you neeed these pills for?" Not expecting it to be an issue I simply answered that my doctor ordered it.  She then asked if I was having bleeding , pregnant, or other issues which confused me because I had no idea why she was asking.  I then said I was having a biopsy.  She sent the drug through the tube.  First, it's not your business as my doc ordered it. Second, you said this aloud and publicly. Third it's not your business.  I will be taking my business elsewhere.  The pill was to open my cervix for a biopsy to check for cancer before a hysterectomy. I don't need your pharmacist asking me personal information in a public setting for one or at all for two.Ridiculous.; Trying to get my medications has been a hassle.

One i've been out of for so long I have forgot how long it been.

So far been getting a off brand variant of the medicine.  The issue with this one is my doctor gives me 90 count pills and yet Walgreens loves to change it to 30 count, change the dosage and add to it no refills.

My insurance says I have 2 refills but bottle says none.

Plus more recently two weeks ago I had eye surgery.

Doctor gave prescription for eye drops I am to take for 4 weeks

I am going into week 3 and so far luckily the eye drops are lasting

Thing is doctor knows I will need refill on the eye drops.

I doctor even sent over a new prescription for the eye drops.

Walgreens claims not in the system. I need talk to my insurance and doctor to over write their system.

I have already talked to them.

Even manager was rude to me.

This Walgreens needs to be audited.

They don't deserve my money!; The pharmacy is very frustrating. I literally walked away because of their incompetence.
They switched to a central fill facility and you can only pick them up the day you are scheduled to run out.
They are super unhelpful when trying to get your meds ready for vacation.
I will be switching to another pharmacy immediately.

Reviews: This review is specifically for the cashier who was working the night shift the last time I visited the store in September ‘24, to buy makeup and whatnot, Ernie is her nickname and she definitely deserves the highest rating of 5 stars! She was so kind and patient as I was trying to find my account number so that I could use all my online coupons and she had such a genuine caring personality and was so patient with me taking longer than normal because I forgot my glasses at home and couldn’t see hardly anything on my phone screen navigating the app. Most of the night shift from about 6 months ago were mean as heck to me one of them even called the police and had me searched b by 2 female officers when I’ve never stolen anything in my life and have never had anything like that ever happen to me before, 2 police officers went through my bag humiliating me in front of a full store. Of curious shoppers and employees, it was mortifying;  of course, they found nothing and let me continue shopping after that,  but I’ve barely gone back there at all since that happened, but I’m so glad I gave it another shot because Ernie went above and beyond to provide the best service..it might have been the best service I ever received from customer service before and hands down the best service I ever had at a Walgreens and CVS combined. If you’ve ever been discouraged by the staff at the Deer Valley location that they used to have I would totally go back into that store and give them another shot. I even have $7 in my rewards account too because of her just like she said I would. Thank you Ernie for being such a hard worker and a friendly face in our community.; I go into this location once in a while but will be going in more often as soon as they start carrying my favorite BeatBox flavors! I hope to see them on the shelves within the next few days.; I went in to get my passport photo done and Colin was very helpful and full of positive energy. He did a great job.; The other day I bought a knee strap. To my surprise the strap was not in the box. I took it back to Walgreens and the manager switched it out with another one. No questions and no hassle. I wish I got her name so I could give the manager in the purple shirt a shout-out.; I just had the best experience at this pharmacy! The pharmacist was kind, helpful and knowledgeable about an allergy situations happening to my baby. I had just gotten turned away from the pediatric place next door and was feeling anxious, but this kind pharmacist took the time to help me pick out an allergy medication and helped answer some of my questions. Thank you!

Name: Walgreens

Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Reviews:
10-1-24 I really dislike this Walgreens and the pharmacist LISA that works there is rude. I came with My Baby to pick up a prescription which the app told me it was ready. My insurance always pays a couple days before the pick up date and they refused to give me my prescriptions due to “pharmacy policy”  which I’ve never heard before because if my doctor released it and insurance is paying for it then its of date… not sure if it’s because she’s new here but total waste of time and rude customer service…

thats fine if truly if its Walgreens policy” but to make faces when a customer asks for the pharmacist or send notifications that the my prescriptions are ready just to drive there with my baby after a long day of work and school to deal with rude unfriendly people is unfortunate.. walgreens you really need to do better.. ill be switching my pharmacy soon.. also got my flu shot here only to get my 25 percent off coupon they offered and they did give me anything.. i swear its always something here PLUS THEY TAKE FOREVER.. guys please chose another pharmacy unless you love being onhold for ever and waiting over an hour just to pick up your so called ready prescription

BY THE WAY The other pharmacist Krista Is the best and she deserves a raise! Always so sweet to me and my family! we love her…  If I do choose to stay at Walgreens, it would be because of her and her kindness.. she is a true definition of how A pharmacist should be.. she truly cares for her customers And always gets the job done.. thank you krista for making our trips to Walgreens great never no complaints with her :); Truly one of the worst pharmacies I’ve dealt with. They don’t answer their phones - picking up a calling and placing it back on hold without speaking doesn’t count as answering. They don’t fill prescriptions in a timely manner and generally makeup reasons why something can’t be filled - anything from a back order to a recall when it was just that they didn’t get around to filling it. You have to count your pills every time because they will short you. If I could give zero stars with a review, I would; Third time I have tried to pick up a prescription and it was closed. Due to a cost issue, I can only get this medication here. Always an issue when using this pharmacy. I have all my other prescriptions at Fry’s pharmacy which I have had no issues with.; Don’t waste your time at this location. They have technical difficulties all the time and shut down the entire store! Unable to pick up my prescriptions several times at this location and when I call to transfer my prescription they don’t answer. Tried to get it refilled at another location but unable to because insurance had it listed completed with this location! I will be moving my prescription services elsewhere, definitely not any Walgreens!! I heard Bashes and Safeway is cheaper with their scripts as well.; Today was my first time at this location, I went to the drive through to pick up and I was greeted by the most angelic smile by Krista the pharmacy manager! I’ve never had anyone ever greet me like that. She was so sweet and happy she left an impression on me. Walgreens you have a winner here! Krista thank you for ordering my meds & the great customer service.

Name: Walgreens
Address: 9050 W Union Hills Dr, Peoria, AZ 85382, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM

Reviews: The pharmacy and staff are so unreliable and incredibly disrespectful and dishonest.  I dropped off a prescription yesterday and was told it would be ready in 15 minutes and called another in this morning.  Both were supposed to be ready by 1230.  I rushed over from cave  creek to pick them up and was told by a rude Middle Aged lady with glasses that the one from yesterday was not filled and the other was out of prescriptions.  I don’t understand the general incompetence.  I asked to speak to the  pharmacist who rudely said he could not do anything and they had a line to move my car.  The older lady with frizzy hair came back and told me to wait in the other lane and handed me back my card.  She said 15 more minutes.  Totally incompetent and rude.  She told me to move my car and if I had issues to contact corporate.  The medications were for my senior dog.  Who was forced to wait in the car in the Arizona heat with me.  Terrible service, just awful.; This pharmacy is very understaffed. I waited an hour for a prescription that I was told would be ready in 15 minutes. The pharmacy tech (Letty) not only was working the register, but had to get the prescriptions ready, as well. This was an impossible task as she had a line that was constantly full of people. She could not fill prescriptions while tending to the customers. After an hour she finally had help to free her up for fulfilling the RX’s. I told her I wasn’t upset with her, but very disappointed that management would cut staff back to the point that it affected the entire flow. Please staff your workers, so you are not setting them up for failure and angry customers!; A big thanks to Alvin, he saved the day.  thank you so much for your help and professionalism. you are much appreciated. 🙏 will definitely be back; Always have to wait for ever on the phone, and most frustrating part is they pick up the phone, and just hang up without saying anything, maybe say we are little busy please call back, it will take us 10 minutes please call back, please hold on we will be with you shortly. There are some great people working there also. It seems like they are always shorthanded. I really like some of your people that I deal with, please don't force me and others to go across the street to cvs. As I am writing this, this is the 8th time, someone picked up and hanged up. I hope you don't view this as a complaint, just work on your opportunity areas please.; I recently had my prescriptions switched to Walgreens off 91st and Union hills because another pharmacy ( not Walgreens by the way) was not being helpful with providing information on a out of stock prescription. I had a great experience with this location, the entire pharmacy team was kind, helpful, and informative. The person that answered my call was very helpful with making sure they had my prescription available. When I arrived at the drive thru, I greeted by the pharmacy tech. The pharmacist was so kind and answered my questions. I received a follow up call a few days later to offer their support and to answer any additional questions. This is absolutely great customer service and great patient care follow up. This is very important to me especially because starting a new medication  can sometimes be worrisome. Although we can call on our providers for any concerns, pharmacists are more knowledgeable with any drug interactions and contraindications, so it’s wonderful that this Walgreens location is supportive. Thank you for a great experience! I’ll be using this pharmacy location from now for my family .

Reviews:
They stayed open a tad bit later for my indecisive ass 😋 can't quite remember who helped me but he was very nice and had patience with me when I couldnt decide between 2 items. I asked for his opinion and gave it freely with no judgement or attitude. Both guys working that night were professional and didnt make me feel less than. Usually when smoke shops/Liquor stores are almost closed and in comes that late customer ( whose got money to spend though, me.. tehe) most of my past experiences ive delt with rude employees who act as if im a burden on them and that they just want my money so they can close up and bounce out. Feeling rushed when buying items that aren't very cheap and nonreturnable at that, is very frustrating when the people behind the counter are supposed to be there to help me navigate through their store and answer questions so that their customer, me, leaves satisfied and wanting to return in the future.. the people working here that night did non of that! They were extremely patience, very helpful , and had positive attitudes !

(OF course they have rules and opening / closing the store at certain times are important to maintain. . But it is always nice to receive a Lil kindness and a couple extra minutes to make my purchase 😋😉 especially when everything else is shut down and they were my last hope !! Lol thanks guys.. wish I could remember the names of the two fellows that helped me. . They were super chill.. && just laid back cool guys. 😎 🙃; The store is very clean, they have many many different options in high quality products, and the store owner is so kind, I go out of my way just to visit this location. If you ever need anything quickly or for a long drive, I recommend stopping here for everything you might need.; Some solid dudes working here. And the owner is good.people too.; 2 stars only because they have a good selection of allocated items but they’re almost double secondary pricing which is pretty wild.; Great selection of items like posters for your room and other items that are interesting. The employees are always super friendly and helpful. My fave liquor store ever.

They stock Zyn now, they did some construction to improve the layout, they have a beer cooler and now they play cool Indian music and burn incense. highly recommend you stopping in for your next purchase!

Waited on 10 minutes, and the lady couldn't be bothered to do more than ask if we had a fax machine and tell me to call back and leave a message. Never had this experience with any other pharmacy.; George is super racist. Changed his attitude at the moment he had to help us. Mad about same deals the store had. Did not give me a deal on my stuff. I did not argue with him but it's really wrong of him to change the price after the deal my price was 18 something. And he did something to change the price to regular price. Ended up being 25 dollars. He racial profiles people, never going back there. Hopefully this gets to a supervisor never had this experience with a person so close minded. He's lucky i respect old people.; My experience has not been good went to have my perception for my dog to be filled they wrote down the wrong phone number. They contacted me told me that they have the wrong number. I said I don't have it you can Google Costco in Puyallup. The gal says to me if I am going to be rude I can find another pharmacy .......; Extremely unhappy with this Walgreens.  I took two prescriptions for my husband from our home pharmacy in MN.  They both had refills remaining, so they only needed to call our home pharmacy for the transfer. After being told our home pharmacy wouldn't answer the phone, they claimed their employee had written down the wrong phone number, we were told to call his doctor & get new prescriptions.  I was told that the pharmacist was talking to our home pharmacy as I stood at the counter & the scripts still didn't get transferred.  I called our pharmacy in  MN and the prescriptions had been transferred the day after we took them to Walgreens. So today, 10 days after we took them in, they were finally filled.  This is the LAST time we will ever use this pharmacy.; The pharmacist or pharmacy tech, either way the one with all the tats and wires hanging out of her nose, was not very kind and friendly in assisting me checking on several medications costs. I needed to know my out of pocket cost. She said she wouldn't know what the prices are until she ran the prescriptions through the system. I understand that but back in South Carolina they can and they can do it quickly. She proceeded to give me a discount card as if she looked at me and thought I was homeless or appeared that I could not afford my medicines. She seemed to be in a hurry. My gut feeling is she had other things to do more important than take care of a long time customer. I'm not going to use this pharmacy ever again.

Reviews:
Paige’s energy was sure to bring a smile. She was so personable and welcoming. I love the name of the establishment, and the chair was a nice touch. You know what they say, “Liquor is cheaper than therapy. A remedy for any day; good, bad, or indifferent. But remember to Drink Responsibly :-); Ya know, everyone wants to feel like they matter in life. That they are significant and important. Well, as soon as I walked into Liquor Therapy, I felt exactly that, thanks to Paige. This is literally more than just another liquor or package store. Trust me.
Paige's energy is genuine and vivid, and offers one a remarkable experience. (Just visit to try for yourself.) It's slightly difficult to explain, as experiences as such are becoming an antiquity.

Double kudos to her for providing us with awesome recommendations to check out in the city!

I will be getting Liquor Therapy every single day that I am in town. Simply, because of Paige and her loving energy! Thank you, a million times, Paige!

10/10
Definitely recommend
A++; You have a "girl ", not a WOMAN working for you that does not get along with me. She made that abundantly clear to my husband this evening while he was shopping for me. Very unprofessional. We will not be spending another dime of our money there due to this. You've lost quite a few of my friends as customers as well. Save it for outside of work, Stephanie.  Personal issues do not belong in the work space.
Btw: if you don't want a trick, tricking your significant other into whatever it is she and her man do... I'd recommend he not purchase inside this establishment until she is no longer present.; This place is amazing.     So close to the ball park you can smell the hot dogs and crackerjack. Reviews: This may be the best liquor store in northeast Arkansas.  They have a nice selection of spirits and wines as well as beer and other alcoholic drinks. The staff has always been super friendly and helpful whenever you need assistance looking for something specific.  Skip the stores at the county line heading to Harrisburg and the ones in Paragould and head to Trumann. This place can't be beat.; The nicest people were here. They are extremely helpful and go out of their way to take care of you; The staff here is fantastic. I get the same thing each time and they usually already have what I want at the register by the time I step up.; Great prices  ... friendly staff; East stop to make off the interstate. There is a wide selection here and what they offer seems to change and sometimes you can find more obscure offerings here. The prices are the best in the area as well.

They also help to support local people and give back to the community! I love this place.; Good prices, excellent selection and awesome ppl. Would definitely recommend it.; Love this little place. So helpful and will answer all your questions!; Occasionally I like to buy wine 🍷 I stopped in this store for the 3rd time in a year and the customer service is the WORST. Hire people that at the very least say Thank you after a sale. No greeting whatsoever and forget getting help with selection. I stood there and watched as they treated every customer (about 10) equally effortless and not one Thank You. I left without purchasing my wine there and will not go back. I don’t know the price difference in the Package Store next door but even if it was a dollar or 2 more, the friendly customer service was well worth it…$80 well spent.; Great ppl, great service, very knowledgeable, good prices

Reviews: Every time I go in with my husband we are followed around the store. You can’t turn a corner without someone being right there although they never offer to help find what I’m looking for. I prefer to go to Macon beverage outlet.  Just as much selection of hard to find bottles if you collect like we do and always friendly service. They even run sales on popular liquors.; This place has an incredible selection of pretty much everything. I’m a flavored whisky fan and they have a huge variety. The prices are some of the best I’ve seen. They have so many specialty beers. Their selection of sours is varied and would suit any taste. The workers are very helpful and knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend.; I used to shop a lot here. I've spent an inordinate amount of money. Prices are not great but selection was pretty good. Got tired of being followed around whenever I brought my wife. Recently tried to give it another try, and sure enough, every isle we walk down, the owner or his wife is peering around the corner in the most obvious way. If you have melanin its not your store. Spend money elsewhere.; The manager brought in Three Rangers Whiskey at my request that is made by friend in Dahlonega. It's so nice to be able to drive down the street to buy it and to help Three Rangers expand. Great employees!!; I’ve been shopping here since they opened. The beer cooler isn’t very cold. Also on my last visit one of the employees was following me around watching me like I was going to steal something. I think I’ll find a new place to shop. They should know me by now. I’ve spent too much money in this place to be followed around like I was a thief.

AND an associate needs to bring your items to the bulletproof purchase area...; This is my first stop for liquor from now on. There is a nice relaxed atmosphere in the store. The staff and owner are very friendly and helpful from the minute you walk in the door. I had a wonderful chat with the owner as he rang up my order and the stocker was very knowledgeable about their inventory. The liquor selection is fabulous! I’ve been able to buy hard to find items frequently. My new go to party store.; Store was clean, staff nice, fellow customers nice.; Very nice staff good prices; Great variety and friendly staff. My go to liquor store.

Name: Sam's Club
Address: 1525 W Bell Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85023, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 1525 (street_number); West Bell Road (route); Deer Valley (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85023 (postal_code); 3411 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
This place is deteriorating. I've lately been noticing lots of rotting vegetables. This time, I came across boxes and boxes or moldy raspberries. Almost every single container I looked at had furry mold growing on berries. Look me a joke to dig down to a box that looked relatively okay.
Seriously disappointing service too. After so many years of never checking the membership card, all of a sudden employees run you down after you've already entered the store, asking for the card.; I shop at this store often but I used the optical dept for the 1st time. It has not been the greatest experience. Simply put, they need more help. I wait a long period of time to pick up samples a few weeks ago and now the order was ready as of today and I had to leave the store without them. I am done packing my patience and will not be using this dept anymore. It is ridiculous. 1 person to deal with the register and help people try on glasses is not effective. Several people were just standing around. Maybe they weren’t part of optical but where is the assistance? Even if someone called out, is there not a plan for things like this so that customers aren’t inconvenienced??  I now have to go back at 10am (pray I can make it back to work timely) to attempt to get my contacts, which I am COMPLETELY out of. I will never step foot over there again. Please do better.; We come to this Sam's club all the time I like the new tables in the food court. They are big and nice with kids now easy to sit and eat. The only thing I don't like big lines in the food court takes 25 to 30 min on weekends just order because the person who is taking orders will help a couple of people and will go and make food so there will be no one to take orders. They don't re stock toilet paper or wet wipes on weekends when we go most of the time empty.; I am visiting Phoenix to see doctors for serious medical conditions that I have that cannot be treated in Hawaii, and I offered to take my 91 year old host's vehicle to Sam’s to have 2 tires that were previously purchased & paid for before my 11 AM doctor's appointment in downtown Phoenix. When I arrived I was greeted by tire tech Odayne and had a friendly introduction. I explained why I was there and gave him the receipt and my friend's Sam’s card along with the appointment confirmation # that I got by phone the day before.. He immediately became very disturbed that the card-holder was not there to have this work done. Odayne grubbed "he knows the procedure" and I cannot do this unless he is here! I explained the car owner was unable to himself, so I offered to do this task. Odayne, became quite angry After my friend arrived & signed off, both techs were "having fun" avoiding the work at hand, smiling & joking with each other and looking at me through the window, letting me see that it was going to get done when they decided it would be done; not a moment sooner. They hadn’t even started tire removal until the vehicle was in the bay for 25 minutes. They took as long as they possibly could to finally get the tires back on the vehicle and then torqued each wheel 2-3 times with a break in between the torquing process.
At 9:45 I walked outside in the heat, which I shouldn’t have done and asked them "please, please, please sir "can you get the vehicle done so I can get to my doctor's appointment." They both laughed and found my begging quite funny. After I "begged" for five minutes Odayne's co-worker asked me if I would like a bottle of cold water, as I was standing in the sun with obvious heat stress.
He approached me with a cold bottle of water, reached his hand out with it, and when I put my hand out for it, he pulled it away, laughed and walked away with it!
If anyone is thinking of patronizing this Sam's Club, I would suggest you find somewhere else to shop. Costco is not only faster & less expensive, but their people are courteous & most professional.
I found the Sam's Club #6608 Phoenix/Bell road experience shocking, revolting & from the phone mishandling to the greeter Sarah's "flipping me the bird" when I asked to take a pic of her name badge and will never set foot in a Sam's Club ever again!; Ordered cupcakes for a birthday party. This is how they were delivered. The driver should have been ashamed to deliver these.
I called customer service and they said someone would call me back. 2 hours later and still waiting for a simple phone call. Extremely disappointed.

It is now almost 4 hours later and customer service has no idea where the driver is to deliver the cupcakes. Got the same run around story as this morning, “trying to figure it out.”

The cupcakes were finally delivered!!

Reviews: The staff are amazing, Estelle,  Jill, and the other ladies there. With the new Manager  Justin he has turned the store around and is very involved with the customer's as well as staff vast improvement.; It's an older Walgreens Store but very well stocked. It's not the regular store that I go to, but if I need a few items & I'm down that way, I will get it there. The store Set Up is very similar to the older Walgreens set up. I can locate items at this location that many of the others do not carry anymore.; Pharmacy is always closed due to pharmacist not on duty, don't ever go here for meds, they don't care at all if your in need or not, this happens all the time as well, Apache junction or Mesa should be ashamed of this facility in there zip code; Long lines, slow staff, no customer service. I had my dog in the car so I didn’t want to go to a large grocery store or anything. I just needed to buy a deck of cards on my way to a family function. I ran to the cards and got up to the line by 3:51. I know because my alarm went off at 3:50 for me to get on the road. I was still in the line at Walgreens when my alarm went off at 4:10. There were two women working behind the counter. They didn’t acknowledge anyone in line nor did they have an ounce of polite customer service once I reached the register. They didn’t move with any sense of purpose and didn’t even speak to the customers. I’d be more understanding of a long wait if they were friendly, but they weren’t even that! At one point, someone else who worked there walked up, made eye contact with me, said NOTHING, walked over to the photo counter and pushed some items around the counter like she was bored and had nothing better to do than move a piece of paper two inches, and then she simply walked away... At that point in time, I was fifth in line. So basically, just like any Walgreens, they’ll carry what you need. But if you have anywhere to be— or a dog waiting in the car 🥺— Don’t come here. There are two other Walgreens in AJ. An alternative isn’t far away.; Outside of a few panhandlers & homeless, the silent/invisable pharmacy, slipshod photo department, the ghost town liquer department, this Walgreens is great! Shop here almost daily, never a dull moment. The mysterious Pharmacist you never see in store is behind a large 1 way seeing glass window secluded from customer contact, and your presciption for pick up is spit out in a bin recepticle next to the annoying photo/picture/copy console. Intrusive stand up cardboard displays are scattered about storewide stuffed to the brim with oversized candie bars and worthless plastic toys or stuffed animals. Any poor soul that ventures into the liquer department, brace yourself for the ultimate shame as you pass the  unattended cashier counter as an intercom speaker blasts out storwide in high volume 'Help needed in the liquer department!' LOL!! Robert at 69.

Name: Walgreens

Reviews:
My husband and I are getting a series of unusual travel immunizations and both Nicole and Charles (pharmacists) have been exceptionally helpful helping us sort out the order of getting these, the best prices and getting them in a timely manner. We’ve gone to ‘PASSPORT HEALTH’ a private immunization clinic in the past but the shots were much more expensive (sometimes double) at Passport Health. I believe this may be the only Walgreens location to have travel immunizations done and I strongly recommend them.; Customer Service is awful... Manager hung up on me for canceling my delivery order. They really need to not offer delivery at all at this location.
October 2024 Update: Original review was posted September 2023... Decided to try again today .. Placed order for same day delivery... At the scheduled time, no delivery, status indicated it would be delivered tomorrow... Tried to use chat to cancel then had to call,  no one could cancel the delivery... Not gonna try delivery from this location anymore... Try at your own risk; Total incompetence!
Staff becomes aggressively defensive when questioned about anything!
Their automated system is absolutely worthless, after receiving text and calling to let them know that you can't pick it up right away they agreed to put it in the hold bin for up to ten days and then they actually call every day to remind you!
Each time you of course get another associate who explains their computer is set up for the daily reminders even though a couple of them did actually check to see it was marked for later pickup because of being out of town!
So we're in the 21st century and the only way corporations want to communicate with us is on line but they can't input a message to their system of a requested pickup date?
So when I get there to pickup my RX
They tell me it's been put back even though I had spoken to at least 6 people who called to remind me that it was ready and  3 of the 6 actually went to the hold bin to verify pickup date!
Customer service is a thing of the past!; Pharmacy it totally incompetent! Made my daughter wait for over a week for the doctor to reply to a refill for important medication fax, while there was already a refill remaining on the script. Continues to fill prescriptions that I have repeatedly told them I do not take. Called to sort it out and pharmacy manager could tell me her name, possibly Nicole,” I have so many young people”!; The pharmacy here is totally unreliable.  I’ve come here twice within a week to pick up the same prescription, and both times the pharmacy is closed even though the hours indicate it’s open.  They should simply permanently close this pharmacy if it’s never open instead of holding prescriptions hostage.  If you actually are interested in being able to access your medication, I’d suggest not having the prescription sent to this Walgreens.

Name: Walgreens
Address: 15442 N 99th Ave, Sun City, AZ 85351, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 15442 (street_number); North 99th Avenue (route); Sun City (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85351 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This little Walgreens is a God send to the neighborhood. The pharmacy does an amazing job keeping up with the high demand daily.
This is a much smaller Walgreens than most I have shopped in. I wish they had a larger food section and more OTC meds . Anyway the checkout is good and very friendly staff Thru out the store.; This is my local Walgreens, and I have been there several times. It's a very nice store with friendly employees. They have a huge variety of merchandise too, and lots of good sales. Yesterday, my daughter and I brought my infant grandson to get his passport photo done, which was a fun experience .  We weren't sure how baby passport photos are taken, and employee Greg was extremely helpful. He took a photo with my daughter holding him and then he removed her image (very interesting process- see photos) I really appreciated Greg's patience and kindness through the photo process.; Reasonably well-run store. Normally clean & tidy. Usually understaffed, never anyone tending the photo department. Pharmacy is also well-run and attentive although typically long-lines during snow bird season.; I purchased knee support sleeves at this Walgreens, but found that they were not snug enough to give the support I needed. There was a buy one get, one half off, sale so the total price was $38.94. Six days later, I went back to return them to get a refund. I was told that in order to get a refund I had to present my driver’s license for them to scan into their system. I couldn’t believe it. If I was returning some expensive durable medical equipment, I might not have been so unpleasantly surprised; but could not understand why they needed to scan my personal information into their system for a refund of less than $40. Since I am on a fixed income, I could not afford to let them keep my money so I had to give them my driver’s license. I could see that my name, address and date of birth was retained in their system. I felt that my privacy had been violated. In addition, I felt that I was being set up for possible identity theft since so many companies have had their computer systems hacked; allowing hackers to gain access to customers personal information. In theory, a hacker could use the personal information that I was forced to allow them to scan in and go on the dark web and use it to find my social security number, too. Walgreens is creating another avenue for hackers to steal customers identity. I will never shop, nor fill any prescriptions, at any Walgreens again. After what occurred both of my sisters will stop filling their rather expensive prescriptions there. I have never, in over 60 years, been asked to present my driver’s license to get a refund! It made me feel like I was being treated like a criminal. What an insult, especially for such a small amount.; This Walgreens location, like many in the area, is in a shopping center where the owners do not clean. There is frequently spills and trash at the entrance and the parking lot as well. I can't fault them for the numerous homeless that camp out and sometimes aggressively ask for money. That is a political issue. No matter how empty the store and pharmacy are,  you will have a substantial wait. I feel that The pharmacists don't make a concerted effort to get in touch with doctors when a new prescription is needed. Items in the store are priced a bit high but usually you get store coupons to help with that. Basically, that is what keeps me coming back. Usually the employees are really nice.

Name: Walgreens
Address: 7448 W Thunderbird Rd, Peoria, AZ 85381, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 7448 (street_number); West Thunderbird Road (route); Peoria (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85381 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I have been going to this Walgreens for about a year now and every time I go it is extremely clean and everyone is so nice and helpful!!! The people that work in the pharmacy are the best! They are always so helpful and explain everything very throughly!!! Even when I ask a million questions they never get annoyed and stay super nice!! I want to definitely give a shout out to Derek who is always working and helps me whenever I go in!! He is always so friendly and sweet and always super helpful!!!! He always has a smile!!! He definitely is amazing at his job and i appreciate him!; Highest turnover rate I’ve seen out of a pharmacy. Maybe they are crappy towards their employer maybe some leave because they don’t believe in the horrible way they treat the customers. Regardless of the reason, this pharmacy cannot seem to get it together. The store manager Cory only listens to your complaints but doesn’t make sure that the pharmacy is running smoothly on a consistent basis. I get the feeling he’s just there to collect a paycheck but not really concerned with the quality of service his store puts out. With so many pharmacies within a 5 mile radius, and with lower costs for scripts, one would think they would deliver superb customer service to KEEP their customers.

Plan on long waits and long lines. Where getting the customer in and out of there is not a priority.

If you call the pharmacy plan on someone picking up without saying anything and being placed on hold numerous times. Apparently answering the phone with “Walgreens Pharmacy please hold” is unheard of. And this may go on for a while.

The newest pharmacist, the man from India I believe is hit or miss with his customer service. He is fully aware that the phones are being answered by picking up and placing the customer on hold without speaking and seems to think this is fine if they are as he said “busy”. Interestingly enough, he was very customer friendly when he was first hired. He seemed to believe in quality customer service and restoring that at the store but maybe 2/3 months in, his habits were just as bad as the techs there. I guess he said what he needed to to get the position and that was that!

For the life of me I can’t understand why bother to get into customer service or anything that deals with the public if you aren’t a customer friendly individual? Is it just for the sake of having a job? And it is really sad because customer service, friendliness and the desire to give deliver quality has gone down downhill and voicing your concerns here at this store falls on deaf ears. So why bother?  Go elsewhere as we have done; I have had issues for years but it's finally gotten out of hand. They cancelled a controlled substance prescription 4 times causing it to be over a month late and withdrawals. When I tried to transfer the prescription away, they told the new pharmacy there were no refills even though it was a brand new prescription and the website shows 4 refills. Terrible service, high turnover, absolutely the worst pharmacy I have ever experienced. Three location convenience isn't worth it and I will never, EVER return; Absolutely worst pharmacy. Mistake after mistake with no accountability. Sad, as they used to be great.
Definitely finding a new provider.; photo order has been ready for over 4 days and the manager tried to tell me it wasn't there. he looked it up in the computer and said i didn't order anything since November. despite me showing him the order was ready. after arguing he actually looked in other bins. i also ordered a custom magnet and an employee left it on a shelf. i never got a call that my ship to store was ready. the manner manager tried telling me that wasn't there either. barely helped me without me begging him to look but he was more than happy to help search shelves for a pretty blonde. very racist.

Tony, the owner and manager provides customers with absolute sincerity.
He and his brothers are pleasant and knowledgeable of their inventory and offer tips on their alcohol sales based on popularity.; Great selection, always have what I need. They have an amazing high dollar selection also!; I ordered an unusual brandy tonight off this store's website. They said it was in stock and would be delivered the next hour. I paid and it went on my credit card immediately. When the delivery window passed I tried calling the store repeatedly. It clicked over to an automated message saying to call back another time. When 2 hours had passed I went to the store. Adrian was unfamiliar with the product and made a quick walk down one isle and said "it is somewhere around here." Of course, it wasn't. He kept passing me over to help other customers instead of giving me the common courtesy of looking up the product, trying to find it, or any action considered customer friendly. He said it would be shipped on Tuesday from another location and didn't seem to comprehend that delivery and shipping are two different things. Salem is the manager of this young man and clearly has not trained him how to provide customer service. He offered me my money back and did nothing to erase the transaction. He refused to put it back on my credit card and gave me cash, which I did not want. This whole experience was disturbing and left me with guests at home waiting for a product that was completely misrepresented. I had never been here before and would never return. What a waste of time!; An incredible store.  All staff is excellent & incredible.; Full secondary or more on most allocated bourbon and they tell me "it's a good price".  Good selection otherwise if you are willing to pay $$$$$$$

Name: Total Wine & More
Address: 1680 E Monte Vista Ave, Vacaville, CA 95688, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 1680 (street_number); East Monte Vista Avenue (route); Vacaville (locality); Solano County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 95688 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Excellent bourbon selection! Although, they don't carry some of the brands I was looking for that a local competitor carries (Weller). Definitely a great stock of spirits.

The beer on the other hand seems to be poorly managed. There's far too many choices from all over the world, but I think they'd do better focusing more on the great local craft breweries we have in our region (i.e. Moonraker, Moksa, Slice, etc.) as well as other California craft brewers. They do carry a lot of these, but we are so spoiled with great breweries in our area, so it would be great to focus more on offering more from our great state. There's just too many different beers from all over the world and it's not necessarily a good thing. Sure it's fun to do a beer tasting session of beers from other regions. A lot of the craft beers they get from other regions of the world are average according to Untappd. How about some of the top breweries such as Trillium, Hill Farmstead, Other Half, Tired Hands, etc.)??? And if you want cold beer from the fridge, it's slim pickings. Seemed like it was a lot of seltzers, Bud, Coors, etc. and a small amount of local craft breweries. Plenty of local competitors with better ice cold selections. The worst part is a lot of that beer is out of date.  I saw a lot of IPAs way past their 3-month freshness date. But I wasn't there for IPAs, rather I was there because it's Oktoberfest season. They had section devoted to this style, however I was specifically looking for this year's Sierra Nevada release. I noticed they had some so I grabbed two 12-packs. Turns out it was LAST year's release. I mean, I didn't even think to check the dates because what reputable liquor store would sell a lager style that is over a year old?! And it tasted horrible. When your supply is getting old, you need to have a clearance sale. No way I'll buy beer at this place again.; Me and my girlfriend went to see and take a look at the new stock on my day off and see what was available. The entire time I was being followed because I have tattoos and so does my girlfriend. When I was looking at the selection of mini bottles,  I was followed by an employee. My girlfriend was also followed from the bathroom and back to me when she was finished. The employees only left us alone after I paid for my items. We both felt extremely uncomfortable the entire visit and we have been there multiple times. We will be back again but please don’t profile us and do better as a company and people in general. 1 star.; I found my favorite Islays there, TG they carry Bowmore, and now I don't have to go to Bev Mo anymore where they don't sell to you unless everybody in your group is 21 and over. Which is stupid because some of us don't want to leave our kids in the car, and some of us are not buying anything and didn't bring our wallets or drive.

Thank you Total Wines for being normal and special thanks to Kim  the cashier who is super sweet and extra awesome.; Total wine has the greatest prices. The employees are very helpful and nice. They know all about their products!! I get great service every time I visit, no matter the location.; I went on the soft opening night. This turned out to be very informative. I was able to talk with experts about different wines and bourbon.  I went in only to purchase a bottle of whiskey but came out with whiskey, wine and some Moet. Thanks to the staff from the front door to the cash register. Everyone was so nice.

Went in yesterday and the same 2 packs of cigarettes are now $25.47. 3 dollars more per pack. Some would say inflation but let's call it what it really is. GREEDFLATION.; UPDATE:  CORPORATE HAS BEEN NOTIFIED!!! The pharmacy staff from the techs to the pharmacist are all rude and make you feel like you are bothering them.  Then when you are told over the phone that you can pick your rx up and you go and then they tell you that it's too early come back another day.  I am a pharmacy tech myself and I would never treat patients like they do. Most of the time it's  either you can't get your rx cause by their calculator it's too early or it's out of stock and you have to wait till it comes in and there are no deliveries over the weekends.  I have gone several days before without meds cause they do not have it in stock.  This pharmacy used to be good and now it barely gets one star from me.  I will be changing to a whole different pharmacy company from here on out.  Unbelievable how they are ALLOWED to treat patients.  I will be calling the corporate office and letting them know this is not right. You would think with all the negative reviews something would have been done already; The manager at Broadway and Kolb is very young and naive. She doesn't have good math skills and should not be working in retail.  She is very young looking,  with short crooked black hair and white makeup,  goth look, which is funny because she belongs to FLDS CULT and is a mormon missionary.  I was overcharged and she refused to even look at the receipt, she didn't appear to know math and wouldn't add it herself,  all she said was the computer never makes mistakes,  which we all know computers do make mistakes.  Not sure how she made manager,  because everyone knows the FLDS CULT  doesn't work,  they steal from government.  So her mission is stealing at Walgreens; Went to pick up a prescription and had a horrible experience with the pharmacy tech. First she had a nasty attitude with me after I relayed that I had pre-paid for my prescription so I just needed to scan the barcode. She then proceeded to cancel out the phone number process for rewards. When I asked to put my number in, she said she had to void the transaction and proceeded to rip everything out of the bags and slam it on the counter. After getting it voided, she aggressively told me to give her the bar code and to put my number in correctly this time. I don’t appreciate this experience especially considering this is the second time I’ve dealt with an unfriendly tech. I would hope in the future that behavior isn’t allowed. I will not be going back to get my prescriptions from this location.

Reviews:
I work at a pediatrics office & called to follow up on a patient with the pharmacy & the pharmacist Amanda was so rude! Not helpful at all & had such a rude tone & sounded irritated. Do better.; many of the pharmacy staff are extremely rude and even cancel prescriptions without any warning or messaging of any kind. completely unacceptable. for months now they have made me wait more than a week after the refill period to get vital seizure medication causing me many difficulties, if you can get your medication somewhere else I highly recommend doing that asap.; Pharmacy takes 45 + minutes to answer  the phone while there's no calls ahead of me. Make this make sense; This Walgreens really need to evaluate the people they hire as Pharmacy Techs.  They are all very Rude, and in patient. You know what really bothers me , is that people with mental illness " --aàdon't need to go threw that. Customer Service is the one KEY to a company.
I think you should definitely evaluate every single person in the Pharmacy.  I don't know if they hate there job , but it certainly shows.; I use the location at 1451 N Dysart Rd Avondale, AZ. My dr prescribed me a freestyle Libre because my sugar levels have been going high because of steroid injections I have to use.   This is easier for me to see my sugar levels regularly. I saw my order pending and walgreens took it upon themselves to cancel my order because of the high copay price. Why would you assume the patient can't afford it and cancel it? I needed this because I can go into a diabetic shock. Now when I called today they told me they would reorder it but now I have to wait another day to get it which I will be out of town. The pharmacist laughed when I asked why they didn't call me before canceling it? She said because that would be too many people to call. So you would be ok with the person dying canceling a med because you feel they can't afford it? Why not give the patient the price and let them choose??? This is beyond unacceptable!!

I'd truly give zero stars!! My husbands dr called in prescriptions for him 2 days ago still not ready so he literally walks in sits there for nearly 3 hours waiting to be sent home and told the doctors DEA #s are incorrect but they have dispensed her meds she's prescribed in the past- I have been hung up on 3 times after holding for over 45 minutes --- what kind of actual customer service is this??
Now again after 40 minutes there's a recording saying call back--- totally not professional zero stars is what they deserve!!!; We had an awesome experience, thanks to Becky. Even though she is in charge of the beauty products. She didn't hesitate to offer help to guide us inside  the store. Very professional she mentioned all the special walgreens has to offer. Customer service as it's best 👌..; How far has the Walgreens name fallen from grace?  This particular store will show you the fall in massive display.  Customer service once something that separated Walgreens from the others now just a memory.  Shame! Shame! Might as well convert it to an online store. Understaffed, no phone service ever , sub par to 0 RX service. Find another RX to waste your time and money.; I have to endure going in this store once a month.  It's pathetic.  They are tremendously understaffed.  Every time....I stand in line forever to get a prescription picked up.  Today I was #2 in line....I was there for 45 minutes.  Just terrible 😞
Also....the phone rang and rang while I was at the counter.   The clerk said they just don't answer it because then there would be no one to assist the customer.   I wish I could rate this store a zero!; It’s their policy to shut the pharmacy window IN YOUR FACE at lunchtime, regardless of how long you’ve been waiting in line. I’m currently waiting for a pharmacist to transfer my prescriptions to Walmart.  THE OTHER COMMENTERS ARE CORRECT.  Avoid this pharmacy and store like the plague.

Name: Walgreens

Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 1995 (street_number); West State Route 89A (route); Sedona (locality); Yavapai County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 86336 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I’m pretty sure a requirement to work at this store is to be as rude as possible! I avoid this store but had to do a FedEx return here. I pressed the call button three times and then had to go track someone down. It wasn’t a big deal, because I figured they were all busy. I said I had a return and she said in an annoyed voice, “is it ready to go”, it was and just needed her to scan my QR code. Apparently that was a lot for her to do because she made a snotty under breath comment that I hadn’t printed the label. I would avoid this store at all cost. The pharmacy staff is rude as well. I go to CVS now, everyone is kind and helpful.; I agree with the statement of rudeness in the Pharmacy that I have seen in these reviews.
I have had immunizations here numerous times. I never had to have an appointment!
I walked in last night and waited 12 minutes until I was acknowledged. Then waited 8 more minutes to be helped. There were absolutely no other customers there or on the phone.
I said I would like to get my shingles vaccine. I had no appointment. The man that was helping me said oh you need an appointment.  Then he asked pharmacist if an appointment was needed. It was clear they did not want to assist me.
I am a retired healthcare worker. I would have said, "We are now requiring appointments,and since we are not busy, we can get the immunization done for you."
I will never go back! In 25 years of living here, I have never experienced attitudinal lack of customer service.
I called Fryes in Cottonwood . The Pharmacist was so friendly. Said,"no appointment was needed,come on in, see you soon."
The pharmacy was busy there and Pharmacist got me right in. Very personable.
She was very good at giving immunization,knowledgeable, and educated me on side effects. My husband remarked on the difference in treatment as he also witnessed the Walgreens situation.
Fryes pharmacy is my go to now. It's worth the drive to get friendly, competent care!; Important prescription was called Thursday, mid-day and late that day I went in and was told that it wasn't ready. I went in Friday, still not ready ("we're just too busy and there are only 2 people in the pharmacy today"). I went in today (my third trip), and the attendant in the pharmacy said it wasn't filled - that it needed to be filled by their "Central Fill" warehouse in Tempe, and then she asked me if I wanted her to ask that it be filled. She saw the look on my face, and said "let me see if we have any in stock". She returned and told me that it would be filled in a couple of hours. I realize it's hard to find employees but in the healthcare/pharmacy field, this type of negligent handling of prescriptions is hard to accept. This place is literally falling apart and I fail to see how it can remain in operation in the long run.; Aside from the pharmacy folks, all the staff, by and large, is rude.  This morning, I walked in to pick up a prescription, and the pharmacy was closed.  When I asked an employee who wouldn't even look up to acknowledge my presence,  when the pharmacy opened, she said, "There are signs everywhere," then stated it opens at 10.  Thank goodness there is a CVS in town.; Entered the store for one item and was relentlessly followed around like a criminal until I made my purchase while others of lighter skin tones were not. In 2024 this isn’t something I should still have to go through, do better.

I can guarantee that today is a tougher day for me then that lady for reasons I don't care to disclose. So please, can we just do our jobs, then go home and do whatever we want? Please ffs; Update:  It has been many months since I have been here ... The store looks cleaner, the shelves are stocked and everyone was  friendly.

Offered raincheck for out of stock product.  Update  - Product increase from $10.99 to $15.99 in a week.  Whoa - crazy.

Name: Walgreens
Address: 6690 W Union Hills Dr, Glendale, AZ 85308, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 6690 (street_number); West Union Hills Drive (route); Arrowhead Ranch (neighborhood); Glendale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85308 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Doesn’t even deserve 1 star! The store needs more worker or better attention to their customers. The line at the front desk was all the way to the back with 1 worker. Went to the back pharmacy no customers in line, waited for 5 min. While 2 workers at register. One tall lady (worker)  looks at me and walks back to her shelves while the other still at register. I thought perhaps the man (worker) was busy still waited. Another man comes and goes straight to him and attends to him, both him and the other tall lady oblivious to me waiting there not even acknowledging me both seeing me wait however not letting me know they will be right with me, nothing!. Was upset another person walks up and gets attended! These workers need to be more attentive! Disregarded myself as a customer, unacceptable!! Horrible customer service!!! Maybe need employee better training. Incident happened 9/8 @ around 330pm.
I will drive somewhere else next time!; I am always treated with dignity and respect by Adam and Anthony in the pharmacy at this location. These two are professional, caring and fun to deal with every single time that I see them. They both deserve a raise!!!!; The online scheduling program allowed me to schedule appointment for 9:50am. When I arrived I check in. Waited for 35 minutes after my scheduled appointment. When I was called up the pharmacist was flustered and said that they didn’t have the vaccine I requested and she doesn’t understand why I was allowed to schedule the appointment in the first place. This location appears to be very unorganized, unprepared and frankly unprofessional.; As someone who works retail it's nice to see a team flow together so well they seem to be finishing each other sentences at work so perfectly worked very well together not sure could go smoother so that's always a pleasure to see.; ALWAYS a problem with getting prescriptions. It is insanely frustrating to have to come back and back and have to argue to get my prescriptions EVERY SINGLE TIME. The staff is nice, but clueless to how their systems work and the “pharmacists is never available. Go anywhere else. Literally anywhere else.

Reviews: I love shopping at Sam's Club cause they have a  really clean store with many different Items to purchase not just groceries but household goods, Jewelry , etc. Fresh cooked pizza at a really good price! ♡🍕 !; We had a great experience at the Sam’s Club. Their butcher counter actually served single cuts of meat. They’re all prime. A lot of them were very very pretty. I was very excited not all Sam’s clubs have this you should really take advantage of this feature. Also, the Sam’s Club has a gas station attached to it. It is super affordable for diesel the best prices around.; I want to apologize to the guys that work at the tire service for the way that I reacted. They did a great job and the general manager was very patient with me and my daughter. Thanks again for everything.🙏 The tires are great 💯. They look intimidating 😂; I received exceptional service from Anthony in auto even though I arrived very close to closing time.  He didn’t skip a beat to help me out.  I wish so badly that he was able to accept a tip.  Sam’s club flagstaff, you’ve got a gem of an employee there!; Racially profiled against natives at least from my experience. Upon walking in the white family in front of me was greeted very nicely so I thought id get greeted the same.. I was not. The white guy greeter got the white family a cart and he didn't even greet me and didn't get me a cart. I said hello to him and he ignored me and I end up getting my own cart.

Address: 5137 W Olive Ave, Glendale, AZ 85302, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Reviews: This a great store.  Extremely clean.  Follows all safety covid protocols.  Tons of parking and well lit.  This one has a ton of team members.  Great check outs.  Each shelf is always full and fruit and vegetable is always clean.  Offers both pickup and curbside.  Great hours and clean carts.  If you want to afford the crowds this one stays preety calm.  Lots of amenities surrounding this spot and easy assecibilty.  I highly recommend this location.; Easily found the items on my shopping list at affordable prices. In and out in a jiffy and the employee monitoring the self-check was amiable and helpful.; This is a solid store. Have been shopping here regularly for a few months since moving near by. My most recent visit was truly exceptional. I required a return and the customer service desk person by the name of Sadie was really great. She made my return very easy and even helped me check out at the desk. Thank you, I really appreciate the great customer service and will keep coming back to this location. Store is always clean and their shelves are regularly stocked. 5 out of 5 stars.; This store is one of my favorite marketplaces in my region. Not too busy. Always stocked! Friendly staff; I don’t know whyyy.. but when you press those buttons for assistance?! for the things that are behind glass. I swear its actually a button for the associates to hide from you and not get you what you need. You’re lucky if you get one associate to help you and that’s if you actually stay there and wait 10, 20, 30 minutes later. Orrrrrr when you go up to the cashier and keep asking then after like 10 times if they can call someone. Sometimes you’ll just end up walking away and leaving without the product you were gonna get. Walmart are you telling me you don’t want my money okay I’ll go buy it somewhere else at that point idc if it’s more expensive or not.

Name: Walmart

Reviews:
We found all of our back to school supplies as well as dorm organization needs at good prices. The employees were very helpful when we didn't know where to look. Some used their apps to ensure that we should find the item in the store or need to buy it online.

I was really surprised that I found Adult strength liquid acetaminophen in the pharmacy area. Usually we have to get the children's strength and just do the math to get adult doses.; The managers at both locations are VERY RUDEand THE HIRING MANAGERS AT BOTH LOCATIONS ARE EVEN WORSE...ALL BECAUSE SHE THOUGHT MO. STOOD FOR MONTANA(WHICH IS MT.), AND IT DOESNT, MO. IS ABBREVIATION FOR MISSOURI(DUH)....I can see why the workers are rude as hell at these 2 locations here in flagstaff!! JUST DISGUSTING....WORST EXPERIENCES AT BOTH LOCATIONS!!!!; I utilize this Walmart primarily for pick-up orders and my experience has been incredible! I’ve had Matt deliver my pick-up items to my car both times. He’s so friendly and has a good sense of humor. With my items, the first time I used the pickup option he brought me a cold water bottle. On my second pick-up visit he brought me a reusable grocery bag with lots of snack and cosmetic samples. You don’t get this type of service everywhere! Great job Walmart Flagstaff and stellar employee Matt!; For Walmart, this store is exceptionally clean. And organized, it is a small Walmart compared to the ones on the East Coast. But as I said, it's exceptionally clean and organized. The people are friendly and pay attention to your needs when you ask them a question.  And they try to help you the  best they  can. This is one of the better walmarts I have been to across this country.
Good management makes a big difference.
I came here from Dothan, Alabama, which has absolutely the worst Walmart and Sam's Club in the entire country and if you travel to Dothan Alabama unless it's a necessity, I suggest you avoid Sam's Club and  Walmart.; I was excited to find out that they had a tens unit that I needed for my mother‘s pain. But when I got to the register, I realized I did not have my wallet and unfortunately, Walmart does not allow  tap for payment like other stores.

Reviews:
Since I live nearby, we have an opportunity to test their service frequently.

The cashiers are almost always very polite. The managers who assist in the photo department are extremely helpful. My mother has gone there on several occasions and needed very specific, extensive assistance, and it's gotten a lot of great help.

The employees offer assistance to help customers find what they're looking for. I got a fair amount of help even from the pharmacy in finding things on the shelf.; Quick service with a friendly cashier. Only issue was they were out of stock of the water that I prefer. Other than that it was a thumbs up.; I want to thank Jacob, working the front counter, for being beyond helpful!
He helped me get my app working while checking out my store goods… and with a smile!! Thank you Jacob!; Superior customer service from the pharmacy staff. Received a follow up call from Dave making sure I was not having issues with my medication. Very kind and helpful. Much appreciated!; So much faster than CVS & employees are so helpful & friendly! I transferred ALL our prescriptions over to them and have been so much happier. They also have a great toy gift section for kids...super cute items!

Name: Sam's Club
Address: 16573 W Bell Rd, Surprise, AZ 85374, USA

Reviews:
Its Sam's.. we all know what Sam is.  Just a bulky Walmart.
We went there this afternoon on 7.27.2024, and got a chicken that was ok but a little dry and a Cesar salad.
I tried calling the store, it rang for over four minutes with no answers. Do not buy Taylor salad stuff. We sorted out the ok stuff and the nasty stuff.  If we get ecoli , I'll know exactly from where it came from.; Sam’s Club gas and in store shopping is fine. Friendly staff and good prices.; Very positive experience here. Staff is fantastic and experienced!! Cafe staff provide pizza in an ordererly time, especially considering the volume of order they receive!! Checkout and customer service staff is fantastic and helpful!! I am here multiple times weekly shopping and this is my favorite Sam's Club to go to.; Experienced 5-star customer service in the Optical department at Sam's club yesterday!
Went in with broken nose pads on my glasses asking for help with a possible repair that, as a senior with shaky hands, I couldn't do on my own. I was assured by Barbara that she would be more than willing to assist me. She proceeded with the repair immediately while I waited. She fixed the problem adding new pads and screws, adjusted my glass frames, cleaned the lenses and was beyond helpful to me with a bright and cheerful attitude.

Kudos to Sam's Optical for their willingness to help with these, what might be considered "bothersome" repairs, and for having such positive employees like Barbara representing them. Sam's Club is the BEST in my book for their unusual customer service!; This samsclub needs to hire young people in the gas station,  this guy was mad of me because I ask for help, when all he was doing was been on his phone,  he told me that he dosen't want to help me, the pump #1 was having issues and he was telling me that I wasn't a member,  or that I don't have money  to 😡😡 so I move to pump #11 and got gas there, he was mad of me for making him doing his job 😡 I will post pictures,  there is an old lady also that is not nice that old too

Name: Walmart Supercenter

Address Components: 5845 (street_number); West Bell Road (route); Bell/Greenway Neighborhood (neighborhood); Glendale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85308 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This dog was allowed in the store on the produce side and through the restaurant. Obviously not a service dog and was aggressive and barking. I know and respect service dogs are allowed but this is obviously not a service dog and is a disgusting health code violation to have animals around food. In addition it’s a safety issue as this was a nippy out of control dog that could harm a child.; This Walmart is very organized I was excited to see they had more than one craft isles and alot of clothing fabric and crafty tools from paint brushes to cutting glass tools  and do it yourself jewelry kits .  Not to mention the number of  workers willing to help make sure your visit is pleasant and you find everything you were in search for. Shelves nicely stocked and carts at door ready for you at the door. Parking large and plenty of places to park.; I have shopped at this store for over 25 years. I ordered through pickup last year, and an older guy came to the window, I said " Thank you  I appreciate  this:. He came up to my window and said, " Really, if you appreciate it then tip me". I was so shocked I gave him money. This morning had tp pick up a last minute gift I ordered for pick up for my small granddaughter. I parked, this gentleman  came out opened my trunk and angry said," You were my last order and I'm giving you yours first. I looked at him and said thank you, and he shut my trunk hard. Like if he wanted a tip, I wasn't  about to give him one. He has a job because we order from pick up ! And he didn't  have to give me mine first, I could have cared less. I wasn't  going anywhere,  I'm disabled  and had my grandbabies with me. This has just been a really crappy store since you have the carts running  people over ( Happened to us on Sunday). Customer Service really isn't  there anymore !; Poor customer service & horribly run delivery service, but, it is Walmart so what can you expect.  Lazy drivers who prioritize smaller light weight higher paying items to deliver instead of something weighing more than ten pounds.  Good luck if you're mobility impaired and/or don't have transportation, you're going to be stuck waiting forever for something to get delivered even though when you checkout it says same day or next day delivery.  One order went from same day to a week later, after not being delivered the same day.  The next order was just completely skipped.; Overall, the place was clean and well stocked.

The only gripe I have is with the checkout. Lack of NFC enabled and high traffic through their POS caused paying for my stuff to take longer than grabbing it all due to "card read errors" from inserting.

If you go, use Walmart pay or their scan and go feature to avoid this unnecessary hassle.

Name: Walgreens
Address: 9220 N Thornydale Rd, Tucson, AZ 85742, USA
