Address Components: 9220 (street_number); North Thornydale Road (route); Park Lane (neighborhood); Tucson (locality); Pima County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85742 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Luis did an awesome job taking my passport photo! He was pleasant, knowledgeable, and kind. I’ve used their photo services for prints in addition to passport photos and Luis made sure I was happy with how the photos turned out before I left! I totally appreciate his attention to detail and making sure the customer is happy. I’ve been in here many times and they usually have what you’re looking for! Great stop and excellent location :); The Walgreens brand has let me down yet again. I started coming to this location whenever I was in town, and brand executives continue to disappoint me with their decisions. I was always helped by this one employee when i visited, very hardworking and friendly. Then he disappeared. Sources confirm he was fired for defending himself against a belligerent drunk man who laid hands on him when he was declined an alcohol sale. They tell me the store manager was fired, too, for this incident. The drunkard was simply banned from the location itself, no charges pressed while 2 people lost their job. Once again, I’m seeing why employees prefer fleeing WG. I fled 1.5 years ago myself, how sad to see no improvements made for the wellbeing of essential employees. No wonder locations across the board are consistently shorthanded. Someone really needs to sound the alarm about how the WG brand mistreats their employees.; They have new pharmacist there now, so I changed my rating if I could I would give them a ten star rating. They went out of their way to be helpful it was a very refreshing change from the last time I rated. So happy to be able to give props where props are due.; Thanks to Richard and Luis, they were able to expertly help me with a problem I had. Everything went smoothly and because of these young men with awesome personalities we also had some good laughs as well! Great customer service! :); This is a typical neighborhood Walgreens, albeit a little smaller than some other locations.

Staff here is hit or miss. Most are friendly enough, but there’s one here that gives off weird vibes. Other than that, the store is well stocked and pretty clean.

Wait times for prescriptions are not as bad as more centrally located locations.

Parking is pretty decent.

Reviews:
Love my Walgreens store. I use my points all the time and always get good deals. I also have the Walgreens app it's useful and helps you chose your items on weekly ads and coupons usage. One thing I hope they improve on the app is id wish that when purchasing your items ,that it automatically clips all your qualifies deals so that I don't have to walk around the store for over an hour. Please,please, please improve this.; Travel vaccine pharmacies are hard to find, and I love this Walgreens! My family and I went there to get a few travel vaccines (we got the prescription from our PCP, not the pharmacy.) The pharmacists there were timely, and patient with our kids.

When we called prior to our appointment, they were able to run our insurance, and give us a quote for the vaccines. The pharmacist was also patient when I asked for a print out of the vaccines for our records.

They are clean and very professional at this pharmacy. We will come here again!; I always have the best experience here. I tried the QR code for input but it didn’t work.
Shout out to Toby. He went above and beyond . Thanks so much !; When this pharmacy was a full service 24 hour shop it was amazing. But ever since Walgreens stopped meeting customer needs post pandemic, this one now opens late and then is understaffed and doesn’t have items ready. I moved all our prescriptions to this Walgreens and now I’m needing to find other option. Sadly, it will be outside of the Walgreens system.; Came in to this location and Michael was a amazing employee allowed me to exchange diapers without a receipt for another brand of diapers and gave me the remaining on a giftcard. Such a simple transaction. Thank you Michael 😊

Name: Walgreens
Address: 10324 E Riggs Rd, Sun Lakes, AZ 85248, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Reviews:
Pharmacy staff was openly rude to me when I told them I came in for the flu shot. 2 of them both rolled their eyes in annoyance. One of them even loudly said that they were the same thing as the COVID one. I also scheduled it online but I assume that didn't matter since they didn't even bother to check. 46 minutes later they let the people who came in after us to get their shot instead of us. I'm never coming to this Walgreens again.; TERRIBLE... AWFUL SERVICE. Please use another Walgreens location other than Sunlakes. There is very poor communications from pharmacy employees. Customer service is unexceptable. This pharmacy service location staff needs alot of training.; Constructive criticism:
Okay as a person who used to come to the store on the behalf of others, it used to be really good. And the pharmacy to the makeup 'girl'who used to help with cosmetics . yes there was one!😀The last maybe three to four years when they laid off their old staff- meaning mature 40+ you saw a slow but declining stage of customer service start. Now maybe they have really terrible rules but I know is your staff is getting younger people in college and this is probably their first serious job either out of school or they're still in school they don't know anything about customer service. They're not well-trained and probably not educated about the medications they're handing out.  Instead of hiring college kids ( with the OK boomer mentality) you should hire people who live closer to the area actually care to have a job and are trained in pharmacy. Or start seriously screening them for attitude and aptitude . I think it's probably harder to get a job at Target than  in this Pharmacy judging by the turnover .Also maybe a course in empathy and learning how to deal with certain situations they need to learn to diffuse and handle sometimes difficult people otherwise you shouldn't be in customer face to face service.

But go ahead keep losing business and frustration SL residents. This used to be one of the friendliest drug stores I have ever encountered, and I've been around a while and while not a resident of Sun Lakes I was quite impressed back then it's only in recent years that I've seen real cs problems and that was before covid.; I made a mistake.  I transferred my medications here.  The prices I was quoted were not honored...  In fact.  they apparently go up $20 a day?  The non-english speaking pharmacist claim the prices change every day?    This place takes advantage of seniors in the neighborhood.  There is a special place in hell for this brown pharmacist.; Everytime I come in to the pharmacy for my Mom's prescription there's a problem. The technicians ignore you when your at the drive-thru.  I went there to get an rx on 3-19. One tech said she'd be right with me. The other technician just ignored the drive-thru.  I sat in it for almost 5 minutes without being offered any help. As a former employee, a Senior Tech and a Manager at Walgreens, I know customer service is VERY important. Ignoring the drive-thru and filling a prescription instead is a big no no! I came in the store and and wasn't going to yell, until the Male technician went over to the drive-thru right after they pulled up, yet he didn't bother to help me while I sat there. I also notice the pharmacists sitting on stools all the time also very unprofessional as they yell out your medication and what to do with it while sitting on the stool instead of getting up and talking directly to you in a private manor.  I also came in another time and was standing in line to be left there while 2 waiters were helped before me. Unacceptable! I was in line I should be helped before them, unless it's an emergency then I understand. There were 2 other technicians and one was just wandering around, so I made a stink about how I should of been helped.  These technicians aren't very customer service friendly.  If I had the right to move my Mom's rx's I would have her go to CVS, not Walgreens! Walgreens treats their employees terribly and it shows in their work ethic.  None of the managers or sales team are friendly either.  I have walked past both without any acknowledgement.  As a former employee and someone who greeted EVERYONE and acknowledged EVERYONE, I find it very offensive. I hate Walgreens and hope to get my Mom to switch! Too bad a once good company has gone so bad.

Reviews: Went to the pharmacy today. Trying to find out about my medications. After about the third time of her cutting me off, I had to ask her to please let me complete my sentence without interruption, like why am I having to ask a grown adult not to interrupt. Mind you I’m the first customer of the day, so it hasn’t been a long day. Then I used to have state insurance but now have insurance through my work. State insurance won’t let you auto refill. So I give Her my new insurance card which she puts into the system and proceeds to turn around and tell me that I still can’t get auto refills because the state insurance is listed as a secondary insurance. Then One prescription was ready but they still had to fill one so I asked how long and she said well we just opened so it’ll be a half hour and I said OK I’ll just that’s fine. I’ll come back and she said you’re gonna come back for both of them in a half hour and I responded yes and said she just hung up the phone and walked away, super rude, terrible customer service, And I might just change to the Walgreens in town and even though I’ll have to drive further at least I won’t have to deal with this rude woman; Ordered online so I could pick up in store at the photo counter. No one was at the photo counter, so I grabbed my package and took it to the register to check out. Male manager at the checkout stand. He was VERY RUDE and chastised me for retrieving my package. He said next time I had to contact the register and have a clerk called to the photo counter and that it should take less than 15 min to get someone to help me. Question? What is the purpose of ordering online then having to wait and extended period of time to pick up my order? Additionally, he said that if I ever retrieved my own package again (the one I bought and paid for), they could refuse the transaction. Not very customer friendly. Ive worked in retail for years and I HAVE NEVER treated a customer like that. And if I would have, my boss would have been all over my a$$. There are plenty of other businesses in town. I think I will start using those instead.; Kevin the evening cashier is extremely rude. Won't listen to the customer; I don't trust the automated messages about prescriptions, but that seem to be true everywhere. Good, well stocked store with staff that know the stock. It's also a place you can have deliveries from FedEx routed and foil the porch pirates, so I love that.; Automation Bad!! My medications are always late. I've driven 136 miles 3 times . Being told to pickup my medications. Each time Not ready and told to return in a day or two. Now I've been waiting 10 days for night medicine. I hope this next 136 miles they are?¿??

Reviews: I have had nothing but great experiences at this store and the employees at this location are such lovely and patient people; I've always had positive experiences in all of the departments. They're always working hard and it shows because the store is always so clean and organized, which I love. I also like the curbside pickup services too. Every person I've met from that department are always so friendly and hard-working.; The supervisor is out of control, very unprofessional. I just witnessed him yelling at his employees and another customer in the pickup area. Not sure if he can handle or be trusted around humans. I'd recommend giving him a timeout. I think it'd do everyone involved some good.; Garden department needs attention! Plants thrive if watered properly!!! Conveniently located, employees have become friends thru the years and banking nearby... What more could one want!❤️; I usually have a positive shopping experience at Walmart. While I understand the need for employees to occasionally check receipts, I was taken aback when a particular employee singled out my husband and me, inspecting our purchases and even removing a bagged tripod I had bought for DIY maternity photos. Despite me mentioning the price to help her out, she made a doubtful face and used a price machine to verify it. It was frustrating, especially since the receipt clearly showed the item name and price. Like many others have previously pointed out, If Walmart is concerned about theft, why not open more cash registers instead of relying on self-checkout?; The greeter was really nice the only thing I don't like is self checkout.If you have a lot of groceries it's hard to do self checkout. Other than that it's great.

Name: Target
Address: 1650 S Milton Rd, Flagstaff, AZ 86001, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 1650 (street_number); South Milton Road (route); Flagstaff (locality); Coconino County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 86001 (postal_code); 0802 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Visited target today at 1030 am.Every time I go to this store , it gets worse. It's a perfect example of managers not walking the floor and paying attention to their surroundings.
( See pics )
Also, they seem to go out of their way to hire as many college students as possible who exemplify younger people today ( won't do anything outside their job description or anything extra ). 3 employees walked by me, never acknowledged me or stopped to pick up anything on the floor everywhere.
I work for a Fortune 50 company. We would write the mgr on duty a warning.; Very appreciative of the managers Gage and Kyle! I was gifted a lot of diapers that were not on my registry nor did I have a receipt to them and as many know, babies go through sizes quickly. I had heard from a friend you could attempt to return them for store credit and so I did. At first, the employee who originally helped me told me unfortunately it wasn’t possible to return nor exchange but I asked to speak to a manager and Gage and Kyle were the ones who helped me make it possible so shout out to them!; NAU move in days and this place was PACKED!! The employees were doing their best you could tell. We were one of the last to move in and gather last minute items. To my surprise they still had plenty of items in stock. A few were sold out but that was no biggie. I am appreciative of the employees handling the chaos as best as they could.; Me and my sisters went into target to shop around a little bit and decided to grab some coffee from Starbucks before we left. This was 2 hours before they closed and from what I could tell there was one person working and we were the only ones in line. We stood there for a little bit as the worker was cleaning up but didn’t acknowledge our presence and continued to do whatever she was doing. We moved closer to the front to hopefully grab her attention and she stared at the computer and then back at us. She finally decided to say “how can I help you”. She was pretty short and not friendly at all. Her face said it all before I even began to order. My friend approaches me and goes under the black divider and the worker shouts “You’re not aloud to go under there!” Doesn’t try to be nice about it at all. Needless to say I’ve never experienced a worker with such a bad attitude taking it out on customers. I’m not one to write reviews but I also work in the food industry and would never ignore a customer waiting. A simple “I’ll be right with you” should’ve been said.; This generation is a joke of employers. They sit there at customer service on there chair don’t even get up to greet you , I felt like I was disturbing her . Employees just walk on past you with out asking if you are finding everything! I got more respect from the older lady that said excuse me as she walked past me and she was a worker .

Name: Walmart Supercenter
Address: 2601 E Huntington Dr, Flagstaff, AZ 86004, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Reviews:
Super Busy Super Walmart. There's nice pretend overnight parking. Grand Canyon calling! Newer, clean, and friendly.; Probably one of the worst Walmarts you can visit. The couple times I have had to stop here when passing through, the staff is either just straight up rude for no reason, or unhelpful. The actual store itself is overall nice as far as appearance, and the one saving grace is the manager called me after leaving a bad survey one time.

Definitely will not be stopping at this Walmart again; I only buy a limited number of items here, mostly food, because of the prices.
As everyone knows, if you want to save money, this is the place to go. Sometimes the prices are even better than what you can find online (Amazon).
This is a HUGE store, so it has nearly everything you might be looking for.
Easy parking. Easy in and out of the lot.
Probably the best place in Flagstaff for travelers needing to stock up while on a journey.; Friendly staff, all with a smile, and well organized store!
Parking lot is NOT idea for a larger rig. I would do 38’ or less. If the parking lot is full it’s hard to find a spot to park.

Found this review helpful? Give us a thumbs up and hit that follow button to see more reviews!; So cool Flagstaff finally has a WM Supercenter!! A lot of panhandler and homeless overnight RV and van parkers here, however.

Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews:
I had a wonderful experience today at Walgreens. The lovely workers helped me out a lot. Especially Esmeralda ;); AVOID THIS PLACE IF YOU TRAVEL!  I'm a retiree and full-time RV'er from New York.  We've traveled all over the U.S. and NEVER had a problem getting monthly prescriptions filled ANYWHERE but here!  The pharmacist refused to fill them "because the prescribing doctor is more than 50 miles away." WHAT?! This caused me and my doctor a lot of inconvenience which is not necessary with 21st century technology!!  Get with it!  Seniors go to warm places in the winter.
*****Side note: On my way out of the store, a man walking behind me had overheard the whole ordeal and said, "I've had the same problem with her.  I finally bought a house here, so it's not a problem anymore.******; The store is clean and neat, and the cashier is nice, but on two different occasions, with two different doctors, the doctors' offices said they did not receive a request to refill a prescription while the pharmacy insisted they had sent the request.  Walgreens sees  no need to take any action as they see no problem here.; Doris in photos has amazing customer service.  She helps navigate online orders, and her work is first rate.  They are my Go To for Christmas gifts because of her work!; Thanks Miguel and Dev for saving the day!  You two rock!

Reviews: Is this Walgreen's pharmacy understaffed? Was on hold close to 40 minutes, late Friday afternoon. When someone in pharmacy picked up the phone they put me right back on hold, without acknowledging. Called back later, early to mid-evening. Was put on hold for 10 minutes too, before I spoke to someone live.; The pharmacy here has plummeted to rock bottom and decided to start digging. Ever time I go here people are abandoning the wait line because it is taking so long to get through. I waited 30 minutes behind one car in the drive through and while I waited 2 cars pulled up and eventually abandoned the line along with me. This a completely unacceptable fiasco.; My 1 year old grand daughter had croup. An after work trip to All Kids Urgent care where the NP there was rude and condesending gave a paper prescription that had to be hand delivered to a pharmacy, only wait an hour at least to fill it (they wouldn't call it in)! After sitting in line behind 8 other cars at the Walgreens on Greenfield(because its the only 24 hr one), the car had only moved two spots because two pulled out and left disgusted. No one would answer the phone at that location. I called the Cooper/Warner location where I get my own prescriptions filled and the Pharmacist on duty was George. He was super helpful and nice. I explained our situation. Single Mom, one baby sick with croup/stridor and another school age child that needed to get to bed. He said bring it over and I will get it filled before ten but I'm backed up here too. She brought it right over to him and came here and fed the baby, gathered her other child and is headed home at 9pm. Thank you to George... and Walgreens hang on to this guy!; Walgreens advertises COVID Vaccine to childern, this is anti-science.  This response is know to result in higher all cause mortality. What does this make Walgreens?; Most disrespectful manager that honestly looks like someone who would murder you and then when he talks to you it confirms your thoughts as his tone and attitude is gruff and rude. Stay away from this store if you want to feel safe while shopping.

Awful. We get delivery every week….and every week the deli sliced cheese is a disaster.  Broken pieces and all stuck together.  Do better Walmart! This is awful! I will be asking for a refund EVERY TIME my cheese looks like this.; I did an online pickup order today and it was horrible! The guy threw my groceries in my car. He put two bags of potatoes on top of my chips and crushed them. He put my milk jug upside down and it was thrown in there as well which crushed my cereal box but luckily the cereal was fruity pebbles so it didn’t damage the cereal. Thank goodness the milk didn’t leak out! My food was not at proper temperature. I feel like it was sitting out for a while and if that wasn’t enough there were missing items, out of date supposed fresh dill, and an open package of pork chops leaking all over the bag it was in. Horrible, horrible horrible customer service. I am so upset. How can people be so rude and inefficient?; Terrible and very rude customer service provided at the self checkout stand. I was checking out a few items and one of my items required and associate sign off. The associate was busy on her phone and when I called for her attention, she then began yelling out directions on how I should proceed. The item required verification and sing-off from the employee, which I tried explaining and was met with attitude and terrible customer service. I tried reaching out to the store manager Christopher via phone but was ignored and given the runaround. Overall, a terrible experience and awful customer service.; The layout is NOT optimal for people moving around.  Several times I was blocked in an aisle by just one person with their cart.  Good deals are hit or miss.  Only one cashier lane open with human.; When you go to check out you will be greeted with no lanes open and be told to go to self check out because they are short staffed.
Then you glance around and see 3 to 5 workers standing around doing nothing. Please steer clear of this store. Works are suppose to help you not tell you to help yourself.

Reviews:
This location is on my route to & from work and I shop there often. The store is clean, well organized & stocked.
While all employees are friendly and helpful,  in particular Eric & Sylvia stand out as knowledgeable,  very helpful & pleasant to interact with. It's always a pleasure.; Went through pharmacy with my 95 year old grandma waited 10 minutes behind a car and when it was my turn they put a card board in window and ignored us we still had 5 minutes before closing not including the 10 minutes we sat there already waiting I was there and waited 10 minutes before closing! Not professional at all, rude and inconsiderate! What a disgusting ghetto Walgreens!; Out of stock on make-up items I buy . I've been here every other week to check on most of what I purchase and leave without. I've gone across the street and it's similar findings as well. Employees are pleasant, patient and I'll keep checking on my items. I do run into some good deals every now and then.; Nice and friendly staff. They were very helpful. They're currently redesigning the inside of the store and it looks great.; Jay and Evit, your calm demeanor and determination to help provide care are noteworthy!  All three of my daughters received two vaccines from you Jay as you were caring and calm as you gave us all shots and you Evit in processing the five of us despite the back log.  You fought through my daughters fears and tears of needles to give each of them two shots!  Moreover your whole team continued to help consumers even when one customer with significant social borderline disorder walked in and immediately started yelling while almost becoming violent about having to wait a few minutes for his appointment.  You all remained calm and attentive to resolve the situation peacefully.  You honored this Marine and my family yesterday; a special day, as it’s the birth of your Marine Corps and day before veteran’s day. Please be proud of what you do and keep you head high and know more people than you realize recognize your hard work.  Thank you kindly!

Reviews: I was visiting from Valdosta, Ga, and needed to get some cases of water. Let me tell you so was blown away with how clean and ORGANIZED the store was.  I can’t remember what day it was but it was around 9:30PM.  I try and avoid the Walmart’s here in VALDOSTA (Marketplace is nice!) because everything is a terrible experience starting with the parking lot. Cars park wherever and the employees stand around talking.  I was so impressed with the staff in Yuma I had to let a few know how impressed I was.  Even the clothes were on the correct hanger size and in order from S-2XL, I ended up buying a couple high school t shirts just to spend more money.  I took those pics to show the wife, she was like wow!; I received excellent customer service from an associate named Ramon. This night a lot of workers were stocking the grocery department and had many palettes lined up blocking the product I needed (oatmeal). Ramon was nice enough to acknowledge me so I asked him for help. He quickly grabbed the palette jack and moved the entire palette out of my way for me to safely choose which brand of the specific product I wanted. I knew I wanted one he could have maneuvered to reach but instead chose to go out of his way for my convenience and safety. I continued shopping and later noticed him kindly helping another customer walking him a ways across the store for the item he needed. Great costumer service! I am happy to deal with a human who acknowledges the needs of others and not another soulless employee that reminds us to use the app, is bothered for being distracted for the task he’s working on and shows little or interest in assisting. I live very near this store and frequent it regularly. His attentiveness and kindness is what made me leave you all a ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ review.; I like this location on Pacific because it often seems to be less crowded than Ave B or 8 E. Of course now in June there isn’t the overload from the winter visitors so that’s a huge plus.; All right let's be honest Walmart is still the best prices if you don't mind the crowds because it's the best prices this is where I shop when I have the time; This is our local Walmart so always a good time here.  Pretty much know everyone of them    Great people!   Very clean store organized comfortable and friendly!

Reviews: Store is nice but I’d like to walk in unabated by people asking for donations. Enough is enough at this point. We all have tip and donation fatigue.. It’s bad enough if you ask for my donation when I check out every single time at the cash register but now you got actual humans hitting me up when I walk inside?? NOT COOL!  Leave me alone, I just paid $7.50 for a jar of peanut butter.; I showed up early to the auto department for a battery change, ROGER was extremely helpful even though he had a line of cars waiting. Every single technician asked if I needed help, although I did not because ROGER had everything under control. I explain to ROGER I would come pick my car up after work if needed and find a ride, but my car was done within an hour. Everyone was extremely extremely kind from Roger , to the technicians, to George, and the young gentleman that helped me at the end I did not get his name In the past, I did not have a great experience, but I never feel it is helpful to leave a bad review so I’m very happy and pleased to say I will be returning!; Watched a pharmacy person come out into the aisles today and follow an old man around trying to convince him to let them vaccinate him.    I fixed that by telling him the vaccine is bad and walk away.   He walked away and the terrible tech was very angry at me for this.    They shouldn't be pushing this crap like this.; I go here almost everyday as its across the street from me. The store is clean and always well stocked. The employees are friendly and it's easy to get help as theres always employees around. Sarah at the registers always helps me find what I'm looking for and Joy is really friendly at the customer service desk as well. The food at the deli is always hot and fresh as well. Overall good location; My experience at this Walmart was great. There was this worker that I think was named Sarah, she was great at her job. I saw her cleaning the registers and stuff like that. She also helped me with scanning and was super nice. I even saw her giving stickers to kids. I had a great experience here.

Reviews:
Love The Very Organized and cleaned store now that I'm able to navigate. Not very happy about the checkout lines there's only four or five that have cashiers can't go to the cell phone because I have a bad back and bad knees and can't always lift everything out of the card and back into the cart I am looking for an alternate place to shop because I'm very displeased about the long lines to check out.; One star. Poor customer service. I asked for help finding something specific in the apparel department and the lady looked at me, pointed in a general direction and said over there somewhere. She turned away and continued on with what she was doing. I asked for jeggings/leggings and she pointed me to plus size and maternity clothes. I spent probably 30 minutes looking and couldn't find anyone else to help. Anyone else that WAS there saw me and just turned around and went a different way. I won't be coming back to this location.; Zero if I can give it to you Walmart. Went yesterday to the 83rd location and customer service was horrible. I can't remember when I ever had some decent customer service at this location. I asked the guy at the electric department if he could help me. Told me " if it's not there we don't have it" No kidding that is why I'm asking for help because there is a glass case and I can't move things around to see if it's there. The worst words anyone can say to a customer is IF ITS NOT THERE WE DON'T HAVE IT. Such laziness at Walmart. You can easily go over there and help move things in the case. Or look it up on your computer. Wow and there was no one at your department. You were just standing around doing nothing. Such a disappointment but not surprised at Walmart. Keep hiring people like that... it's the face of the company!!!!; My biggest annoyance about this location is how aggressive and rude in tone most of the employees are. After their remodel, it seems they care less about the customer and just about making money. After today, I will be less likely to shop at this location, if I have to remind an employee not to touch my phone, and rather use his words to ask me to show the receipt.
I don't know the last time that this employee has washed their hands or what kind of germs they carry, and especially with another pandemic, looming around the corner, do better about training your employees not to touch customers personal belongings.; The store is very clean, well organized. There were employees available for any assistance I may need and the prices are reasonable.

Reviews: Rug doctor at this location doesnt work proper. Had to call costumer service and wast a lot of time waiting for them to reboot the sistem....    then again the machines where dirty and had to clean it before and after using it....     never saw the 25% discount for cleaning the machine....   lack of attencion to do mantainance on the machines....; Very clean and nice customer service at checkout; This location has officially become unbearable. Full of cranky snowbirds who will stand in your way and stare blankly at you when you ask to get around them. I have had MULTIPLE employees flat out ignore me. I work retail and I understand you probably hate your job, but scoffing in my face?! There are some kind employees at this location, surprisingly the door greeters/ receipt checkers are the nicest people there. Oh, and don’t ever expect to get anything out of the locked stuff in beauty, nobody has a key and does not care to get someone who does. I waited 30 mins for a package of press on nails!!! Eventually just left them. I would advise to STAY AWAY FROM THIS LOCATION IF YOU WANT TO KEEP YOUR SANITY!!!!; I have used pickup since COVID. It's been excellent. My order is usually ready early and accurate. Staff members are great! Occasionally, a gift bag appears in my order. It's a nice selection of goodies. I feel appreciated for my loyalty.; I was in the store today and is a very clean and filled store. I would give it a higher rating but over the last few weeks I have noticed 2 employees that I assume are supervisors as the way they were treating their subordinates was horrible. I'm on asking around for information I got the names as Laura and Maria. These two treat them is with no respect and no decency even to go as far as making them even cry. I have heard numerous employees bring up their names alone and it sickens me. Please do something about the management here.

Reviews:
Update: the manager contacted me and made this right, fixing the images and reprinting them. Manager was apologizing and assured me that more training for this type of thing would be provided for the employees. Because of this interaction with the manager, I'm adjusting the review and star rating.
Went in for passport photos for my daughter and I. The person in the photo department acted like I was asking for an extraordinarily difficult thing... They offer passport photos at this Walgreens, why be cranky at me when I want to buy that? Just made me feel like I was an extreme inconvenience. Sorry but if you didn't want to talk to people, don't work somewhere where you have to talk to people! Not recommended as she also cropped out half our hair in my and my daughter's photos, like weirdly cropped it, from the outside, it looks very strange. When I requested the photo be sent to my email, which IS ALSO OFFERED, free of charge, that turned out to be another issue because neither of the people in the photo department had any idea how it worked or what to do when it didn't get sent to my email. They said I would have to come back tomorrow when the boss was there. Not a fan, likely going to have my prescriptions and business elsewhere. My husband is on a ton of meds every month, and I know our insurance pays thousands for them. It shouldn't be such an issue to deal with the staff here and not be treated like I'm inconveniencing them when asking to purchase something that's offered by their company.; Pharmacy is always low staffed. However the pharmacist named LIZ who is an older white lady, wears glasses, and has braces ..Invisalign) is extremely rude, idk how she helps customers if she has terrible customer service! She literally rolled her eyes right in front of me, Like hello, you know I can see you. She should know  that the people asking for medication refills or whatever the case might be, rely on certain medicación and she is there to help, Not make things worst or in my case make me go home with no medication. I could have easy payed out of pocket for the medication and she said no she couldn't do that I told her my insurance will be able to reimburse me for what I payed. She still said NO!! Like WHAT, this was a first…smh…; Pharmacy is terrible. Every time I need a prescription filled it’s never ready at the time they give me. Always have to come back multiple times. Taking my business elsewhere from here on out. I’m not a pharmacist but I can’t imagine it takes 4 hours to put a couple pills in a bottle…; Do not send your medications to this pharmacy‼️TERRIBLE.
Was miserably sick and went to pick up my medication and was told it was going to be 2.5 hours before they would have it for me, so to come back at 2:15. My husband went back for me at got there shortly after 2:15. Same lady helped him and told him, “I told your wife it would not be ready until 2:30.” Lies. He had to wait for my medication still.

Terrible customer service. They are rude. And why is it that the lines are so long? Every time I go, there are employees frantically running around in the back. Evidently they all like their cardio.; Constantly dropping the ball on refills or callbacks. Pharmacy Tech Cesar is usually ill-mannered & impatient, almost seems lOst and will end up hanging up on you. Always hoping for improvement but continuously let down.

Reviews: Working from the Starbucks inside the Target while I charge my car. What if these two brands started working together. Starbucks and Sacred Bev.🤔🤞🏾; A couple days ago i purchased these beautiful pair of knives at the self checkout and the short employee with glasses there was just EXTREMELY RUDE!!! I had my mother and my 7 month baby with me.  We needed the employees help with an alarm but my baby had an accident and spit up seconds before.  I asked the employee for help. He took the knives after i was done paying… then he came back with paper towels and slammed them on the checkout counter and exclaimed “HERE ARE SOME TOWELS!” We were shocked so we just stood there for a moment and my mother started cleaning it up… i had my baby crying and however i could i didn’t let her clean it. After cleaning up this heartless employee just stood there and watched. After we were done cleaning spit up off the floor he then took the paper towels and then decided to give us the knives. No mom should go through this. I don’t think it was okay that he did this but I could tell he wasn’t mentally okay. He was just a miserable arrogant condescending man.; Target is always a nice welcome at any time. Employees are nice and check out is quick. Store is well maintained and stocked! I especially like the value I get  at the grocery department.; Not a bad Target...cute in size and has a Starbucks with cool staff.; I usually prefer Target. It's clean, organized and the customer service there is great 👍

Reviews:
I arrived at the pharmacy just as it was closing, unsure if they could take my dad's prescriptions. Calvin was the only one working, and he was simultaneously helping three patients while handling a call. Despite the busy situation, he assisted everyone professionally and with great care. He deserves recognition for his exceptional service. Thank you, Calvin!; Made a vaccine appt a week earlier.  Showed up 10 minutes early and checked in.  Watched as they helped every person including walk in vaccinations while ignoring me completely.  I walked out 10 minutes after my scheduled time and went to Walmart.  Never again Walgreens.; No pharmacist available. I don't write many bad reviews. You can see the 500-plus reviews that I have written. I have been to this Walgreens numerous times over the past 10 years. This Walgreens is always busy, always understaffed, and today they have no pharmacist. The pharmacy at the Walgreens in Old Town Scottsdale I highly recommend not coming to this Walgreens and go to a different Walgreens or CVS if the pharmacy is not open. Thank you for reading my Google review; Pharmacy staff is extremely rude. The man who took my call literally yelled at me as I was trying to explain what was happening with my prescription. Talked over me and down to me while also screaming at me. Absolutely unacceptable and inappropriate. Appalled you allow your staff to act this way.; Rude, Rude, RUDE!  I took my 95 yr old mom to have a passport picture taken.  We waited 15 minutes for someone to come by the photo center.  I pressed the button, the lone cashier called out on the PA to no avail.  We were getting ready to leave when the rudest, most inconsiderate man, comes racing by.  "What do you need", he says with an attitude. I need a passport picture.  "Who is having the picture taken?" My mom.  He snorts "Can't do it, she is wearing a white shirt.  (It was a light rose colored blouse) "Needs to be a dark shirt for a passport picture".  Whaat?
He was nasty and frankly, the lone cashier was not anymore personable.  The help seemed pissed off to be there.
Luckily, Staples is just across way.  My mom & I walked into Staples, were promptly greeted, the photo taken, and 5 minutes later we walked out the door with the passport photos in hand.
Whoever is managing this Walgreens should be sent to customer servicing school so they can provide appropriate training to the staff.  They are to put it mildly, AWFUL.

Reviews: The pharmacy closes earlier than the posted time, we were next in line and they closed 5 minutes early as per Verizon phone time (please review camera time stamps.) Corporate: please help this store do better.; ABSOLUTELY the worst pharmacy in the country!  From the rudest pharmacist (woman) of all time, to their complete incompetence.   You call in a RX, they tell you pick up any time after X, you arrive after that time, literally 95% of the time they tell you, it’s not ready, come back tomorrow, come back in 2 hours, etc.  They gave us the wrong medication one time, luckily we realized prior to taking it.  This has to be the biggest liability pharmacy in the country and Walgreens continues to do nothing about it.  If not for the insane insurance in this country forcing you to use certain pharmacies, this place would be out of business.  There is ZERO chance anyone chooses to go there because they get great service, friendly staff, etc.  This has been going on for years, WAKE UP WALGREENS!!   Unfortunately, it will take a lawsuit before they act.  You should be ashamed Walgreens, allowing this to continue for years !; The most awful pharmacy and staff I’ve ever been too. Bad attitudes, no accountability, bad prescription system. Two hour wait and told to check back after lunch. This is a recurring problem. Go anywhere else , also don’t trust your doctor to send in the scrip digitally. They send it but this becomes an excuse to hide behind. Bring it with you so they can’t shrug at you for two hours then take lunch; Picking up my girlfriend’s prescription and this has to be the slowest pharmacy I’ve ever been to. Both lanes pile up fast. Be prepared to wait 20+ minutes in line. I’d recommend you go elsewhere and avoid the headache; Trashy, rude, obnoxious, employee. Why would you want to hire someone like that to interact with customers her name is  Madison. She  must hate her job and people. I heard some of the nastiest ugliest attitude just pour out of this lady. Foul Ill never come back to this location. Ugh

Name: Walgreens
Address: 3487 Stockton Hill Rd, Kingman, AZ 86409, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 3487 (street_number); Stockton Hill Road (route); Kingman (locality); Mohave County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 86409 (postal_code)
Reviews:
There is absolutely no reason why I should come home after driving over an hour to pick up my medication and coming home to find that the pharmacy has only filled my prescription with 9 pills instead of the 14 labeled on the bottle. When I called and asked what to do, they informed me to “bring the bottle in and /maybe/ they’ll fix it.” I’m done. I’d like to add that I waited over an HOUR in the drive thru lane behind 10 different cars. Absolutely insane behavior.; Dear Walgreens,

You have a pharmacist here in Kingman AZ who believes he has more education and understanding of my child’s medical condition than their trained psychiatrist of the last, over 2 years.

My child has schizoaffective disorder with bipolar tendencies and psychotic features, severe generalized anxiety disorder, agoraphobia, hypersomnia and panic disorder.

We have spent over 2 years and 3 hospitalizations to find a medication regimen that would keep our child safe, out of psychosis and finally at base line. Do you know what it’s like to have to admit your child and not be able to bring them home? To stay up all night long praying that they know how much you love them and that you would be right by their side, every second, if you only could?

Twice now this pharmacist has refused to dispense my child’s medications basing his refusal on his “contract” with the state.

However, he seems to be the only pharmacist in the area who disagrees. I would absolutely understand hesitation and wanting to speak with the prescribing physician first but he has spoken to him and his MA numerous times.

Multiple times he has told us that we are wrong and that our psychiatrist, who is based in Idaho, is not licensed here in AZ. That is false.

The first time he denied my child their med, we were in the emergency room not even one week later with psychogenic seizures and muscle deterioration. Will you be paying these medical bills?

The second time he denied, yesterday, his exact words were “go back to Idaho and have the med filled if you want it. Otherwise their Dr needs to come up with a ‘better plan’.”

I am not sure how to get ahold of someone at the corporate level or who that would even be but I would really appreciate hearing back regarding this situation.

We have obviously switched pharmacies but I am sure we were not the first people he has done this to and we won’t be the last. This is negligence. Unfortunately, he was not very forthcoming with his name in the drive thru but his initials MIGHT be AL. I will be figuring out his full information though and will be filing a formal complaint with the Arizona State Board of Pharmacy.; We come to walgreens for our vaccinations every year. The process is easy and quick. The pharmacist who gives the shots is gentle and puts you at ease. Would recommend this pharmacy for easy and convenient vaccinations.; I went through the pharmacy drive thru for my mom's medication and the lady rolled her eyes and made us wait until she was done eating to talk to us and made us feel like an inconvenience. She proceeded to be rude as we gave her information. Don't know her name but she had a bunch of facial piercings, go figure.; Terrible customer service.Very rude and hangup the phone instead of listening to customers.Im going to find another pharmacy.Never text you when your meds are in like they say,ect

Name: Walker Food & Liquor + Drive Thru
Address: Bethany Main, 2621 W Bethany Home Rd #1, Phoenix, AZ 85017, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM

Address Components: 1 (subpremise); Bethany Main (premise); 2621 (street_number); West Bethany Home Road (route); Alhambra (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85017 (postal_code); 5953 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
I had never been here. I walked toward the back and as I got closer to the counter the black female working asked what I needed.

I said "I think I'm going to take a look in here." While the coolers in the front are fully accessible to the public there's a weird layout and partition on the back end. So in that moment I realized that perhaps I wasn't allowed where they kept the canned beverages. (These must be easier to steal. The neighborhood isn't great.) It genuinely could have gone either way. I politely asked "Am I allowed to go back there?"

The response was dripping with snark: "No, that's why I asked what do you want." My reaction was "With that attitude, nevermind." and I turned right around heading straight for the exit and she started yelling at me throwing a total fit.

This lady may be absolute clueless about her tone. That's very possible. Nonetheless there is zero chance I will ever go back. This place clearly only exists to serve people within walking distance. There is nothing about selection, cleanliness, service or prices, based on my brief glimpse, that would justify it otherwise.; It's as intended a drive through convenience store.; They have two new people and I was very unsatisfied 1st time I came she ignored me and was asking the other girl what she wanted for lunch. Second time I went, I just left she was very rude and didn’t even know the products they sell. I come all the time but with these new people I don’t think I’ll be going back.; Dumb clerk had an attitude as soon as you open the glass doors💀Pinche vieja panchocha; Ok, I previously ripped these guys, however they have redeemed themselves ... they stocked the Nestles' Vanilla milk I requested them to and have kept them stocked.   Recommended - check them out.

Reviews: The guys are sexy, funny ,oh and the chick way cool. She has 8😄love you all, even the day shift. Miss the other guy, saturday shift he was to funny and helpful. Family came had a boy and he left.God Bless all of you . I should take stock in the company! Kidding or?🤔; Shout Out to the best liquor store!!! Johnny is the greatest 😍😍. New years day they were super busy but they managed to get us out of there quick with the best service. Good selection and reasonable prices. I'm hooked up here for life. Love them 1,000,000%; Love the employees and selection. Drive-through is a nice feature 👌; I loved and enjoyed the convenience of the liquor store drive-through, but having the experience today of asking the price difference between two different sizes, and being told completely different higher prices than what it actually was really makes me not want to come back again. Reviews: Idk how we got so blessed to have drive in liquor stores everywhere in AZ but this is one of them that has beatboxes on deck. Quick and easy.; I love Jerry's Liquors! Like they might come home with you and party too! But being very responsible, they know their way around the place and know all the ins and outs of what they have and where it's at! Reviews:
Loud obnoxious combative and confrontational women at the front desk laquanda needs to check her attitude at the door before she comes in.; The older gentleman that work there are nice and perfessional. It's unfortunate that have to agree with the review before me and let you know that if you are African American the younger Latino men and women that work here will over charge you when ever they can. I will not be coming back. This has happened on to many occasions. African Americans go to Las Amigo's. Much better service from all aged groups of employees.
Update: 3/6/23, went back 😆. Not overcharged this time. Still recommend Las Amigo's, The younger male and female tonight seemed annoyed I arrived at this location. What did I do?; I went in looking for a nice lighter. The man was so rude , there was a line and I realized that. If I had wanted to make a purchase I would have got in line . I asked the guy behind the far counter not behind the register " do you have lighters" he said " there is a line you need to get in the line "
I then said " but if you don't sell them I don't want to wait in line 10 minutes for nothing"
He said " you need to go out the door we don't have lighters"
How rude and how dare him . I know he is not from here but he needs to know we don't treat costumers or people in general like that for no reason here. I'm 62 years old and I'm not an indigent. Steer clear of this place no Manors; Came in today to get some change and picked up a non alcoholic beverage. This is definitely a liquor store with lots of choices to satisfy your thirst. They also sell other interesting items but I didn't really have time to stop and look. The guys seem nice enough behind the counter and I was in and out quickly. There's a drive thru as well so that's a bonus for those that don't like to get out of their vehicles. I miss coming to these kind of places but I don't really drink as much anymore or smoke. But it is a perfectly ideal neighborhood liquor store.; Poor customer service if your African American…my husband and I went in to buy something to drink (non alcoholic) walked to the counter and they would not wait on us or even acknowledge we were standing there! I don’t recommend!

Reviews:
It’s a liquor store not the Ritz. The clerks are always nice. They have liquor and munchies and the sort. Five stars.; This is a VERY nice little liquor store. I come outta Vegas, was in town for a wifey's family B-Day thing and looked up on Google: 'liquor sales'.

After review of 4 spots, I wanted to check this one out, based on reviews and photos. This is a very honest, very simple, very awesome place. If I was local, this would be my spot.

Very clean, personable, welcoming owner ..... This does have, as most stores in the Phoenix area, drive through service. Very simple stock and display ..... But sooooo very clean!!

If you are visiting, as I was ...... 100% recommend. If you are local ..... THIS, is your store, no questions.; My go to spot for tall cans and cigarillos! Always cheerful when I pull up and asks how I am doing because they know me very well. I know if I need any bottle service they have what I need.  Dont always have to walk in because they have a drive thru service window. Love them; the guy ho drives the maroon van is rude. always seem like hes in a bad mood and takes it out on his customers. Asked him for a bag and he said "dont be rude. does it look like im done?" i dont understand how that was being rude.He also got mad because i wanted to pick my lime, not grab the one he gave me. The other guy who works on weekdays is very nice no complaints there. The rude one there now should just stay home with his rude attitude and personality.; If you are looking for bourbon, go elsewhere. I thought I walked into a liquor store, what I found was a museum. They charge over msrp on most items and price gouge on the sought after ones. Most of us in the whiskey community want to support local stores, however, we will never spend money at these places. They make hundreds in profit selling one bottle, in turn they lose thousands in sales from people like me.

Don’t support stores who gouge.

It changed hands a while back and now they are marking their whiskey up like secondary. Stopped in today and they were trying to charge $80 for eagle rare. That was my final trip here. I will not go back to anyplace engaging in markup like that.

Edit: No. Eagle Rare MSRP is still around $40. $80 is robbery.; Don't judge a book by its cover! Once you enter this store you will be amazed at the selection available. It rocks! They have everything from milk & tp to that special/rare/unique alcohol gift for that hard to buy person.The store is clean, their open late, & the employees are always professional.This place is AWESOME! Check it out!; I absolutely never used a delivery service for alcohol until covid 19 really but boy am I glad I found these guys when I did. Easy online ordering, no silly fees, and they always call to double check personally if a flavor or size your picked is unavailable instead of just leaving it out and you having no idea. Always friendly and reliable and I just wish I had my job back so I could tip them more. Great selection and occasionally there's deals and sales which are just everything right now when heat and grocery stores are so daunting. Thanks!

Address: 4949 W Chandler Blvd, Chandler, AZ 85226, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 AM

Reviews:
Went to the pharmacy to pickup prescriptions for my husband who is sick. Only one prescription was filled so I went to ask about the 2nd one. It was 8:02 and they closed at 8pm. I saw the pharmacist and tech walking out of the pharmacy area and I asked if they were done and that we had a 2nd prescription that was missed. The pharmacist walked by me and completely ignored me. The tech at least told me to call the 24 hr walgreens. I understand they were closed as of 2 minutes but to walk past and ignore me like I didn't exist was horrible.; Absolutely the best Walgreens pharmacy in town! I drive out of my way to come to this Walgreens location, the staff is amazing, Brent and Linda, specifically have always been unbelievably wonderful - helpful, kind and understanding! I appreciate their attention to detail and contacting me if there is an issue with insurance, etc. thank you so much for making a difference.🩷; JD from the liquor department is a very rude and a in knowledgeable person. I was not working with him, but he decided to butt in over a financial transaction I was making, and he was extremely loud and rude and intrusive. If he is that way in all of his life I don’t know how that store has any business.  I took my money and I left that store to never go back what I was leaving and I said I won’t be coming back. He yelled out Promisr!!; Had a wonderful experience here .  I went to Walgreens for a weird problem. - To get dental floss to try and remove the dashboard pad of mobile holder stuck to my windshield.

The floss approach wasnt working and the pad was. Strongly stuck. Came across Mr. JD who was walking by, told him about my problem and he immediately jumped to my rescue. He removed the pad very deftly using a card and also went inside and got rubbing alcohol and himself removed the stuck adhesive completely

I was amazed at the gesture and kindness displayed by Mr. JD. He didn't need to do  anything what he did but he out of the way to help me. This saved me a lot of time and effort. Thank you JD!! Cant Thank you enough; Quite possibly the rudest staff and manager I have ever encountered. I originally ordered an item to be shipped to this location. Went to pick it up and found out it had been lost. No problem, manager said she would follow up with me and get it fixed (awesome or so I thought). Fast forward a month never was followed up with and figured oh well it’s $20. Placed a much larger order of multiple Peel & Stick posters for a same day print. Showed up a little early as the last one was coming off the printer, come to find out they wrong paper was chosen and it wasn’t the adhesive backed option. No problem I’ll come back later. Brought up the missing item from a month ago. Manager said I was lying and never spoke to her, then after further investigation remembered me. Come in to pick up items a day later and they are trying to force me to buy the mis-printed items “at a discounted rate” explaining how much money I’ll save. I pay for items I ordered say have a great weekend and get a dirty eye roll 😂. I’ll make sure to use a different service for my prints in the future.

Reviews:
Great place for a quick in and out. Very helpful staff and self-checkout. They also have self check out! Variety of specialty items you can't find at Costco! Plenty of ice too.; Because I can't respond to your form letter reply, I will here. I contacted your corporate office, and as expected, more standard form letter replies from someone not from the USA. We all know you won't do anything about it. IF I even go back to your store (unlikely) I will no longer wait in your secondary line, if it is more than a couple people deep. I HIGHLY encourage other customers to do the same. Sam's club does not have ANY LEGAL RIGHT to detain you unless they have a legitimate belief that you have actually stolen from them (eyewitness or video).  Anything past that is actually a crime to do so. I have no issues when they have another person up there to reduce the line, but past that,,,,,,,,,, walk on by 👍

After waiting 15 minutes on line for a real cashier, the line to be scanned AGAIN to leave went back to self checkout. They had ONE person doing it and she was SLOW. I work for myself and time is money. I said nope, and walked past her and out the door. As a consumer, I completed my transaction by shopping and PAYING. If you can't hire people to do their job efficiently and correctly, either hire more, or replace the slackers. They can NOT legally physically stop you from walking past them, providing you did your part as a consumer. Any monies saved is lost through time. The employee yelled out "we have you on camera" as I walked past holding my receipt up. AND? Going to call the cops? Going to ban me? Go ahead on either. I'm done with this store.

I ONLY gave a one star because there isn't a zero star option. If your time is worth ANYTHING shop somewhere else.; 5 stars for the size & selection.
-2 stars for no bags (harder to take into the house.
-2 stars for having to stand in another long line to scan the receipt on the way out.
-all stars for the lady scanning receipts getting rude when I mentioned she needed help to scan them.
Definitely not worth the $3.25 in savings when the membership costs $53; Neil is the best here at this T-Mobile, he took care of us getting new lines set up. This store doesn't have stock but our items arrived fast . We then took them to the store & Neil set them up by porting out numbers. Thanks Neil your definitely an asset to this company 👍 😀; Haven't been in about 2 years. I do think prices are a bit higher on most things that you can get at Walmart, I was looking for salt free green beans, had know salt free canned veggies, so I will keep going to Walmart

Name: Walgreens
Address: 7059 E Baseline Rd, Mesa, AZ 85209, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 7059 (street_number); East Baseline Road (route); Superstition Springs (neighborhood); Mesa (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85209 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Fully vaccinated and even after forgetting my vaccination card on the second dose the pharmacy crew were exceptionally patient with me. They were professional, delightful, and direct during my first and second dose. The greeting card selection at this location is filled with cute cards that are great for browsing while waiting out the 15 mins after being vaccinated.

As a mom to twin boys, it was cool to find a card that was twin themed. And I just had to buy the baby Yoda Squishmallow after my first visit which became my support stuffy throughout the first and second dose. If you are feeling apprehensive then no worries because you are in good hands when you visit this Walgreens pharmacy!; Dan was a massive help when I was having issues filling my insulin.  Thank you so much for the help and support!; This is  the nicest cleanest, freshest store I have been in.  I drive out of my way to shop and use the pharmacy here.
The shelves are ALWAYS neatly arranged. It really is amazing how this young lady takes care  of her store.
She would be a shining example of someone who really cares and sets a wonderful example of how a store could impress others.
I appreciate having a chance to thank you.; Obviously everyone knows about this drug store chain. Their standards and service are consistent across the stores, so you know what you are going to get most times. One thing I like about this location is the very good staff they have that works in the evening.

On this evening on a Wednesday, I was in need of getting a passport photo. I hesitate to go to a busy store in the evening since people are often going to stores after work. I dread standing at a photo center counter waiting for a long time for someone to come grudgingly to help that annoying interruption called the photo customer. But this was the absolute opposite of my experience here.

At this local Walgreens, the staff came quickly to the photo counter. They took the pictures, and went to work immediately processing them. Of course, I can get all my drug prescription needs and over the counter meds taken care of here too, along with the regular conveniences of such a store.  But the highlight of such a place is the staff. They make all the difference. One of the failings of many stores is the poor training of staff that end up treating customers as though they are a bother or inconvenience.  Not so here.

Customer service is king, and it is nice to see a place that takes it seriously.; This is legit one of the best Walgreens in the valley! Everyone is so nice and helpful. I will purposely go out of my way to go to this store because they are just that great of a location!

I had to have some guy come over ride me like three times because of vegetables and double scan these machines are very sensitive and it’s so time-consuming shame on Walmart for trying to save money by replacing people, they need more cashiers here.; IM GOING TO CONTINUE TO CALL IN AND FILE COMPLAINTS ON THIS WALMART FOR Lying to customers because thr to lazy to do thr job thr paid to do and Walmart should be concerned for false advertisement because they clearly state that if you have a Walmart card that you can load at any Walmart at any register and this Walmart has repeatedly lied over and over they say they can't load it from the register when they can cause they have done it before cause I had to tell the manager and he had to tell the workers that they can't be telling the customers no anymore because they are doing wrong by doing that and just right now Kathleen did just that SO WALMART BETTER GET WORKERS IN SHAPE and stop lying to your customers cause your false advertising when your workers say no to something you guys say you do; I stopped one of the Managers to ask her the exact price on one of their Walmart Cash cards and she was so polite and helpful. I needed to know if there would be tax on it because I had a certain amount 9f money on me at the time. She didn't know and instead of telling me she didn't know and walking off this Manager took the time to go out of her way to ring it up and find out while she said "go ahead and continue shopping and I will find you"! She came back with the answer! Thank you again for your professionalism and kindness. It's employees like you who people think about and make want to come to the store. Name: Sam's Club

Address Components: 4701 (street_number); North Stone Avenue (route); Northmall Centre (neighborhood); Tucson (locality); Pima County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85704 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Sams Club has a way better variety of stuff than Costco and a little bit better prices. Staff is always helpful. Great deals on tires too.; Awesome!  Clean store, great produce, great meat counter, not crowded at all. We normally go to the other place and while we are loyal members, it's way too crowded no matter what time of day you go. Sam's has a lot more variety. We got a discounted membership for $14 a year and then $10 off to use the Scan and Go, where we scanned our own items with our phone. Highly recommended. We will be back.; I watched the cafe cut up pizza and have the icee machine running while telling me all they are out of both of those items that I pre-ordered. They offered me a pretzel which I don’t like and refused to give me a refund. If I wanted a pretzel I would have ordered a pretzel. The cashier also looked clueless and tried to weaponize her incompetence so she wouldn’t have to help

Upon looking at recent reviews, I am not surprised to see that I am not the only one upset with the service. The staff needs to get it together. Not to mention when I went to get a membership the lady at the counter called me over, only to immediately send me to the next person at the counter; causing another guest to have to get sent back in line, all so she could help someone who cut in line with a previous issue. And after the Second person started helping us, she came to interrupt to try and try to make sure what she did wasn’t wrong (it was), and her interrupting us finally being helped only put a bad taste in my mouth.; Came in from out of town and was asked to grill two nights for a large group. Sam's had everything and for a great price. So lucky to have this store available.; I just got another new membership at Sam's and had problems with Sam's credit card payment as I had not yet received my new card. Both Carla and Madison were very helpful and patient with the issue... what assets these two employees are to the Sam's team! Way to go, Sam's!

Name: Walgreens
Address: 313 W Esperanza Blvd, Green Valley, AZ 85614, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 313 (street_number); West Esperanza Boulevard (route); Haven Green Valley West (neighborhood); Green Valley (locality); Pima County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85614 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I submitted a prescription to Walgreens, knowing it needed the doctor to refill it, as it had run out. They indicated it would be submitted. I followed up and on line got an email from Walgreens on Esperanza) that it was ready for pick up. I went in and was told they have no record of my ever submitting it (even though I resubmitted it again today).The Pharmacy tech/clerk said they can't fill the prescription because it ran out. I explained very carefully that I had submitted it over 3 weeks ago and again today along withe email they sent me that it was ready for pick up. She kept repeating they can't fill it because there were no more refills. I called my doctor's office and they said they got it today. I asked my doctor to try and switch it to the other Walgreens on Continental. I ran out of this prescription a week ago.; As a loyal customer of over a decade it's disappointing that my spouse and I now feel as though we are an inconvenience to a certain cashier. We have never been rude, intolerant or inappropriate yet certain staff members feel they can treat customers as an inconvenience.; This is a big drug store with almost everything you need.; I found out that many residents in Green Valley no longer drive. They walk to Walgreens for groceries. I looked around and the store has a nice variety of products. The staff are always friendly. I like coming here.; (UPDATE) Called for fill, was told will take additional 2 days as they are out of stock on that specific medication (shocker). This store is a joke and their hours are as well. Save yourself the time and fill in Tucson, the drive is long, but at least you’ll get your medication the day you request the refill.

I am not retired, nor am I even close to retirement, however this pharmacy absolutely cannot keep any stock of the only medication I need, and consistently is “Out of stock” each month when I refill. This causes a delay sometimes of up to 5 days, stretching over weekends and holidays which is not acceptable. While I understand the local traffic is high during our peak months, I have a hard time believing that there are that many retirees on a dopamatic antagonist medication. I appreciate the staff and pharmacist, as they are just employed here, and have always been helpful and friendly but whomever is in charge of medication stock and consistency of recurring refills needs help.

Unfortunately, my prescribing physician’s office cannot locate the one on Duval Mine Rd, so I am forced to fill here, and wait for my medication while it is “on order” spanning 6 days from request to fill.

TL;DR
If you aren’t 78 years old, or actively retired, your prescriptions will LITERALLY never be filled on time, regardless of using the Walgreens app or calling in, and the medication I am prescribed is out of stock Every. Single. Month. Not acceptable, in any fashion.

Reviews: This place seems kinda racist! They will treat you like a criminal if you want a cup of soda that’s not in their cup even if you’re one of their regular customers. They literally watched me all the way to my car through the door even after I dumped the soda. Went right across the street to Snappy’s and got a soda in my cup no problem. Makes me wonder how they treat their other black customers, honestly!; I was just there in the drive thru, purchased a two litter soda, cherry Pepsi . Note* the soda there is expensive. When I poured a glass of soda it was flat! No fizz at all!  It had to be slightly open before I purchased it. I called the store, the guy there that sold it to me remembered me. Do you know tht the guy (owner) did not apologize or offer me a refund or to replace it. I was told they dnt do refunds. I lived in this neighborhood for about five years. That drive through was a great convenience for me, I’m always there. Blunt wraps, beer, energy drinks vapors- tht was my go to spot. Now on I’ll just hit up the store across from Los Primos food mart! F yall! Yall just lost a loyal customer. Definitely will spread the word about how loyal customers are treated here at Los Primos food mart!!!; I only use they drive thru; One of the best stores in the area to to buy Beer. Name: Sunrise Market
Address: 4349 N 7th Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85013, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 4349 (street_number); North 7th Avenue (route); Woolf (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85013 (postal_code)
Reviews:
They have Barq's Red Cream soda in the fountain drink section.
And Tons of other great beer's 🍻 and wines 🍷 👍 👌
Hidden 💎; I can say enough good things about this store.

Ive livd in the area for 3 years and a big part of what has kept me here is this corner store. Being able to walk down and get some essentials is so peaceful and meaningful to me.

Their staff is kind and helpful and just good people. The owner is a great guy and if you ask him to stock stuff for you he will do his best to get it for you.

I used to always drink flax milk and asked if he’d carry it for me, he did! And I was so grateful for that!

You definitely should buy all your booze and other snacks for this shop. They have a deli and great sandwiches too!; This is our corner store and we LOVE it! Bob, the owner is the nicest down to earth guy. It took me almost a year but I finally convinced him to put diet Dr pepper in the fountain😄I was so happy. The food in the deli is great, store is ALWAYS clean and stocked (except when I buy out all the Swedish fish lol), and Bob plus staff are so friendly and helpful. They are also proactive with keeping themselves and the public safe with dividers at the registers, masks etc. I saw some crazy jerk left a bad review accusing them of not wearing masks, but I can attest that they wear masks and are behind a divider. The next step would be an isolation pod. Give it a rest. I go there every day sometimes more than once and have never seen any of them do ANYTHING that would be harmful to themselves or the customers. So stop in there and check it out. They are awesome! (No I don't work here. Just a very loyal customer!); Firstly they have awesome pricing, I always expect a huge mark up at places like this, but everything is very reasonable. The staff are super friendly and helpful.

The little deli inside has great food! They exclusively serve boars head. Prices for the deli are a smidge steep, but they make up for it by not skimping on the fillings.; Live right next door so it’s super convenient. They have a very good selection of craft beer and a wine section that could compete with a full size grocery store. They have everything you could need. The owners are very friendly and are constantly trying to improve the store. They are about to introduce a deli which is exciting. Come support your local convenience store !

The pharmacy has a good RX manager who helped with a complicating refill and was so incredibly helpful and mind (Giang Nguyen), Christine has been a great friendly help often, and Desenia is an  epic machine, working the RX phones and helpibg customers, enough work for 3 people, and with these last 2 refills helped us out with getting us our coupon to work easily.
