Reviews: Terribly run Pharmacy. I waited at the counter for 25 minutes while a new employee  asked instruction from the manager on  how to find me on their computer. I had already previously scheduled the Covid shot. This wasn't my normal pharmacy because this pharmacy had the Moderna vaccine. My normal Walgreens pharmacy is at 2921 N. 83rd St., Phoenix. This pharmacy  is 5 stars because it is tightly run, very efficient, friendly and consistent.; This Walgreens location has the best employees with the best customer service. Everyone was so helpful from start to finish. I would definitely recommend this location in particular. I will be coming back!!; I called two previous Walgreen Pharmacy’s before calling this one. Anthony in the Pharmacy went beyond he had too. I know this because the previous two stores I called were not willing to help and Anthony was able to find what I needed and at which store.; DO NOT get your prescriptions from here. Head pharmacist just withheld my wife's pain medication for two days to "line up all of her medications on the same day"...her refill was supposed to be today. She now has to go two days without pain meds with fibromyalgia, Degenerative disk disease, Degenerative joint disease, chiari I malformation and the list goes on...WHAT THE HELL!? Even the doctor that sent the prescription in did not understand the pharmacists reasoning and argued with him over it. This is ridiculous and blows my mind that this is even legal??; My husband n I just shopped at this Walgreens. Very pleased with a young man in Pharmacy department. My husband first approached middle aged Hispanic woman n asked for an over the counter inhaler n right away she said "No" we don't have anything like that here. Then comes the young man who then says "yes we have one" n said to my husband, follow me sir, n took me right to what I was looking for. 5 stars to that young man. He was 100 percent great customer service skills. Thank you n Happy Holidays...

Reviews:
The pharmacy line moves slower than a snails pace. Expect to be there for a long time with seemingly no explanation. This is every single time not just once in a while. Pick another pharmacy for your own sanity.; My last visit with Walgreens was excellent.    I didn't realize I had a discount coming that was associated with my phone number because I haven't used them for awhile.

I appreciated the discount and the customer service.     I didn't take photos because I was in a hurry.; I don’t know how it’s possible for every time I come to pick up a prescription there are six or seven cars in the drive-through lane all waiting 10 to 15 minutes for someone inside to literally “hand a bag” to a car.  This place is absolutely pathetic. I keep telling my wife to change over to CVS but this is 50 feet closer drive time. DO BETTER WALGREENS; This is the worst pharmacy ever. I don’t even know what else to say. Fill your prescriptions somewhere else.; This is worst pharmacy have ever experienced, at 64yrs old have experienced a few. Went 5mins til close & they refused to help cuz my prescription wasn't ready even though called earlier in day to verify it was. Then said it was returned to stock even tho it was filled just 3 days prior. It was an Inhaler which needed right away. The pharmacist told me he had young kids & needed to get home to them, this is 10pm. Have no co-pays so didn't need to ring it up. This return to stock or prescription isn't ready thing has happened almost every time get med refilled. Had to drive much further to 24hr location & wait over an hr. When call put on hold 10-15 mins & then get hung up on. Yesterday was hung up on 3 times, took 25 mins to talk to someone to see if med was ready that Dr sent refill for. Was told they didn't have a refill order. Today called to see if my prescription had been sent by Dr & they said no. Called my Dr's office & they said had sent yesterday. Called another Walgreens & they said it was ready at this location. You'll get robo calls that your prescription should be refilled but no calls once it has. They are rude & never apologize for their mistakes, just get more hostile like I'm the one responsible. Stay away from this Walgreens!

Reviews: Walgreens is not a bad place to be In South Phoenix it is a place away from the family sector. The security is excellent and the staff pay close attention to customers. This place does good and sometimes not. I'm trusting Walgreens can keep up with social issues and grow roots in Arizona.; For over 9 years this Walgreens Pharmacy has been my go-to Pharmacy for all my prescription, over the counter, my wife’s cosmetics and many loose end needs. Except for maybe a handful of less than adequate experiences, considering no retailer is infallible, I have been very, very happy with the service, attention, cleanliness, demeanor, assortments and odds and ends needs one uses a pharmacy for. I give the kudos to the counter help with their service-oriented abilities, but most of all, the very qualified, sincere, nice and knowledgeable pharmacy staff with their extreme patience and helpfulness to everyone I’ve seen them serve, including me! Kudos Walgreens, this has got to be one of your best.; Call before you come…the pharmacy may randomly be away at lunch.; The customer service and assistance provided by the manager, Mike, and a pharmacy associate to resolve a same day delivery matter was beyond amazing. Both were extremely patient and responsive.; Sitting here reading the reviews. I see that I’m not the only one whose prescriptions they push back dates and make you off track. None of the pharmacists are on the same page! EVERYONE SAYS SOMETHING DIFFERENT. They will make an error and tell you too bad we can correct it. The pharmacist lie and don’t even look at the screen. They all need to be retrained on their programs they use or they need a computer update because their dates be so off and insurance don’t play! They won’t even call insurance to correct their errors.

Reviews:
Love this Walgreens! As a Black Shopper, I have never been profiled or followed in this store. I visit sometimes daily for a quick drink to cool off, to use the ATM, get cash back and a few well priced candies for my child. I feel comfortable spending my money here as someone who works hard for what I have. The staff is alert and friendly. Thanks for constant positive experiences.; (I rarely use the store for purchases, this review is based on the pharmacy)
I have some meds that can be out of stock sometimes.  This pharmacy continues to be so kind and patient. They have called other pharmacies, my insurance,  my doctor for things when other pharmacies just tell me to deal with it. They go above and beyond with a smile on their face! They always seem happy to help and never like it's an inconvenience. I wish I could remember all the great folks over the past year to give them a shout-out.  Kenny today was WONDERFUL. Keep it up Kenny and crew!; The manager Angela is absolutely awesome,  I had an issue that she corrected and appreciate it was taken care of so quickly. Thank you!; Yesterday, while visiting my Mother I had the distinct pleasure of experiencing EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE from a lovely young lady, her name is Jahira.  She was just so helpful, knowledgeable, and very, very patient.

Jahira is an asset to the company and deserves any additional accolades Walgreens can muster up.

Good customer service is hard to come by and she is indeed a GEM.; Pharmacy customer service is absolute trash! In person it's "ok". But God forbid you call! They won't even answer and ask you to hold, they will either hang up on you continuously, or constantly pick up and immediately place you on hold! I've been calling/sitting on hold for half an hour now with them periodically repeating the same actions. I wonder if this is what they are taught to do during training to bridge the last half hour or so of their shift. Does Corporate approve of this behavior??

I'm eagerly awaiting this location to get the same makeover you've seen at more-current Targets--The addition of Ulta, etc. The older Targets like this one, now feel extremely retro in comparison. Your guess is as good as mine if this location will be fortunate enough to qualify for the upgrade.

At certain times, especially towards the end of the day, you will need to use self-checkout, as there aren't many cashiers available. This is not too bad if you don't have many items, but it can be difficult to balance multiple items on the self-checkout weight checker.

The service at Starbucks is often not the best, but I'm not sure how much of that is due to this specific location or if it's an issue with Starbucks in general.

Either clean it up or lower your prices to reflect the Walmart you have become!; Used to be nice but has fallen hard the last few years. Store is a mess. Clothes everywhere and all mixed up. Clothes all over the floor, nothing on correct hangers, NO EMPLOYEE AVAILABLE and if you do get one it's horrible customer service. Address Components: 6838 (street_number); North 7th Street (route); Alhambra (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85014 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Edit*They filled the script the following night.

I’m extremely frustrated with my experience at Walgreens. I take a controlled substance that I rely on, and it’s known to be in short supply. My psychologist and I have worked to stay ahead of this by ensuring my prescription can be filled with either the generic or regular version. I called Walgreens earlier today after they mentioned an issue with my insurance, and they assured me it would be ready this evening.

When I arrived to pick it up, they told me it wasn’t ready. I returned before closing, only to be told they didn’t have it in stock at all and would need to order it, with an expected arrival on the 11th. This is absolutely unacceptable. Why didn’t anyone inform me of this when I called at 3 PM? Had I known, I could have asked my doctor to send the prescription to another pharmacy that could fill it.

I’m now left without my medication, and I hate the fact that I rely on it to function. Walgreens doesn’t seem to understand the kind of relapse I experience when I don’t have it—it’s truly unbearable. The lack of professionalism was evident, and I’m deeply disappointed. Walgreens, if you don’t have the medication, please let us know upfront so we can make other arrangements. Now I’m left scrambling, hoping and praying that another pharmacy can help me tomorrow.; Hi, I had to share an absolutely wonderful experience I had yesterday! I just got out of the hospital and had some pretty expensive prescriptions. The amazing woman behind the counter, Gracie, found a cheaper price for me than my insurance was. She saved me about $50 and was just awesome! Then the awesome pharmacist, Luu, noticed some of the meds had pretty specific instructions. He made sure that I was well informed and really helped me out! Both Gracie and Luu were incredible, knowledgeable, and kind and I recommend them wholeheartedly! They should probably even get a raise for being sooooo awesome!!!!!💜🙏🫶🤟💜🙏🫶🤟💜🙏🫶🤟; Most “Woke” Walgreens I have ever seen. Nothing but a bunch of mask wearing rude employees. One of the female employees was literally blocking my path and I said excuse me and she just stood there like a brain dead zombie, staring at me with a mask on and then says “Did you need to get by?” Wow, just wow. They also don’t know how to make a proper path to the cash register, you literally have to walk towards the back of the register area or walk towards the front of the store which makes them think you’re going to walk out with the items.; I had been trying to fill my prescriptions here and I kept being told I owed significantly more than my insurance company confirmed I should pay since my deductible had been nearly been met.  In fact, I was told by Walgreens my deductible was twice the amount on my card and in my policy.  Finally, my insurance company figured out that Walgreens incorrectly input my name, relationship code to the policy holder and other items when I was originally put into their system, therefore Walgreens never applied my previous out of pocket payments on prescriptions to my deductible.  After a week and a half of trying to get my prescription filled and on day 2 without my medication, my insurance company called this Walgreens with me on the phone, as well.  The person we spoke with was angry, he acted completely annoyed to deal with this, and he kept arguing with the insurance company that I had not met my deductible despite her telling him repeatedly that I had.  He then "accidentally" disconnected the phone call.  The woman from my insurance company was appalled by his treatment of me, and the incompetence and lack of any desire to try to fix the situation.  I am transferring my prescription to another pharmacy and will never again do business with this Walgreens.; 5 Stars to a seriously overworked team.  I was waiting for a vaccination and watched them work for 20 minutes.  Every person there was putting out 150% to fill orders, answer the phone and  be friendly and helpful to the folks waiting to check out.  I didn't feel good about what I saw and neither should Walgreens management.  Lets just remember that what people in a pharmacy do is important and mistakes can have terrible results.  These people need some help.

Reviews:
Every time I shop here there is an issue with their supposed “sale” items. Literally every single time. Just a couple examples, one time I went in for cold medicine I think it was well the Walgreens app had coupons on it for the items I was purchasing, well their system was not processing the coupons for some reason, they were adamant that there was nothing they could do about it. I even asked for a manager and said you can see the coupon on my app and that it is legit can’t you just honor it? She said again nothing she could do I would have to call corporate as people have been having issues with the app. Second time I went in and there was a posted discount for an item I purchased and again their system was coming up with it as regular price I said well you have a sign back there that shows this sign, the cashier even went and looked and said oh that’s weird but again refused to honor it!! So since your system or your workers don’t do their jobs by making sure the item is marked as sale in your system you won’t honor what the clear sign says?!? Not to mention whenever I have encountered these things happening it never fails the cashier instantly turns rude. I will no longer shop there and I know this probably means nothing to them but hopefully this helps save future customers a headache.; In the year and a half I have lived in the neighborhood and been going to this location, I have had more problems with my prescriptions and their lack of communication on Walgreens part. At first, I thought it was the Pharmacy department now I am realizing it is the whole dang store. I was just rudely greeted by a manager who instead of trying to fix the problem spoke over me and made it sound like I was the one creating the problem. I would highly recommend going to a different pharmacy. GET IT TOGETHER, WALGREENS.; If I could give zero stars I would...I was at this location the other day to buy some cold medicine and leave. I felt like going in my pjs because it was going to be a quick trip but apparently that was my first major mistake because almost immediately I started being followed by 2 employees as I walked across the store. Then as I proceeded to check out they were both standing behind me starring at me (but pretending not to stare at me and "work"). I felt so uncomfortable, I didn't realize you need to look a certain way in order to not be discriminated and followed when visiting this store. Maybe if the staff actually did their jobs there wouldn't be empty shelves and more customers like another reviewer mentioned.; This Walgreens is awesome!!!!!!
Angel,  an exemplary employee at Walgreens, embodies the essence of dedication and excellence in the workplace. With a commitment to providing exceptional customer service, Angel consistently goes above and beyond to ensure that each customer's needs are not only met but exceeded. Known for their friendly demeanor and willingness to assist, Angel has garnered a reputation among both customers and colleagues as someone who can be relied upon to deliver outstanding results.

In addition to their outstanding customer service skills, Angel possesses a strong work ethic and a keen attention to detail. Whether it's stocking shelves with precision or handling transactions efficiently, Angel approaches each task with enthusiasm and professionalism. Their ability to multitask effectively and adapt to changing demands makes them an invaluable asset to the Walgreens team, ensuring that operations run smoothly and customers receive the highest level of service.

Beyond their exceptional performance on the sales floor, Angel also demonstrates leadership qualities that inspire their colleagues. Always willing to lend a helping hand or offer guidance, Angel fosters a positive and collaborative work environment where everyone feels supported and valued. Their passion for their work and dedication to excellence make Angel truly stand out as the best employee at Walgreens, setting a shining example for others to follow.
Angel, You are my sunshine
My only sunshine
You make me happy
When skies turn gray
Also I want to give you my top favorite actors as seen below
Thank you LeAngel JeIslas for helping opening the vibrator case (used); The two ladies working the register last night were super happy and made the experience just that much more enjoyable the facility is clean and easy to navigate!

On 9/15/2024, I was stuck in a sticky situation having trouble tracking down supply of a time sensitive prescription. The pharmacist Dr. Bereket, and the  pharmacy technicians Richard and Joe truly went above and beyond to help me and make everything right after a long day! I cannot thank them or sing their praises enough. This was the 3rd pharmacy I had been contacted over the course of the day and they were the first ones to truly be able and won't to take the time to help me out.; Absolutely do not try and fill your prescriptions here!!! I've had non-stop issues for the last 4 months, I have severe anxiety and even going out is really really hard for me!!! And every single time I go in to pick up my subscription there is some kind of issue and they're just really rude about it, not understanding whatsoever of my condition or apparently how to run a pharmacy!!! Absolutely ridiculous!!! After I pick up my prescriptions tomorrow I will not be using CVS whatsoever to fill my prescriptions I'll takenmy business elsewhere!!! I'm really glad I just called because my prescriptions were supposed to be ready days ago and today is the first day that I've been able to feel good enough to go out and they don't have them ready and supposedly they're going to have both of them ready tomorrow at 10:00 a.m. which is absolutely insane!!! Your pharmacy is literally open 24 hours a day!!! And I know I'm not the only one because every time I'm in there somebody else is having an issue with them too!!!!; Antonio who helped me out in the Photo Department tonight passes the ninja processing vibe test!! Super personable, photo book turned out amazing making me look like the best daughter in law what what too!!! Website quoted middle of the night time frame and he processed it asap! TY Walgreens for offering late photo printing options too!!!; Changed to this pharmacy 2 months ago and I do not recommend. I will be changing back to the previous Walgreens location I went to.
The first Rx I had filled I was shorted 30 pills of a controlled medication. I was able to pick the missing medication up after speaking to the pharmacist but this was really concerning.

I wish I had the woman’s name that I have spoken with over the phone a few times when calling the pharmacy. She is very rude and short every time I’ve spoken to her. I asked a question about their store’s policy (because they all have different policies) and I wanted to make sure that my meds would be available and in stock to pick up when it was due and so that I was not out of my medication just like any of my other routine meds. I was shut down and told they would not fill early. That’s not what I ever asked. I simply asked if they would have in stock so I could pick up on the date that they are able to fill. I don’t think that’s unreasonable. If they only refill 1 day prior (Day #29) and that happens to fall on a Saturday or a Sunday and are out of stock - you will have to wait several more days for them to order your medication and have it filled. I told her that I was trying to avoid a delay or being without my meds as there was a time my meds were due on a Friday but because they didn’t have in stock on Thursday and didn’t submit the order in time … AND it was a 3 day weekend, I had to wait 5 days before they would have in stock so I was out of my meds for 4 days. She had the audacity to argue with me and tell me that wasn’t possible, that never happened, and the only reason there would have been a delay is if there was a manufacturing problem. Seriously? Why are you even arguing with me about this???

Avoid this Walgreens.; I would give 0 stars if it were allowed.  The customer service from the pharmacy is a joke.  They have no customer service skills what so ever.  I was simply calling in ahead to request an additional bottle for my script. I was on for 8 min before deciding to just go to the pharmacy and the call transferred to my car.   I am currently on hold going on 22 min now(still holding) . The call has rang through the hold 7 times now, and each time nobody says anything,  they simply answer and go right back to hold.  Not a please continue to hold (answered and back to hold again) not a bite me,  NOTHING! So frustrating.
Still on hold 30 min later
By the time I got to the drive-thru window, there was one guy very polite working the window and the whole Pharmacy was full of girls standing around and giggling and waving and chit-chatting to each other not working.

Reviews:
Had almost everything we needed. Everyone was friendly who worked there. Not sure why social media posts that only crazy dressed people go there. Most just wore jeans and t's.

However, I don't agree how the owners treat their employees, and would rather shop somewhere else, but unfortunately it is the only reasonably priced option where I live. That is why the rating is not higher; I love the grocery pick up and delivery services! Always friendly and efficient! Saves me so much time every week! And if I do have a question on an order, the customer service is top-notch!; Tonight I came in tired from a days work and needing just a few things to have an early 3 am morning the tomorrow.
My card was not working so I was forced to use another which didn't have the right amount to cover the transaction.
Julian was the cashier and he was so encouraging and patient. He helped me get the total to the right price and even chipped in to cover the change I couldn't cover. I hope that doesn't get him in trouble, because this review is a shout out to him and the way he treated me. It's so nice to see a young generation be so caring. He truly made my whole night better.; My husband got disorientated going to our car after shopping.  Not sure where he had parked.  It was shortly thereafter that staff from Walmart came to his aid.  They were concerned for his welfare and were going to take the time to help him.  A staff member found me, told me what happened and suggested I make sure he got water.  We both have nothing but the highest praise for these employees who put the welfare of a customer at the top of their concerns.; The floors were a little dingy. The produce department was very impressive. The ACC department and garage area were well taken care of. The gentleman who was working freight inside was awesome. I believe his badge stated TL Dakota. Very helpful and had a great disposition about him.

Reviews: I have used this pharmacy for years and the ladies I have dealt with are great. However, to I interacted with a guy that was very rude. I just needed to pick up some prescriptions. I am very flexible on picking up prescriptions, if the Rx isn't ready, I just want to know what's going on and get any problems fixed. Today, one Rx wasn't ready despite me getting multiple texts saying it was. The guy tried to tell me Rx wasn't covered by my insurance (it is) and was very snippy and rude. I didn't care that it wasn't ready, I would have come back, but I needed to make sure that it would be filled and covered. I ended up needing to go in (an ex was too big for the drive through drawer). When inside the snippiness continued and he rudely explained that it had been put back (ok no problem, I just requested it be filled again - no hurry). Inside I was horrified by the toy they had on display at the register. They had a rubber duck in the style of Donald Trump with a bandage on its ear. I don't care what your political views are glorifying political violence in a setting such as Walmart is not acceptable. I don't mind people being proud of their political views, whatever they may be, (though I don't think it is very professional at a business like Walmart) but displaying something that highlights political violence is sickening. Do better Walmart. I am going to look into taking my prescriptions elsewhere because I don't need to deal with someone who is rude just to pick up necessary medication. It's sad because I have had such great experiences with this pharmacy before, but this guy ruined it.; Employees are rude. Asked for help getting water off top shelf and three employees walked away not helping. One male employee with long black hair balding with beard gave me a stupid smile and walked away. A 4th employee helped me. All self check out rows were closed except last row and people were waiting. Never will go back to this store again and hope they close allowing a store to open were employees that are nice helping old people.; This Walmart store is undoubtedly one of the cleanest I've ever been to in my 30 years of living. The representatives were extremely friendly and truly went above and beyond to assist me. 😍; Today my boyfriend and I were shopping and we had a Caucasian dude followed us in what looked like he was taking a pic or video . As we checked out no one said hi or good afternoon but some worker came up behind my boyfriend who is "Blk" and grabbed a plastic bag he put down. It was very rude and felt unwelcome like they don't like "blk" men secretly. We are confused because this just happened to me this passed Friday. Some Asian worker there came up behind me and was 2 " from me stood up behind me looking at my transaction and my boyfriend was behind him. I was so afraid I didn't turn around but I was then calm when I saw my boyfriend behind him. It seems like they treat us as if we are stealing something. We've been shopping here for a year not sure what the real issue is but we had enough. Not going silent anymore.; Thrift store is pretty decent would be nice if their mobility scooters would have more and we'll all be working but other than that it's a nice store to shop at the the staff seems to be very nice

Reviews:
Somehow, this Walgreens looks extremely outdated and dim inside. They had everything we needed. The elderly cashier, and another cashier were extremely kind, informative, and smiled during the transactions. They have excellent customer service.; I come to this store often for things I need but I have noticed a lot lately like almost everytime that the food and snack and candy items are EXPIRED. I’ve worked at Walgreens and the items close to expiration should be pulled from the shelves BEFORE they expire. Not left for customers to buy.; I went in for a Coke Zero and three employees were at the front gossiping about other customers. They all looked me right in the face and did not greet me, just kept speaking poorly on a customer.

I grabbed my Coke Zero and walked up to the register and the three started talking about breaks and who gets to take one. The cashier was screaming the entire transaction that she hadn’t taken a break yet. It actually hurt my ears, her voice sounded like she has smoked for as many hundreds of years as she’s been alive.

She did not make eye contact with me the entire time I was checking out and kept screaming while holding my receipt up. Am I in NYC? How is this behavior appropriate? It’s time for basic customer training again me thinks. I should not have had to have my ears ringing just to get a Coke Zero.; The cashier at the front Michael was rude unprofessional and and harassed my daughter about her ID when I was buying a bottle of wine she is 15 she doesn’t have one he was just very unprofessional over all and should not work in customer service!; I understand they the pharmacy has reduced hours, but when I went I not was closed any there was no sign stating when it reopened.  But asked at the front and the rude young man barked - “there’s a sign, it’s 2:00”.  I went back and checked again and another store employee asked if they could help me, I stated I was looking for a sign with pharmacy hours because the young man had been rude about it.  The employee couldn’t find a sign either.  Unfortunately, rudeness is very common among their employees (not the pharmacy employees).  Last time the cashier ripped my debit card out of my hand and swiped it - it wasn’t working for her either.

Name: Walmart Neighborhood Market
Address: 5122 E University Dr, Mesa, AZ 85205, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 5122 (street_number); East University Drive (route); Mesa (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85205 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I went last night to get a few groceries and checked out at 7:45 pm I went home unloaded my groceries only to find out the 7 dollar bag of cheese had a slice in the bag. I took it back to the store to exchange it with the receipt and was told I would have to wait till tomorrow because customer service closed at 8 pm.
I advised them I need the cheese for tonight and the rep said let me find someone else to help. Which on the 3rd try finally got another rep to help her. I was told by this one no it will mess up their inventory and can not do it. He said I know because I work in customer service. I asked for a manager who was conveniently at lunch till 9 pm. I told him I will wait. Within 10 minutes he came and said I spoke with the Mgr.  and cand do it this one time but never again. I had to go get the cheese to switch it out. When I came back to the counter I was greeted by the manager?? She said just so you know you can never do this again like I was being scolded for returning their defective product.?? I said don't worry I won't because I won't be coming back here again after shopping here for the last 16 years and she said GOOD! Just so you know!! Wow!!!; The pharmacy here has PROMPTLY to filled rxs just phoned in by Drs offices several times. I don't drive, so I really appreciate that they expedite these fills while friends wait for me. I love that a Pharmacist speaks to you regarding every prescription, too! Pharmacy techs here are all professional and kind as well. Glad THIS is MY PHARMACY! Thank you all!; First time seeing the new reno....Nice inside with a great selection.
The gals in the pharmacy are awesome and very personable.; This is the worst Walmart I have ever been to. I have never been so disrespected in my shopping experience. Publicly humilated and treated like some third grade animal. Thier staff degraded me like I was a terrorist. I will never set foot in that store again.; The Walmart team here is very friendly with a good attitude and very helpful They seem to be happy and take pride in helping others find what they need.

Name: Beer World
Address: 1530 N Country Club Dr #20, Mesa, AZ 85201, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 20 (subpremise); 1530 (street_number); North Country Club Drive (route); Fairway Estates (neighborhood); Mesa (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85201 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I stopped by for the first time today, checking out beer stores around the east valley, unfortunately most of their beer coolers were down except one chilled room due to some technical issues which is not a huge deal, it happens, they're handling it.

There is a strong smell of cigarette smoke in this establishment but that's okay, they have an excellent selection of beer, and smoke products. Patty (or Pattie?) helped me out with a Drekker PB&J which was very nice of her, and she helped me find one other flavor to try out.

She mentioned she would order anything in that you would want, so if there's a particular beer you're looking for, Beer World appears to want to help you obtain it. That's nice, I've never had a local place to go to that would order me in something if I wanted something different that wasn't available in the area, not sure on the pricing on that, but it appears to be a featured offered.

Pretty neat place, oh and they have a drive-thru!; This place doesn't look like much. As a matter of fact, I would have drove past it and went to QT if not for a friend's recommendation. Don't let that happen to you, it's a hidden gem! The owner mans the counter himself. They guy is knowledgeable, funny, and friendly. Visit a few times and he will remember your usual order or your craft tastes and recommend something for you. He has the standard domestics plus a nice selection of craft brews from which you can build your own six pack and sample. Overwhelmed by choices or not sure where to start? Just ask him, he knows his inventory and is happy to help. Even if you think you don't need help, listen up- he has good suggestions. Prices are average. You can save a few cents by recycling your old cardboard 6-pk carriers.; I love this place. They’re so interpersonal and work to get to know their customers. Just amazing customer service and connections. My husband and I visit often to try out something new and it’s always so positive. I brought my dad and he loved it as well. I can’t rave about this place enough. As an introvert who doesn’t like the crowding of bars, the level of social interaction and variety is so ideal for me. One of my favorite local businesses.; This place is has a great selection of Beer but I go there for the selection of Hemp Wraps that I can’t find anywhere else!; Edit 2021: beer world was my favorite spot but they were bought out and now they only sell basic beer. If you're looking for everything you can find at Circle K, then this is your spot. It's not the cool craft beer store it once was.

Original review: Beer World is a gem in Mesa! Tons of craft options and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable. I'm happy I found such a cool spot!

Reviews: Always great and helpful, ... Thanks a lot, from Josh Big O Tires; This is the best store on El Cajon Blvd!!! I receive the best service every time the guys they make you feel like family...If you don't go here for All your Needs check them out I am not ever going to any other store but this one for my quick trip stops!!!; Guess who has Single shots Of Casamigos!!!! If your on a budget or Monitoring yourself this place has those and a wide selection. This store has been around for a while and there friendly and helpful great place to get that party started. 🥳; We used to come here on the regular until they refused to accept $1.17 in change. Not only is that ridiculous but it's illegal unless they have a sign posted in the store stating they don't accept coins or certain methods of payments. They told my husband not to come back. No problem. We never will.; Fantastic local shop with friendly service and great little selection of food staples in a relative grocery desert.  This place has saved me a few times when I needed to grab a couple ingredients but didn't want to drive to the grocery store.  Their beer selection has a little something for everyone and it's all chilled, ready to go.  Wine and liquor price and selection is on par with a corner liquor store.

Reviews: The drive up at this store is a complete joke. The guy working it today was bringing one bag out at a time versus the cart they always have. He felt like he need to take off his vest on and off every single time he delivered a bag. Don’t come here if you are looking for efficiency from the the drive up crew.; I usually love Target, but AVOID this location. The store is small and a lot of basic products are now locked in glass cages. There are never representatives available to unlock them. I waited 15 minutes and wandered around the store for another 10 trying to find someone before giving up. They also frequently change what they do and do not sell in the store and most of the time are low stocked on the items that are “available” so I never am able to check everything off my list. It’s worth the additional drive to go to the Target off 44th St, or even a competitor closer.; my review probably won’t matter to most, i needed to use the bathroom and i had my 12moth old baby with me and no one else. to pit in perspective i couldn’t wait any longer to use the bathroom.  first they had to call someone else to open the family bathroom ( witch is fine) but it took 10 ‘minutes for someone to show up all for them just to tell me i can’t take the cart with my baby in it in with me. my baby can’t walk, and  i didn’t want him on the floor or out in the hallway alone i was willing to put my stuff back that i had in my cart but he told me it didn’t matter and it was apart of there “policy” i was polite  i wasn’t rude or a “karen” but he wasn’t giving me any other solutions other then holding in my uncontrollable bodily functions or going somewhere else. HE was rude and unconsiderate of the fact that i was alone with my baby and needed to use a restroom. even if this is the policy or he was lying to my face about the policy something needs to change i expect more from customer service job for mothers who are alone. this would’ve have been that big of a deal if he just left me use the restroom instead i got stressed out and cried in the middle of target thanks; Was sold a video game that did not have the correct disc in the case. Immediately came back to the store to correct the error but was accused of swapping the disc & they refused to make it right. So now I’m out of $75 because obviously one of their employees accepted a return that they shouldn’t have.; One of the smaller Target stores, with a compact, yet sufficient selection of groceries, tech and clothing. A very small selection of books. Oh, and the shelves are almost empty of sales products. (I am being told that it is not unusual.) The place to find all GCU students.

The pharmacy here is awful.  They lose or miss prescriptions that are phoned in (even by the doctor directly!), they're always overloaded with customers with long wait times.  If they can't manage the counter it's tough to imagine them managing the meds properly.; (a Walgreens slightly north and west of the 'Phoenix Mountains!')

Never have I shopped at a Walgreens where I didn't find at least one -if not all- of the cashier and floor management to be brusque or oblique or indescribably rude or sub-rosa disdainful of people in general. Occasionally, there comes a weirdo or a pleasant odd bird, but not today. The undercurrent of 'clients-are-to-be-tolerated-only' was pullng crosswise at the ankles of my soul.; Amy (apologies if I misspelled) and Joseph were exceptional and helped me with my urgent issue by handling the other customers fairly.
They showed professional, dedication, and respect towards everyone.

They are the reason why I prefer Walgreens. God bless them and I wish them all the success. ❤️

They are polite, helpful and relatively efficient. They do a good job of notifying you via phone, text and even email when orders are in process or ready for pickup

Reviews: Nikki is the best!!!! I had an issue with photos she was helpful and kind. Called me back like she said and fixed the problem!!! Thanks so much for your assistance!!!; The front checkout and photo department have always been speedy and friendly with me. Even once going above and beyond and printing out paperwork I had just sent to them online when normally I have to wait.; A small corner store on 16th st/thomas. Its a confusing layout to other walgreens i have been to.  The pharmacy is adequate. It is quite security conscious due to the area. I would not feel too safe going alone there despite parking lot at entrance being well-lit in the pm and a busy cross-street. Please check pharmacy hours. For the most part they shut at 6pm. Early compared to most Walgreens. This is a M-F time too. Weekends they have very  limited hours at weekends. In fact pharmacy closed sundays. So try to plan for that or get script to another store. Not sure why pharmacy is hour restricted at this branch.; I don't know what kind of issues some of these people have had with the pharmacy, but they always take care of my family. I'm sure the other reviewers did absolutely nothing wrong, and the pharmacy staff is out to get them.; Only had to use the restroom. l did not receive a code nor were we told where it was. We needed to wait for a associate. I asked 2 for help. Everyone was "busy" with only 4 ppl maybe in the store.

Name: Walgreens
Address: 1825 W Bethany Home Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85015, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews:
My girlfriend bought some pictures from here a couple days ago that had some sort of disfigure line that cuts across the frame. I went back to see if they can reprint it. The guy I talked to with a long striped colored hair stated that I have to reorder it and they will print it out. It sounds so inconvenient to do that especially if you picked out 60 photos to be printed. He seem like he did not want to do some little order research to just get it printed out. Just plain out lazy. I do not like individuals, who can not do their job. I ask someone else by the name of "Star", who got it done right away without having to tell me to reorder it and she said she can do it with no problem. Individuals like Star...they tend to make things easier for customers like myself. I applaud Walgreen for at least hiring someone like Star, who has great customer service and good problem solving skills. The individual with the colored hair....not so much. I hope he can redeem himself someday.; One of the strangest Walgreens. In a less glamorous neighborhood, with some interesting characteristics. Some of the upkeep has clearly fallen through the cracks, and the clientele and staff is happy to take their time at the check-out, but the employees are nice and chatty.; Where do I start. Bought a bunch of their Xmas present items. Had to return 2 of them because they were so cheaply made they didn't even work. Tried the big dill pickle. Almost thru up. Food is supposed to taste good not bad. Why do places sell food that no one would eat? I just don't get that? And why do they only make one check out person ring everyone up? They never have two check out person's working no matter how long the line is. It's like they could care less if you buy something in their stores. They just don't seem to care. And I go regularly to get my refill medication and it's  always like this. It never changes; I had to get two prescriptions filled for my dog. I came here around 7 o'clock at night. I was glad the pharmacy was still open at that time of the evening.

The young pharmacy tech who helped me was very nice. He helped me with the Good Rx coupons. The other guy made sure I understood the directions for giving the  pills to my dog.

I didn't have to wait long at all to receive have the prescriptions filled.; My father and I went to buy walgreen's severe cold and flu that stated at the price of "8.99" on the price tag ticket. When we  purchase the product, the price on the receipt said 11.99. With tax, it was a total up to nearly 13-14 dollars. If the medicine cost 11.99, please put it at 11.99, not 8.99. And some lady with short hair and a guy that works at the register told my dad if there was difference in pricing, we should tell them before purchasing. How should he know that ? Does my dad even work there ? GEE Why should it be a customer responsibility to tell an employee at walgreens "what the pricing was before purchasing?" We only knew it was 11.99 after the purchase not before it. If the price ticket on the shelf said 11.99 instead of 8.99, this would not be a problem. To add, the cashier stated he could not refund and it was only "exchanged or store credit". It took the manager to give us our money back for a good 15-30 minutes. The manager seem to be the only one to show genuine sympathy and apologize to us while the other lady was frustrated about the situation. Walgreen should check their employee's for being incompetent, their lack of communication skills, and their incorrect prices.

Reviews: I ordered online and decided to try curbside pick up. I was so impressed that after I parked, my order was brought out in like 2 minutes! (A few weeks prior I had tried curbside pick up at a local home improvement and after waiting 15-20 minutes I just went inside and got it so I was prepared for similar). About a month later, I ordered online for curbside and again my order was promptly brought out. Way to go Walmart!!! Great prices and service.; This Walmart lacks in keeping their store stocked.    I come everyday for a week trying to get some items that never get restocked, seems to take weeks for some items.   Store is clean and neat.   Employee at the door is pleasant as well as self checkout employee.   Pharmacy is good as well.; Walmart is always my go - to and this location has been fine for the most part as I’m usually in and out… but today I simultaneously encountered 3+ different employees, one being a manager that absolutely left me speechless with their unprofessionalism. Miscommunication amongst your staff, and then one gentleman on self check out then thought it was a good idea to become aggressive towards a female customer. VERY disappointing, I will not be returning back if I can help it.; I normally visit this location on my drive home from Phoenix to my place in Fountain Hills, which is literally right off the freeway,  so that's away great. As for the atmosphere or this Walmart, nothing impressive.  Specially the fruits and vegetables section, not the freshest selection unfortunately.  And the workers tend to be a bit demanding when it comes to checking out i.e. self-checkout; I usually use the delivery service via Walmart plus  the lack of care is getting out of control the orders are always late by hours and the food is never fresh or quality they’re so careless  truly shocked by the lack of care I was refused a refund and told it didn’t matter if the order was late or food was fresh because it was received?! Huh truly spend your money elsewhere these corporations do not care about you

Reviews:
The store interior and exterior looked clean. The shopping environment was very nice and bright.
However, the selection of the cold beverages, dairy/egg, or produce items was not that diverse and large. The team member looked a bit serious instead of any similes.; Best target in northeast valley! I went to three other targets before ending up here, after the one off of 7th Street and bell failed to fulfill my pick up order in a timely manner, thus leading to the item i was looking forward to selling out. This target was my last bastion of hope! A very kind worker in the toy isle went out of her way to help me out at 9:30pm and even went to the back to look for the item before finding it for me! Super clean store with 10/10 customer service!; After having lots of trouble using the online ordering system, this Target location was a bright spot in my day. I want to send a HUGE thanks to Julie, Tanya and the young lady cashier (I so hate that I didn't write her name down) who were VERY helpful with helping us get the items we needed at the price that was published and did it all with a wonderful attitude.  I felt as if they wanted to help me and not that I was intruding in their workday.  Great Customer Service!; Do not use same day delivery from this store. Ordered items needed by 5 a.m. the next day to save time and stress. At the delivery window, I received a text saying it would be delayed 3 additional hours until 9 to 10 p.m. It is now 8:30 with no sign anything has started.  Willing to bet it's not showing up tonight. Instead of saving time and stress Target added more. Canceling the 360 membership and will get items via Amazon from now on.

** Update- found out a driver signed up for our order at 5 p.m. and held it for 2.5 hours before deciding they couldn't do it.  Needless to say I was at Target (for the last time) at 9:30 p.m. and never going back. There were plenty of employees, had a question and said to my son, " oh maybe we can ask her," only to have the employee vanish. Most of the employees were teens which is great - if you also train them how to work in retail. Entitled N. Scottsdale attitudes.; Wanted to get a Lego Duplo Mickey & Minnie Mouse Set quickly for a birthday gift. Checked prices at several merchandisers, & Target had a competitive price, & I was able to get it on the same day that I ordered it. Easy & quick. Can’t ask for more.

Customer service telling me im not suppose to take my medication as prescribed by the doctor and the pharmacist.  This place is a disaster, although i will say the pharmacists that work there are nice.; Debra cashier was just standing around daydreaming. Then when she finally let me stand there for 10 mins, she comes over and when I paid for what I needed. The women goes and crumbles all the ones up in-front of me and try to hand them to me like such, says they are all new and we have to do that to all. Well in that case like actual cashiers use a product for it or even wear a glove. Never had I did that to someone or have someone do that even self checkout is more professional then this lady!.; sadly, these people are overworked and miserable. VERY long wait times on phone, in person and in drive-thru. really long times too to get prescriptions filled--LIKE days of waiting!!  apparently their corporate office doesn't care, otherwise they would address the problems.; This has been my pharmacy for years, but will now move to a nearby (less convenient) CVS, unless they remedy their service capability.  The newer lady in the pharmacy is not fit.  Every activity she performs is a protracted exercise, like it's her first day on the job.  Lines at the drive through have blown up, because each conversation seems have devolved into a drawn-out ritual.  I've watched her hunt all over the pharmacy area for people's med's - either they have no systems (not conceivable) or she just cannot learn them.  I've just walked out, empty handed, as I watched her flail for 5 minutes trying to serve someone at the drivethrough - they were there before I walked up, so who knows how long they'd already been there (the look on the face suggested "a while").; Called in for medication today. They asked me what I needed (transfer a medication) and put me on hold for over 30 mins. The person picking up the phone sounded lazy and just didn’t want to deal with the customer. I am leaving this pharmacy!

I have been really disappointed in the quality of ready-made food at this location. I’ve had two occasions where food items have been inedible. The first was a rotisserie chicken that was completely raw inside and the second was a pesto pasta salad that was full of mold. I will say that customer service was very kind when I called but I don’t have time to drive back to Sam’s Club to get a refund, so I’ve never actually done it but that’s what they offered to correct the situation.; Nestled at 700 N 54th St, Chandler, AZ 85226, Sam's Club stands as the epitome of convenience, quality, and savings. Here's why Sam's Club should be your go-to destination for all your shopping needs:

1. Wide Range of Products:
Sam's Club offers an extensive selection of products ranging from groceries and electronics to furniture and home goods. Whether you're stocking up on pantry essentials or shopping for the latest gadgets, you'll find it all under one roof.

2. Bulk Savings:
As a membership-based warehouse club, Sam's Club offers unbeatable savings on bulk purchases. From family-sized packs of household items to wholesale quantities of your favorite snacks, buying in bulk at Sam's Club means more bang for your buck.

3. Quality Assurance:
At Sam's Club, quality is paramount. The store prides itself on offering top-notch products from trusted brands, ensuring that you get the best value for your money with every purchase.

4. Member Benefits:
As a Sam's Club member, you'll enjoy exclusive perks such as members-only pricing, early access to sales events, and additional savings on services like optical and pharmacy. Plus, the Sam's Club app makes it easy to shop, track your savings, and manage your membership on the go.

5. Exceptional Customer Service:
From friendly staff ready to assist you with your shopping to hassle-free returns and exchanges, Sam's Club is dedicated to providing a seamless shopping experience for its customers.

Whether you're stocking up for a family gathering, shopping for everyday essentials, or simply browsing for something special, Sam's Club in Chandler is your one-stop destination for quality products, unbeatable savings, and exceptional service. Experience the convenience and value of Sam's Club today!; It’s a great place and no need to buy expensive Costco membership and you can buy lesser value items for family of minimum 2 too …; Nice store and employees. I love being able to come in at 8:00 before I go to work and save with the mark downs in the meat department. Scan and go is awesome. Costco makes you scan your membership card before you enter now, so I’ll be shopping even more at Sam’s Club. Great job to everyone. Keep it up.; Great location however, the loading docks are a mess! The staff back there have an attitude problem. We were there an hour before our appointment and told that we couldn't dock, eventhough all the docks were empty. We were also told that we could not come inside to use the restroom until our appointment time. Off loading took two hours!  The restroom was one of the most disgusting I've ever run across!  This store should take more pride in their appearance and hire more polite staff.

Then when finally found it, they said to me come back tomorrow. I went today after days trying a refill a prescription the farmacist was assisted other client and when finally another employee appears she told me sorry we are close, I look at my clock it was 7 pm o'clock I was there before 7, and she said sorry we actually closed, i tried to tell her that i was there and the other guy was attending a client and I heard all the instructions for their medication, and I  only want to pick up a prescription that is ready. My son has been missing his controlled medication now for days because his carelles in attention and actitud, they really don't care about the people they attending and the emergency of them.
The cashiers at front are nice this is only good about this place..; Every time I go in there the cashiers are rude to me! The only helpful person is the women who works in cosmetics. I shop here often and it’s ridiculous that I’m treated the way that I am. I can’t help but feel it’s due to the color of my skin. On multiple occasions the cashiers (older caucasian women)that ring me out do not say one word to me. They’ve ignored me when I’ve said hello. I’ve literally seen them chatting it up and laughing with costumes ahead of me (Caucasian women and men) today the cashier Ignored me as usual and I said hello twice. I will not be shopping here anymore!; We are regulars at this location and are generally happy with the promptness of preparing prescriptions, the automated communication updates and variety of items available on location. Name: Sam's Club

Address Components: 1225 (street_number); North Gilbert Road (route); Gilbert (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85234 (postal_code); 2306 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
This Sam’s Club is hit or miss with items in stock.  No help on the floor. But the very worst is their cafe, so little people in line and about 5 people in the back serving. They still can’t get their grape out of their backend. Kept giving my order away to whom ever came up. They just said oops let me get you another, we’ll it only took 3 times to get 2 hot dogs and a pretzel. The only plus side that yeah it’s cheaper than eating some other fast food places.; Ruth really made the mistake to treat customers like trash today. It was really busy because it was lunch time, she was treating everyone with an attitude, and then when it was finally my turn, I asked her for a pizza pretzel, and before saying anything else, she made this annoyed weird face with anger, and said no because it’s a 30 min wait (which is pretty normal for this location, usually 20-30 mins). I told her I could wait, and she still hesitated and suggested that I don’t. Anyways, she finally put in the order. Charged us. No big deal. Understood that it was busy. Moving on. 30 mins later, we get our order. Part of the order was wrong, but whatever, didn’t even bother to tell them. But, Because my pizza pretzel was hot I needed utensils, and there weren’t any knives on the dispenser for it. I go to the front again, and I asked for a knife, and she told me to find them in the dispenser, and I told her there weren’t any, and she kept saying that there were. I kept trying to explain to her that there weren’t any. And she kept fighting me to check again. I went, checked again, and nothing. So I go back, asked for a knife again, and she starts arguing with her co-workers and laughing that I keep saying that I keep claiming that there weren’t any knives. I stood there for about 2 mins waiting. And Ruth kept telling me to get the knife at the dispenser area, she said she was busy helping with orders. And once again, she told me to look in that area. I told her “M’am! I am not blind, can you please just get me a knife.” After rolling her eyes, and her co-worker telling me that I don’t need to have an attitude, even though it wasn’t, and simply was over begging them for a knife, the co-worker went to the dispenser area, and she realized that it  was stuck, so it took them a couple of minutes to fix it, they finally fixed it, didn’t say anything and just walked away. Overall, food tasted well, just the experience made it really bad, especially when I come here often. I understand that they were busy, there was no need for employees to treat their customers that way.; I always have a good experience at Sam's Club.  I much prefer over Costco for a number of reasons.  I've had both memberships at the same time and most recently chose to renew just my Sam's Club membership.  More locations available for me to shop although they closed the one closest to me.  I wish they had one in my city.  I always start with gas.  Most always the lowest price I can find most anywhere.  Using the gas application within their app for gas makes fueling up a breeze.  Very quick.  Food court is always good for the money if you need a quick bite.  Although they took away my favorite pizza (the supreme). Most everything is always in stock.  I love using the scan and go shopping tool on their app.  So nice not to have to wait in line to checkout and makes the exit process very efficient.  Products are always good quality and prices are very competitive.  They change a lot of products very often which is nice.  Keeps it fresh.  Service although minimal is always good.  I will definitely continue to renew my membership.  The value is definitely there.; Frankie in the meat department was very professional and helpful. I didn't see the grass fed grass finished striploin steak out on the floor. I mentioned it to him and he brought out an entire box full of what i needed. We took some time to appreciate the quality of the meat, it was a good time.; Sam's Club has so many different products for you to choose. They have also added a new convenient way to shop. You just shop, put your items in the cart and scan as you go. Once you are done, you just add your credit card information and away you go!! There will be a receipt that is on the app and it will show how many items there should be in your cart. The person that is standing by the out door will scan a few items in your cart to verify that they are on the receipt and away you go.
Scan & go is the way to go!! Oh did I mention that you get discounts on certain items when you use this app?? It saved me an additional $25!! I would recommend if you are going to Sam's Club that you do the scan & go!!

No many selections on different products, the food court was terrible Saturday around 6pm and only 1 guy taking orders and preparing orders, only item available was a cold hot dog, No pizza ! , shelf empty, the line to order was long , the line at the door was long with only 1 lady checking the receipts, bad management !

Thought I would give Sam’s Club a try as I have been a Costco customer for years. Glad I only paid half of the usual membership price due to their membership discount going on. Immediately when I walked in the store appeared unkempt and felt dirty. One person running a checkout whom was in training and the rest were all self checkouts. Thankfully it wasn’t busy. Employees not professional at all in appearance and or mannerisms. Some prices good and some not so good. Produce and meats not even comparable to Costco. Most looked like they were not fresh or day old. Unfortunately the quality is just not there. Not sure if I will be renewing my membership and so glad I did not pay more and go with the plus membership. If you are a Costco member I suggest you stay there. Costco has much better quality in produce and meats and Costco runs multiple sales where you get excellent discounts on products that are already decent in price. I didn’t see one item marked down from original prices. Very disappointing.; Sam’s Club really needs to take some notes from Costco. We have been so spoiled by Costco that anytime we go to Sam’s Club, it is a major letdown in terms of customer service. At this particular location, the café is a complete joke. If you look at the pictures, so many people are waiting for their food, but nobody was getting anything, including the people that had paid in advance with the app. After 15 or 20 minutes, someone finally asked where the food was. The guy behind the counter said, “If you tell me what you want, I will get it for you.” You read that correctly, he wasn’t going to send out any food unless people ask for it. People could have told him anything, and he would’ve handed it to them without seeing if it was really part of their order. This location gets worse and worse. They really need to train their cafe employees.; What is with all these people in Az. with all the black clothing on? Is this the color of death? to look 'tough'? to identify with the gang image? Think it started in the early 90's with 'rap'/hip-hop crap..E-gawds..Robert at 69.; Store was nice,  clean,  good selection,   Sunday and very busy.  Got to the front and there was one cashier.     3 employees standing around the self check out while a huge line was behind the one cashier.   Come on Walmart this is insane.

Name: S'Boro Liquors
Address: 860 Buckhead Dr, Statesboro, GA 30458, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 9:30 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 860 (street_number); Buckhead Drive (route); Statesboro (locality); Bulloch County (administrative_area_level_2); Georgia (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 30458 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I don’t know his name, but he was working Friday evening 9/07/24 around 7:30 pm and I came in looking for a chilled margarita to drink soon as I got home. He didn’t have anything chilled but recommended these little round ball margaritas and suggested I put them on ice… well I did. They are amazing! Just the relaxation I was seeking. If I could give him and this place a 10 I would!; I wanted to add on here, i used to be friends with the people that one star bombed this business, they did so just because they were fired, this really is such a great business. I wish the best for the owner; did not like any of the employee's. when I came in they had an attitude. terrible products as well.; Awesome environment in this place and the owner is very kind and relatable sometimes my wife and I want to go there just to talk to him even if we have nothing we need to buy; They are so great! I was having a problem with my credit card, it had been tagged with fraudulent activity and put on hold. The owner was there and helped me choose a bottle of wine for my cousin as a gift, she loved it! She considers herself a wineologist and I believe her but I was afraid it would make her hard to please, So he did a wonderful job.
He was extremely patient, he didn't get frustrated with my situation. He simply carried on and waited until I got off the phone with my bank then helped me figure out a way to get my full purchases. I've made it my 'go to package store'.

Name: Damon's Beverage and Redemption
Address: 700 Hogan Rd, Bangor, ME 04401, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Address Components: 700 (street_number); Hogan Road (route); Bangor (locality); Penobscot County (administrative_area_level_2); Maine (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 04401 (postal_code)
Reviews:
There is sooo much to choose from in this liquor store !
The selection & the prices are both great.
I stopped here on my way back to Canada and the staff were very helpful and friendly. I bombarded one guy with so many questions and he was so patient with me and very knowledgeable. Excellent service !
All of the staff made me feel very welcome. I Visited on January 2nd.
I'll make sure to stop here again next time I'm in Maine :); Do NOT use this redemption center they legit throw peoples money away!  My husband went in yesterday to return bottles after having to waste a 1/2 hour he took bottles that the machine wouldn’t take to the employee who went through them and proceeded to throw away bottles that clearly have the 5 cent return on them because “ we don’t take them here” so instead of asking if he wanted them back to return elsewhere!  When my husband asked for them back he was told they were thrown away and taken to the dumpster There was atleast $5+ in returns how dare you think it’s okay to throw away other peoples money! Will never return to this location again it’s a waste of time and clearly money.; Went there to return my bottles. Didn’t like that his was self service. Since when do you go to return your bottles & cans you have to do the work yourself. Then why pay 2 -3 people to be there. If I wanted to do that I would have gone to Shaws. Just saying!; You have to really watch this place. You could do the machine and return your bottles but every bottle that you throw in that box don’t count it being counted because I counted how many one time that I threw in the bin and when I went up to the front to exchange my receipt for the money, counted 45 bottles the dude only counted 24 Kind of a rip off if you don’t count your bottles that you throw in the bin; Always liked coming to Damons until having to deal with this one lady. Idk what her issue is with people but generally when people have 10-15 bags of bottles they are not stored in a house and there may be a little dirt on them. For an associate to state they will turn away business if there is a little bit of dirt on the bottles is crazy. Attitude is insanely rude. I've never encountered such a rude ignorant associate before

Name: Steve's Wine.Beer.Spirits
Address: 3618 University Ave, Madison, WI 53705, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 12:00 – 6:00 PM

Reviews:
Steve’s is a fine, long time Madison establishment - always finding new experiences in drinking.  Newest find - but apparently available since 2021 - Steve’s Crowlers :  pre-mixed cocktails of many varieties.  Latest tasting “The Aviation” - very nicely done.

Addendum: Mezcal margarita is more smoky than most I’ve had - in a good way!
Crowlers batting %100; Steve's is one of my all time places to come to get alcohol! I truly believe that this store is a Madison staple. They have a vast selection of wines, and they also have a healthy selection of champagne/bubbly wine. I adore the fact they have a whole wall dedicated to tequila, which is my preferred hard alcohol. Steve's also has Sake! It's so hard to find sake at liquor stores. The people working here are amazing and nice!; Recommended! This is a great liquor store with an excellent collection. One of the reasons I like going here is because they have nice little placards that tell you about the wines. They're informative, and the owners tend to highlight wines that are good buys or interesting finds.; Great selection. NA and other options available!  Friendly.and helpful staff; I've never seen so many helpful people at a liquor store in my whole life.  I was looking for some N/A options and they had a great selection.   Everyone was super friendly.

Name: Global Beverage Warehouse
Address: 425 High St, Ellsworth, ME 04605, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Address Components: 425 (street_number); High Street (route); Ellsworth (locality); Hancock County (administrative_area_level_2); Maine (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 04605 (postal_code)
Reviews: Stopped in cause of the positive reviews- staying a month in Bar Harbor…. Well, I gotta tell you— none of these favorable reviewers encountered the totally ignorant woman we did at the counter. I asked a simple question about pricing on 2 different sizes of the same Rum and she was just plain nasty, 🤢, condescending and impatient. The store was not crowded, though even if it were that was not excuse her behavior. You had to be there, to believe it. Anyways…. I won’t be back !; This is an excellent liquor store. It is a must stop on our way to and from Mount Desert Island. There is always a good selection, great prices, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. I walked in on a Saturday morning and found some excellent Bourbon and rye, plus a good deal on Caymus Wine. Thank you!; If you're in Downeast Maine and visiting the Acadia region or if you are a local like me, GBW is the place to go if you're looking for a more than ample supply and variety of wine, spirits, and beer. More importantly, the staff is knowledgeable and if you're not sure of what to buy, their recommendations have always been on point.; Great selection. Good prices what more do you want?; Excellent customer service!!! Impressive. I was not a number, but treated as an actual human being, as opposed to other businesses. Staff at Global beverage is helpful, very friendly, outgoing. Wasn't quite sure what I was looking for as the selection is overwhelming. But staff encouraged us to ask questions, and never badgered or hovered either. Prices are fair and competitive. Really great people that work there! Thank you!!!

Name: Fred Meyer
Address: 1900 SE Sedgwick Rd, Port Orchard, WA 98366, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 1900 (street_number); Southeast Sedgwick Road (route); Port Orchard (locality); Kitsap County (administrative_area_level_2); Washington (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 98366 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We shop here for our groceries almost exclusively. Produce is always fresh and restocked several times a day. The store is clean and rarely are they out of a normally stocked item. Prices are very competitive. Deli always has fresh (usually prepackaged) salads, lots of fresh made sandwiches and a good selection of meats.; Please stop having your cashiers yank out ID our of our hands and scan it without our consent for age restricted items. Who knows where that data is going and when it will be lost in a data breach. There is the option for them to key in the date and then hunt for a manager who doesn't even look at the ID to approve the override. Your customers aren't criminals. Quit making us feel like it. It is already bad enough that you require us to let you profile us by needing the card to get discounts. I will start shopping elsewhere.; Free the pant!!! Seriously I don't want to have to grab some one just to checkout some jeans. I was ecstatic that there was a rack with pants that aren't locked down, only to realize that yes they are still locked up. Some of the Jeans have the tags on the wrong side and you have to fight with the cable to see what size it is or the price.
Missed out on a couple hundred bucks; After a long Remodel the Store is complete. Now to locate where our household goods are. Nice one stop shopping. Garden, outdoor-rec, clothes,shoes, full service grocery store, electronic store and s Nice Jewelry store 👌Offers self check out or regular cashiers. Lotto Kiosks and gas station. Lots of parking and several other businesses surrounding the complex.; Great store. Very nice size, larger than other department and grocery stores in the area by far. Goof selection of fresh produce, and also fresh plants if you prefer to grow your food from home! Fresh hot sandwiches and Delicatessen have very good eats if you are feeling hungry. Great liquor and beer selection. Apparel, home, garden, and hardware sections are also available and offer just as many, if not more goods than the local Wal-Mart or Target. Best location in the area. Would definately recommend.

Name: CVS Pharmacy
Address: 1615 E Baseline Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85042, USA
Address Components: 1615 (street_number); East Baseline Road (route); South Mountain Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85042 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I'd give zero stars if I could.

Staff is fine, pharmacist Emily Nadler is HORRIBLE.  She is an awful representation of an otherwise decent brand.; Rude & incompetent pharmacist & staff.  They did not want to assist in transferring my prescriptions from Walgreens. I was told to find a different Pharmacy, then I was told it would take two weeks, then I was told it would take 72 hours. I called and prescriptions were not filled. I called after 2 weeks and they said the transfer was complete and asked me if I wanted them filled. I thought that was the point of getting them transferred. They said it would take two days to fill them. I went in to pick them up and they double filled one prescription and failed to fill three of them. I called to ask why they didn't fill the other three prescriptions and was scolded by staff. The woman said she had to restock all of my prescriptions and I should have picked them up sooner. I explained that the prescriptions were not filled and each time I called they said they were not filled. She blamed me for their incompetence. The pharmacy did not have my correct phone number which may have led to the complications. The staff is extremely rude and unfortunately the pharmacist is the pharmacy manager and the store manager has limited hours and capabilities. I was told to file my complaints with corporate because they would not be addressed at the store level. I had to transfer all my prescriptions to another CVS location.; There were three of us in line waiting. Four ladies talking about their ages and laughing while we stood there waiting. The gentleman in the front had been standing for 20 minutes while two people answered phones and one stayed at the window just waiting for cars to come.; My daughter needed her medicine. They told me it would be about an hour until it’s done. Luckily, my husband looked online at their portal, and found that it is out of stock and won’t be able to fill it until tomorrow at 6pm at the earliest. I tried calling to see about switching it to another location and was on the phone for 57 minutes!! That is absolutely unacceptable. To make matters worse, at about 12 minutes, a lady picked up the phone, and after me saying hello, she said hello and then told me to “hold on just a minute.” This location does not have good customer service, and they are always behind. It is difficult to get ahold of anyone to talk to them. I understand that they could be under staffed, but there has to be some solution to this problem. It has been going on for more years than before covid.; Thank you to my CVS Pharmacy Staff at store# 7660 in Phoenix, AZ. I want it to be known that the staff at Store #7660 continues to extend customer service and assistance that goes above and beyond expectations, by going out of way to show there that customers are we appreciated.
Thank you to CVS Pharmacy Staff for your services. Go Team🎊🎈!

Name: Walgreens
Address: 12050 N Dove Mountain Blvd, Marana, AZ 85658, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
