Reviews: Not a great experience.  Took 7 hours to fill a prescription.  Staff complained their shorthanded. Went back 7 hours later to pickup prescription and also tried to get a Sudafed decongestant.  Pharmacist told me she was too busy to help and stated you have to provide ID. Not sure what she was implying, I'm not a crackhead, just looking for a decongestant for my flu. She refused too help. Definitely do not go here. Walgreens on twin peaks or cortaro is a better alternative.  The Pharmacist working on 09/28/24 needs to find a new career, maybe something she enjoys doing.; The store area is really nice and has great service, do not use the pharmacy…always new people, takes forever to even get acknowledged even if there is no one waiting in line, and usually have to be calling to get prescriptions resent; Don't call to make any vaccine appointment. You'll be speaking to somebody in India and they still screw it up.; I called  to ask when my prescription would be ready. The women pharmacist said in a hour. I went through  the drive thru over an hour later, which it took them about 5 minutes to even acknowledge me at the window, to tell me they would be with me as soon as she can. Waited another 5 to 10 minutes be told my prescription was not ready. She was not genuinely sorry and in just in a big hurry.  I had to ask them if they can text me. She began to tell me they are just too busy with keeping  up with everything including  vaccinations.  Not my problem.   Don't tell someone  iprescription will be ready in an hour  and it's not. Now I have to make another trip. I would have been  more understanding if she nice and genuinely sorry. Thank goodness I don't have to deal with them all the time.; Extremely unprofessional. Canceled my refill two days in row without reason when i need the medication as a priority to stay healthy. Answered the phone then hung up in my face .

Thank you CVS!!; Been coming here CVS , for years always been very helpful; They have a women at this location that thinks she is speaking English but I can't under stand her. One simple question, do you do in store covid testing? She never did give me the answer. If CVS is going to hire foreigners to answer the phone, at least make sure they speak the local lingo.; This pharmacy is much improved in the past few months.
But still,
I truly miss the mom & pop drug stores.

Name: CVS Pharmacy
Address: 1137 S Dobson Rd #10, Mesa, AZ 85202, USA

Reviews: I really have to say the staff makes this pharmacy unique.   It's like being at a small local pharmacy.  Not a huge CVS fan however the people here have completely pleased me.  They've gone above and beyond to assist me and always leave me very pleased.  Great service. Clean. Very efficient.; CVS aka Caremark is an abomination and should be shut down. The pharmacy is a joke, and getting any help at this or any of its locations is a 20 minute waste of time. You get better customer service at Walmart if that tells you anything.; The pharmacy team here is incredible! They have a huge customer volume, and I’m always amazed by how efficiently they get us all through. They’re also always professional and gracious, no matter how hard they’re working.; No way to connect to the pharmacist through automated system. Worst automated system ever; This CVS has not been filling prescriptions within a reasonable amount of time. Once a prescription was filled and available for pickup, went in to pick it up the couldn't find it. Now, for last few months prescriptions are still in progress for 5 to 6 days and still not progressed then try to call to get them filled; phone system is messed up and the hold time is ridiculous, then they are rude over the phone. There is so many more issues with this CVS Pharmacy...I don't have that kind of time. What ever you do, don't go there. Btw, I've this Pharmacy for more than 20 yrs so this review does come lightly.

Reviews: Good deals of you're willing to analyze coupons and prices carefully. Walked out with nearly $20 of snacks and candy for pennies.; Based on my experience here, the store was well organized and pretty clean on the interior. Really good customer service from the associate I encountered. Exterior was pretty dirty and sketchy. Probably wouldn't recommend this place based on location. But no other issues presented.; Honestly tired of being yelled at by the Chinese lady when they constantly mess up my prescription orders, I get a text and email when my meds are ready and 95% of the time I go get them im told they are not ready and come back later. She's rude and I've tried to make complaints about her yelling at customers to no avail. She actually yelled at me in front of a pharmacist one day because they made a mistake on my insulin, the pharmacist dismissed her and took over then tried handing me cash as an I'm sorry so we can get lunch cuz he saw I was upset and there with my kids. I didn't take it but could tell he's used to this and I at least appreciate him having compassion and trying to do something nice for how we were treated.; Pharmacy technicians are very rude. It’s the second time I get such bad experience with them and told they don’t have any prescription “ready”! Only when I asked them if there any prescription then they said “15 minutes wait”! If I didn’t ask them again they wouldn’t tell me and I would just leave!; Best CVS I have been too. Brian the pharmacy manager is so great. He will make you feel like your a true person

Name: CVS Pharmacy
Address: 1855 W Thunderbird Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85023, USA
Address Components: 1855 (street_number); West Thunderbird Road (route); North Mountain Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85023 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This score is not a reflection of the staff at this location. The staff is great. The low score is because I can no longer get a human on the phone and am required to leave a voice mail for the pharmacy team. This is a huge inconvenience and I find myself driving to ask questions that I used to be able to call for. Unfortunately after many years there I will be switching locations.; No one wants to work the counter register and you are forced to use self check out. Pharmacy people are good. But the parking lot and landscape looks awful. Almost looks condemned out there. CVS also has huge markup on most items. Mainly I go here for my meds; To be honest, I'm really tired of all these companies having automated voicemails or answering for the pharmacy. It can't answer any of the questions that I have and for that reason I'm super disappointed. You should have more jobs CVS.. I think your customer service would be better then; Here to grab meds, came in to find out that they decided on their own to forward the medications to a different location. Now waiting so far 23mins to get it here and filled.

While waiting the "pharmacist for the day", Mal a snotty lady, was told they made an error on medication. She was rude and very adamant that the lady was wrong, she needed to run it back to her insurance, because it wasn't them .. well it was them, they charged her for 3 months supply, and gave her 30 days supply, and she had to give her a refund and rerun it.

I witnessed tour outwardly reprimanded colleague because a lady named Sharon said to do things one way, but she shut her down and told her "don't ever say Sharon said something when IM here, I'm the one who's in charge and what I say goes".... She absolutely needs more training and customer service, but also communication. I understand having the title of being in charge, but to act like a total ignorant oppressive monster is not okay.; CVS membership owner and go to this location about once a week because it's right next door.  The store itself is fine, some employees are super friendly and others really arent.  While not in the best of areas, it could be far worse.. so I don't fully understand the vibes of disdain for the job I get from a few of the staff members.  I've had bad luck with calling the pharmacy multiple times of the day on several occasions.  Store is clean and usually stocked with whatever I'm looking for.  Be prepared to be asked for money from boozers outside once in a while.

Name: CVS Pharmacy
Address: 5050 W Baseline Rd, Laveen Village, AZ 85339, USA
Address Components: 5050 (street_number); West Baseline Road (route); Laveen Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85339 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This neighborhood CVS continues to provide quality products and services even with an increase in crime and theft nearby. The daytime manager and front store clerk are always helpful and pleasant.; (REPORT THEM) worst experience with this location. Not only did I have poor customer service I also was accused of being a thief. I was shopping with my mom for her vitamins and dental floss. My mom needed assistance by the vitamins and pushed the button. We waited for 10 min and the manager finally came to help after the other associate called over the intercom for security to check the aisle for thieves. So when the store manager comes up to us to get the vitamins out the lock box she turns to my mom and says it will be at the front. We don't argue we walk to the front thinking nothing of it. I try to check out at the kiosk and my mom at the register with another associate who couldn't locate my mom's number. So she creates a new account. My mom asked the manager why she didn't give the vitamins to the associate and the manager said she didn't have time for thieves. Which we were paying for the things. She told us she didn't need to deal with us or any attitude and kicked us out. We asked for corporate number and she refused so I asked her if it's normal practice to deny providing corporate number which is nowhere on the building. She then stated it was 1800 cvs which is incorrect . I'm a state employee and with accusations like that are automatically suspended if reported which she did call an officer. I did wait outside calling corporate which I found online. The store manager Monica Hernandez is very rude and discriminating just because I am dressed in leggings and a sweater no make up, messy bun and Crocs probably thinking I'm a homeless person but I didn't refuse to pay. I was refused service which she states is her right. Please don't give them your money if they feel discriminating is appropriate treatment.; This CVS Pharmacy is disappointingly unprofessional. Every time I’d come here for a pick-up, pharmacy technicians and/or pharmacy assistants would be rude. One experience in particular made me switch locations when a bottle of Cetirizine was supposed to have a quantity of 90 but instead had a quantity of 30. I then had to pay for the prescription again (had to take the L). Oh and another thing, the pharmacy had claimed they didn’t have record of me picking anything up from their location in the past 6 months when I’ve received countless of medications, which I found strikingly unusual.

TLDR: This CVS Pharmacy doesn’t pay attention to medication quantity, they don’t keep record of when you pick up prescriptions, and their customer service stinks!; This CVS is the closest to our home.  We have lived here for 23 years.  What was once a clean, organized store with kind, professional employees has changed over the years.  The employees at the front registers are nice enough. However the store is a mess.  Empty shelves and a terrible selection of goods. I rarely bother anymore and simply prefer to order from Amazon.  I am taking the time to write this because you MUST do something about your pharmacy.  They are rude, slow and quite frankly not smart enough to be working in their positions.  I have had many terrible experiences at this location.  Medications are never ready when promised. Staff goes out of their way to make it known that they don't care.  At my last visit I picked up two of my three medications (because although my doctor's office made note of an adequate alternate drug) your store couldn't complete the entire order making it so that I had to drive to a second pharmacy. The young woman at the drive through was fine during our initial interaction, once she passed my meds through the window she didn't make eye contact or say a word.  I looked at the window and said \"Okay, is that it? Am I done?\" Finally she picked up her phone line and said \"yes\". It was lazy, rude and lacking simple social skills.  I have had enough and will be changing to another pharmacy for all of my family prescriptions.  Do better people. You look really bad.  I'd be embarrassed to be any part of your company.; Sorry we are "short staffed" seems to be the answer for every mistake. The rep said we don't have anyone that can call your insurance??? I'm sorry but your mistake is the reason why we have to call them now, really thought that would take priority. I wish they knew what it felt to go without my rx, they simply don't care. I hope management or ownership will hurry up and hire more people to avoid these issues, until then 1 star.

Name: CVS Pharmacy
Address: 18460 N 7th St, Phoenix, AZ 85022, USA
Address Components: 18460 (street_number); North 7th Street (route); Seven Palms (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85022 (postal_code)
Reviews: I was in an emergency situation and needed help. Pharmacy was able to fill my prescription in 15 minutes, and also David helped me with insurance and getting a 5-day supply until it is sorted out. I am grateful he was able to help me right before they closed for lunch. Great patient care at this pharmacy and David went above and beyond to help me.; I've had nothing but good experiences with this pharmacy. Went to them because I was unhappy with the one inside target. This pharmacy helped me with everything when my son was sick a few times and when I had to transfer a prescription. They where helpful over the phone even though I knew they where busy and took the time to explain things to me. Being a new mom I'm running into many new experiences and I'm glad they've been there to help me in store and in drive-through.; Keep more products stocked on the shelves they were a little bare today. But Biljana, cashier, made up for that by being very friendly and recognizing me from previous visits and greeting me with a warm smile and positive attitude!!; Hannah at 18460 N 7th St CVS pharmacy is phenomenal! She is knowledgeable and friendly and I've had the pleasure to have her help me several times this past week. My insurance is no longer contractual with Walgreens as of 1/1/2023. To move all my husband's and my RX's to CVS was going to take effort but Hannah's expertise and excellent customer service made it quick and easy to do. David the pharmacist is also very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly.  I'm glad I was able to have such two great people to help the transition go smoothly.  A+++ and 10/10 all around for outstanding customer service!  Thank you Hannah and David.; I picked up my Rxs for my husband today. Another hit for me at the CVS Pharmacy at 18469 N 7th St in Phoenix.  This time I had the pleasure to meet Dorothy.  She was very efficient and friendly. That's all I ask for it's not rocket science.  I was in and out with my Rx's smoothly.  Thank you !

Reviews: The product is fairly priced at this walgreens. I thought it was very interesting that they have a doctor's office inside of this Walgreens, I have never seen a design like this before. For architecture purposes I really enjoyed going in here, but I cannot tell you whether the doctors are good or not. They also had some really beautiful flowers outside, they even had birds of paradise. As for the product, like I said it is fairly priced and I was able to find things that I was not able to find it other Walgreens.; I am not sure what is going on here but I needed a script for my husbands blood pressure medication.  I called them on Monday to retrieve script from my pharmacy in Nebraska.  I did not hear back from them.  Tuesday I called the Nebraska pharmacy and I had them fax the script to Walgreens as Walgreens told me they didn’t have time to contact the Nebraska pharmacy. Tuesday later afternoon I called Walgreens and they said the script wasn’t ready yet but they were processing it. Wednesday I finally went in to check out why a simple but important blood pressure script wasn’t filled.  The lady told me it wasn’t done, did I want to wait for it? I said absolutely! The pharmacist was filling scripts, stapling bag and pitching them into a bin behind him. Real classy!; It is one thing to require a photo ID on products like tobacco and alcohol if the customer has a possibility that they are underage. It is another to require if from someone who has a long past looking young. Adding insult to injury is every Walgreens store does this and will not accept photo ID on electronic media even though all of Arizona law enforcement accepts it since it is issued by the government.; I went to the pharmacy and was a bit confused with my prescriptions.  The person that helped me had extreme patience with me and was very helpful since two of my prescriptions had been changed to a different dosage.  Thanks to her for keeping me on track.  I've been very pleased with all the services at this Walgreens. The waiting time was not excessive, maybe 5 minutes.; Change your provider and save yourself the headache. Stood in line today for 20+ minutes just for everyone to chitchat with an off the clock coworker that came in for her own medicine. People come there to get the meds they need, not to listen to the employees at the pharmacy talk about their covid experiences amongst each other. Ive been trying to get my wife meds for weeks now. The doctor says she did her end, insurance said it's absolutely approved, Walgreens says the doctor never sent it and it's not approved through insurance. Which out of the three do you think is giving me the run around????

Name: Walgreens
Address: 4875 E Elliot Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85044, USA

Address Components: 4875 (street_number); East Elliot Road (route); Ahwatukee (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85044 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I would definitely not recommend getting your flu or Covid vaccine here. The lady from the pharmacy who administered them pushed them into my arms SO slowly, which makes it hurt way more!! OUCH!!!; My experience while printing a photo this afternoon was a wonderful experience. The guy was genuinely nice and even helped me put the photo in a frame.; The pharmacy operation manager is rude and does not know how to bill insurance. I believe the reviews for this pharmacy/store. Don't know how most of the pharmacy staff still have a job there.; I thought the reviews were a little extreme until I started using this pharmacy regularly. The wait times for filling a prescription are longer than any other pharmacy I've ever been to, even for very common prescriptions that don't need any kind of special mixing or ordering. I have never NOT had an issue with insurance at this location, despite using the same insurance at other locations. I've had to explain to multiple employees how Tricare works (extremely common insurance) and have had them argue with me about it only to call Tricare to confirm pharmacy benefits and find out that I'm correct. I primarily have filled prescriptions here for my kids when they're sick, so that makes the issues even more frustrating. Waiting hours and hours or even days to get a script filled for a sick kid is unacceptable. Today was the last straw for me, though my own fault as I should have switched pharmacies ages ago. I called just to get a status update on a prescription for my sick baby and the pharmacist wouldn't tell me whether they had even received my prescription until I gave her my insurance issue for the 4th time in a row. I'll be utilizing another pharmacy going forward.; On hold to speak with a pharmacist now for over an hour... unfortunately this is a common occurrence for this Walgreens. have never had so many problems with any pharmacy I've ever visited as I have had with this one. It's too bad because it is so conveniently located but I will be going out of my way to visit another store. Over the course of the past 4 days I have been put on hold for over on hour twice, hung up on without speaking to anyone twice, been incorrectly told that my medication is ready for pickup when it was actually out of stock, and FINALLY after I get my prescription filled and am going through the checkout process I am told "hang on a second" and then met by the operations manager 15 minutes later who informs me that they "accidentally deleted" my prescription during the checkout process and need to get a new one sent over from my doctor. So essentially day 5 and I still haven't been able to get my medication.
Something very odd is going on at this pharmacy and I will not be going back, I recommend that anyone reading this review steers clear of this location as well.

Reviews:
The pharmacists at my Walgreens are always friendly and they always make sure we get the best available price for our prescriptions, even though they are VERY busy and short handed.; Gavin was such an amazing cashier! Not only was he knowledgeable about Walgreens, but he also offered great recommendations about what we should do as out of towners.; Way more options than others I’ve been too. The employees are nice too and always greet you. I work in this plaza and im always greatful they let me use their bathroom to freshen up on break even when I don’t have anything to buy. Thanks guys; Pharmacy is the worst!
Understaffed, high turn over, takes forever to get prescriptions filled, never answer the phone, they dont ask if you need to talk to the pharmacist about your medication information.
Every time  I am there they are arguing with customers.; I have dealt with Walgreens for several years. As they are required by my health plan I have no real alternative. I have found them to bombard me with messages to order more drugs. In addition, when I have requested a reduction in the medication amount to be distributed they have ignored my request- distributing the 90-day max. When a prescription is back-ordered, they are slow to respond (taking multiple days) even when the medication is on hand at another Walgreens close by. If you call to find out the status of a back-order they will look up where it is available and they tell you to call that location. When you ask them to coordinate (one Walgreens to another) they tell you they are too busy. This combination of emphasis on revenue and avoidance of service is one reason why we have high health care costs and low satisfaction with our health care system.

Visited Phoenix for the first time with the wife. Whiskey hunted solo while the wife was in business meetings.

They had a nice inventory of rare whiskey but out of my price range as they were HIGH secondary prices. They had my favorite, Eagle Rare, but wanted $80 for a 750.

Staff wasn't very welcoming and were more interested in the game on TV than helping me. Took 1 star off because their prices were too high, even for regular bottles. Took another star off because staff was so unwelcoming. Took last one off for overall experience.; Update:

We have enjoyed every sandwich on their menu and never had a complaint. Everyone employed at this establishment is always cheerful and always ensures we know our patronage is appreciated.
************************

They have an excellent inventory of booze and more. Everyone is very friendly and helpful.  Inside is "Hangover Hoagies" sandwich shop. Veggies aren't prepared until you place your order. I've enjoyed the Rueben 3 times thus far.  Additionally, there is an outdoor dining area that was very nice for late night snacking! Everything is always kept super clean.

They stock liquors I've never seen before so if you're seeking hard to find spirits I recommend checking this liquor store out.; Love this place!!! They’ve been around since I was a kid. Stopped in yesterday and picked up all kinds of things. They welcomed me and my team in and were very patient. Thanks guys!; Marks up their allocated bourbon to ridiculous prices over fair secondary prices. It’s called a museum by the local bourbon community. So yourself a favor, go somewhere else for allocated stuff and save 30-100%.; Good beer and some Indian drinks on sale too

Name: Tops Liquors
Address: 403 W University Dr #104, Tempe, AZ 85281, USA

Reviews:
These guys always come through. Highly recommend if you’re ordering kegs. Our favorite liquor store in the area and always a pleasure to work with.; Awesome store and fast and friendly.I recommend highly.; Literally stocks more beer than the store can hold. The cases line the isles, and take up half if them. It is overflowing with beer. (Perhaps it even violates the fire code, who knows, but beer a plenty.)

Good prices, amazing selection, and plenty of sales, especially on freshly arrived cases.

Always have good supply of rare hard-to-get releases, like KBS or Bourbon County. Highly recommended to get that hard to get bottle.

And as a bonus they do help you carry it to your car, if you buy more than you can carry. Definitely good service.

If you are craft beer aficionado, then you owe it to yourselves to check this place out.

[Edit] Just added a couple pictures.; As a beer drinker this place is like a candy store. Staff was super friendly. Definitely recommend this place; This liquor store is stocked to the brim and if they dont have something you want they will accommodate you! Always super friendly! Love this place!!

Enjoy everyone; Very nice owners and great selection but they really need to get their coolers to a much lower temperature.

Every time I have come here I've found that the beer is just not that cold. If you don't mind sticking your beer in your freezer or fridge for awhile after you get home that's fine but in my case, even though I live right around the corner, I prefer to drive a bit farther so that I can get ice cold beer.; I like this place because the owners don't sell crack pipes. Reviews: Use to be a really great place. New owner though doesn't know how to display proper pricing. Everytime me or the hubs go in, the ticket price and the price rung up at the register are different. Every, single, time. Just make sure what see is what you are paying because he won't bother to change it on the price tag. The other staff there are wonderful and do their best to correct it. But I dont want to have to keep an eye on pricing because you want to nickel and dime me. Get your pricing straight or you will lose alot of business.  For the owner directly,  learn INTEGRITY. It will go a long way with people in this area.; They have a lot of liquor. Not sure how fresh everything is but alcohol holds for quite a while. The store itself is dirty but as I said they seem to have everything you might need. It might seem a bit sketch on the outside and in but the staff was very kind and helpful. Definitely don’t judge a book by its cover it’s a good liquor store with a huge selection.; So many options to choose from,  you might come for one thing but man you'll end up browsing this place like a candy store 🔥🔥🔥; The men who manage this store are great! Very helpful….   It’s a scary location at night, and they seem very aware.; Amazing people every time I go in there I’m welcomed in the store with nothing but love from the owner and his wife and thee other employees I love stopping there I have a good relationship with all the workers they are very good people and they have so much to choose from and the prices are good and they work with you on some of the items

Reviews: They never have what I want. I am a regular in the store and have requested a specific bottle of champagne for over a year now and it's still not there. So they're not catering to their customer.  Sad😔; It's okay, just another liquor store. The prices are a bit high here, though, but I guess convenience costs. I don't really go here. Don't care for it.; Horrible. The staff is old and in knowledgeable. I tried to buy alcohol here and was told a passport wasn’t a valid form of ID. As someone who is working on getting an updated drivers license, I find it hard to believe that passports are not an acceptable form of ID. Especially , when you have people from other countries that comes to purchase alcohol that don’t have State ID or drivers license what do you require them to use?; I don't shop here often, but I'll be returning more frequently.  Yes, some of the prices are a dollar or two more than their competitors, but being greeted by a smiling, welcoming face is pretty rare.  Additionally, the gentleman securing the shop (wonderful selection, btw!) thanked me for shopping with them on my way out.  At the end of the day, I'd always rather pay a bit more for quality service and variety.  New Town delivers.; This spot does have a very nice wine and bourbon selection. The prices can easily be hit or miss though. Ive seen bottles there for a steal and then others that were ridiculously overpriced. I stop in often just to see if they have something. Scotch collection is even bigger than bourbon.

Fast, easy, convenient, discreet. Some things are expensive, some are cheap.

Service with a smile, helped me find my hooch and beer without missing a beat, rang me up, and asked if there was anything special he could order for me, and if there was anything else he could do for me. It's a small place but they will listen to your preference and get what you want. If you tell them that their prices are higher than where you usually go they will try to price match. I'm sure the rent is high where they are but they will make it work. Usually open later than other places. Convenient, good well lit parking. Reviews:
Best beverage clerk in Johnson county.

I hold very elaborate events and have personally used the services of this location for years I’ll be moving to California this June. However, I wanted to personally leave a proper review.

I have gotten to know the owners and staff for a number of years now. Every order has been precise and exactly as promised every recommendation has been aligned to our needs with thoughtful consideration.

We couldn’t recommend a better place. In the north liberty area!

Johncy I personally thank you for your service and fair sales in our community.

We will miss you on our relocation and wish you only the best.

Stay classy.

Mr.Mabry and Co; Great selection of top shelf bourbon, as well as beer and wine. Prices are very competitive if not lower than Hy-Vee and other "spirits stores." Been stopping there for a year weekly. Working my way through the inventory. 😉  Super friendly and helpful staff.; Prior to this last week, I had only been to Johncy's twice before.  Johncy is renovating for a better atmosphere, and that's great.  But what really makes this place special is that the guy is a servant to his customer.  You can't find it? He'll get it for you. He's a service first guy and has awesome prices on his goods and a HUGE selection.  Now compare that to a convenience store clerk you just pulled off smoke break to come ring up your order and I promise you'll never go anywhere else! Check them out; Great little liquor store. Great selection of beer wine and whiskey. Friendly staff and reasonable prices.; Every now and then you get it wrong, and this time I made an error.  When I called Johncy's and inquired about a delivery, I had no idea additional licensing was necessary to do what I was requesting.  I thought they did not want to deal with my request.  I wish they would have told me, but they didn't and I felt slighted. I am sure Mr Johncy runs a top notch establishment and is a man of the highest integrity and intelligence.  My apologies to his store, friends  and employees for writing a bad review.

Reviews:
Great whiskey museum with a great selection of bourbon for viewing. Sadly, it's priced above even the secondary market prices if you actually were hoping to buy anything from the store. Most standard bottles on the shelf were higher priced as well. There are other stores in the nearby area that charge near msrp for their liquor and those places won't gouge you on the allocated bottles when they come around.; Friendly staff but bourbon was way overpriced (even compared to the secondary market); Shady bag charge practice. I brought my own bag, and declined a bag from the store. I asked for a receipt and was shocked to see I was still charged for a bag. When I asked for a refund the cashier was rude and unapologetic. Have been a customer for years and will be cautious to return.; Great store. Great service. Kerry A and Abbey are the best. They helped design the wild duck Patriots sweatshirts and the storefronts. Ezio is also great. He is so helpful when customers have questions. It is an interesting store with more than just alcohol. Tourists love the tee shirts. Make sure to pick yours up today!; First time in Boston. Alex behind the counter should have been making commission on the restaurant fare, as well as helping us tourists with the touristy stuff!

We found a nice wine selection, and for me a good bourbon menu with lots of options at several price points.

Caters to the drunks that trash our area. Everyday I walk around the parking lot and nearby areas and find at least 15-20 of their alcohol bottles everywhere. They need to equip the areas with garbage cans considering the amount of foot traffic they receive. They are ruining the area and the neighbors are tired of them and want them to leave the area and relocate!!!; Please rotate your coolers! I got 3 large truly cans the other day and 2 were expiring in October and the other 1 expired in April? That makes me wonder how often expired beer is sold here. Now I'm wondering about the wine too.; This store is a terrible place to work. A couple of my Co-workers have been great, but the manager, Angie is absolutely horrible. She is very rude and cranky. She drives good employees away. And she refuses to have an open mind to new and better ideas. She shouldn't be a manager anywhere.; All their employees are friendly and personable. Great customer service; unlike Payless Liquors on Albany. They have the rudest costumer service reps that I have ever come across in my entire life (50 yrs). It's unbelievable how rude they are. Actually, in all honesty it is only one who is the problem. I think she is a manager. She trains the new employees to be rude like her. When they hire a "nuwby" they are always friendly, helpful, curious, etc... Greet you with a smile and hello. However, after working and training under this rude and hateful person for a couple weeks, they also forget their customer service skills...they become a chip off the old block
If I sound disgusted it is because I have good reason to be disgusted. I was totally humiliated and slandered in front of other customers, by this certain "so called manager". I could have and should have sued the establishment for what this chick screamed at me and said about me. I am sure that the company has lost many good paying customers due to this chick. I had been a daily regular for years. Although, I never liked going in there because of her. Yet, it was close to home and convenient.
Anyway, that's all I'll say about that for now.
Swing on over to Crown liquors, corner of Sherman and Raymond. I have never been given a reason to complain there. Even though my brand is a couple rollers more than the other. I guess it's a small price to pay for good and friendly service.😁😋; Friendly staff and very convenient. Only minutes away from my house. But I have decided to take my business elsewhere after tonight and can probably speak for the other customers that were planning to buy product from this same store tonight. We were told they have to close early because all systems were down. They didn't offer to take cash which I had. And I have to say not the first time I've dealt with this. Prices are very good on most items.; I simply adore Wyman Liquors, I always walked to their store to buy beer and to recycle the cans; even after moving out of Leominster, MA when we are in the area, as was today, I make a point to stop in. I like that they have a sale table in the back to purchase some much-needed wine when you want to restock. Hello to all at Wyman Liquors, perhaps at times you are not nice to this person but I like you all the same. Not my family either since the world dictates as if family depends on who is paying,  when not in fact.; Picked up a couple of rare finds. Great selections. This place almost anything you would ever need, lots and lots of craft beer packs from all kinds of breweries, with very good prices, and topped off with always friendly staff happy to help.

Definitely deserves all the local love.

Name: Grapes & Hops-Craft Beer & Wine II
Address: 1550 NC-24, Cameron, NC 28326, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 1:00 – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 1550 (street_number); North Carolina 24 (route); Cameron (locality); Harnett County (administrative_area_level_2); North Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 28326 (postal_code)
Reviews:
If you enjoy a quality craft beer and excellent wine experience, look no more then Grapes and Hops II!

I’m an out of town visitor, spending some time with my service man son (go Army!) and we wanted some great beer for the next few days. Enter Grapes and Hops! First off, the business is set up to serve you a beer or wine to enjoy, while you shop - a very refined experience! The store is easy to shop, the beers and wines organized by style.

Next, what a selection! You would have to be mighty hard to please to not find something you like. I was in the shop to buy beer but was impressed with both the beer and wine selection. Don’t look for big brewery products or common place wines here, this shop is definitely top shelf. Be sure to look at their port and champagne offerings!

Another feature of this store is the staff. Ask for Marcy! She was very helpful. Served our beer and answered a lot of questions. She was very knowledgeable about the stores stock and promised to research the possibility of obtaining beers not currently in stock.

My son and I spend a delightful 45 minutes enjoying a quality pint and picking over a great selection of beer. We went into the store for a six pack, but ended up with two six packs! A great way to spend some of our afternoon! The store has a variety of specials, one for everyday of the week!

Cheers!; Even though I don't come here often, the staff always makes me feel so very welcome and appreciated. I typically am by myself when I come in and I never feel out of place. Marcy is a rockstar! Gracious, kind and so cognizant of the people she helps.; Nice place. Huge selection of craft beer. I didn’t even look at the wine. They also have 10 taps for draft pours. It’s bigger than the location on Ramsey with some different beer choices, both on tap and in the fridges. I drank a draft sour from Clouds Brewing and took home a four pack of different Edmund’s Oast. The lady working was friendly and attentive. Cozy spot to sit and drink a couple of good beers.; Great place! Beer selection is on point and the ambiance is cool and relaxing. Reviews: Groton market is the best local wine, spirits and beer shop in the area. We love shopping here! They’ve got a terrific selection and everyone who works here is so friendly and helpful. I’ve come in several times to buy ingredients for a new cocktail recipe and I’ve gotten great help on what to purchase. My dad loves shopping here too and always gets lots of great local craft beers!; Great selection of beer and wine, and super friendly staff as well.; Great stout beer selection.; One star, only because you have to put one to review,  I am so appalled by the way one of the staff members acted tonight. I was on a video call with one of my children and was talking about tent rods to fix the tent I set up in my backyard so we can all camp out. The "woman" working there said to me " that's inappropriate,  talking about bras" . I was talking about tent rods. She decided to get in my face and threaten me, not even having correct knowledge of the conversation I was having with my child. I will NEVER go back into that store with her working there. The owner at one point told the employee to walk away. She was in the wrong and completely disrespected a potentially paying customer that not only took money away from the liquor store,  but money away from Filhos, where dinner was going to be had afterwards.  Shame on her for her sickening behavior. What a disgrace to a local business that employs horrific people with such audacity to chime in on a conversation with a mother and her child that did not, in any way, have anything to do with inappropriate talk.; I love the store itself, it has a great selection to choose from. However, every time I have gone in, I feel very uncomfortable. There is a short-haired older lady that is always rude and cold. She stares at you when you pull up to the store, and is cold when you check out. I get the vibe from her that she is annoyed that you are there, and I feel unwelcome there. Back when I still had my vertical license and was newly 21 and just picking up a single bottle of wine, she was extremely rude about it. She took forever to look at my license and would claim that it was "the wrong way." I explained that it doesn't expire for another year, and she went on to say that because she was "nice," she would accept it, but it "would never be excepted in Boston or at bars." I can confirm that that is not true. I've never had any problems with anyone or anywhere because of the vertical license, just from her. Needless to say, she is the only reason I almost never go to that store, which is such a shame.

Name: The Bottle Shop
Address: 1148 Central Ave Suite B, Wilmette, IL 60091, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 3:00 – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 1:00 – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 1:00 – 5:00 PM; Friday: 1:00 – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 1:00 – 5:00 PM; Sunday: 3:00 – 5:00 PM
Address Components: Suite B (subpremise); 1148 (street_number); Central Avenue (route); Wilmette (locality); New Trier Township (administrative_area_level_3); Cook County (administrative_area_level_2); Illinois (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 60091 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This is a weird, musty place that smells like your grandma's attic and it looks like a mess with
boxes everywhere. Nothing is organized properly or logically, it's dark and not contemporary or very clean. Their inventory is also pretty low and generally overpriced. The service is quirky at best. And their hours are absurd and eratic- 25 hours a week total?!  I don't really understand the great reviews, honestly. It's too bad this is Wilmette's only wine shop. We can and should do much better.; There's no greater place to get your thirst quenched and get your mental health check up than at the Bottle Shop.
There is really no greater lady than Amy Lafontant, sole proprietor - aka fortune teller, ski bunny and Mensch.
Whether You are a connoisseur, or you know enough about wine to be dangerous, there's something for everyone at the Bottle Shop.
Go early and often.; I am new to the area. I stumbled upon this place during my few hours off duty on Mother’s Day. I was interested in a glass of wine. The door was unlocked, there were great reviews, I thought I hit the jackpot. I was asked what I would like. I responded a glass of wine. I was then told that the Bottle Shop was having a private tasting. If the store was not open to the public, why ask me what I wanted? I left because it was not my intention to interrupt their private tasting, but there no sign or other communication indicating that I should “move along.” This was an extremely baffling experience at a place that is so highly regarded. I’m left wondering if this is the weird gatekeeping/racism I should come to expect on the North Shore. Zero stars if I had the option.; Great selection of wine although I went there for the beer found some excellent sours!! Nice atmosphere!!!  along with customer appreciation.; Could not be more impressed with the Bottle Shop, specifically owner Amy. My colleague lives in Wilmette, and I stumbled on Amy's shop online when I was looking for some place that was able to send him birthday beers. Not only is she super friendly and helpful, but she was incredibly knowledgeable about beer. Amy is a rockstar, her beer selection is awesome and I hope to one day be able to enjoy one in her shop!

I have closer stores that I could buy cigarettes, but T & S Liquors has my brand cheaper than anyone around.  They do have some weird hours of operation, I've walked there a couple of times, and they had closed at 8.  It is a place would visit if you have need of liquor, cigarettes or lottery.; I don't often need to purchase wine, but  when I am hosting a holiday event, this is the best place in Leominster for service. The space is small, which means the wine sommelier is selective in what they stock. You can walk in, give a few details (...I need 4 bottles for a dinner party...as an example), and they will provide selected suggestions. I'm in and out in 5 minutes and later guests comment on the choices.; Great family business. If you are regular, you will get to know the cashiers there, which are all amazing in there own way. Great place to grab a beer on your way home from work, or load up for a party. They'll help you whatever your needs.; I don't drink much but I like the willies superbrew cinnamon pear they didn't have anymore so the owner ordered it for me and when we went in the following week the owner had it put aside for us and remembered us. He is such a great guy, and for that, that's why we go to T&S and always will.; I go in t&s liquor everyday spend a minimum of $30 on $30 tickets this morning I was working on a book I kindly didn't rush back inside and let the older gentlemen in before  me he had alot of tickets to buy he told the the clerk take him first the clerk declined to let me after I been working on that sane book 4 losers what my chances of winning something was 99 percent he sold a ticket I know the ticket number due to the losers prior that should have been sold to me do you think anything would fly in a casino there must be alot of honor and self-respect in cheating a person out not to be rich but a a simple down payment  enough for a home to live instead of conditions he's been living on for his life no matter how hard I try work at accomplishmening a place to call home .of my own people will say things about me but have no clue the things I've done whether the correct way maybe not but sometimes seconds or minutes you have a choice to do the write thing to save someone from whatever that may be and the cowards wanna keep using the sane stories and lies probably the same reasons my Civil rights are always violated to show the truth the evidence..One wrong bad choice in life when I was young that will always and is always used against me for the rest of my life .Maybe I went a little outside the the original subject of the ticket but grimmy is what it is lottery is illegal to play while working same with drinking. They sell a huge variety of wines, some mixers, and a few other items like chocolates. A must if you like wine and supporting small business.; I LOVE THIS PLACE!! The owner is very nice and personable to all his customers. Every time I visit Boston I stop here. I get the chance to experience and learn something new every time. The employees are very helpful and knowledgeable. You don’t feel rushed at all like some places make you feel. The store is stocked with a huge selection and the quality of the products are amazing. They even ship to ya! People in Maryland love you guys! Keep up the good work and I’ll visit again soon.; My last time coming to the store was today.  I always try to buy local to keep money within the North End community, but I do not feel appreciated as a customer.  Time after time I try to start conversations, being friendly, talking about wines, liquors, and on occasion, ordering wine.  I have a 150+ bottle cellar and am always on the hunt for a new wine or spirits.  However, I always feel as if I am disturbing the owner Jeff who 9 times out of 10 bites your head off.  Today was no different; I simply asked about getting Sam Adams Utopia which comes with a price tag of no less than $240.00 a bottle.  Instead of welcoming business Jeff remains angry and rude creating an unfriendly environment.

I will now spread around my business and give all my business to the competition or direct order from wineries.  For those reading this go to Golden Goose, Hanover Wine and Spirits, Wild Duck, or if you want some fantastic specialty wines go to The Wine Bottega.  To add one more wine location that is also fantastic take a walk over to Beacon Hill and try Beacon Hill Wine & Spirits Co.

Sorry Jeff, I will never step foot inside your business again.

If you are looking for an understated place to find fantastic organic wine without the pretentiousness and the high prices, this is your place. The wife and I sampled and took home several bottles. Amazing experience.; A cute wine shop with a variety of unique wines. Check out their basement as well when you are there.; Great wine store that specializes in bio dynamic wines. Super helpful staff help you navigate their selection of a lot of small producers. Good selection under 20 and some great finds you're not going to run across elsewhere in the 20-35 range.; Awesome selection of Natural Wines with a very knowledgeable staff; Everything about this place is amazing!

They specialize in natural wines and have a very impressive selection.

The staff is incredibly knowledgeable - able to answer any questions we had and to explain the origin of every bottle, including not just what it is and how it will taste but also details about who made it and where it was from.

We walked out with a case of delicious wine and an excellent education. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews: Great selection of wine for very reasonable prices. They are also great people. Every single staff member I’ve encountered was friendly, pleasant, and helpful. The wine tastings are a bang for your buck and I always purchase a bottle afterwards although there is no pressure to do so. Even the guests who visit during wine tastings are friendly and pleasant. It’s really a great vibe. I also bring my family members here to purchase wine when they visit me and they also give it 5 stars!; I always have a nice time here when I come for a wine tasting. Friendly staff and a cozy place to meet up with friends; My card didn’t go through for “wine club”. Yes, that was on me, however considering how much money I have spent here in total I do not expect to be called out on it in front of 2 total strangers. This is beyond unethical and shows no class whatsoever.  I will never patronize this establishment again.  There is a way to do things and this is not the way. Maybe I should go back to bank statements to show just how much money I dropped here or maybe he should!; Great ambiance and customer service. I stopped in to pick up a Christmas gift with no knowledge of wine. Staff took the time to explain to me the many types and tastes of the wide variety they offer. Nice experience for me visiting The Vino Shoppe.; I finally had the opportunity to visit the Vino Shoppe!  The comfortable and casual setting made for a fun experience for all within my party.  They have areas for groups between 2 and 8 people.  The employees were wonderfully informative and pleasant.  Weekly/affordable tasting options allow you to find "Your" perfect bottle.  They host a monthly book club for the public to join.  I and my party had a great time and plan to return soon!

Name: Winston-Salem Wine Market
Address: 1231 Creekshire Way, Winston-Salem, NC 27103, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 1231 (street_number); Creekshire Way (route); Winston-Salem (locality); Forsyth County (administrative_area_level_2); North Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 27103 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Whether you're a wine connoisseur or just looking to explore and expand your palate, this boutique wine shop has something for everyone. The owners' passion for wine is evident in the carefully curated selection of wines from around the world. From bold reds to crisp whites, sparkling champagnes to sweet dessert wines, there is something to suit every taste and occasion.

In addition to their impressive wine selection, the shop offers a range of services to enhance your wine experience. The Wine Tour Bus takes you on a journey through local vineyards and wineries, providing a behind-the-scenes look at the winemaking process. Memberships offer exclusive access to limited edition wines and special events, while fresh food pairings and wine tastings allow you to sample and savor new flavors.

One of the standout features of this boutique wine shop is the self-service tap for wine by the ounce. This innovative system allows you to sample a variety of wines without committing to a full bottle, making it easy to explore and discover new favorites. Whether you're looking for a special bottle to celebrate a milestone or simply want to unwind with a glass of wine after a long day, this shop has everything you need for a top-notch wine experience. Treat yourself and indulge in the world of wine at this fantastic boutique wine shop.; One of a kind! Excellent wine selection & fair prices. This is my favorite wine shop around. I recently planned a COVID safe wine tasting for my Mom’s 60th and Beth was HUGELY helpful! Not only did she pick wines that we all LOVED, she also went out of her way to pair them with a four course meal and found a great bakery to make a dessert that would compliment the wine as well. They also included tasting notes! I’m incredibly impressed by her expertise & grateful for the invaluable help.; Learned a lot about local wines, they are very knowledgeable; Went to a wine tasting and loved it. Very knowledgeable staff with a friendly environment.; My favorite wine shop in Winston Salem! I joined their monthly wine club when I first moved into town last year, and have loved every bit of it. The staff members are always very helpful (and non-judgmental for people like me who don’t know much about wine!!) and I love their weekly tastings. The atmosphere is also nice if you just want to drop by and try a glass of something out of their wine stations. Would definitely recommend!

Name: Kroger Pharmacy
Address: 305 E Lewis and Clark Pkwy, Clarksville, IN 47129, USA
Vicinity: 305 East Lewis and Clark Parkway, Clarksville
Address Components: 305 (street_number); East Lewis and Clark Parkway (route); Clarksville (locality); Jeffersonville Township (administrative_area_level_3); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Indiana (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 47129 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Currently in the drive through line for 30 minutes. There were two cars in front of me. I have pressed the service button multiple times and they are not paying any attention. I didn’t jump into a closed lane. It’s been 30 minutes so I’m not about to leave without my prescriptions. Going inside isn’t usually any faster but I’m watching them check people out and keep their backs to me. Come on you guys!!!; Never ever answer their phone. I needed medication interaction advice and could not get it. Eventually went to voice mail but never got call back. Not people friendly.  The automated line doesn't recognize what you need and just replays the same choices over and over. Going to find another pharmacy.; *Warning* Avoid at all costs. It is criminal what they are doing. This is Medicare and Medicaid fraud down to a science. Please, federal investigators start a case on these places. My insurance covers about 98% of prescription costs at my previous pharmacy Westmoreland (that Kroger bought out for their customers database), but at Kroger's my insurance is covering less than 2.5%. Pharmacy techs say that Kroger club prices get it lower than my insurance, but even that is over 4 times more than I paid last month.

I wish that I could give these folks zero stars. I believe they are committing Medicare/Medicaid fraud. Kroger's bought out my pharmacy, Westmoreland. Prescriptions that I paid $1.20 for, with my insurance, now costs almost $20. My entire monthly prescription costs were less than $20. Through Kroger's it is over $150. I'm disabled and this is the difference between having food and having medicine.

This also doesn't account for the horrendous service. If you phone, they won't answer. You have to make at least 5 calls to even get your call answered. Orders that should be filled the same day, takes them at least 3 days to fulfill. This is a business that the community needs to come together and refuse to do business with. If you're an investor in this enterprise, you should be ashamed.; Avoid this pharmacy at all costs.
You’ll stand in line for an hour or more, just to get them to refill a prescription; and then come back later to stand in line for another hour + to pick it up.  Since they never answer the phone.
I literally almost threw my back out standing, while ONE Tech did whatever they do back there.
The line went all the way to the cash registers.
I honestly don’t understand why each and every customer has to talk to them for ten minutes, just for them to grab the medicine and go.
Half the time, the tech wasn’t even at the cash register.
WTH you doing back there???? Move the line along !!!!
This is a big problem.  Serious problem.; Just got a prescription filled and had a wonderful experience with the pharmacist Rachel and the techs. Yes, there was a 15-minute wait, but chairs were available. The tech rushed mine and another lady's script so we could get them before the staff went to lunch.

Recently there have been problems at this Kroger pharmacy, resulting in turnover most folks aren't aware of. A few weeks ago, ALL the pharmacy staff quit, according to two store cashiers. They said things would eventually get worked out but it'll take a little time. I'll give them that time, because this has been MY pharmacy for over 15 years. The staff have always treated me well, even when there were five people waiting in line.

Kroger management may want to consider raising wages. A sign near the aisle states $14/hour starting for non-certified pharmacy tech, while employees at the ice cream place in front of Kroger start at $16/hour - and they don't have to deal with irritated customers nor consult insurance companies.

Reviews:
Always busy! Nice and newer interior design. Parking lot always busy. Always other customers within reach. A Variety of specialty items with extra counters. Check out registers not too bad of a wait.
update: busy Sunday, three cashiers, store floor needs swept, parking lot littered, no carts at entrance…plenty of self check out available, no one wants to work, store lacking.; This was the most ridiculous shopping trip I have had in a very long time! The app is horrible and finding the coupons that are advertised is almost impossible! Even searching the name doesn’t bring up the coupon.. and then trying to check out and the coupons aren’t being applied at the checkout! Then it took multiple tries to get the order correct and then I had to wait forever for a manager to approve the order!! She was snarky and didn’t know what she was doing either.. she couldn’t figure out why it wasn’t going through and then when I tried to check out again I told her I needed cash back.. she said oh well it should ask you.. but it DIDNT give me the option.. and she just smirked and said well guess it didn’t.. shrugged her shoulders, rolled her eyes and turned away and walked off!!  This should have been a 5 minute stop to grab a handful of items and it ended up taking an hour!!!! There is absolutely NO customer service in this place!! The gentleman who tried to help me was very kind but the management is a JOKE!!!
I have a loyalty card and still avoid shipping here because the discounts aren’t worth dealing with the horrible environment; This store is always clean, employees always working. The rotissere chicken was fresh, I made chicken and dumplings with it. This is the only store of Charlestown rd and here that has the cream cheese cinnamon rolls. Today I noticed they were a lot smaller and less icing than usual. Please don't skimp on the cinnamon rolls for the love of all that is good in this world bc those are really good lol; Primo water exchange listed for this location on app as original price of 7.99 still. This placard up the night before Hurricane Helene winds expected to roll through area. I’ll be interested to see if this price holds a week from now. Won’t be buying Primo from this location; Went to the deli for lunch today. As I walked to the deli, there were two other customers doth looking around like they were lost.
One left and walked out the front door. The other stood there another minute or two, then he walked away as well.
I stood there and then walked to another section of the deli where I could hear people talking, but they did not greet me or acknowledge that they had seen me.
I walked back to the other end and then left without ever being seen or greeted.
Maybe this was just an off day, or maybe this is normal, but I won't waste any more time trying to get served at this kroger.

Address Components: 2565 (street_number); East Commerce Center Place (route); Airport Commerce Center (neighborhood); Tucson (locality); Pima County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85706 (postal_code); 4535 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Valid walmart! Super cute and well stocked and everything was clean! Even the bathroom. The parking lot was really small though and super crowded a little bit dangerous. They should maybe get a bigger lot. The staff also was not very helpful and they didn't wanna be there I don't blame them but defintely need customer service training; I live really close by. Am an actual employee from Walmart but another location. I did some shopping with my mother who's getting Alzheimer's and she wanted to scan so I let her. But almost close to finishing and this older lady who checks our receipts for missing change that the machine didn't give us back. Because of our Dr pepper we didn't scan that was gunna be handed to the lady's in the corner by the ice machine but instead this lady got me took it up on herself to decided to checking our bags making us feel like we were stealing to come to find out we paid for everything except the Dr pepper which we handed back as she checked our receipt. I snatched our receipt well she snatched it back I re snatch it. I don't plan on coming back I personally don't wanna be employed by Walmart now because this is not the first incident I had with WALMART!. Since I've been shopping there. I've seen this lady be rude and always gets complains but yet makes it to manager or supervisor. i get she sees theft happen a lot but to make us feel like we didn't was sad, made me mad. To be asked one thing, TO GIVE US OUR CHANGE $. YET SHE HAD TO EMBARRASS US BY CHECKING OUR BAGS FOR EVERYTHING WE PAID FOR EXPECT THE DR PEPPER WHICH WE WANTED TO HAND TO THE LADY CAUSE WE CANT PICK IT UP DUE TO ME HAVING SURGERIES AND MY MOM BEING VARY OLD NOT BEING ABLE TO LIFT PROPERLy. Yes I have a picture of her. Walmart won't let me upload it to reviews; Beware when shopping here. We have multiple times ended up with food that had been expired, and not by a few days but a month or more. This time my fiance had gotten a bag of little donuts, we have never had issues before but he ended up reaching in to find them molded, why? Because they expired in June! How do you let something THAT EXPIRED still be on the shelf?! He had ended up eating one prior too so were hoping he doesn't get sick. I had gotten yogurts there before too that ended up being a month expired. We shouldn't have to be checking everything we buy to make sure they aren't crazy expired ffs. Will be glad after this month we wont be shopping here ever again because this is beyond not ok.; Worst Walmart in Tucson. Below you'll find pictures of the "Loss Prevention Specialist " which is extremely rude and is now harassing me if I decide to go into Walmart.  All because on July 15, 2023, while I was shopping another customer in the store stopped me to ask for help in the pet aisle and afterwards she apparently stole something. After I tried to help that lady I continued shopping. I had no idea anything was going on until I noticed a lady following me around the store. I was uncomfortable and I took a few pictures of her and then she started making remarks directed at me and when I asked her what she said,  all she would say was "you heard me". I informed her I did not hear her, but she refused to repeat her remarks.
Now, I was upset so with my pictures I asked a Walmart employee who she was and if she was an employee. I was informed she was a Walmart employee and worked in loss prevention. I then asked to speak with the store manager but was advised the actual store manager is not there but they have a manager on duty. When I asked the manager on duty why this lady was following me around and making rude remarks to me, the manager said my friend stole something.
I was confused because I was alone and I informed the manager I was shopping alone, at which point she basically called me a liar because the "Loss Prevention Specialist " told her otherwise.  I asked the manager if they were referring to the lady that asked me a question in the pet aisle and I explained there was a lady that asked me a question about dog shampoo when I was in the pet aisle but I don't know her, she is a stranger.
Needless to say, I was less than happy with how I was being treated by the manager on duty and the fact that this loss prevention lady (Walmart employee) had the audacity to make remarks to me which were obviously rude and/or unprofessional because she didn't have the nerve to repeat them.
I looked down at my full cart and said to myself, No, absolutely not, this is not okay. At this point I wanted to just walk out and leave the full cart there and drive down the road to Fry's to get my groceries BUT it was already 10pm and I had a long day at work and I was tired and still needed to make dinner.
So right there at the self check-out I decided to set aside everything in my cart except what I absolutely had to have for dinner that evening.
I advised the manager standing there, that they can now return all of these items because I refuse to give Walmart my business after how they have treated me.
BECAUSE the only thing I have done today is be nice and try answer a question when a stranger asked me for help.
I got busy and did not contact the store manager.
I have not returned to this Walmart location
UNTIL TODAY.
When despite my better judgment, I decided to stop off to return 2 things at this location, only because it was the closest most convenient location.
I purchased the items from a different Walmart location.
After walking in and standing in the customer service line I was immediately harassed treated like a criminal, complements of the same person!!
So today I took some more pictures to show corporate the employees harassing me.
The "blonde" in the pictures is the so called "Loss Prevention Specialist "
and the current manager on duty, which were both EXTREMELY RUDE, to me today for no apparent reason, other than to harass me and to be vindictive.
I will be contacting corporate because today I was harassed for returning 2 items.
Based on my 2 "wonderful" experiences with this "employee" the so called "Loss Prevention Specialist " she is not very good at her job because she apparently watches other people/customers(the stranger I helped) steal things and then spends her time harassing/ alienating actual customers while acting extremely unprofessional.; Arrived on my bike at 905 to return a 50 lb bag of dog food and was told I'd have to come back tomorrow. Then, to add insult to injury I was made to wait an extra 10 mins so they could check the cameras to make sure I didn't steal it. Definitely avoid this marketplace if you actually need help cuz you won't find it here.

Edit:
So, I returned today like the lady told me to. However, customer service, an oxymoron if there ever was one, closes at 6 on Sunday. She said she told me last night. However, I swear I wouldn't have waited until 7 to ride the 2 miles with an extra 50 lbs on two badly infected legs had she bothered to mention it. But on the plus side, I wasn't accused of stealing anything this time. 1.2 stars

Reviews: Store pickup staff were amazing tonight! I messed up where I was placing my order to pick up and didn't realize the mistake until I was waiting for my pick up. Called this store and the guy on the phone was attentive, patient, and really went above and beyond in helping me with the situation. The other workers were also friendly and quick in getting my order out! These guys deserve a raise for the hard work they put in.; Pharmacy shout out. Thomas and I think her name was Kim were awesome. Fast. Nice to my kids. Helpful guiding us through our needs and complications getting a certain vaccine. So nice to have people give helpful advice and are committed to service. THANK YOU.; The store was not too crowded. My first stop was the pharmacy, which has an outstanding staff including Thomas, Issac and Cathy.  The service was quick and friendly.  Then i continued on to do some shopping for mom and everything was great in the store and at the  self-check checkout.; This Walmart is the only Walmart I have gone into, in a few years where I can go in there and find everything I was looking for and at decent prices. I also have to say there’s at least five associates on the floor helping people which is one of my pet peeves when an associate is around and they don’t   help a customer when they are in need. Like going out of their way to show them where somethings at. I saw this at least twice during my visit. Then I was looking for some thing and I told the guy to just tell me what isle it was on, he could tell me exactly what aisle and I went there and the item was exactly where he said. It smell clean in there like. I said every single thing I was looking for was right there.; This Walmart usually always has what I need. It is usually always clean apart from all the homeless outside. The only problem is check out can be faster.

Name: Walgreens
Address: 1415 W River Rd, Tucson, AZ 85704, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 1415 (street_number); West River Road (route); Tucson (locality); Pima County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85704 (postal_code); 5829 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: This location has lost/delayed my Fedex shipment which was only a minor delay. The pharmacy is where this location really falls short. Overall, the hours are becoming more restrictive but yesterday sealed my option and is causing me to switch locations. I waited behind a vehicle and when it was my turn the bald male pharmacist told me that he was 1min past his time for a break and refused to quickly ring my meds. He said to come back in 30min.This caused me to be unable to get my much needed medication. This is his job and one more min of inconvenience is not too much to ask. Instead he showed why Walgreens is having to close stores across the US. His attitude is one of a true underachiever and the problem with today's workforce as a whole. It's a job...; I’m absolutely furious with this pharmacy.(This is only a pharmacy review).I’m furious and disappointed because this is our main Walgreens we go to, but when you F up this bad, you get a bad review. My mother tried so hard to help my aunt who’s battling cancer get her medicine she desperately needed. After she had to call in because she didn’t hear any update from the order put in at 1pm, This pharm tech said that it would be ready 30 minutes before they close. So, she went in early because she doesn’t trust their word because they’re cutting it close and never gave an update. She checks in with them and they end up not having the medicine after saying it was being filled.They send her to the location on Silverbell after she asked where they have the medicine because she needed it tonight. She drives all the way over there and they end up not having it either. So, River location lied about them having it or what?! So Silverbell sends her to Fort Lowell and Campbell location who, guess what?! DOESN’T have it either and it ends up being too late to get the medicine. They have to go the next day to pick up the order. Walgreens you really screwed up! All you had to do was your job. Say you didn’t have the damn medicine. My mom had a full tank of gas and now has half of a tank of gas and my aunt still suffering. Complete s%#t show, Walgreens.They’re both exhausted.So, I have to stand up for them. This is the best way. You paying attention now, Walgreens?!; For the cashier Jaquie when a customer is polite, you should be polite back. A please and thank you goes along way. Terrible customer service skills; They have most everything you might need, friendly and professional staff I usually pop in at least once a month! Shampoo, toothpaste and deodorant and refreshments are some of the items I purchased at Walgreens! It's not to far from my apartment so the convenience is great, they have rewards and specials that I take advantage of as well!; It's ridiculous and absolutely annoying having to hear "we are always hiring" It shows dishonesty and disregard to people who actually want to work and could be applying to other places that actually need help. Either you are hiring at the moment or not stop trying to waste people's time.  I had an employee tell me that they are constantly having employees come and go. That only gives the impression that they have poor management and poor customer service, and the bad reviews to this place only proves my point.

Reviews:
This man don’t deserve a star but it’s the only way to post how you feel. So today 06/17 at 1pm to Walgreens on Golf links and Harrison there is an older men that works at the registrar was very rude and very unprofessional. I purchased 2 bags on chips that were on sale for $1.99 my disabled mother was with me as well. So I paid for my chips for my household and he refused to sell the chips to my mother for her household because I was with her and I had just purchased chips. Mind you my mother has a different residence than I do. I’m very disappointed and will not be going back to this location again. The register old men told me come at a different time when I’m not on but I refuse to sell her the chips because you just purchased chips.; Great service. Extremely professional. I am having my prescriptions moved from the store just a few miles down. The difference is night and day for how these stores operate! So happy to have found a pharmacy near me that I don't dread going to.; Update: 29 Nov 23. Not sure who answers the phone but they need some training in customer service. Extremely rude. I'll be taking my prescriptions elsewhere.

I went there today to pick up my prescription and was mind-blown that the pharmacy was closed. The pharmacy is not open on the weekend. To think that a drugstore closes its pharmacy on the weekend while Fry's (a grocery store) has theirs open. It's time for me to switch pharmacies.; Some of the employees are great. Others in the pharmacy are not. Once upon a time the staff was perfect and then they switched all the staff in the pharmacy except 2. The Male is amazing the women as I see below has already been mentioned as somewhat of a trouble maker. She was rude to me and I put my foot down. I will not be dehumanized because of medicine I am prescribed.  I'm sure they get all walks of life going into this place but as I told her she doesn't get to judge. She seems to make the process more difficult. The women at the front of the story. Older ladies and the photo woman is amazing. It's one specific person making this place unbearable!; It’s your typical Walgreens, over worked and under paid personnel doing their best. Sadly this day in age their best isn’t enough for the customers who only think about them selves and their wants. Over all it’s a great Walgreens. My experience with the pharmacy staff exceeds expectations no drive through though.
