Name: Best Liquor
Address: 3320 S Priest Dr Suite #2, Tempe, AZ 85282, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: Suite #2 (subpremise); 3320 (street_number); South Priest Drive (route); South Tempe (neighborhood); Tempe (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85282 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Excellent customer service excellent beer selection. For it's kind of small size this is the largest selection of single beers and six pack beers I have seen in a while. Prices are fair and customer service is great.; Highly recommend! Really friendly & helpful staff who gets the majority of the best new craft beer releases. They have a great tap list with over 20 taps, wine, mead, cigars, groceries, and even select fresh produce. Make sure to check this place out. You won't regret it!; I have been shopping here since they opened. They are in the former well established Beads Galore location.
They seem to be good hard working guys who go out of their way for customer service. Great selection of beer and wine and a surprising number of taps for your growler refills.
Prices are equal to or less than the QT down the street and they'll take requests for your favorite brand.
They have delivery available with better coverage than most Tempe pizza joints.
They do need better street signage as it's easy to drive by them if you're not looking.
Definitely worth a stop if you're anywhere near Priest  and Southern.; They have an excellent (almost overwhelming) selection of different beers, with a decent selection of wine. I picked up a couple of varied cans and a growler of a blood orange witbier which was inexpensive and delicious. I'll definitely be back to try more of their tap selection and get more growler fills. The owner told me they're working on getting a license to be able to give out samples of their on-tap beers, which will make it even more attractive for me as a growler refill station!; While visiting Tempe, I ordered wine online via Drizly and ended up purchasing from this store 2x. The delivery person was very pleasant and the 2nd time, I learned he's the owner of My Beer Wine #1.

A lovely person, and the store has great service and fast delivery. I understand that it's a new store and has a broad range of craft beer from what I see. Also has reasonable prices and delivery cost from my wine purchasing experience. I highly recommend and hope the great selection, service and pricing enable this store to continue to succeed. Wishing you all the best!

Reviews: I come here a couple of times a month and the guys here are always kind and courteous. Never had issues. Sometimes it's just the customer's attitude that makes their own visit unpleasant.; I been here alot from when a woman worked to when its been only men lately. She was nice but lately the guys here even tho they see me time and time. They want to sell you discount items (alcohol) for my instance and I tell them No. Each and every time I say No. Yea I get it same price but how many times do you have to say no. Rolling Rock I don't drink but for a 6 pack 10 + dollars that's steep. It's an okay spot other than that.  They do like to hide and make you feel like no one is there but they watching feels uncomfortable when you come in spending money; Ravi was super helpful and kind!! Love the good prices and cool shot glasses!; Wow I don't know if I have enough room in this Box to talk about how amazing this liquor store is 1st of all the employees that I've met there so friendly they always have everything that you need and they go out of their way to make you smile and today I witnessed them turn away business because somebody was inabriated not because they were worried about getting in trouble but because they genuinely care about people.. I have been a few dollars short and they have not made me feel bad! All I feel is absolute Happiness when I go into that store and they have so much that they need and more with amazing prices amazing customer service and an untouchable is untouchable selection Of all the drinks that you need for any occasion!! My name is Marcus and I approved this store prove this store! And if you need to know who I am I'm the black guy with the big bullring in his nose; Good selection of liquor, not a great selection of beer. They have deals where you actually do get a steal on small bottles, often found by the register. I can't give them a great rating though because the prices here are crazy. Never in my life have I seen a Natural Light 30 rack cost above $30, its below $20 at Fry's!

It means a lot when a business shows genuine honesty. I'll recommend these guys all day long. Thanks guys.

Reviews:
This place is ghetto. I thought my Walmart was bad. I didn't get a lot of pictures because of several bad interactions with different customers. The lady that helped me out in electronics was very nice and helped me with what I needed . There was a lady there that cut in front of us and started playing the race card, acting like she was there asking for help first , when that was not the case. These employees are overworked and underpaid like most of these big corporations that just suck the life completely out of you.i did get my phone mount that I needed and picked up our other stuff but forgot it as there was another lady starting problems at the self check out and we ended up forgetting our items. We left and ended up calling back and got help to no avail. I would recommend finding another Walmart because this one is the worst one I have been to in the valley.; Don't come to this location if your female. I don't even want to give this place a half star but its the only way to leave a review.  Made an appointment for oil change for 8am. Checked in at 740a. The lead took my keys said i had priority because i made appointment. It's now 916a a tall bald man just took my car in. Mind you i been sitting here watching them take 5 cars into the bay.; Stood around waiting for someone to come and open a glass cabinet just to get some electrical tape.

When an employee finally walked in my direction I was given a grip of attitude just for inquiring why it was taking so long.

The most important thing in the World, before love, family, money is the one thing that everybody has limited amounts of.  That
would be TIME.

Not only did I waste time trying to get into a cabinet. More time was wasted waiting at the register for the employee, as he took off to the backroom somewhere.  Lame; THIS STORE IS NOT SAFE AND EMPLOYEES WONT EVEN CALL THE POLICE FOR YOU!!!!!

Harassed By 4 Arab Immigrants When Walking In To Get A Oil Change. They Are Yelling And Cussing At Me. All 4 Men In The Bay Standing There While Im Asking For Help Or Security Somebody!!! No They Stand There With Their Mouth Open DOING NOTHING!!!! When I Asked For The Manager He Said Hes Inside. I Walk In Lube Center And The Arabs Start Yelling Once I Tell The Manager They Are Harassing Me They Get Louder! At This Point Employees And Management Doing Nothing!! So I Call The Police. Then Management Wants To Tell Him To Stop. Its A Dang Shame Your Employees DO NOTHING I MEAN ATLEAST CALL  THE DAMN POLICE!!! There Are 3 Men And A Woman Yelling At 1 Woman!! Are Y'all Serious!!!! Manager Says Well We Cant Do Nothing Were Not Security All We Can Do Is Yell. And I Said Yet NONE Of You Did!!!! Called For Management The Big African American Comes Up And Not One Word To Me And He Even Came Back When The Police Left. PROVIDE YOUR EMPLOYEES PROPER TRAINING SOMEONE COULD OF BEEN REALLY HURT!!! Thank God Police Came ASAP!!!!; I’m a regular at Walmart, and I always have a positive experience. The store is consistently well-organized, making it easy for me to find what I need quickly. I appreciate the wide selection of products and the great prices—they never disappoint. The staff are friendly and helpful, which makes every visit smooth and pleasant. Whether I’m picking up groceries, household items, or just browsing, Walmart has become my go-to spot for convenience and value. I’ll keep coming back for sure!

Reviews: Staff at the front are pretty aggressively rude when it comes to self checkout. I know the homeless problem here is bad but the way they will linger and profile people is aggressive. It's the closest walmart to me and I refuse to come here normally in case I really need something. Would rather drive 20 mins to winco; EACH TIME I COME INTO THIS WALMART, USUALLY ONCE A WEEK. HOWEVER, EACH TIME I VISIT, THE STAFF AND SECURITY ARE ALWAYS VERY KIND TO ME. I HAVE LIVED ALL OVER ARIZONA AND FEEL SAFE WHEN I VISIT THIS PARTICULAR LOCATION. I WILL DRIVE OUT OF MY WAY TO COME HERE FOR THIS REASON ALONE! THE STORE IS ALWAYS CLEAN, AND ITEMS ARE EASY TO FIND. BUT MOST IMPORTANTLY, IT IS THE SAFETY AND THE WAY I AM ALWAYS TREATED THAT WILL KEEP ME COMING HERE OVER OTHER LOCATIONS. WHEN I VISITED, I WAS ABLE TO FIND ALL THE INGREDIENTS TO MAKE THIS DISH! VERY HAPPY WITH THE END RESULTS; Love this neighborhood store! Usually Wally World is not my first choice but this place is different. The perfect size for grocery shopping and it contains enough drugstore items that I don't have to visit a drugstore for sundry items. Like shopping here very much!; Had a cart full of groceries. Was impressed with how well the store was kept. I was not pleased with three staff in self checkout that did not see the need to open a staff run lane to assist me with the amount of groceries I had to scan. All three staff were standing there not doing anything.; Very knowledgeable staff and the store was clean and isles clear. I was able to check out fast, made my whole experience fast so I couldn't be happier.

Name: Liquor Hutch

Reviews: As someone who used to work for Instacart, I've been to my fair share of liquor stores.  Some were always busy, but one way or another someone always assisted me when I needed help. Hutch Liquor, it's located in downtown Hutch off of Mainstreet in a really nice huge building.  The parking lot is a bit awkward, so it's just easier parking on the street.  I really like the atmosphere inside, it's fancy with ambient lighting and the layout is great. It's real easy to find what you want and they have just about everything you can think of.  And everyone is really nice. I don't go there often enough, but when I do, I am very pleased with my selection.  And, when I am there, it's never that busy.; Got this beer and it's TOTALLY AMAZING I'm getting more for sure; This place has a lot of items, although they could really double their space to be competitive and carry an increased selection of craft beers. There is a very large wine area, but what is hot these days is beer.; I come here once a week after dropping my children off for their weekend visit with their mom I always make sure to stop here 1. A great selection 2. professional staff 3. Welcoming and friendly environment and lastly. Wonderful deals.; Polite people very helpful love the scan program for free whatever when you get enough points!!

Reviews: Great place to get what you are looking for. The staff is always helpful and they work at getting new things in or if they don't have it will order it. Always have new items and they have brought in great Meads from Grimsby Hollow Meadery.; First off, excellent selection! So much so that it's borderline overwhelming. The issue is pricing, had a gift card and purchased two x 12 packs of Founders beer. It's Founders so one expects that to be a bit more expensive which is fine. But I've never seen two 12 packs, one an All Day variety pack and the other a basic Pilsner equal almost $50. Might be a good place to go for that hard to find bourbon but if you're in the neighborhood for beer at least, the local Meijer or even Orchard Market down the road is probably going to be way cheaper.; Very impressive when you walk in the door! Selection is exceptional. Prices comparable to other liquor stores. Location is easy in and out.; They ALWAYS have what I'm looking for, so many awesome choices!; Incredibly large selection. The staff were very nice, and they were able to help me find everything I was looking for, and also some great things I wasn't looking for.

Name: Rishi's International Beverage
Address: 3839 28th St SE, Grand Rapids, MI 49512, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 3839 (street_number); 28th Street Southeast (route); East Beltline (neighborhood); Grand Rapids (locality); Kent County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 49512 (postal_code)
Reviews:
My wife and I were traveling for work and we always try locally owned spots to hunt for fun or hard to find bourbons. Rishi delivered!

Rishi's felt more like a destination than a pit stop. The selection was expansive yet exclusive. The perfectly curated store was filled from floor to ceiling with every kind of elixir.

Within a few minutes it felt like we had known the owner for years as we exchanged stories and recommendations.

If you are in Grand Rapids and in need of the perfect bottle...Don't miss this spot!; This is a large store for wine and beer. I spent at least twenty minutes looking through the beer. Some breweries I was familiar with and several I was not. The staff was very helpful and kind!; Rishi is the man. I've shopped here for years but I recently stopped in to stock the bar for my wedding. Rishi helped me pick out great wines and liquors for the event. Great selection, great customer service, top tier alcohol knowledge.; Wow! What a great selection of just about anything you want. If you are looking for something they don't have, just ask Rishi. He can give you taste alike suggestions. He can also show you things in different price points. They have clear prices. Customer service was wonderful. Id recommend going here if you don't know what you want or even if you do. Either way you will leave satisfied.; Great selection. Don’t be dumb and walk to the Tito’s display thinking that the vodka section is back there when most hard alcohol is behind the counter. Excellent customer service.

Name: Village Party Store

Reviews:
Very well stocked. Significant inventory. Surprising amount of stuff considering their size. Good stuff, too!; I do not live in the area but we love the pizza.  Stopped in at lunchtime and the pizza was not ready and way behind so I grabbed a sub. It had potential to be really good but was warmed up in a microwave with the wrapper on it.  The middle was cold and the cheese didn’t melt. No lettuce or any toppings other than I was offered mustard and mayo packets.  It was still good but could’ve been great. Isn’t there an oven use for the pizza to run that through.  The lady working is really nice but the last two times I have been in there all she does is complain and customers don’t need to hear that. Lastly it was so typical because the other employees don’t do anything and she does it all LOL and she was complaining to another employee not the customers but it could be overheard easily; Everyone here is like family, the owner knew be by name within 2 visits and is always honest about what he sells. Saved me a lot of money by not selling me high quality liquor and wines for cooking. .

His prices are great and the atmosphere makes the visit worth every second!; Amazing. Very very helpful. Had to use a cane and the young man made the extra effort to carry my items to the car. They need a ten star option.; Huge selection and enjoy talking to owner.  Alot of cooler space filled with everything from imports and domestic beers,  seltzers, mixed cocktails,  and a nice freezer for things like fireball yager

Address: 6562 Old Canton Rd, Ridgeland, MS 39157, USA

Reviews: Decent prices which is why I shop here and the customer service is typically okay. However today I felt compelled to leave a review on this place for the first time. Today I walked in was not greeted nor was I asked if I needed help with anything after pacing the aisles for a couple of minutes. The male attendant was deeply engaged in a conversation with another male. Shortly after me, a white male customer walked in and surprisingly the attendant immediately acknowledged him. After my disappointment, I then proceeded to walk out which is when the attendant asked if I needed help with anything. He was completely aware of what he had just done. Very poor customer service.; Friendly associate, she called management and they made the decision not to sell us but two bottles of Moscato after driving two hours.  We were there to purchase cases.  Apparently we had the means to pay.  Stated unable to because needed it  for other customers.  To sum it up didn't want the money right then (now).  But when one store will not make a good business decision, another will.  We were able to fulfill our goal.  The trip was successful after all.; They worked hard to keep inventory up during this pandemic. Always having what I'm looking for. The employees are very friendly and helpful. Thank you.; Overpriced. Parking lot is always crowded, hard to maneuver in and out. Wouldn't suggest unless your wanting high priced wine or specific type of whiskey, brandy, bourbon or high priced champagne; $150 for a bottle of Blantons is absurd.  I’ll never buy anything from this store again after seeing how they gouge their customers on bourbons.

Name: The Depot
Address: 555 Dyckman Ave, South Haven, MI 49090, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 555 (street_number); Dyckman Avenue (route); South Haven (locality); Van Buren County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 49090 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I don’t generally make it a point to give bad reviews, but I have had this happen to me more than twice now and want to express this, especially to the local people. I’m a local business as well who spends a lot of money and cares about shopping locally. I want to support year round business here in our small town. I have had two separate experiences now with the owner, John who made promises and did not deliver.

I’ve always called days in advance, asked if there are specific times better than others to pick up and wait my turn in line with others despite putting in orders ahead of time. I was told to come down and pick up my order I had waited 3 days on. I called ahead to ensure it was there, ready to go and waiting for me. When I arrived, not only was it not there in full (he quickly could find one bottle but the others had been sold), I was told by the owner that because there was a line behind me (which I had also waited in) that he was not going to look for it and I could take part of my order or… and he shrugged at me. Needless to say I walked out without making a purchase at all. He clearly did not care about my business. The business of another local business owner. I will be sure to let anyone know every chance I get to not to take their money there as he seems to care only about himself, the larger faster dollars and not showing mutual respect to other small business owners in our very close knit South Haven.; The Depot is within walking distance in downtown South Haven. They have an amazing selection of beers, wines, and spirits. And it's got atmosphere. You owe it to yourself to check it out.; FYI the deli is only open Tuesday - Saturday. If we had seen that we wouldn’t have stopped in hoping to get a sandwich. Looks like a cool spot though to eat and they’ve got some pretty good alcohol options.; Great options, all home made sandwiches. I would definitely recommend this place for any one who wants a fresh deli sandwich foe the beach!; We pre ordered a bunch of sandwiches and a charcuterie board for our arrival during a family trip. Everyone I spoke with was so helpful and friendly. The charcuterie was impressive and was a huge hit with the group! We will definitely do that again when we’re back in town.

Name: Gurney's Harbor Bottle Shop
Address: 215 E Main St, Harbor Springs, MI 49740, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: Closed

Reviews:
Quaint little bottle shop that’s family-owned and operated. Their claim to fame is their made-to-order deli sandwiches. Their bread (baked in-house) is potentially the best I’ve ever had on a deli sandwich.

Gurney’s is so popular in the area that during peak summer months, you should plan on getting there around 11am if you don’t want to wait in a 30+ minute line that goes out the door. NO TOMATOES, so don’t ask! Trust me, you won’t miss ‘em.; When you see a line of people out the door, it's probably pretty good!

Gurney's is pretty good and then some! Sandwiches were made to order with generous portions of fresh ingredients on thick bread.  Delicious!; Pick up a sandwich and have a picnic.  Do not let a long line intimidate you as it moves along pretty fast... WORTH IT!; I always have great things to say about Gurney’s! Amazing sandwiches, friendly faces. The bread is wonderful, too.; A popular sandwich stop for good reason! Bread tastes fresh and food tastes great. The Train Wreck seems to be a crowd favorite. For those who like a little "zing", ask for spicy pepper cheese, banana peppers and dijon mustard.

Reviews:
My grandfather, my father, and now always used this convenient spot. I would describe this as a boutique type of store.
And other words  ,you have Lowe’s Home Depot to go buy a hammer if you like. Then again, you can go to your local corner Ace Hardware store where they know your name and and would you like to drink and probably would have it out for you on the counter before you got to the front door. This is the ace of liquor stores out on the counter probably for you before you walk through the door.; Beautiful selection of wines and liquors, including many from lesser-known countries and smaller companies. Knowledgeable staff.; Excellent customer service, very knowledgeable staff, great selection. The whole staff is very focused on customer service. 👏 This is my go to place when I have questions or looking for something hard to find.; My father's 70th birthday is coming up next month. I've been searching for weeks for a specific 18 yr old single barrel bourbon with no luck. Everyone I spoke with told me I would have better luck hitting a unicorn with my truck.
That is, until I contacted Briarwood Mart Wines & Spirits. Thanks to Nathan & his staff, I can proudly mount that unicorn on the hood of my truck!!!
The customer service & the correspondence was above and beyond  my expectations. I HIGHLY recommend Briarwood W & S.
Thanks again!

~Ryan Roberts; Great selection but more importantly excellent service. Always helpful and knowledgeable. Like they WANT you to find what you're after! A 1st for me 😂

Name: Jerry's Express
Address: 2998 W Russell Rd, Tecumseh, MI 49286, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Reviews: Great store, I will always support Jerry's as long as I live in Tecumseh because it is one of the last remaining great old grocery stores to shop And see the vintage images of the cattle intake and butcher area mixed with new technology giving me a real nicely priced neat  shopping experience.   Note: (The best Meat prices hands down pretty much anywhere.).; Jerry's is a nice, convenient grocery store.  It's size is small, that it's great for those who can't do alot of walking.  I find their overall prices higher that the big box grocery stores.  What I like to get at Jerry's is their meat which is superior and their deli is fantastic.  They have wonderful ready made snacks and sandwiches to pick even deviled eggs.  Their egg salad by lb. is my favorite you can get anywhere.  In the front of the store they have a little cart with 1 - 2 serving size portions of hot food.  I just tried the chicken and biscuit.  It was really good.  They have a nice selection of to go beverages also, I was able to get coconut water.  It seems fast food resturants keep raising their prices.  I'm going to stop by Jerry's this summer for lunch and snacks.; The lady behind the counter was very nice we were only there a few minutes but a friend of mine used to own that it was called George's Market I painted this house wiring then I ended up getting 12 houses on the same street by the country club in Tecumseh because of it; Carol and, Jenny who work here are thee best worker's this company has working for them at this time. When I come in and, get what I need they are there to assist me with what I need or, offer a idea to use. If Carol or, Jenny are up for a rise please give them a big rise. I do hope Carol and, Jenny hang around this company for some time.; I don't know who the little short guy is that thinks he's a badass wearing his little hip gun but 40 years I think I would go ahead and change over to somewhere else thank you buddy

His team was superb, making the best drinks ever and procuring the wines that we had selected. Everyone had the party was raving about the bar. Thank you, Charlie!; Amazing place! For a small store it carries quite a selection of liquor, wine and beer. Huge selection of Craft Beers, local and from across the country. I finally located it here and called, they put a case aside for me and I went the next day to pick it up.  The woman who took my call and then rang me up the next day deserves some sort of trophy... She saved both my fall and winter seasons of semi-sanity...; Whether the N"Boro or Hudson location.. Bacon's is the best non-big box store to conveniently grab your drink of choice. Great family run local biz executed with pride and great service.  Excellent and deep selections...not your 'Daddy's packy'...you won't be disappointed or walk out empty handed.

Name: Bill & Carol's West Side Grocery
Address: 523 Charlevoix Ave, Petoskey, MI 49770, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 523 (street_number); Charlevoix Avenue (route); Petoskey (locality); Emmet County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 49770 (postal_code); 2205 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: I wanted to like this place, I really did. But there was a cockroach under the sticker of my homemade Twix cheesecake. Omg I was so excited to eat it too. My boyfriend and I went in because we saw the good reviews. He got a burger and I got a sandwich along with some chips and cookies and some other snacks ($43 worth). After we received our sandwiches from the deli counter, I noticed a cockroach above the cookies. Ugh I was so disappointed. I tried to think about how many restaurants I’ve eaten at that have cockroaches that I have never noticed. I tried to eat my sandwich. I really did. We threw the stuff out. I was checking over our other snacks we got from there and saw the cockroach under the deli sticker of the Twix cheesecake (pictured). I know both of the bugs I saw were cockroaches, I unfortunately know what cockroaches look like. I called the store immediately when I saw the second cockroach because at that point I didn’t even want to eat the packaged lays chips I bought. I told the woman the story and asked if I could get my money back. The woman said “yes” and nothing else, she did not sound shocked at all, nor did she question me. Anyways, when we got to the store, the woman at the register told me to show her where I saw the roach. I showed her, and I also showed her the one under the sticker. She barely looked at the sticker and told us that it’s probably a piece of peppercorn or spice from the deli. I assured her that I have great eyesight, I know what a cockroach is, and even if it wasn’t a cockroach (it was), there’s no denying that it was a bug of some sort. Definitely undeniably NOT a peppercorn/spice. The woman told me she’s there everyday and never has seen a cockroach… Based on the state of the store and the TWO that I saw, I highly doubt it, or she needs to visit an optometrist. Not sure how the health department hasn’t done something. At the end of the day, we got all our money back, even though she questioned if we wanted a refund for the whole order… Umm yes? We do? Cockroaches are not to be messed with. Stay clear unless you’d like an extra protein surprise 😊; Best “Home Town Deli” ever! Exceptional humans who help their community & literally the best sandwiches ever! I recommend to everyone & they always go back!; Fast, friendly, affordable. Delicious, made to order deli sandwiches and salads. Perfect for grabbing a bite to pack while exploring the the region. We always try to support the local economy when road tripping. They were so good, we went back for second day. Give them a try.; I had never thought about Bill & Carol's for lunch, but I would hear from others how great it is. I make it a priority now if I'm on that side of town. They always have a lunch special, or you can just order off their menu with a variety of condiments for everyone. I love they have jalapenos to add to my sandwich.  Prices are great, your dollar goes a long way and all the homemade cookies are to die for.  Check them out!; Owned by local folks for 60 years, the market has exceptional service.  Very friendly and helpful, they have a huge selection of beer, wine, and liquor, a fantastic deli, and are committed to making your shopping experience a delight.  5+ stars.

Reviews: I've been shopping here since 2020. The owner is really cool and I appreciate how they will stock personal request items of regulars. They also are always helpful if you want to learn about a product or get a recommendation. It also doesn't feel like a creepy or sketchy liquor store. The variety of options, presentation, and most importantly the outstanding staff is why I keep coming back.; This is the cleanest and most organized liquor store in the area. They have a great selection and competitively priced. Stop by here for your beer and wine purchases.; This has to be the most expensive liquor store in the area. Decent selection and very friendly owner, but it’s worth driving a few more minutes to save 20-30%.; I’m not sure why anyone would choose to pay 30% more for a terrible selection but this liquor store literally has 1/10th the selection of Total Wine and 30% higher prices. Not sure how they stay in business.; This place is a hidden gem in Highlands Ranch. They have an excellent curated selection of alcohol, not just your standard brands. Our go-to spot for dropping by for a bottle of bourbon or Drizly delivery.

Reviews: I wish I could give a negative one. Ordered on door dash, but as stated davidsons delivers their own liquor. The driver didn't read my instructions and never asked for my ID. I really enjoy chatting with him when he delivers for me and I recommend Davidson’s Highly  for this reason!; This is a very large store with a huge selection. Reviews: Ordered at 8:30 last night when the hours posted said they closed at midnight.  Order was never acknowledged so I called and got no answer.  This morning Drizly’s website says the order was delivered at 11:59 last night.  It was not.  You can bet I got charged for it though.  This place deserves zero stars.  Scum of the Earth.; Guy that works there in the evenings is always nice and they have an amazing variety and selection of vapes. my go-to now!; Visited this store for a bottle of bourbon priced $129.99 on Drizly. Their shelf price was $199.99. I showed the women and man in the store the price on Drizly. The women then called the store manager. He would not honor their price on Drizly. The man then made a joke about me to my face, and I told it wasn’t funny and he shouldn’t be making jokes about customers to their face.This is a classic ‘bait & switch’ scam. Beware!; Sign outside said Jamison 41.99. Inside it’s 49.99. The nice lady asked the boss and he said the sign is broken and then told me to go somewhere else. Very rude and obviously he hates his store. Everyone else was nice. I wouldn’t spend a dime in this store ever. Classic bait and switch. If the sign is broke easy fix.  Flip the breaker. Reviews: My boyfriend got a half pint of JD fire from here. We got back to where we were staying and he was going to have his drink but noticed the color was off when he looked at it. I took the container from him to see that the seal had already been broken, the liquor inside was a light tan color not of the usual JD fire color AND the amount in the container was not where it should have been compared to a sealed bottle. I told him to discard it because of the seal being broken and discoloration. Whoever sold him the bottle was reckless and/or did not care they were ripping off a customer.; It's a small shop but it has everything you need, including an impressive selection of small producer wines. Not a huge selection of French and Italian wines, but it's curated and solid.; Small and easy to drive by, but filled with wonders! A huge beer selection available with plenty of local Colorado brews. Even offers New Mexican beer! 🌵 🍺 Looking for an adventerous gluten free option? Try out some hard kombucha. 🌻  Brettlyn was super helpful.; Friendly, close by hotels and shops, lots of variety of beer, hard liquor and ciders/ seltzer. I'm gluten free so I go for the cider/seltzers. I don't love sweet drinks and I like to try local items. They lots of have options. If you play it safe they have the common brands too.; Some of the staff is very rude. I will not be returning to this liquor store.

The parking lot, store, and bathrooms are always clean.

Most for only a dollar.

I don't know much about liquor but sometimes my recipes call for certain types of wines or liquor and I'm pretty oblivious as to where they are located in the store so the staff takes time to help me search but mostly knows where to find it and about the types I need for my dishes.; Definitely has one of the biggest varieties of wines to pick from definitely need to check it out if you're looking for something like that great people very knowledgeable help you find it if it's at another liquor store; Bill and Denny are awesome. However the new manager,  I don't have any nice words to say about her. She accuses people of things that are not true. She followed my mom around the store.; Bill is awesome! The second we walked in, he greeted us and asked if there was anything we were looking for in particular. My fiancé told him he was looking for a specific brandy, so Bill walked us over to the brandy. We didn’t find the exact one we were looking for, but he had some other suggestions for us. I haven’t tried it yet, but one of his suggestions was a mixture of a peanut butter and a chocolate liquor. I can’t wait to give it a try!

Bill is 100% the reason we will come back to this liquor store. He’s such a nice guy and extremely helpful! It just seems like he really cares, and that’s rare nowadays.

Name: Walmart Supercenter
Address: 100 W Riverside Dr, Parker, AZ 85344, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM

Reviews:
This rating is specifically for Mario. He was working the self checkout line and help me with professionalism and a smile when I had some issues.  I had also received money from my account and forgot it in the slot. I did not realize this until I got home and was going to kiss it off as let’s face it, most people if they found it would keep it. Not Mario, he turned it into security and when I called, he told me where it was. Keep up the great work, Mario, I hope Walmart gives you a promotion and a raise. God bless you and thank you for reviving my hope in humanity.; Great customer service. Took care of customers and had everyone smiling entering and exiting! Definitely will come back again.; I called the store 5 times at 3 in the afternoon to check on availability of an item and no one answered the phone. When I finally got through I was told they have 7 of the appliance items I was looking for in stock.  But once I got to the store there was none. After I did other shopping the night clerk at the register didn't even know what he was doing so I had to move to another register just to pay, leaving one of my bags behind on the carrosel. From my experience a very poorly managed store.; Very clean friendly, always find someone to help you if you can't find it. Large fishing, camping and ammo selection. Now selling guns and more....they have just remodeled the interior of the store.; Don't go here if you work late and need something last minute they close at 11. It was ten minutes till they closed and I was told I couldn't come inside at first I had to haggle with the lady to get something to feed my dogs and baby wipes for my kid.

While I was inside going down an isle to get these things a worker stops me and yells aggressively at me that "we're close you have to leave right now" In response I asked can I just get what I need to get??? These people are ridiculous and aggressive between 10:45-11.

Name: Liquor Bueno Live Oak
Address: 7525 N. Loop East STE 132, Live Oak, TX 78233, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Vicinity: 7525 N. Loop East STE 132, Live Oak
Address Components: STE 132 (subpremise); 7525 (street_number); N. Loop East (route); Northeast Side (neighborhood); Live Oak (locality); Bexar County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 78233 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Great place, the owners are good guys. Had some great informative conversations. Raise your spirits here; Great experience in the store over the weekend. Instantly greeted as I walked in and was asked if I was looking for anything in particular. I've been looking for Weller 12 and Weller Antique for awhile now and while Nas explained why it's been hard to find but told me that if he comes across a bottle he'd let me know. I shared a story about my sister in law finding a bottle of Elijah Craig 18 for my brother and how I was hoping to find one as well. I had just met Nas and he told me he thought he had one at a different location. He didn't have to do that but I truly appreciated his kindness so I bought the Basil Hayden Red Wine Cask Finish
since I've been intrigued by it for awhile before I left his store. He called to verify the EC18 was still available since it was on the other side of town and didn't want me to drive there if it was already gone. True to his word, I was able to purchase it today. Great service at both locations. Too often I read reviews detailing negative experiences so I definitely wanted to share my positive experience. Thank you Nas. You're a team player!; I like liquor Bueno. Effie is a great employee.  She knows my name and always greets me with a smile.  Maybe you can get some blinds for the front window for your customers and employee s. Thanks; Good selection, friendly and helpful staff working here. I’ve gotten multiple recommendations from staff and they are always happy to help pick something new or find something you’re looking for; First time in the  store and the guy would not sell me liquor. He thought I was drunk because I went to door next to the entrance. He had no reason to suspect I was drunk and I do not even like to drink alcohol.

I did that move because I was waiting to meet a friend, he was running late so i thought I would look around and buy a bottle of wine for my wife.

He had no reason for his comment and i will never buy anything from this place and I strongly discourage anyone from buying anything, unless you want to be considered a drunk.

Name: AD Beer & Wine
Address: 565 W Oates Rd, Garland, TX 75043, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:30 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:30 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 10:30 AM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 10:30 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 10:30 AM – 1:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 565 (street_number); West Oates Road (route); La Prada Retail (neighborhood); Garland (locality); Dallas County (administrative_area_level_2); Texas (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 75043 (postal_code)
Reviews: Been to this store multiple times. Those guys are very very nice. Lot of good stuffs esp wine & liquor. This is the type of store I dire to support in the area ... small business w good attitude & quality service. Keep up!; Great little hole in the wall liquor store. We came in to grab some unique beers that we can't usually find and were pleasantly surprised of the available selection. The attendant was very nice and helped us get a discount on some beat-up bottles. So we were able to save even a few more bucks. Awesome selection if you are looking for craft beer.; I honestly think this is the best craft beer store in DFW. I’ve gotten to try so many new and great brews by shopping here. If Anun (not sure how to spell his name, but he’s the really cool younger dude) is working, he always has fantastic recommendations. That dude can tell you about almost any beer they sell, which is very impressive considering their extensive collection of local and regional craft brews. He’s genuinely the best and seriously deserves a raise. And if Prisma is working, she’s always super polite and nice to interact with. If you love beer, live in the area, and don’t frequent this place, you’re really messing up. I’d honestly give 6 stars if I could!!!; There may be a few places that have a bigger selection but no one with more rare beers. This is a craft beer lover's Paradise, hands down!; Been going here for years.  This place is awesome because for a store so tiny, they carry hundreds of beers.  Even rarities like big bombers from local, far away, and international breweries.  If you're a beerknurd and you live on the east side, this place is a must.  Try them once, come back for life.

Reviews:
Wednesday night before Thanksgiving around 8:30: Your female cashier with glasses, black hair, super pale skin and on the heavy side is a complete jerk and should probably not work in front with the public. I said “hello” and no response. I thought maybe she didn’t hear me the first time. Louder I said “hello” again and nothing but silence. If “I hate my job” was a person it’s her. It’s crazy because I have always found the employees here to be awesome. She’s your weak link.; If I could give the service a negative I would.  My first time in this establishment and the last time. The service was horrible.  I went to check out and the sales clerk did not acknowledge me or the fact I was purchasing a bottle of wine. So I went to another register to purchase the bottle of wine. The same sales clerk acknowledged and a rang up a white customer. The sales clerk who rang up my purchase was not friendly and rude. I will spend my hard earned money where I am appreciated.; Staff is super friendly. They have a nice selection of craft bears and all the regular brand names of liquor.     Not bad pricing either.  👌🏽    Ask any of the staff for help or about a product they know their stuff.; Very nice staff! Good selection for a relatively small shop. Very glad to have this shop right here for sure.

Annoyed with the city for banning tobacco here (I don't use tobacco to be clear) because the connected Hy-Vee sells it all so really it's just lost funding for the park department but really that's beside the point.; Great liquor store... Although the location it is in, they do not have much of any higher end spirits... I love my Johnny Walker Red & Johnny Walker Blue.... They do not carry them flavor's... They used to when they first opened, plus they are a Lil pricey... Still a great place to buy your beer and spirits...

Mostly positive. Today the two daytime ladies treated me like some kind of bum. I took a minute or two to look around deciding what I wanted -- literally nothing beyond that amount of time. I got the vibe they were trying to get me out of their hair as though I'm up to something. There's a fairly distinct line between just trying to be helpful and I'd rather you weren't here. Based on that I'm dropping a star.; Yesterday I went to buy a wine through the window and when I got home I realized that they put a different label on it. The old label said $6.99 and the new one said $12.99. A scam; This place is got it all. They are open until 2am most days.,store closes the door after 10pm a walk up to their drive  thru gets accurate and honest service. Reviews: This place is a gold mine and the owner was so nice, and proud too of the collection he has to offer, letting me in to take a look at the bottles. I had to call before and ask if it was okay to come inside. I found an absolutely amazing collection of tequilas, bourbons and scotch ( as expected,  inflated secondary markup prices) but the owner was open and willing to negotiate because I purchased multiple. I'm very appreciative that the individuals that work there were so nice to me and think this place is just great. I will definitely be shopping here into the future. Never seen such a collection like that before of rare bottles. I walked out with a great deal and still a few bucks left in my wallet. In case you haven't read from the other reviewers, this is a drive-through liquor store too.; I love this place! Awesome customer service! I go here just to get a soda, snack, ice cream or when I need something stronger! Excellent variety of everything! Prices are good to! So lucky its so close to my house!; They have been here for years serving the local area and are open a log of times when other stores aren't.  Always has friendly staff and dr8ve thru has 2 windows.; This store illegally charge $1 fee for using credit/debit cards…the owner told me he is not required to post a fee sign this is not true…I will further report to higher authorities; The secondary prices on the bourbon are the craziest I have seen in arizona. 150$ a bottle for eagle rare is super crazy, that's 5x retail price, no thanks.... they do have a nice "collection" but not a good selection and it's gonna stay a collection till it's priced to move.

Reviews:
This is the best liquor store in town. Friendly staff and able to meet my alcohol needs if I ever have a party and also soft drinks. Drive thru is perfect for quick stop before dates or sometimes I can stop inside to chat with the staff.; Went thru the drive thru around 9pm. Idk the guys name that was working last night but quick to get the line moving. Have great selection of everything alcohol/tobacco related things. Great customer service. Ty Liquor Basket; Friendliest service ever! Those guys are the greatest ever!! Thanks for your kindness and showing me how great the neighborhood is!!; Clean family run shop with friendly service and will meet most of your Convenience Store needs.; The staff here, every one that I've met, are all very friendly and very competent. They all knew what was in stock, where it was kept, and a good estimate - if not the exact amount - of how much was in stock. They've all been very helpful too. I had an unexpected problem with a payment card once, and the staff did everything they could to help me resolve the issue. Without me having you ask, they kept my order pulled save ready until I fixed the problem. The store has an update atmosphere, and the staff appear to get along. They seem interested in helping me get the items I need rather that just getting my money and getting me out the door like the other convenience stores tend to do.

For those reasons, I gladly continue to go to the Liquor Basket for everything I can get there rather than go to any chain convenience store, and will do so for as long as I can.

The two clerks working were so nice, knowledgeable, and helpful- and they had a surprisingly good selection of mezcal and tequila! Will definitely go back.; Mazen is very friendly and gives great recommendations. They usually have a few items on special and they offer a nice selection. They're offering more tequila, which is very cool! I picked up a few great bottles that I wouldn't have tried if not for their recommendation. Drop in and check them out!; Small liquor store I’m here for the scratcher ticket hehe. Good clerk indeed. Just nice.; Let me tell you .. Mason and Ron are GOLDEN in my book. Mason is literally the nicest most humble person I’ve ever met. From business owner to another, you sir are the reason I will only buy my booze here. Many blessings to you and everybody at the store.; Nice folks at this store. Good beer selection too. You can smell the In n Out next door. Win win.

Reviews:
I wish I would have gotten the guys name but whoever works the night shift on weekdays is SO NICE!! Went in to grab some small airplane shooters and he was so nice and efficient!! I dont live in LA but anytime I come back I know I will definitely come back to this store for any drinks we need! Very cute little spot I definitely recommend!!; Classic boozer palace with no judgment on how often you frequent.; Bizzarely a very inexpensive option to get some liquors or beers.
The same amount of liquor would cost me around 8 more bucks (per bottle) if you go to other spots around Hollywood or LA in general. The owner is friendly, the other employees never have a bad attitude, always laid back and overall pretty chill.
Maybe some have had a bad experience but I can't say I have ever had one, it is a small little place so don't expect a huge walmar supercenter kinda selection from beers and liquors, some six packs and a good enough amount of liquors to satisfy your basic needs.; I like a wine store that allows you to bring your own meal as you enjoy your beverage of choice. As a result, this location is one of my favorites because there are numerous eateries within walking distance. Great staff and even better customers, plus the workers here are some of the nicest.This is the place to go if you want to hang out with individuals who like wine and small conversation.; I have been living in the area all my life ,the mother and son duo . WILL OVER CHARGE YOU if they think your a tourist. No lie prices already high.only there because they have good area .Mother didn't recognize me bought  $10 dollars charged my debit card $18 not posting this put of anger.just  warning people.

Reviews: I’ve always had horrible experiences here. The prices change by the customer and there’s always a language barrier. I try to give them another try and everytime I’m left irritated by the customer service. I finally got upset enough to review and never go back. Great liquor stores a block west and east. Also these two cans cost me just shy of $10, and the gross corona one was mislabeled a cheaper price.; Great Customer Service. Very Well Mannered Staff. And All the Hot Girls order Liquor from here. Well maybe just my Luck. So Thank You Postmates for all the beautiful women I got to deliver they drank too. I hope you work with UberEats as well.; I wish I have known about this place earlier. They have a variety of selection of EVERYTHING. I love how they care for customers. I was having really a bad day and I felt better because of how I was treated there. Very mannered and respectful People.; Rude clerk who got angry with me for asking for simple price checks on three unmarked bottles— which it turned out were absurdly overpriced.; I tried to go here late last night. It’s located next to a busy bar / restaurant / club called Amber. Many people from there pour into this liquor store. I waited outside for the large crowd inside to finish and leave. There were about 5-7 people hanging out inside near the entrance while I waited and waited. Most of them weren’t wearing masks. The few that were had their masks pulled below their chin. Upon realizing this place is a Covid petri dish, I followed the logical side of my brain and left. This place should be shut down if they’re not willing to enforce public health measures.

Dimitri is the actual best. He’s always so welcoming and has the best customer service. My friends and I LOVE him and this store.; Open at convenient hours and the staff all.seem friendly.

Being in K-town they have selection of Korean alcohol and Asian non-alcoholic drinks too. I'm a big fan of guava juice and was pleasantly surprised they carried it.

Have been back a few times already!; Kelly at Catalina liquor always goes above and beyond for me. I love the spot because it is easy parking and easy access to the community. They have a wide selection of liquor, beer, wine, and snacks. When I’m on the go and I need something quick. I gotta Catalina liquor. Kelly really treats me well as a customer and so does the other stuff there. The store is very clean and I really recommend everyone to come here cause it’s the best store ever! 10/10 stars would recommend!; Been going to this store for 5 years and everyone working and the owner are very friendly and their prices reasonable compared to other convenience stores. Also, when and if they don't have something in stock (a rarity) they are quick to point out alternatives or simply ensure to have what you need the following time you're in, granted that you ask, kindly. It's not a supermarket, folks. So don't go on thinking they are expected to have it all, (it's a LIQUOR store). However, most of the items you can think of needing (refreshments, GM, snacks) you're sure to find here!

has great selection of of beer wine liquor and cigars.. i purchased a bottle eagle rare which is kinda hard to find locally.. normally you have to hunt for it and they had it in stock.. problem for me was that in order to buy it you had to bundle it up with a bottle that im not fond of.. and i asked if i could buy it alone and the guy refused.. i would've purchased more of that one bottle but because of the bundle deals he had i chose not too..; Danny(Owner) and Aaron are the coolest guys. Best in Long Beach. 99% of their beer is really well chosen so you know anything you get, even if you haven't tried the brewery yet, is going to be good. They have great taste!

Great place.  Stays open till midnight.; This is my neighborhood liquor store. They have the best deals on liquor and beer. They also have a wide section on any kind of beer your looking for. Same with the liquor section is huge. If your looking for a variety or something new you can find it here. I love that they have so many different kinds of tequila here. Every time I go I try a new bottle. If you go on Friday they have samples of some new liquor or beer and they will help you find something new and maybe better. They different have some kind of liquor to keep you happy..; Found my new liquor store...!!! I walked into Happy's Liquor today and first off behind the counter they have a plethora of commonly salt for and many rare or just hard to find hard alcohol. The layouts great lots and lots of wine about three-quarters of their coolers that wrap around more than half the store is wine and craft beer. Very impressed and got my 12 year old Weller's and my Special Reserve I'll be going back soon! Glad to meet these fine gentlemen.; The very best liquor store!!! The owner and employees are extremely professional, friendly and generous. Gave me a gift on my birthday!!! I love this store and how the new owner cleaned it up, refurbished it and stocked it everything and anything one could ever want!!!! The very best selection in town!!!; Unprofessional rude. The three guys working behind the counter we're not very welcoming when in just to buy some lotto tickets they didn't say thank you for my business I tried to break the ice and say Merry Christmas and the three of them standing there with their turbans on their head just gave me the coldest stare and replied with "no thank you". This is America if you don't like what the United States is about and the love we have for Christmas you can get the hell out of here. Just really pissed me off it's the holiday season supposed to be cordial and nice so I tell everybody I know not to ever go to that store again boycott it at every means

Reviews:
Nice place to visit at City Market 21 at Tujunga CA Foothill Blvd @ Plainview Ave. Busy area with loud noises driving around the intersection. On the other side of street is Original Tommy’s Burgers which I haven’t try yet but farther than that there is Super Char Burgers which I came across ordered a burger & fries with high prices. Inside the liquor store with great prices of snacks, beverages, liquors & much more!! Great selection for me to purchase & play lotto scratcher tickets. The owner at the counter who is kindfulness, friendly, smart & super duper nice to me. Not rude, very good attitude of which I could tell very polite. Having no issues. Keep up the great work definitely come back again. Nice & clean, well organized. Of course I like the hot weather. Anyway I highly recommended visiting to City Market 21 Liquor store & the customers must try fast food burger & fries at Tommy’s & Super Char Burgers if you come across. This was my best day I had ever experienced.; I was there today at 12:50pm. I bought a money order and paid with four 100 dollar bills. Everything seemed good until I was in my car writing info on the money order when he clerk came out and said one of the bills was fake. I went back in and saw that the bill shown by him was fake. I was a retail store manager for over 10 years and know how to spot a fake money when I actually check.  The only thing is that I tend not to check anything that I get directly from a bank. I quit my job prior to Covid so any 100 dollar bill I have now is from Chase. Now here is the what gets me frustrated. He showed the surveillance video of the whole transaction. I saw that he kept my 4 bills separate from the rest of the store money until the last minute. He took one bill that he was comparing my bills with from the drawer, turned around, and walked out to the parking lot to talk to me, presumably to show the difference between the two?  I watched the video till this point and decided this guy is good and I must have had the fake bill all along. If that one bill he took from the store drawer was the problem why would it be in the drawer in the first place? He seemed to me a straight forward person. I paid him the 100 then came home fuming to call Chase. The Chase customer pointed out something that I hadn't thought of. That I've always used an ATM, never went to a teller to withdraw money.  An ATM machine makes a mistake. What is going on. ANYWAY. This isn't to blame the store.
Everyone at this store always has been friendly and helpful. I get no nonsense straight honesty vibe every time I visit this store. The store is well organized and very clean.  The clerk was very calm, polite, and accommodating the whole time I was there. I really appreciated that he didn't get emotional.; City Market #21 is a gem among liquor stores. The inviting atmosphere, well-organized layout, and extensive selection of spirits make it a delight to browse. The knowledgeable and passionate staff at City Market #21 offer personalized recommendations, ensuring a satisfying shopping experience. With competitive prices and a commitment to customer satisfaction, City Market #21 stands out as a top destination for both casual buyers and seasoned liquor aficionados.; Cold refrigerators. If you’re gonna do one thing right at a mini market, make it big very cold refrigeration

Very well stocked shelves and excellent variety of snacks and foods

Also love the convenience and the easy parking.
Every time I pass this store, I make it a point to stop in and support them by buying a few sodas and chips

P.S. friendly cashier; Great neighborhood market. Friendly people.

I did love the fact that they had so many options for their drink choices, but we're just out of stock for a particular one that I was looking for at the time. I did make a few rounds their way while I was in LA.; They could be a bit friendlier in the service aspect of things, but who really cares. ...it's a liquor store. Apart from that, it's right on Hollywood Blvd. They probably have about anything you're craving. Every time I went I got my booze and smokes quick. That's what I look for more than anything for places like this. ... Easy to find what you're looking for and quick service.; The neighborhood corner store, I like looking around the counter to check out the random things. My favorite is the wet food for cats.; My friend bought two girls we don't know a pack of cigarettes just because, they we 'apreciative. Good store.

Name: Jason's Wine & Spirits
Address: 828 Main St, Los Angeles, CA 90014, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Address Components: 828 (street_number); Main Street (route); Downtown Los Angeles (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90014 (postal_code)
Reviews:
“I’m a pick up driver and it was my first time in this store. There were 5-6 people in line at the register, so I joined the line. When it was finally my turn, I showed him the order details. Description of the cashier: long hair, goatee, light skin, and about 5 feet 9 inches tall. He pointed to a place, barking, ‘Wait over there,’ without even looking at me. I tried to explain that I was there for an order pickup, but he didn’t listen. All he said in return was, ‘Wait there,’ yelling again without explanation. At that moment, I felt completely and helplessly discriminated against. What was worse, he kept serving the next customers, continuing to put on that fake smile on his face, being courteous with them while I had just been ignored and dismissed in less than a minute. The difference in his behavior towards me versus the others made me feel deeply humiliated and angry. I knew without a doubt that it was prejudice driving his actions, and it left me furious and incredibly hurt. Clearly, this store employs racist and mean-spirited people, and if fair and decent treatment matters to you, you shouldn’t give your business to people like this.”; Jason’s Wine and Spirits is more than just a liquor store—it’s a cherished cornerstone of the Silverlake community. Every time I walked through the door, Harry, the owner, greeted me with his signature, “Party time?” which always brought a smile to my face. Harry embodies the spirit of this place with his incredible kindness and genuine care for everyone who visits.

I vividly remember one time when I walked in with tears in my eyes, going through a particularly rough patch. Harry noticed and took the time to offer me some profoundly wise advice that I will always hold dear. His empathy and support in that moment were truly touching and made a lasting impact on me.

During the two years I lived in Silverlake, Jason’s Wine and Spirits became a weekly ritual for me, and even now, I make a point to stop by whenever I'm in the area. It’s a place where you can count on finding not only what you need but also a sense of community and warmth. I highly recommend this wonderful establishment to anyone who values not just excellent service but also the genuine human connections that make a neighborhood truly special.; It's cool to see all the variations of liquor. Yet still no flavored 211 aka steel reserve in general; Convenient spot to grab some drinks or have them deliver to your hotel. Wait/delivery time could be a bit better, but still convenient regardless.; Ordered at 11:40am. It’s past 1pm. Really should change the 30 mins delivery on your website.

I stop by after Zankou and get the best Grapefruit Beer.

Name: Walgreens
Address: 8816 E Pinnacle Peak Rd, Scottsdale, AZ 85255, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 8816 (street_number); East Pinnacle Peak Road (route); La Mirada At Pinnacle Peak (neighborhood); Scottsdale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85255 (postal_code)
Reviews:
My god I thought it couldn’t possibly be a worse experience then the normal Walgreens I go to. That place is a 5 star compared to this. It almost feels as though there is a candid camera. I mean you can’t be this bad. First I tried calling to avoid waiting for my script to be filled no answer for the entire 45 minute ride here. Second for whatever reason with Walgreens they need you to show up to start the process of preparing your script. This place lacks processes and training. This is like going to the circus minus the fun and cotton candy. Hands down worst pharmacy I have ever been to; Oh my, where to start. I got used to going to Safeway, but my new insurance wouldn’t cover RSV vaccine type, so off
to Walgreens I go. I made an appointment, filled out all relevant paperwork, and when I got to
the counter 20 minutes in advance, I had to do it all again! Then I waited and watched all the chaos behind the counter. Customers complaining about prescriptions not ready,etc. When the pharmacist was ready, I had to sit in a corner behind a screen. Customers were seated so close they could watch. No privacy, pretty sure a HIPPA violation. Dirty and cold. Never again. Walgreens, shame on you.; The absolute worst experience with the pharmacy. After waiting 3 days for a prescription for a rash, I finally had to ask my provider to send my prescription to Safeway who filled it in less than an hour. Walgreens told me multiple times my prescription was ready, and yet it never was. Then they told me that they “didn’t have instructions from my provider.” My provider confirmed that they did have instructions. Then, they told me it would be another 36 hours to get a simple cream for a rash. Save your energy and time and avoid this place. They are so unhelpful and not willing to give you an ounce of their time.; If you take a medication that you cannot go without for a day, DO NOT USE THIS PHARMACY. They are so disorganized that my medications are never filled on time. They will absolutely leave you hanging with no medication. Prescriptions are often delayed with no action taken by the employees. The only way to get your prescriptions filled is to call. If your medication is out of stock, they will not order it for you or even tell you, until you call.

Of course, calling means waiting on hold for 10-60 minutes, only to be treated like an inconvenience and be transferred around.

I have tried to be patient with these people. Their employees are disorganized, rude, and condescending. Walgreens has used their monopoly power to ruin local pharmacy care.; Update: Within hours of posting this review the pharmacy flat-out cancelled my order- I immediately called and inquired why, and was advised yet again that it was out of stock and they would not be requesting shipment. I told the supervisor that I have a voicemail, email, and two call logs where I was told this was being ordered and would be ready tomorrow, and she said that was false information and to go elsewhere. I asked why this would not have been disclosed a week ago when the RX was sent to them and she stated she does not work every day and is not responsible for what was relayed to me previously. I’m truly mortified by the blatant lies and disrespect from this facility, never in my life have I experienced this kind of treatment from a pharmacy.
—
This is the most deplorable pharmacy location I’ve ever had to rely on for prescriptions- like other reviewers have stated they are constantly making critical errors and have zero empathy for the delays that coincide. I had a prescription sent by my provider on a Thursday morning- as per usual with this location I immediately received notice that it was out of stock, and they would have to order supplies. The following business day I received a call from an actual tech that my prescription would be ready Monday. Monday morning comes around, suddenly the prescription is marked “delayed per insurance issue”- I knew for a fact this wasn’t correct as I’ve had this pharmacy fill this exact medication before. I personally call their extension, am put on a rotational hold for over thirty minutes just to be told the previous person that worked my order not only failed to actually ORDER it, but also incorrectly entered my insurance. I relayed to the tech that I am a day shy of being out of my meds, and she coldly responded there was nothing she could do. I asked if they would call when it was received, to which she smugly replied “well it seems you get our notifications since you called”. Anyone that requires medication to stay alive/stay out of the ER, PLEASE do not trust these people with your care. When this order is complete I will be transferring all prescriptions elsewhere.

Reviews: Very nice convenience store. They have just about everything considering that it's such a small building. They're well organized and completely stocked. Not like these other convenience stores where as the shelves are empty. The staff is very friendly and kind and boasted of having Christmas bags during the holiday season. So even Christmas shopping is available during the Christmas rush. Prices are pretty reasonable. I don't think they have a restroom considering that many of these small stores don't. However they do get a lot of business. They are centrally located on W Cocopah Street and South 15th Ave. I give this door five stars simply because they are very neat clean, professional and fully stocked. 👍; This store is a hidden gem in the heart of Phoenix. It's a small grocery store with a big heart. It has a little bit of everything at very reasonable prices. The owner is often seen working in the store and welcoming customers. If you're in the area, I recommend Family Market over any convenience store around. You won't be disappointed.; This store opens at 6am closes at 10pm they have a lot of varietys of your everyday wants and needs including food and household items dog food ,grills,etc it's worth it since their our no major stores in the neighborhood I would definitely recommend coming here you won't be disappointed ..; I searched and searched everywhere for the lowest price on a gass refill canister for my one burner butane gas stoves went to Walmart the first time for one but this time they didn't have any. Then I found Family market on the web $2.94 including the tax. I called ahead a very nice sounding lady gave me the price. And I was on my way. I didn't have a chance to look around as soon as I walked in and asked for the refill can for a stove they knew what it was and about 5 seconds later I already payed and I was out the door. Thanks for being there; This is the cleanest, best stocked and safest neighborhood store I've ever seen.

Reviews: For some reason I seem to have the right to head straight for the soda aisle when there is a wide variety of well stocked alcohol and wine selection to choose from...between the four or so aisles in the Liquor store...In which I choose what path I take that day...All I have is one word... Cold...Cold...Cold... beer to choose from at your discretion... and please take your time because after that you have a variety of Cigars to choose from as well as many snacks and candies...all is well that ends well...From the thought... to the drive...to entering the Liquor Store...getting what you want...to the significance others's choice...the kids candies.. and finally the trip home that was well worth it...Happy Trails...and when all is said and done...Don't forget to pay the cashier...; We love valley! We love the owner Frank he is such a kind, sweet, friendly person! He goes out of his way to help people and always has a smile :) Great selection too!; Frank the owner is very friendly. Prices are good. I like the selection. On occasion I’ll try wine at a restaurant and want to buy for my house. If he doesn’t have the wine in stock he’ll order a box of 12 bottles for a fair price. His service and friendliness keep me purchasing there. I walk right past the supermarkets liquor section because I like supporting local business and I prefer doing business with Frank; Great selection of craft beer. However, we were disappointed that one of the packs of craft beer we bought had expired over 2 years ago. Took it back, and they were great! No questions asked, and were very nice and gracious with the return. Will be back.!; The best store in yuma by far the best selection and personnel their its like a mom and pa store they have pride of ownership, you cant find a better place! if they dont have it you can ask ferris and he will order your selection and carry a small selection for you, and more if it sells well!

Reviews:
This store is kept clean and organized at the highest standard.

When shopping I found the items I needed without fidgeting other items. There are labels showing of which size and brand.

The place is calm, no over shouting, people running or heavy crowd. The atmosphere is welcoming and gives you sigh or relief when shopping.

Cashier was excellent; showed firm posture, welcoming smile, and well understood conversation.

I HIGHLY recommend this place.; I placed an order online at this tab location, once the order was placed I called to confirm the order because the process was very quick and it seemed a little odd. I spoke with a manager by the name of Thomas. He was very rude to me on the phone, all I had asked was if her could verify the order that I had placed online. He kept speaking over me and was very condescending. I was at the store within a few minutes, when I arrived I asked the person at the order pick up window if he could please verify my order. He was able to a very polite about it too. I asked to speak with Thomas, who again was very rude and defensive. All I had asked was how come he couldn’t verify my order. He then proceeded to talk over me and made me feel very uncomfortable. After I that I stayed to please leave me alone and I will wait for my order. He then proceed to keep berating me about the conversation and wouldn’t stop. He kept remarking about how smelt I front of the entire store. It was very embarrassing and I have never experienced it before in my life, especially by a member of your management. I asked how to identify him when I leave a review. He states “ I’m the only Thomas at this location covered in tattoos. I will never shop at Target again!; Walked into Target to purchase a few things for my new home I purchased. Within 5 minutes of being in the store, Khadigah, African-American female with black dreadlocks with blonde streaks asked me to leave the store. After she approached me, she then walked over to several other personnel to leave the store immediately. I do not know why any of us were asked to leave the store but approximately 11 people were asked to leave the store. An older gentleman approximately 55-60 was also asked to leave. Her exact words were on the radio, “I don’t know what these people are doing in my store but I’m mixing them all out because they looked suspicious.” She did not ask approximately 7 other people she walked by to leave. I’m extremely disappointed with this interaction with his Target. I will not be coming again and I’m highly upset that I was told to leave and was unable to complete collecting the things I added to my shopping cart in the app before being told to leave the store. The rest of the employees were respectful, but Khadigah was extremely rude.; Love shopping here. It's always so clean 😍.  Top it off you have Starbucks ,too. Enjoying my refresher drinks or ice cold coffee as I'm shopping. I'm even happier cuz I even enjoy groceries, clothing, kitchen and etc. So convenient for me. Saves me time and I don't need to go anywhere else. 😉; First let me say that as of mid October 2022 the parking lot is a mess of chain link fencing blocking off almost half the front parking area while they do some kind of update or repairs or something. At low volume times for shopping this won't be a big deal, but any other times it is nutty trying to get a spot very close to the door.
Next I will say, all right, it's Target. They have the stuff from their weekly ads plus many of your household staples. The store seems clean and organized, but like almost every Target I've been to in the last 6 months, there are so many empty shelves and so many times I use the Target app and it says what I want is in stock, and I go to the aisle it should be on, but it's not there. Sold out, out of stock. This happened to me in 3 different states in the month of October alone, so I guess that's just how it is these days. Even so, kinda bugs me to drive out there and blam, no thingamajig or whatsit. I don't want to mail order my supplies for daily living.  Sometimes I need them today!
Now how about something good? They had plenty of carts and hand carry shopping baskets and they were fairly clean. They have self-checkout and real cashiers. I love browsing the clearance racks. This time I didn't even need to, though, because I found some lovely $5 women's everyday wear t-shirts, soft fabric and nice colors. Had to get two. Upon checking out with the real cashier person, I was asked if I had a phone number to type in for loyalty rewards, but when I said no, there wasn't any uncomfortable insistence that I sign up for their plan. I loved that. I get sick of handing out my data like lollipops.
Overall, a solid 4 stars, going up to 5 stars when the parking lot is fixed and when they tackle supply chain issues or stop saying they have stuff laying around to buy when actually they don't.
