Reviews: Manager Denise is disgraceful, and needs proper training on the different payment types that are accepted at Walmart and how they work. How can you accuse someone of stealing and after it turns out your wrong, you don't apologize? Even after you have held the accused against their will for an hour and ripped open each of their grocery bags? Not to mention embarrassed someone who already has social anxiety and was just trying to get some quick groceries for her baby? And to top it off, after you realized they did not steal, you follow them out to their car so they still look like a criminal when YOU were in the wrong? As a nurse, do you know what kind of set back you just caused this person mentally? To be held, and aggressively accused while surrounded by three individuals? For some people with this mental illness it can take years to take a big step like shopping on your own. What kind of training does Walmart provide their managerial employees? Discriminating against someone who has to use EBT assistance is pitiful to say the least. Struggling to make ends meet is already hard enough without people like Manager Denise on the loose. Just because you have the title of manager, it does not allow you to treat people the way you did tonight. A complaint against Manager Denise has been made to corporate and hopefully Walmart will take this matter seriously or a lawsuit for pain and suffering may need to be made based on manager Denise's negligence this evening.; Well stocked and has everything you'd hope for a super walmart.  I must say the self check out lines can be terribly long during times and it's quite frustrating when you only have one human operated register. Wish when it was busy they'd have more staff use them and then slower times let the self check ours handle the load but other than that, it's pretty much Walmart; Dear Walmart, produce has never really been your thing. Don’t charge Good money for bad produce.; Absolutely great service. Got all four new tires estimated wait time was an hour and a half mm they did it in 30 minutes. I will be making this location my store even though I live 30 minutes away.; Not sure if the kid was new but my order got messed up 3 times. Ordered my stuff to realize he didn't get all of my order so had to order again. Then I said I didn't get my lemonade, it's because he didn't put it on my second order, so I had to order again. Ugh hopefully next time I go , itll be smoother. The fries are amazing

Reviews:
I am SO tired of never having someone to help you check your items out!! It's ALWAYS an excuse of being "short staffed" too, and they couldn't care less to try!! I am SHORT STAFFED at my work all the time as well, but it doesn't mean customers are left to CONSTANTLY HELP THEMSELVES. We work harder and faster to TRY!! Thankfully another CUSTOMER helped me, (MUCH more than any employee) with tired, hungry little kids! So disappointed in how Walmart has become less & less customer friendly, helpful, and CARING!!; It's a Walmart what can I say? They got cute stuff sometimes; I recently visited the Apache Junction Walmart and my experience was fairly average, leading me to give it a 3-star rating.

On the positive side, the store has a wide variety of products and competitive prices, which is always a plus. I was able to find most of the items on my shopping list without much hassle. The layout of the store is fairly straightforward, making it easy to navigate.

However, I did encounter some issues during my visit. The checkout lines were longer than expected, and it seemed like there weren’t enough cash registers open, which led to a frustrating wait. Additionally, I noticed that some shelves were not well-stocked, particularly in the grocery section, which was disappointing.

The staff I interacted with were polite, but there was a noticeable lack of assistance available on the floor. I had a couple of questions about product locations, and it took some time to find someone who could help.

Overall, while the Apache Junction Walmart has potential and offers great products at reasonable prices, they could improve on customer service and stock management. I hope my next visit will be a better experience!; It was ok but no cart available for the handicapped.  Then we cut our shopping short because of that n then NO people to check ya out we had to go to self check out. I do not do that. If I want a job to do that then I would get one but I don't. I'm retired n will not check my self out.  If the guy at the self check out wouldn't check me out I would have walked out n left it all there.; Self checkout "clerk" accused my wife of theft/deception. She buys the same produce every week. She was accosted by the "clerk" and said she did not even look up the item. She has a memory longer than a piss-ant. Open up the checkout lanes and stop employing low hanging fruit to just "observe and accuse". I'd like to see him try that with me!

Name: Walmart Supercenter
Address: 41650 W Maricopa-Casa Grande Hwy, Maricopa, AZ 85138, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 41650 (street_number); West Maricopa-Casa Grande Highway (route); Maricopa (locality); Pinal County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85138 (postal_code)
Reviews:
It’s a Walmart. Lots of different things. Can get busy. Staff are generally friendly. Some good bargains. Great variety. Has obscure things you may be looking for, sometimes you just have to ask as they may not be in obvious locations (or that could just be me). Depending on who you ask you can ask a staff member who is encyclopaedic about where everything is. Bonus!!; Walmart in Maricopa is a well-stocked and clean store, providing a good shopping experience that meets expectations. The store is always busy, being the only Walmart in town, which speaks to its popularity and convenience.

While I haven't had much interaction with the employees, the overall shopping experience has been positive. Notably, Dickey's Barbecue Pit inside the store has closed, though it wasn't a favorite of mine anyway.

In summary, Walmart Maricopa offers a reliable and efficient shopping experience, providing a wide range of products in a clean and organized environment.; Went in to this location 9/12/24 with $26 in rolled coins (2) $10 rolls, (1) $5 roll & (2) .50 rolls. Paid for my items at the register with no problem. A older woman of color was working. Went back in 9/13/24 to purchase something for my child that totalled $23 & again wanted to use rolled coins. This time a non woman of color was working and told me they can't take rolled coins. I asked why not as I just used rolled coins the previous night. She went to get a manager also another woman not of color and I was told I had to PAY to use the coin star machine to then get cash to turn around and pay for my items. I asked why and she said they get Canadian coins and have never taken rolled coins it's always been store policy which is untrue. Then I proceeded to unroll the roll of quarters to show her it is American currency and in fact the correct amount in the roll. She then say I still can't accept this. I ask why not & she says because we don't accept change. So first you wouldn't take my money because it was rolled, then you wouldn't take it because it may be Canadian, then you wouldn't take it because it was change all together. She then says with an attitude fine I'll take it this one time and walks away from the register. I'm standing there looking around and she comes back and tells me I can only use it in the self checkout lane. Another worker who was Hispanic and very nice suggested that once she heard the manager tell me no but I didn't want to hold up the line putting coins in the machine one by one because only 4 out of the 8 self checkout machines were working the other 4 had out of order signs on them. I did end up using the machine because it was my last resort. I need someone to help me understand what was the difference between taking my money at the register and it taking 1-2 minutes for the transaction vs refusing me and making me hold up the line in self checkout. I spent the same exact coins, I spent the same amount of money, it's all going to the same exact place at the end of the night. Terrible customer service. Literally the worst Walmart experience ever.; The manager sucks!!! The store is dirty! They have frozen ice cream cakes that are already half melted, still trying to sell. Frozen fish case has frost outside of doors. Most employees are rude. They stock shelves during business hours.  They are always out of stock of affordable grocery products. Please take those online order employees out of customers' way. We are the customer, not them. They just push customers out of way with those big carts. Go shop in Casa Grande, now they have a good manager that keeps their store well stocked and very clean. Maybe they need to bring in a manger that cares and get rid of the worthless one they have now. He needs to put his Doritos down and get to work. Save your time and go elsewhere.; Associate was the most unfriendly person. Never smiled or uttered anything. No HELLO nothing.
I had arranged my merchandise accordingly on the belt. Keeping cans together and cold items together to help the scanning process. She put chips with canned good so I ended up with crumbs. Did not keep cold items together to help them stay cool on the commute home. I LIVE IN ARIZONA. Hello!!!!!!!!!!
Only put 4 cans per bag/2 boxes of pasta per bag.

I normally use self checkout because I don’t like standing in long lines but Walmart has changed the policy of 15 items or less for self checkout. AND IM OK with that. That’s how it should be. I was actually stocking up on stuff due to the strike at the shipping ports and was happy to go to a cashier.

Since our move to Arizona I have been doing most of my shopping at Fry’s because they have some really great deals. I almost exclusively shopped at Walmart prior to our move and know that some items are priced better at Walmart. But never have been so disappointed and irritated by a cashier before that I felt compelled to voice my frustration.
NO THANK YOU. NOTHING!!!!!!!

I’ve been in retail management for 20 years and this is TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE

Name: Walmart Supercenter
Address: 1060 S Watson Rd, Buckeye, AZ 85326, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 1060 (street_number); South Watson Road (route); Sundance (neighborhood); Buckeye (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85326 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This Walmart needs help. The ice cream case needs defrosting and the staff needs trained on how to wipe down registers in between customers. Not just stand and talk. Customer service went down hill.; This is not an exaggeration, I waited for 3 hours at the Walmart pick up for 14 items. I was picking up an order for my mom so I didn’t know how small the order was until it was eventually brought out. I got there right at 5 when my order should have been ready and we got told that they were so behind on picking it would be an hour wait, that we should go home and come back. We don’t live in buckeye so that’s not an option for us. After 2 hours the team lead tells us that the 5 people she had picking all went to lunch at the same time so they hadn’t even started our order yet. Idk why she couldn’t go and get the 14 items. It was after 8 o’clock they brought out the order, it was only 2 totes! I asked “is that really it?” And they didn’t answer me just said thanks and ran inside. I checked and they didn’t even get the order right, I had to call and have them come back. The team lead admits she saw them bring the wrong item yet she still let them bring it to me??? She was able to walk into the store and bring the two correct items, why was the associate not able to get the correct items if the team lead found them so quickly? The entire 3 hours we had to sit there and wait every other car that came received their order and got to leave. There was multiple moments that we would be the only car in the pick up area. If I had known how small the order was or if they would actually give you your money back right away I would’ve had my mom cancel the order; I could’ve gone inside and grabbed those items in 10 minutes. I don’t understand why it was so hard to get my order or how it could possibly take that long then to not even get it correct is crazy. I asked if there was anything we could receive to make up for this and she tells me she needs to find a coach, don’t you think you should have gotten them after the first hour, or the second hour, or the third hour. She tells us there’s nothing they can do, to call the store in the morning and ask for Chad. I tried and kept getting the run around. It was the most ridiculous experience I’ve ever had.; Update: 05/11 and 05/13
Still a great customer service department. Very understanding and considerate. Had an issue with an online order pickup and they gave me the wrong item and Customer Service took care of it immediately. 🤙🏼

Great Customer Service. Not a big Walmart, but decent size to go shopping from automotive to groceries. Great neighborhood stop. Only open until 10PM, so get there early.

Update: 07/28/2023.
Been trying the curbside pickup service for a few months now and it's been going well. The service and staff are also great. Polite, courteous, helpful in bringing out your order.; I really do enjoy shopping at this Walmart location (Watson Rd & Yuma)!
I have very rarely had to do without an item because the employees here keep things stocked up.
On the occasion I cannot find what I am looking for, I'll ask an employee.  They are always willing to help me locate it and one even helped me order it for delivery.; Took my 5 year old with me today to do our regular grocery shopping,  and as usual, we grabbed everything we needed and went to self checkout (because you have to) , which I absolutely hate! Who wants to scan and bag all their own groceries? Anyhow, I always scan the big stuff that doesn't fit into bags last because it makes it easier for the people at the door to find it on the receipt (cases of water, soda, laundry soap, etc.). The lady who was at the door (I wish I would have gotten her name) was absolutely the sweetest! She gave my daughter a sticker and then gave her this bracelet! My daughter was so happy! This lady just made my 5 year old the happiest little girl in the world today! Thank you to whoever you are!

Name: Target
Address: 16806 N 7th St, Phoenix, AZ 85022, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 16806 (street_number); North 7th Street (route); Deer Valley (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85022 (postal_code); 2662 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
I have always loved this Target and find the staff to be very helpful and friendly until last week when I needed to return an item that I had purchased in two different sizes for my son. I rarely return things, but I did have my receipt showing the purchase was split in half between a gift card and my Target red card, which I preferred the return to my Target red card.  I was told I had to have it back on a gift card so I said okay well is there a manager I can speak with because I'm sure that that can be done. The manager Maddie was firm on no we cannot give it back to your red card it must be a gift card even though it was a split tender on the receipt.  When I asked to speak with someone higher than her, that is then when she said she can make a one-time exception, which she could have very well done in the first place.  I find it odd she could do it when I asked to speak to a higher manager.  Because of the attitude and tone she used and the poor way she handled the situation, Target has just lost a very long- term customer and Red card holder.  If I ever shop at Target again, it definitely won't be this location.; We have been shopping at this location since it was just a Target, sans SuperCenter. Recently, Target invested in Smart Carts, most likely to combat theft. It is completely understandable, however, the new carts are not built for people who are under five feet tall. The clerks have been so kind in trying to get the carts to work for me, but there is a design flaw. After leaving in tears last week from having to walk through the whole store on a recently replaced knee, I entered the store yesterday to find one of the routine carts available. I don’t know if it was in response to my issue, but it was a kindness I greatly appreciated.; Was a great location until socks, face wash and a million other things became locked behind plexiglass. I don’t want to wait 10 minutes for a customer service rep to come unlock something, then again for the next item because you don’t want to hire more security.; Large store with a massive selection of many products with excellent every day deals. Having the Target Circle Rewards is another benefit to doing your shopping that will save you money over time. The toys/collectibles always are picked over and gone through. The toy lady with the curly hair sets aside cases on her cart for dealers/scalpers of the newest, highly sought-after items. It's really disappointing because it's not fair to the other customers. There's always a good selection of merchandise, store is clean and employees are friendly & helpful, especially the cashiers when coupons don't scan or there's an overcharge. I wish they would open more registers. Sometimes it gets really busy and the self checkout line is a mile long and there's only 1 or 2 registers out of the 20 or so that are closed.; I am in a leg cast and when I went into store yesterday there were no wheelchairs. A man working at guest relations went to other side and drove one down for me. Very nice. He said “if the battery runs or when your shopping let a team member know and we will bring you another”.
I shopped for probably about 20 minutes and then worst scenario happened. I had three bars of battery to dead in a matter of a few minutes so no time to anticipate it.
I tried to make it over to one of the red towers to use the phone but no phone in the tower.
I used my cell phone which was also almost dead and called front desk. The man who helped me earlier answered and said someone would bring me a new one.
I waited 15 mins and called back. No one answers after long time of ringing. I called again and the man answered again but didn’t greet me. He said “we are working on getting you a wheelchair” I said ohh did you run out? He said yeah, I said if someone could please bring me a regular cart so I am not stranded here that would be appreciated.
I waited another 15 mins.  No one came. I left on my own. I noticed when I was passing by guest relations there were two people standing there talking with no customers in line. Why couldn’t someone bring me a cart?? I had to hobble out of there in my leg cast.

Name: Walmart Neighborhood Market
Address: 2175 W Ruthrauff Rd, Tucson, AZ 85705, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 2175 (street_number); West Ruthrauff Road (route); Tucson (locality); Pima County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85705 (postal_code)
Reviews:
When I recently visited my local Walmart, I was thoroughly impressed by the exceptional level of customer service I received. From the moment I stepped through the automatic doors, the store's employees were attentive and eager to assist me with any needs I might have. The greeter at the entrance warmly welcomed me and asked if I was able to find everything I was looking for, setting a friendly and helpful tone right off the bat. As I navigated the aisles, I encountered multiple Walmart associates proactively inquiring if I needed any guidance or had questions about locating specific items. They were knowledgeable about the store's layout and inventory, and gladly escorted me to the products I was searching for. At the checkout, the cashier was courteous and efficient, quickly ringing up my purchases while engaging me in pleasant conversation. Even the bagger was meticulous in carefully packing my bags to ensure nothing was damaged. Throughout my entire shopping experience, I was struck by the genuine kindness, competence, and customer-centric attitudes displayed by every Walmart employee I interacted with. It was clear they took great pride in providing superior service, creating an enjoyable and hassle-free experience that has left me eager to return to this Walmart location again in the future.; Great store... clean, well- stocked,  and staffed with kind, helpful, caring employees. Excellent prices and great service make it my go-to place to shop. Thank you all!; The crew has always been polite and helpful.
It does suck that corporate chose to go full self check out with this store. Staff cannot help that though.
The staff are great it's easy to find what I need.; Beginning to also close 15 minutes early. I understand you can’t control the people get $100 cart fulls after close , but you can’t cut off store hours. Walmart needs to figure it out. “My cashiers NEED to leave” I heard the lady half yelling at a man at the door…. It’s self checkout , babe. It’s a store. There’s full store hours. There’s not a “last call” on a store like a restaurant. Covid hours need to be fixed.; My husband hates that it's fully self check out! We are also not happy with their fried chicken that was barely chicken it was mostly breading! We probably will never go back to this store!

Reviews:
This place has all you are looking for. Great prices and staff are always there to help u. Ask what u want, and they do the rest. Thank u.; Very clean place. The store is fully stocked up. Sometimes they have promotions & will give out sample taste. They staff are very polite and helpful.; Bad Customer Service!
After explaining to the manager that the wine that we bought was bad (tasted like vinegar), she refused to exchanged the other 2 bottles we bought and we did not opened!  We have been loyal customers and although this has happened before, we continued to buy from here (since it is a local business).  We won’t buy from here again!!! Don’t buy wine from here!!! If it is bad, they won’t work with you to enjoy a good glass of wine, even if you expended your hard-earned money with this liquor store.  Bad management!!!; Great store they have just about what you need if not just ask you’ll be happy with staff results; This will be the only place I buy liquor from in the Bronx! This place is beautiful! It’s like walking into an apple store. You don’t know where your eyes want to go first, everything is organized, the store is bright and well lit, the customer service is A1. As I glanced around in wonder one of the store clerks asked if I was looking for something in particular and then gave me some recommendations based on my answer. I really like this store!

Reviews:
AVOID AT ALL COST. Just moved to this neighborhood and came to browse the selection. The woman(owner?) at the register LITERALLY LEANED INTO MY CHEST TO LOOK AT MY PHONE. When I turned the screen away from her she stood between me and the shelves and blocked me from viewing the selection.

She said "YOU BUY?!" and then turned the bottles and boxes down so that I couldn't see them. At this point I left because she gave me no reason to stay and support her local business like I wanted to do. I went to another liquor store a block away (82-71 Broadway liquor), and made my purchase there. They had much better customer service. (ie, knew basic basic manners)

I will not be returning, there are plenty of cheaper and better serviced liquor stores in the area.; Woman at the register was very rude and unaccommodating, didn't like it when I asked questions about the selection, and was very pushy.

Take your business elsewhere.; Dope spot, nice staff and always stocked; The landlady is very enthusiastic and so is the boss

Reviews:
Best customer service!; Have been in this store multiple times to order my select brand.  Lady there is very helpful & polite.  Unfortunately there has always been a balding man that us argumentative & rude, has no customer skills!  This place has order sheets that the lady helped fill out to process my order however it was never ordered by management & then argued that I never ordered it!  I took my business to the other liquor store 500 yards further into Gordonsville!!  They carry my brand and are very friendly & beautiful store!; LADIES BEWARE!! Wanted to leave zero stars but has to add one to leave this review.This was the worst liquor store experience. We decided to stop here due to the convenience of it being next door to the gas station. But more importantly.. my sister and I were followed by a man who was sitting in the parking lot in a older Pontiac Bonneville (license plate
Y00 68A). I believe he accompanying to the bald "creepy man" who worked there. He not only stared us down as we exited the store but stalked us when we were at the gas station and proceeded to followed us out of the parking lot into a different gas station down the street (as we were being cautious and wanted to be in a more public place). Luckily we trusted our gut and got away safe but wanted to share with others. Be on high alert if you HAVE to stop here. I recommend going somewhere else, the selection for wine was minimal anyway.; A great place to restock your needs. Owener and staff are great, and Charlie the ninja chihuahua is always on the job.; Great selection on hand if Jonny doesn't have your brand on hand he works to get what your looking for, great customer service.

I came on my 21st birthday (august 4th) to get alcohol for my party and after i had everything at the counter the man refused to sell to me because i just turned 21…. Makes absolutely no sense. I 100% recommend this place of business!; I ordered a bottle to be delivered to a friend as a surprise gift -- I know nothing about SI, and found their store online. Reviews: Excellent customer service from Ash!!  I placed my first online order with the shop earlier this week early Tuesday afternoon.  I was looking for a particular wine from the Azores and they were one of the few shops that had it.  Ash took the time to reach out to me that same day to let me know there was a vintage variation and to ask me if it was ok to substitute.  That was fantastic since I had asked for an overnight shipment as we were going to a wine tasting gathering on Friday with some of my WSET3 and WSET4 certified enthusiasts and colleagues on unique volcanic appellation wines and the Arinto was a perfect fit.  The wine showed up Thursday, in perfect shape and I am very looking forward to trying it and letting everyone know where i picked it up!  Thank you again Ash!  I'll be back!  Cheers!; Owners & staff are so welcoming. Wonderful people always helpful. Prices are very affordable; They had EVERY whiskey you would ever want but at extremely marked up, predatory, immoral prices. Especially the lady at the register is someone you wouldnt want to even talk to... She is very nasty, rude and disrespectful. If a customer is asking you a simply question like,(do you have this liquor) your answer should not be (go look)..... Well at that time there was no other place open so i actually did go and find it myself. While atthe register waiting to pay i noticed the date on it had expired, when asked, she said (you no nothing no drinking you no understand) i guess she was trying to say its okey but i just walked out. It was the last time i went in there. The next day i went to the store next to key food and the employee or owner who ever it is was very nice and cared about the business i will give him. One other thing is, some of the reviews in here are from the owners im pretty sure, this place does not deserve more then 1 star, and thats for being open.......; The Lady or  Wife who works there never smiles never says Thankyou its like your doing her a favor, (dont like her) if you dont like your job ,hire a happy girl who talks to people. Has some special products especially when it comes to vegetables. Its good but not perfect. Lots of buses go nearby.; It's a good store all over the city and just ok. Still you can have a visit here.

Name: Kroger
Address: 2910 Center Ave, Essexville, MI 48732, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 2910 (street_number); Center Avenue (route); Essexville (locality); Bay County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 48732 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Kroger used to be my favorite store. They now never seem to have enough employees and nobody cares about doing any work. There were 12 people waiting in bottle returns and nobody would empty the machines. We kept calling the store to have someone empty the bins and all they did was go back and shake them and then they kept filling back up and no one would change them. Employees kept walking by and nobody did anything. I asked to speak to the manager at check out and he looked very sloppy and tried to blame it on the machines not working correctly and not enough staff. I can understand if they would have told us that but every time we saw someone they just said we will get someone and never did. I went again a week later and same issue. We also went to self check out and needed assistance and she was no where to be found. When she did come over she was laughing and didn’t care we had to wait. Service hasn’t been good at all lately. They need to make some changes.; I was over-charged twice on two items that were priced differently on the shelf. The self checkout anti-theft AI technology has gotten out of hand and the loud beeps, locking carts, and flagging of cashiers has become an unwelcome nuisance. No one wants to pay to shop where they are instantly an assumed thief, when in reality Kroger is the thief, displaying a different price on the shelf than at checkout. I am extremely happy that I will never have to shop here ever again or endure the embarrassment that comes with being a paying customer with Kroger.; So your trying to hitch up with Albertsons? Albertsons charges premium prices, which is why they're not around here in bay city , I lived in Denver and Albertsons was above my pay grade, so I shopped at King Soopers, which was very similar to Krogers , Save Alot  shopper now
or Aldi's; Are you aware that you have homeless
Folks parking overnight in vehicles
On your property , been going on for a few weeks a yellow s-10 - 4 door
A mini van , and some near O'Reilly's
Just so your aware; Use self checkout to ensure you're not being overcharged by cashiers who can't count.

Name: Walmart Supercenter
Address: 700 Mike's Pike St, Winslow, AZ 86047, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 700 (street_number); Mike's Pike Street (route); Winslow (locality); Navajo County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 86047 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Estella our cashier was cheerful, friendly, and just a joy to end our shopping trip talking with.  All the employees were friendly, helpful, and working hard to restock the store and put out new displays.  We shop here every time we go through town just for the wonderful employees even though the prices in town are a bit higher then other Walmarts.  The service is definitely worth our time and money. This Walmart also gets a lot of truck driver traffic and has great semi parking next door.  They cater to all shoppers.  Thank you!; Went to the deli to get some 2 pounds of sliced turkey. The gentleman that helped me was very quick. He had it sliced and packaged very quickly. He was also very polite and courteous. He. Had Avery professional attitude. Be nice to others. And they will be nice to you; I always stop at this Walmart in
Winslow, AZ when passing through because its not laid out cookie cutter style, it has more of a hometown feel to it with very friendly staff. A big shout out to Dawn and to Mia for being such great representatives in the self-checkout area.
Great customer service speaks volumes! Also, Lindsay with the great smile is a welcomed presence when i see her at the entry.
The store is not cluttered with pallets in the aisles or disorganized shelves, it's like a library EVEN WHILE THE STORE IS UNDERGOING MAJOR INTERIOR REMODELING.
The garden/seasonal area is always full of surprises which i love. The parking lot is super smooth with clearly marked handicapped parking, ADA compliant entryways, shopping, shelves, rest rooms and wide checkout aisles. Restrooms are very clean, nothing looks or feels dirty which is especially a big deal nowadays.
The shelf-stocking crew aren't afraid to leave what they're doing to assist or retrieve items from out back or on a high shelf. The shopping carts are clean and not all wobbly. I'm a big fan of the
self-checkout section vs the conveyor belt and clerk process as bagging my own items is important to me to ensure i have things packed/bagged to travel.
Love this crew, five stars!
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐; The prices are mostly more favorable than in Europe, and what made it a more positive experience was that the sellers could be found in the store and you didn't have to lasso them, like in a Hungarian hypermarket.  There were times when they came to help and give advice without being asked.  In many ways, it is different from Europe, Asia or Africa, but we were not disappointed.; The store is clean. The merchandise is usually in stock, and the staff is courteous and helpful, especially when I can’t find what I want to buy.  Sometimes the produce is moldy, but that occurs at all the other grocery stores in town, and they ask every time I shop for feedback about my visit and occasionally send email surveys for more feedback.

Name: Ensenada Vinos
Address: Av Adolfo López Mateos 1090-1, y, Castillo, Zona Centro, 22800 Ensenada, B.C., Mexico
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Vicinity: Av Adolfo López Mateos 1090-1, y, Castillo, Zona Centro, Ensenada
Address Components: Castillo (route); Zona Centro (sublocality_level_1); Ensenada (locality); Baja California (administrative_area_level_1); Mexico (country); 22800 (postal_code)
Reviews: Hands down one of the best experiences tasting wine I have ever had.  We were there on a cruise and randomly found this place.  It is about a 10-15 minute walk from the cruise terminal.  Raul who was the owner took us on a personal tour through the Ensenada wine country just by sitting there and tasting the wines.  No driving or expensive tour packages needed.  His knowledge of the region and what the makers have to offer are top notch.  Every bottle for sale in his shop are from local wineries.  My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed this and if we are ever in Ensenada again, we will be stopping by the shop.  Don't waste your time and money going on an excursion off the ship, I would head straight to Ensenada Vinos and enjoy your time there.; We just got back from a wonderful wine tasting experience with Raul. We lucked out, and got Raul and the place all to ourselves. I have done wine tastings before, but this was *by far* the best experience I have ever had. Raul knows so much about wine, and I loved that he had only local wines in his shop. We will definitely be back next time we’re in town. Raul made us feel like family, and we felt like we’d known him for years. I loved it and highly recommend it to anyone who wants to have a really personal wine tasting experience, and get to know the Ensenada wines.; Loved this wine tasting with Raul. He is well traveled well spoken and so very respectful. His knowledge and expertise is impeccable! We loved it. Wishing you many blessings and future blessings ! Thank you !! Aloha; Amazing wine and a very knowledgeable owner who spent a lot of time with us and taught us a lot about how to properly taste wine. The prices are very good for the quality of wine you get. Wish we would have this place locally!!; If you get the owner talking about wine by describing what flavors, aromas,  or production qualities you like,  he is extremely knowledgeable.   Don't expect him to expound spontaneously though.   Fair wine prices for Valle wines... this is a legit wine shoppe.

Reviews:
Limited selection, prices are $5-10 more than other stores for the same bottles, owner wasn’t rude to me but not friendly either, doesn’t take Amex, charges you for a bag and gives you a recycled crumple one, this I found funny more than anything. Conveniently located across an awesome supermarket which is the only reason I went in but wouldn’t come back.; Im not sure why anyone would give this woman any more than 1 star, perhaps they shop in an alternate universe? Singularly one of the rudest people I have met on the other side of the counter. I frequent this store regularly and she is also extremely racist. Not explicitly, but whenever a person of color enters, she follows them around the store. I shop there out of convenience since I dont have a car. I miss the previous storeowner, we were on first name terms. And yes, if you dont have cold hard cash - you WILL get that glare, and never ever try to tap your card or use a smartphone to pay.; I been going to this liquor store for almost two years now the Asian lady who works there is very rude and isn't willing to answer any questions regarding product that she may sell and I normally go there because it's convenient the supermarket is across the street and Dunkin donuts is on the corner so it saves me a drive down wood haven blvd or further up Austin Street to Forrest hills liquors where customer service is amazing and the staff is super friendly at the other liquor stores
So here's what happened
My wife and I recently gave birth to our 1st child last week Friday so her mom & dad came down from Massachusetts to help us with the baby and stay for a week
I went into 3 sun liquor to purchase two bottles of wine for her parents and 3 nips of rum chatta she was very rude and didn't help me with my wine purchase so I video called my in-laws via Whatsapp to show them the wine selection
After I paid she walks away from the counter so I say excuse me may I please have a bag she then sucks her teeth and says "you come to a store to shop with no bag! You're supposed to carry a recycling bag" So I responded very nicely im sorry but I didn't carry a bag so im going to need one . I told her I will pay for a bag she then replies only this time next time bring you're bag with you
After that experience there won't be a next time because she won't get my business ever again; The shop keeper is very rude. I was looking through the chilled wines and she was visibly annoyed and rather than offer to help she told me to close the refrigerator in a very nasty way. As a frequent customer I have never been greeeted or received warmly. I will not be returning. While the selction is decent I’d rather spend my time and money somewhere where customers are appreciated and customer service is provided. It’s a shame because the location is very convenient for me however I’d rather go out of my way for a more pleasant or at least halfway decent experience. I’d advise others to do the same.; I tried to buy a bottle of Marsala for cooking. It came up as $9.79. When I handed over my credit card I was told there is a $15 minimum for credit cards. I asked where the sign was which stated that, the woman told that they don’t have one. I think she was making it up. For what reason I don’t know, she lost a sale and the business lost a customer.
For much better service, better selection and reasonable prices go to the The Wine Room of Forest Hills on 69 Ave between Groton and Harrow.

Reviews:
Best price on vapes in sparks or reno. They are absolutely chill people. I’ve been to many shops and by far this the best overall store to check out. Plenty more than just vapes of course. They got cool water pipes and smoke accessories too. Check them out!; BEST smoke shop in the whole area!! I drive from Fernley specifically to get my vapes here. The experience has always been, seriously so great! I am always greeted warmly by the guys working there, the prices are unbeatable and the fantastic service makes my day!; This review would have zero stars if it could.
I’ve come to this store for years for misc. reasons, but specially for the 2 for 40$ vapes. I get one for myself & one for my wife, every few days, and I only bring my business here. I had an issue with one that tasted burnt out when I got it home to my wife, and all the owner would do is give me 3$ off my next one. Fast forward to now, since last Friday I’ve purchased 3 vapes all not working. & although they lead you to believe that if you try it in the store, if it doesn’t work they will exchange it.. that’s a LIE. This man really said, maybe if you have an issue you should call the manufacturer? They think just because you blow the smoke out, that it’s working fine and doesn’t warrant an exchange. The coil is burnt out!! The products are faulty!! I don’t want no hand outs or freebies I just want the product I’m buying for almost $25 to WORK. & if it doesn’t, swap it. Not even asking for my money back just a working product. The owner will laugh in your face and could care less about your business.. so maybe word of mouth will step on their pockets a little just like they did mine. They treated me like I’m incompetent and delusional.. . It’s truly disappointing.; If you're looking for a wide selection of high-quality spirits, look no further than this liquor store. From rare and hard-to-find bottles to everyday favorites, they have it all.

What sets this store apart is their knowledgeable and friendly staff. They are always willing to offer suggestions and help you find exactly what you're looking for. Their customer service is truly top-notch.

In addition, the store is always clean and well-organized, making it easy to find what you need. And their prices are very reasonable, especially considering the quality of their selection.

Overall, I highly recommend this liquor store to anyone in the area. Whether you're a connoisseur or just looking for a good bottle of wine for dinner, you won't be disappointed with what they have to offer.; Great glass selection. Bought a small glass piece, hard to do, because they had so many nice ones to chose from! I use it everyday and plan to come back and buy more! Also great carts at low prices, and a good selection of flavors! The staff are always very helpful and ready to serve!

Cash register runs things for more than they are listed at on display. Overall they charged me $8 more than advertised.; I have lived in Sparks since '07. I rarely take the time to write a review for anyone. This, I think, is a good reason to write one. On February 3, 2022, my girl and I were headed home and decided to stop at S Mart to grab a couple of things. As we pulled up, the 'OPEN' sign was being turned off. It was just after 10pm and they close at 10pm. We were kind of bummed but sat in front of the store debating where to go instead. Right as I said, "Well you know he isn't going to let us in there." The guy that was closing and locking up, waved his hand in a motion letting  us know to come in. He surprised the hell out of me. He could easily have left and not said a word. Instead he had the courtesy to allow us to come in and purchase what we needed. I still can't stop being amazed at this. We live in a time where people rarely go out of their way for strangers and I appreciate his time and kindness. I had never had a bad experience at this store anyway, but that was far from what I expected. On another occasion a few years ago, I needed to use Western Union and the owner was there. He took care of me and told me if I ever was in need of using Western Union in the future. He said that if he was not at the store to have his employee call him and he would come to the store right away to take care of me. Nice guy who obviously hire nice people to work for him. The store is in the parking lot at Los Altos and Vista.; These guys scammed us. They charged us $18 for 6 pack of Long Drinks when it should have been $10-$12. They just lost us as customers for a lousy $6 bucks. Also, their customer service is horrible. There is a reason why Stereotypes are funny.; this liquor is ripp of people with very high price olmost double with every product

Great service great selection great recommendations. Hey so try it out see what you think, and go away with a smile.; What a great store! My friend and I stopped in to find a few things for a wedding and STEVE saved the day. Steve helped us find everything we needed. He was so helpful and fun to shop with. I wish we could have taken Steve back to St. Louis with us! He was the best. The selection at this store is really excellent. And the Frank Sinatra tunes playing overhead didn’t hurt either. I am so so glad we stopped into this store. Thank you, Steve!

Name: Walgreens
Address: 2610 E Rte 66, Flagstaff, AZ 86004, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 2610 (street_number); East Route 66 (route); Flagstaff (locality); Coconino County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 86004 (postal_code)
Reviews:
POOR SERVICE AT CHECK OUT.
I was checking out. The heavey set blonde haired guy with the long pony tail tried to throw me out of the store and refused to serve me. It was over revealing my personal information to him.

I gave him an old ID. He said," I can't used this."
As I searched foe the current id, I said, "I would rather you not see my personal information as to why I gave it."

He looked me up and down rolling his eyes with fury and said, "I am DONE with you. Get out!" And took the item from me and would not serve me. "You can get another to serve you!" So I tried to reach for the item. He yelled, "DO NOT TOUCH THAT ITEM!" And shooed me away from him as if he was a royal and I was a peasant to him. Is he Henry VIII? He sure does act like it.

I had to go back to the isle and get another and then find another associate to help me. It was so embarrassing
The line was full. Nobody in the line spoke up for me. All kept silent and waited to be served by him.

Another woman who was stocking in the rear came up and helped me with no issue and apologized to me. She gave me contact info to file a complaint.

All I did was tell him that I didn't want him to see my personal info while I was searching for the current ID. It was so embarrassing and I will not allow him to serve me ever again.  I will always request someone else as he ordered! I don't obey people like him. I avoid them. DRAMA!; Worst customer service ever.  One guy even said I don't have time to help you.  Online it says Walgreens carries purpose cleansing bar.  They have no clue if they carry it and were unwilling to look.  It was like a scene out of worst jobs ever.; This is the best Walgreens for me, because the staff is actually incredible. I wish I knew their names, but the lady from the east coast in the makeup department is great, the black man as a cashier is so genuine and funny, and the young white gentleman at the photo department was so pleasant. I felt at home and was able to get everything I needed and more on multiple occasions. I didn’t feel rushed, or like I couldn’t enjoy myself at Walgreens services. Maybe I can find their names out and re edit this. Anyway, it’s been like 3 years I’ve been coming here at the employees have really come together at this location, I’m happy for y’all.; I scheduled a COVID vaccination online and when I showed up, they didn't have vaccine. Their online corporate infrastructure is out of sync with the people on the ground. Go somewhere else for services.; Absolutely horrible customer service. Called this morning at 8:30am to have my son's mandatory prescription refilled was told they would have it ready in 2 hours. Got there at 3:45 pm today.  They still don't have the prescription ready. Said I need to come back at 5.
They literally put meds from a bigger bottle into a smaller bottle. What's the hold up?
Save your time and go someplace else. Working with docs now to send any and all prescriptions to another pharmacy. Screw Walgreens.

Not good customer service beer half drank and they wanted to cha he me for it. Brought a bottle from the fridge. Where the price was $9. She wanted to charge me $14 for it. Reviews: The store is always stocked with everything I want and need. I love this place ❤️!!! The owner and Tom are just awesome!!! I will always come to this place everyday after work; Friendly liquor store. Sonny always in a good mood; Is really unfortunate when you go into a place, maybe you haven't had the best day not the worst but definitely not all that great and you try to spark up a conversation with somebody just to feel human, and they flat-out ignore you in order to move on and help the next person. I understand having the flow of business but you can't have a three-second conversation with the person who just handed money to you and supported your life. It seems as though a lot of businesses are ending up that way right now I don't think there's any excuse for it. When things get worse on this planet we should all get better towards each other there is no sense in adding to the destruction of this world with your hatred and with your nasty attitude. So when you read this man who is exceptionally rude and knows exactly who I am just remember that you are what's wrong with this world.; Friendly atmosphere, great prices, professionally run. They were fast and helpful! Other CVS locations were out of a medication I needed. It’s impossible to talk with a CVS pharmacist when calling (you have to leave a message), but they were super quick to return my call, confirm my medication, and had it ready in less than an hour.; We have gotten to a point in time where people in customer service are so wildly incompetent, its easier to become loyal to another business than deal with a pharmacy technician than insists your prescription doesnt exist. I stopped wondering a long time ago why CVS as a business model barely stays afloat.; Much more helpful than the pharmacy on Mill & Univ, only go here now. Staff are friendly; pharmacist Omar is v helpful and knowledgeable. He and the others are just too busy sometimes; otherwise, excellent; Elizabeth is an excellent pharmacist. I showed up at 6 pm and they close then on weekends. Instead of turning me away she helped me and I was able to get my antibiotic prescription. Normally people would be jerks and say come back tomorrow. She was so kind and I will forever appreciate her kindness.; Experienced slow waiting time for vaccination jabs. Appointment was set at 1230pm but I had to sit for at least half an hour with no indication of why.

Why do appointment times if they aren't respected?

Name: CVS Pharmacy

Reviews: My CVS is critical to my health care and overall well being.  I would not be able to function at a high level without them.  They not only stay on top of my meds, but my shot record as well.  CVS is an integral part of my life.; Drive through for pharmacy was long, so went into the store. Everyone was very nice and polite, offered me assistance though it was not needed. Pharmacy was busy but I was helped quickly and smoothly.; I meant to write this sooner. On New Year’s Day my usual CVS was supposed to be filling my very important prescription. I got a call from them saying that the pharmacist didn’t feel comfortable filling it. She didn’t like the way it was written. I was freaking out but called 99th Ave and Peoria CVS, I told the pharmacist the deal and she said she’s filling it and it would be ready in 30 minutes. She lied. It was ready in 22 minutes. She was so kind and picking up was so easy. I know working on holidays sucks, I was working too but they stuck to their limited hours as advertised unlike the 83rd Ave and T-Bird CVS who wouldn’t fill it and decided to close at 2pm 1/1/24. I don’t know if they’re short staffed but I’m done with them. I’m using this pharmacy now.; Best Pharmacy ever!  Customer service is always top-notch.  Employees are knowledgeable, professional, helpful, patient, and friendly --- all the time!  This is what every other pharmacy should strive to be like.; CVS website says they do color copies. Upon arrival at the store, was informed that they do not make photocopies, color or otherwise.

Maria DEFINITELY bought and owns this CVS/PHARMACY location. She had to buy it yesterday or this morning because Maria at the pharmacy treated me as if I disturbed her peace by coming in there to pick up a and try to purchase a gift for someone which was just a greeting card and a candle. Maria at the pharmacy is the rudest customer service representative I’ve had face-to-face, she was flat out rude, her attitude WAS HORRIBLE her coworker next to her found it very funny. She laughed while taking her customer,  the pharmacist whomever she was a black lady in pink scrubs seemed ok with it. I visited Maria CVS pharmacy today and I probably should have kept my little uneducated self away from Maria’s pharmacy today because Maria was not having it and how dare I come to Maria’s pharmacy and disturbed her peace today,  little ole me , so until next time Maria, I’ll make sure I am a better customer next time because there will be a next time Maria take care Maria bye for now Maria; My Rx was requested to be filled and then two days later never received an update on my request. When I called the pharmacist said I never requested it. I told her I did and then she said it was cancelled. When asked who it was cancelled by she refused to answer saying the system didn’t let her know that information. When I asked if the pharmacist or the pharmacy tech cancelled my order from the doctor she refused to
Answer when o asked who is being held accountable for my heart medicine not getting filled. After I told her that she said it would be ready in 30 minutes. When I walked in to get my med staff were very rude and not welcoming at all. The pharmacy tech rolled her eyes and threw my med on the counter. This is such a horrible place but I go there for the close proximity of my house.; It’s always been a pleasure for me not sure what the problem is. The only problem I have is the drive line is always always very long…. 👍🏼; I went through the drive in to pick up my dietbets medication, employee Michelle at 19th Ave and Baseline location (Phoenix AZ) told me there was a $125 co-pay. The next day I see I was charged the entire ammount $820.66. I called the next day and was told they don't accept my AHCCS/United Health Care Insurance. \n\nNow I don't know how I'm going to pay my mortage and get food if my insurance company doesn't pay me back.; The worst pharmacy never have meds in stock. Lines are ridiculous both drive thru and inside. Will hand you multiple meds without considering give a plastic bag 😤

Name: CVS Pharmacy
Address: 3440 W Glendale Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85051, USA
Address Components: 3440 (street_number); West Glendale Avenue (route); Alhambra (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85051 (postal_code)
Reviews:
CVS has the best pharmacists go out of there way when you have a issue with insurance company to. Been going to CVS since 1998 and never had a problem. Won't name pharmacy that gave me the wrong medicine that almost killed me CVS pharmacy remembers what your taking and knows if you get a medicine that will interact with your current medication without looking up your profile. Highly recommend.; The worst CVS location. We had appointments for Flu shots and were there 15 minutes before. the lady was nice and wanted to serve us but the guy behind the computer was such a an idiot was saying  yes you have appointments but we can’t serve you for no reason. He said you have to go to the 24 hours location. CVS shouldn’t hire such idiots.; The audacity  of this location at 3440 W Glendale Ave, to treat patients and customers they way that they do.  You call the pharmacy and they refuse to pick up the phone, and when they do, they pick it up ,say nothing and hang up on you.  Today I finally got through, after three tries and a total combined wait time, of 1hr 15min,  she answers without any professionalism at all, takes my info, and then acts like I'm not in the system, and then finds it, and without explanation  or apology  she simply  says , " they will be ready after 3pm" and slams.the phone down, basically hangs up on me.  Now I was quite patient and pleasant with her, given I just got out of surgery a few hours prior.  But the audacity  of this center at this location to get away with  treating there customers with hatred, disregard and disrespect for almost three years now, without repercussions from there district manager,  regional or corporate offices is obscene.  Now my employer  uses CVS Caremark for prescription insurance,  and we have no choice but to use their mail service or go into their stores, which is upsetting,  since I have never seen Walgreens treat people the way CVS does, and if I choose  to pick up a script, at Walgreens, CVS will send threatening letters saying they will drop coverage,  it is outlandish  and outrageous  that CVS forces upon their customers  the opportunity  to deal with their unprofessional  employees  at there pharmacy stores.   I have walked into this store and stood in line at the pharamcy and watched their employee's entertain screaming matches  between themselves  and their customers in line, cuss in front of children, let the phone ring and hang up on callers,  not acknowledge customers  existence, and treat the customers  with indifference  and annoyance when assisting them.

I dont understand  how CVS gets away with this. And frankly  if their jobs then they should quit, or get better training, and be held accountable.; On hold for 1 hour waiting for someone to pick up the phone, before they closed at 130 pm. Someone kept putting me on hold.  Still, no one answered the phone.
Was charged for medication I didn't pick up. Still no refund!; Horrific location. Multiple sketchy people walking around peering into car windows that aren’t theirs. Once you get inside and spend 10 minutes waiting in line while 6 employees are making small talk and ignoring customers you’re rewarded with an pharmacist that is entirely ignorant on medication and claims OTC medication requires a prescription.

Lots of pharmaceutical options and is also well stocked in food, treats, drinks, and more; While visiting on vacation, we needed to fill an emergency prescription. I left there at 4:50pm.
Took an hour for a vaccine with an appointment.
The person who gave me a shot took care 7 customers who came after me.
How does this work??
She said they were shorthanded today, but to me, she doesn’t know what the appointment means or she doesn’t know the idea “first come first serve”. 👎👎
I will avoid this Walgreens next time.; Hit and miss service. 40 minutes for passport pictures six staff most of them talking with each other. My person was texting someone else while I waited. Things on the island happen in their own way, and it is a STEEP learning curve. However, this Pharmacy handled business well, and I will be back. Thanks.

Name: Grecafé
Address: 314 Méndez Vigo Rd, Dorado, 00646, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 314 (street_number); Méndez Vigo Road (route); Dorado barrio-pueblo (sublocality_level_1); Dorado (locality); Dorado (administrative_area_level_2); Dorado (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00646 (postal_code)
Reviews: We loved the food there, specially the cream cheese and guava French toast. The coffee was great. My husband had a parcha (dragon fruit ) mimosa and it was delicious. The servers and overall everyone that worked in this place were very kind and polite. I would definitely recommend it to anyone that’s around Dorado town.; This place is wonderful! The brunch menu is varied. Great coffe. Sorrullitos were on point and the spicy mayo give it a good taste. The french toast with cream cheese and guava sauce is incredible. Good portion and tasty. Good prices and the service is top notch. Highly recommend this place!; Loved the vibe and food! I really felt like I was in my grandma's back yard with family. All COVID protocols are being followed. Such a homey feel, beautiful music, and great service. If you come to Puerto Rico, you have to visit Grecafé in Dorado!!; Really good food and service . They’re quick on the service, we loved the caramel ice coffee with oat milk and the red velvet waffle is a must . Will definitely come back; Place is small, quaint with a feel of fresh home vibes. Food is fresh, delicios and coffee is surely strong! Serves are bilingual so feel free to stop by!

Name: Pinta y Brinda Dorado
Address: Mahi Mahi Shopping Village, Dorado, 00646, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM; Thursday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM; Friday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: Closed

Reviews:
Excellent concept for people who want to have a different romantic evening, celebrate a birthday or just relax a little. Personnel is very kind and helpful with painting (you don't need any prior painting experience). They have beers, drinks wine bottles and snacks. Although the snacks and drinks were a little overpriced, is still a great experience, just don't go there hungry : ); The concept is great and there is so much potential but the staff was so grumpy and flat out mean when we went.  It really took the wind out of my sail and my excitement just faded.  I certainly wouldn't want to do my children's birthday here if the staff is in the same mood.  It was quite unfortunate.  My son who's already pretty quiet rushed to finish his painting so we could leave.  As for me, it took everything I had not to snap at the girl "helping" us was incredibly rude to both my son and I.  I like to end on a positive note so I'll say the owner's son was nice.; It was a amazing experience; By this means I want to thank you for all the attention provided during the visit of my group of over 10 people to Pinta y Brinda. Congratulations on the excellent service. We will definitely return!; Cozy, relaxing and fun place at the same time.
The staff was very attentive, friendly and cordial, in addition to having knowledge of art (Mitch helped us🥇) Tremendous option for different types of activities. Recommended!

Name: Beach Liquors
Address: 33012 Coastal Hwy, Bethany Beach, DE 19930, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 33012 (street_number); Coastal Highway (route); Bethany Beach (locality); Sussex County (administrative_area_level_2); Delaware (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 19930 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Really nice place. Clean, great inventory, and nice staff.   Love they carry case quantities out to the vehicle.  All good here.; Big store and a lot of selection. But beware if you are looking for craft beer they have a lot of old stuff. Especially the warm shelf they have beer from some big name breweries that aren't normally available outside of their local area, which is surprising until you look at the can dates on the bottom. A few I looked at would be a huge find if they were fresh, but many cans had canning dates of 6 months ago or more. They obviously don't care they are selling old beer that has turned bad, or they aren't educated and responsible enough to pull it from the shelf. Just irresponsible.

Edit: since I can't respond to the owners response, take a look for yourselves at the dates on the beer. Several Vitamin Sea cans with canning dates from February. Same with Foam Brewing. I'm not making this up folks.; Good inventory and selection. Prices are high, but totally what you would expect at a vacation destination. Small selection of cigars as well if you need them.; I come down to this place every time I come down anywhere from Ocean City to Bethany. This place happens to have summer special Liquors that you just don't seem to be able to find anywhere else, even a different states. Love it!!!; Very rude and not customer-friendly greeting. I was stopped at the door and was told I had three minutes otherwise they will new able to ptocessy purchase.

Hands down !!! Come check this store out you will not be disappointed!
Great prices !!!!! Great customer service !!!
My go to store 100%; I dropped in for a cold beverage. The store was organized and clean with stocked shelves. I loved their assortment of snack!  The attendants were friendly with wit.

Small parking lot, but people are in and out with quickness.

Accessible entrance.; Saw that they recently opened this location. Pretty nice and clean store with a decent selection of beers and liquor as well as plenty of snacks. Workers were cool and helpful. Will definitely be going here again 👍; I'm having an absolutely rotten say so I'm not in the mood for more rude| cashiers. I used to be fairly regular before they moved and then I discovered this place had good prices and even more selection.

So I just drove out of my way and discovered the price on the one item rang up substantially higher than expected. (It's also stocked in the wrong spot with no price so there's no way to know in advance.) Based on that I questioned it and asked if it had just gone up recently hoping perhaps there was a mistake.

Where it went off track was with the dismissive attitude and the indifferent shrug at the end. I'm sorry that a 33% price jump is relevant to me. A pretty face behind the counter doesn't make me a moron.

Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: # 133 (subpremise); 9301 (street_number); East Shea Boulevard (route); Central Scottsdale (neighborhood); Scottsdale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85260 (postal_code); 6736 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: My favorite Scottsdale liquor store, one of the best around for sure! Solid people all the way across, owner to cashiers, all great people! Great pricing, knowledgeable staff on all products, honest straight shooters! Do yourself a favor, stop by and say hi, get some cold beer, good wine or some good booze!; I just called a number of stores to try to find out if they carried the white claw zero for my pregnant daughter who is allergic to mango. The other stores pretty much just blew me off. This nice man not only check to make sure that they had flavors other than mango, but made sure they had back ups because I wouldn’t be able to make it until tomorrow. I have loved the store for the 30 years that I have lived here. If we just had a few more clerks like this guy who took a few minutes to care about someone and not just getting a paycheck, the world wouldn’t be the way it is. Thank you, sir.; Was in town for a week from Chicagovisiting Scottsdale. I stopped in The Liquor Vault, the staff was great. They were welcoming, talked to me and asked where I was from. The one gentleman talked me into a Mexico tequila shot for sale at the register… was amazing and smooth!! He also informed me they deliver, I called and had a delivery to our resort. They were here in 20 minutes. Definitely recommend them for your vacation Happy Hour needs if you’re in Scottsdale (or Bkfst 🤣) it’s vacation!! See ya soon!; Best Liquor store in Scottsdale, if not Arizona. There is way too much to say about this place, but the customer loyalty is absolutely off the charts. If you’re looking for gem finds across the board this is the place to be.; Surprisingly nice little liquor store!! Super friendly staff, very helpful with selections. And close to a grocery store for limes and lemon juice. Perfect for our little vacation pit stop!

Name: Walgreens
Address: 204 E Bell Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85022, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Address Components: 204 (street_number); East Bell Road (route); Deer Valley (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85022 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Terrible customer service. I picked up a medication on a Thursday, was told by the tech my second medication would be ready the next day (because they are always out of everything. What kind of pharmacy is consistently out of a medication?) I call on Saturday to make sure the prescription is ready before I go over to get it, and I'm told there's no record of that prescription. Your own pharmacy tech told me it would be ready the next day!

I don't know what cracker jack box these folks got their pharmacology education from, but avoid this circus at all costs. Luckily, there are around 15 other pharmacies nearby. Go to one of those.; The pharmacy staff last night around 7 was simply the best!!! They had my prescriptions ready so fast and were really helpful. I wasn't feeling the best,  so I really appreciated it. Thank you! The store staff were great too.; Yesterday, I was stuck for over an hour behind a woman who wanted to talk to a manager. Getting a migraine while trying to pickup migraine meds. It had already been slow, she herself had been waiting for a while before the issue even arose. It was a hot mess of incompetence and understaffing. The same pharmacist wasn’t adept when they took nearly 10 mins at the pneumatic tube I frequently used, just to ask asking me to go inside because the box wouldn’t fit.
I had gone to drive through without a bra or getting ready, I was beyond frustrated to then go park and go inside, making my trip 90 mins.

All they had to do was discuss this issue in a way that didn’t continue holding up the line of over 16 cars between the lanes. I watched 6 more care get helped while I couldn’t even leave if I wanted, because I needed the medication in real time. All pharmacists in past had no issues and this was the cherry on top after months of progressively crazy, you almost wouldn’t believe it- levels of service. They did this in front of the other cars-when some had been there over 75 mins by that point.  If you have one pharmacist and poor management then don’t bother opening “both lanes”. Not functional in my mind any longer.; Jasmine (with glasses) is the nicest employee of any store I’ve ever been to. She is genuinely kind and not fake nice either. Thank you Jasmine for making my day with your amazing smile!; Lack of customer service here and structure. We pulled up and went into the far lane, literally nobody even acknowledged us. After 10 minutes we reversed and pulled behind the car in the left lane with the window, they left and we pulled up still nobody said anything to us, then a car pulled into the lane and they helped them. Lol. So 20 minutes waiting for someone to ask how can I help you.

Reviews: Walmart puts a person by the door to make sure you don't get to walk in with a purse or bag that is too large.  That's fine, but the person don't tell am old lady with an oversized bag she couldn't go on with the dog in the bag, yet they picked younger girls to tell them they can't go on with the large bag, so no large bag based on age? And since you watch the door, how you managed to let pets in? Dog in bag is not a service dog, not a working dog, that's a pet. Dogs in the cart where young children sit are house pets, HOUSE pets! It's against the law to bring dogs into places that sell human foods, it's against walmart policy to bring large bag into this walmart, which one you think health department cares more? The law or policy?  Which one you think walmart cares? Your health or their bottom line?; Their reefer cabinets have been dodgey for months when you buy meats they just don't last and their deli sandwiches don't look that fresh either.; Car side delivery was very fast, my grandfather ordered but he’s bed bound and can not get out of bed, so he had me do it, pick up the groceries that is. everyone was awesome an in good spirits. The loaders were very professional while also having a good time, it’s clear they work well together.      Mobile Order; This is one of the best Wal-Mart's in Phoenix. It's always clean, well stocked and the staff is friendly and helpful. Shout-out to Mike the door greeter, the consistently friendly pharmacy staff and the self checkout ladies.; Walmart pickup workers are lazy. Then when you call about their laziness they leave you on hold and never return to the phone. Twice my order has been missed up in one night. Not to mention the freaking driving drove off with half my order. Ridiculous! Texas Walmart would never! Do better!

Late prescriptions, lost prescriptions, rude staff.  The pharmacy staff likes to make your health decisions for you and tell you what medicines you can and can't take.  I heard pharmacy staff threaten to assault a customer because he did not speak English. Reviews:
Just moved to town a few weeks ago. Came in looking for mine& my husband's whiskey. Both employees came around the counter & helped me in looking for what I was wanting. Made recommendations & suggestions til I found what I wanted. Definitely found our new spot for purchasing our adult beverages.
And cigarettes also. Cuz they own or are partnered up with the smoke shop next door. Cut threw the liquor store to the smoke shop. Let me scope out some of there products.
Again answered any questions I had & made suggestions. Felt like a was chit chatting with long-time friend not a 1st time customer.
Needless to say I'll be coming back here again & again. Your stuck with me now as a forever customer.
Thank you for being so nice, friendly & helpful. You guys are awesome. See ya'll tomorrow more than likely.; They always have a good selection, and I frequently find new things to try on the rare occasions I stop in.; Great selection of beer,wine and spirits. The cashier is always very friendly and knows his stuff. I've only seen him as the only employee and does great running the drive thru window and in person customers.; Friendly and knowledgeable staff, great variety for a smaller store, and reasonable prices, no gouging.; This store is amazing! I recommend to everyone! I was in there a few weeks ago. To let the wonderful trustworthy owner know her card reader machines were down. And the money was not removed from my bank. She got it fixed! I was NOT charged double or even a penny over what I owed. I will be shopping here often!

Reviews:
I brought a toilet and as I was checking out the cashier asked me if I needed help loading it in my car and I said yes. When I stepped outside a young man by the name of Derrick approached me and asked was I the one that needed help. He helped me load it and when I tried to tip him, he apologized to me and said that they are not allowed to take tips so I think he deserves recognition for a job well done. Everyone in this store has been very helpful.; I have been to-minimum-5 Home Depots in Brooklyn & Long Island. I do not even bother asking for help because the employees stare at me as if I am speaking another language.
At this Home Depot I AM speaking another language, and yet the employees could not be more helpful.
If they do not understand me, they take me to someone who does. And then walk me directly to the product I am looking to find.
So. It is possible to be treated like a human being at Home Depot. ✅; This is a delivery review. Great service, fast delivery and friendly drivers. Of course I forgot their names, unfortunately - but it was the guys working on 06.03.24 in Isabela.; If I could give it zero stars, I would. I come here very often as I work a lot of home projects and what not. They take advantage of the fact that they are open til later compared to local hardware stores. They also have a pretty decent stock. But they lose all my gratitude with the horrible lines, the lack of back up power. Hello! In Puerto Rico Home Depot doesn’t have a generator to run the cash registers. It’s a joke!!!!
Today they were ringing people manually and trying to figure out prices. Hours wasted! First world problems, I know. But this is third world convenience.; The employee Zuelly Hatillo HomeDepot was very very pleasant and helpful. Wonderful experience with her.
Educated and full of information. Five Stars for the store just because of her
