Reviews: We had no idea that we needed to go to a government sanctioned store for wine! This city was about 15 minutes away from where we were staying. Springdale is picture perfect, def visit and stop by here to pick up wine. This place has a section dedicated to wine. I didn’t find anyone to help me but that was okay. We found Daou so that was great. We found a wine opener for $2 as well. The store sells interesting things, souvenirs etc.; Small liquor store but decent beer selection. Purchase by the can. Staff is very uptight and dry as can be when it comes to the "Utah State Laws".  Chill out a bit peeps!!!; Small selection of wine and spirits. Prices are competitive but it's one of the only places in town anyway.; The shop is very small but it has all the basics liquor-wise and a pretty decent wine selection. The only reason I'm giving it three stars is because we were charged full price for items that were marked on sale. We didn't realize it until we got down the mountain and I wasn't going to go back for $10.; Cute and small but definitely has quite an assortment of wines, beers and spirits. We didn’t find it to be over priced either. We paid $29.99 for a medium bottle of Grey goose that was $55 in Vegas.

Name: Daveco Beer, Wine & Spirits-Thornton
Address: 16434 Washington St, Thornton, CO 80023, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM

Reviews: Huge space, lots of alcohol, yet I felt the selection of various types of liquors there were limited.. and pricey.  They did have a couple unique brands that I hadn't seen before, as well as some gimmicky ones (like the machine gun shaped glass bottles..).  However, there’s a large shop in Boulder and medium-sized shop in Superior where I can find just about anything I've heard of or about or am interested in, at a cheaper price point.; Decent prices and good selection on whiskey, but they practically push you out the door 20 minutes before closing. They had the doors locked and were making multiple announcements by 10 till 10 on a Saturday.; Huge selection and excellent service. Stopped in last week while traveling and had a great experience. I called today and spoke with Tim who answered all my questions and went out of his way to help me find what I was looking for.; I was visiting the Denver area and decided to make the world's largest liquor store a destination. Great place, and it's dog friendly. I've joked with friends that they should put me in charge of their marketing. There's a small area just inside the front door that should be selling T-shirts, mugs, shot glasses, etc. with Daveco / The World's Largest Liquor Store. I would have bought all of that...; "Great" selection of whiskey, scotch, and Belgian beer. Great in quotes because I definitely am not a connoisseur. Definitely better selection and pricing than a supermarket or strip Mall liquor store. Get the Cherry Chouffe or Lindeman's Framboise for a treat.

Name: Switchback Trading Company
Address: 1149- C Zion Park Blvd, Springdale, UT 84767, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 8:30 PM; Tuesday: 12:00 – 8:30 PM; Wednesday: 12:00 – 8:30 PM; Thursday: 12:00 – 8:30 PM; Friday: 12:00 – 8:30 PM; Saturday: 12:00 – 8:30 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 1149- C (street_number); Zion Park Boulevard (route); Springdale (locality); Washington County (administrative_area_level_2); Utah (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 84767 (postal_code)
Reviews: Tried to park here in the morning before they opened. Their kiosk was broken and it directed us to a separate kiosk across the street which we headed to and payed for parking on. There was no indication that this kiosk was part of a separate entity and it looked exactly the same. When we came back to our car there was a note saying we would be fined 250$ if we did not enter the gift shop and pay for parking. We thought it was a mistake so we headed inside and asked and they said the kiosk across the street was “part of the government” so we would have to pay again. We asked for a manager and she repeated the same thing. She said it was our choice that we paid and we had the choice to not pay the parking again. When asked if we could get a refund since we could chose to pay the fine, she said “Sure but you MIGHT get fined” we paid the 25$ to avoid problems and left. Manager gave us sooooo much attitude the whole time and threatened us. Terrible service never coming here again do not fund these people!; The cashier seemed flustered - couldn’t open the liquor cabinet with her keys for the guy in front of us so he didn’t get what he wanted. Then when she was ringing me up, I had a 50% off clearance shirt, asked if it rang up that way and she said it did. Realized later that night that it didn’t and couldn’t go back the next day to get a refund because they were closed and it was our last day there.; There are three venues here. JACKS sports bar. Switchback store and their restaurant.; Shameful customer service!!. They sold me a bottle of red wine that was RANCID. We immediately returned it with our dated receipt to exchange it and the staff insinuated that we didn’t store the wine properly. They went on to say “no exchanges.” They have free rein to sell bad products and won’t take responsibility for it!!! DO NOT buy their wine. They are the only store in town that sells it, so if you are a wine drinker please make other arrangements. Extremely poor business practice.; Cool little shop.  Was surprised on their selection of craft beers. Sarah R. gave us the locals only run down on where to go and what to do we felt we got some speak easy info.  Pretty awesome.

Name: Willowbrook Spirit Shoppe
Address: 2 Willowbrook Rd, Cromwell, CT 06416, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 2 (street_number); Willowbrook Road (route); Cromwell (locality); Middlesex County (administrative_area_level_2); Connecticut (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 06416 (postal_code); 2505 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Close parking was available and they have spots resevered for their shoppers. The beer was average price and cold. Check out was quick, simple and friendly. It's not a Big Place, but you'll find a good selection of product's and it's very clean. They have good hours and open on Sundays.; OK, it needs to be said. I try to only write positive reviews, but they are price gouging. They are the most expensive liquor store in Cromwell or Middletown. Go down the street to liquor world. Or take a turn, go down East Street, and save even more money at the Spirit Shop. Didn't Willowbrook just sell their wooden shanty town for 2 million dollars? Do they really need an extra 2 or 3 bucks from you?; New ownership. Did some nice remodeling inside, changed the carpet, built a new countertop for sales. What’s really wonderful is that they significantly expanded their selection of local craft beers which is a huge draw to this establishment.; Immediately profiled and the guy went the extra mile to hound the person i came in with and then made the point to be " kind" and hold the bottle i had in my hand up front u until i was done shopping. 1st time i let it slide but not twice.; Willowbrook used to be my go-to store for beer. They had shelves full of interesting craft brews, but over time they’ve reduced their selection. What was once four shelves is now one.

I’ll poke my head in every so often, but the selection seems less interesting than it once was.

Edit: I visited again recently and the beer selection seems sparse more and more frequently. I’m leaving my review at 3 stars, but Willowbrook has nothing to differentiate itself from dozens of other liquor stores.

Reviews: Rude obnoxious staff. On May 4, 2024 @ approx 6pm I attempted to park my SUV with small utility trailer in the back of the BIG empty parking lot where no cars were parked for a few minutes at the slowest part of the day just to order from the food truck that was located in their parking lot and perhaps go in for a beverage from inside the liqueur store but never got a chance before the owner/employee came out of the store and rudely screamed at me across the parking lot claiming "you can't park there, you're blocking my parking spaces, I'll have you towed!!!" he said. Which I was not! I was literally in the middle of the parking lot in-line to the food truck and not blocking anyone anymore than the food truck itself. The screaming and rude hand gestures were completely uncalled for and the situation should have been handled in a more professional respectful manner, not screaming like a maniac. I will NEVER do business with rude nasty people like this and will steer all my friends and family and anyone who asked where to buy liqueur in Woodland Park away from doing business with these rude nasty people. I took my business elsewhere and always will.; Everything we needed under one roof, with decent prices, and helpful staff!; Great selection, prices are a little more after new ownership a few years ago.; They are super friendly Everytime. Reviews:
I've been going to this pharmacy for years. By far the rudest people at the drive through.  There's an older lady who had the odasity to tell me rudely to turn off my truck while I have kids in the car in the summer heat. When I refused she just walked away and said deal with someone else. What a piece of work. I'd rather go to another pharmacy than deal with people who lack customer service and who lack respect for other people.; Hey Walgreens if I'm going to call your store number maybe tell me my call is being handled by a call center and not directly with the pharmacy of the location I'm calling. And maybe don't tell me my prescription will be ready in 30 minutes, only to show up 45 minutes later and you tell me it was fulfilled somewhere else. So ridiculous and unprofessional.; The young man with dark hair this evening was extremely professional and very kind to everyone in his line ..way to go sir ;)
More people need to be like you !
Thank you for making my shopping experience a delightful experience.; If I could give 0 stars I would!!!! Tammy and Jonathan were very very rude to my aunt!!!! This was around 6:20pm the amount of anger they had was crazy for no reason! When my aunt can potentially die because of wrong medication given to her you guys and pharmacist need to do better I hope yall know if she does get sick law suit coming especially because of the rude dismissive and nasty behavior Jonathan displayed this evening and didn’t even care if my aunt was allergic!; If I could, I wouldn't give them any stars on this review. Every single time, they've screwed up prescriptions for both me and my father. Every time I order a 90-day prescription, they only give me a 30-day prescription. How can they expect me to take my prescription when I run out of medicine to take?? This pharmacy is trash! Don't waste your time here folks!

Reviews:
Convenient to downtown and UAB. The employees are super friendly and helpful unlike most places these days. Good prices. Excellent WINE Selection, even chilled.; Only place I go because of the great selections! Employees are always friendly and reliable for a good chuckle. They even helped me pick out the perfect cigar for my hunny!
Update: They're still the best place to go! like I mentioned before they have great staff and if you're looking for a particular type of beer they'll Look into finding it for you. great smiles, great prices, a wins a win.; Overall a very nice place...  I visited on a recommendation from a coworker No hours of operation posted anywhere outside that i could find. The exterior windows are cluttered with all sorts of advertising in the ,window which made me a little apprehensive about going in... Once inside, I was surprised that they were clean. I was greeted promptly. I am not a drinker so I can not review pricing or selection of alcohol, but they seem to have great selection. Now for the cigar review...... They have a small walk in humidor that is packed with all different kinds of cigars. They are reasonably priced and offer a 25% DISCOUNT on Sundays from noon until midnight. They have glass jars on the counter of cigars that are infusing with various flavors.  I would have to say stop out and check them out, especially in Sunday's.; Prices are higher than the real ABC but they have great personalities when you go in great service it gets what you need done and they're open late; Been coming here for a long time.  This place offers a vast selection.  Friendly and polite, the people who work here know their alcohol and would be happy  to help you select a bottle. The cigar side of the building has kind of faded, though it is still present.

Reviews:
This is hands down the best liquor store in the area. The staff is super friendly and helpful. They are happy to look up anything they don't have and see if they can order it for you and be sure to follow them on social media for their latest additions.; Prices are INCREDIBLY price gouged! Blantons was almost $200 and Weller was $300 just to name two... Even the non-allocated product was above local ABC pricing. Not sure how this place has such good reviews. 🤔; I have been here twice now and found beer that I wouldn't normally find in a grocery store. There is a good selection of alcohol and some you won't find in the state run ABC stores. I bought a six pack and didn't realize until I got home that one of the cans had an issue but rest were all right. You couldn't tell unless you looked at the bottom of the box. I know going forward to check before leaving the store.; great place ! I have tried to get my hands on eagle rare bourbon since so long. but yesterday i got a call from hilltop that they have bottle of eagle rare set aside for me! the staff here is very friendly . I also got a bottle of the four roses bourbon on the recommendation of staff. Me and my husband really loved it! great selection of bourbons !Must pay a visit!; Great Whiskey/Bourbon selection, friendly staff. Their great selection can probably be attributed to the price gouging though, selling Blanton's at $175 is a bit blatant (pun intended) on the price gouging. Also another bourbon, Dettling Single Barrel cask strength, that sells for roughly $80-$90 was selling for $135.

Nevertheless, if you're really looking for something and don't mind overpaying a bit you'll likely find it here.

Reviews:
The lady with an accent was very rude. The man was answering some questions for me and she was very rude to him for stopping what he was doing and helping me. She didn’t want him to stop stocking to help me which  is his job helping customers I thought. Every time I’ve been in this location she has been working. She’s very hateful.; I love this location. I've never had a bad experience. I look really young so sometimes people can be somewhat rude when asking for my i.d. I've never run into that at this store. They're always super nice to me and I don't like going elsewhere! Awesome addition to the shopping center.; It is a State liquor store. It's clean, friendly, quick to get through, and expensive as all-get-out.

It's really the only option: non-State liquor stores in Alabama have to buy wholesale from the State stores. Much of the expense is due to the extremely high alcohol tax.; ABC Select stores have the best prices and selection of spirits. Generally, whatever I am looking for is in stock.; Great store with extremely low prices! Closes at 7pm! Not open on Sunday!

Name: International Wines & Craft Beer

Reviews:
So the company has downsized and laid off the majority of the employees.
Their right to do so.
Severance pay for those willing to stay until business restructured.
Good……but they had to have those people else they would collapse before restructuring…..self serving . PERIOD.
Telling their employees that they had no “seniority “ system when announcing cutbacks……meaning we’ll keep whom we want and you have no say….smells bad to me.
They say they support their employees……judge for yourself.; I wish they were all this easy.
There is parking adequate for 3 trucks on the side of the road leading up. When you pull in, you'll be in the first bank of docks to the left. If there's nobody in #4, back it in there. Plenty of room to swing around and back.  You don't have to go looking for check-in; check-in will find you. They pop your seal.
Backed in just a smidge past my appointment time and they got right to work. Didn't take but forty minutes for a full trailer. The man brought my paperwork back to me as soon as they were done. Friendly, helpful people. 10/10 would deliver here again. Well done!; Excellent place to deliver. About 3 truck spots before thr entrance to the side to sleep.

Unloaded under 20 min 44k lbs. Amazing.

When you get in, take the first 3 docks to your left.; Excellent place to deliver in and out 30 minutes; You deserve the 5 stars very efficient

Name: Alabama Crown Distributing Co

Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: Closed; Sunday: Closed

Reviews: OVERNIGHT PARKING AVAILABLE on the side of the road. DO NOT park at the gate they tend to get itchy about that lol. You can take the chance and back in to any dock with paperwork in the trailer and hope they take you then or check in at the ramp near the restrooms (to the left ) at the window and they will let you know if your too early or not but fast unloading you just have to make sure there is room to leave or get in if they have the box trucks in front of the rocks or if it's a cluster fux because so many drivers are there lol; This is my first time at this location.  Was very easy to find right off hwy 65. The truck entrance has a sign in front and a phn number on the entrance gate to call for check-in.  Opens at 7am, and I arrived 30min. before my appointment and received a door right away. Good space to turn around to back into docks. There is a port a potty on site. The paperwork goes into the back of the trailer. Goes from green, red to green light, and your complete. Paperwork will be in the back of the trailer. Exit the same way you come in. Unloading was very quick. I would definitely come back.; Call the number on the gate,  have your appointment # handy. They let you inside go to receiving for a door.  Unloading is quick once in the door. When they turn off your red light go back in for the paper work.  I have only delivered here and that was my experience.; Deplorable company. Not once have they delivered a correct order in the 8 times we've ordered from them after they bought a bunch of brands from our original distributor. No apologies, no making things right, just ignores us and blames everything on some other person we can't talk to because they know we can't get some of these brands anywhere else. Can't provide the bare minimum of their job. Do better.; Worst place. First off the rate con and bol had the wrong address for the delivery. Then when I get here I get a dock right wayBeen sitting 3 hours with the doors open to be unloaded  and a reefer running along with the dock lock.

Reviews: I’ve never seen such bad customer service before! The clerk asked for my ID and asks what’s the address on it. So I tell him the address then he proceeded to ask for the zip code, which mind you I haven’t lived at that address in over 4 years and could not remember. Which is fine I understand they have procedures to follow but this guy literally starts bending my ID trying to snap it in half. At this point I’m annoyed and just want to leave but then he says he isn’t giving it back. The ID is real and I told him he can either scan it or I’m calling 911 because you can’t steal someone’s ID for not knowing the zip code. He ends up taking a picture of the ID, sends it to his boss then calls his boss then confirms the ID is real! This guy was obviously on some power trip, he was cocky and beyond rude during the whole situation, safe to say I won’t ever be spending my money at that liquor store.; This was a hard to find item around town, but I found it at the Beverage Place at a reasonable price.; Great selection, and open 365 days a year! Awesome staff, and the owners are first class.; Selection is broad , store is in very good location . The only reason I’m giving this location 2 stars is because there is a very unfriendly clerk who makes me feel uncomfortable when shopping at this location. I prefer the pink package store on 280 because the clerks are more friendly & they have more variety of sizes; There is only 1 reason to go here.  The ABC store is closed.  ABC has better selection, better availability, and WAY better prices.  It's 1 mile away look it up.  Also, he store keeper is a horrible human being.  The guys at ABC are much nicer and way more knowledgeable.

Name: LeNell's Beverage Boutique
Address: 1208 32nd St N, Birmingham, AL 35234, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM; Tuesday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM; Wednesday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM; Thursday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM; Friday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 1208 (street_number); 32nd Street North (route); Norwood (neighborhood); Birmingham (locality); Jefferson County (administrative_area_level_2); Alabama (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 35234 (postal_code); 3238 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Love this place! Such a unique store with friendly and knowledgeable staff. This is what a great local business looks like. We are lucky to have LeNell in the ‘ham.; That was an educational, fun visit with a few roads down memory lane. Some bottles I hadn't seen since I moved to Alabama, some I hadn't seen since I had moved to the States. I was offered some samples and left happy with a few bottles of never ever seen spirits.
If you are looking for a vermouth that has pronounced vanilla notes or is cinnamon forward, when you need a bourbon that you cannot get anywhere else, a gin from Sweden or France, this is the place to go and find it. Bring some time to learn something new and socialize with the proprietor and staff.; Friends have been telling me to check out LeNell's for years since I moved back to Birmingham, finally checked it out today.

Great store, has all kinds of oddball liquers, bitters, etc which are harder to find around here. Went to three different stores looking for PF Dry Curacao before finding it at LeNell's.

You can even sample bitters there! Will definitely be back.; Wasn't there long but long enough to see she is a cool beans type of lady. She gave me a lil course in bourbon (Ky girl here). The boutique has a nice laid back atmosphere. I know where my husband's Christmas present will come from.; This is the best package store in the south, if not one of the best in the country. Their tastings are out of this world and the staff knows about every bottle in the store. They also carry a huge selection of bitters and can help you learn how to make amazing mixed drinks. It is incredibly rare to find a business owner who cares about their customers and their experience like LeNell does. I highly recommend stopping by for a tasting and picking up a rare bottle to try out!

They have very, very little Irish Whiskey.
They have everything behind glass and the glass is covered with signs, notices, rules, adverts, so trying to see what they have is a pain.
Their prices are inflated, big time
Finally, they are extemely rude. If you do not like to sell alcohol then don't. But, do not come off nasty at me for asking for a liquor that every other State Liquor Store in Cleveland has.
I would not step foot back in here if you gave me free liquor to do so.; Kinda in a bad area but, they do have Armed Security Officer there. He gave a teen boy a hard time for not having a mask and told him to keep his shirt over his mouth and nose. But every woman that walked in without a mask, or a mask around their chin, he flirted with. We live down the street and will not ever go back unless the owners crack down on this. Other stores in the area do a great job of enforcing masks.; Is extremely overcrowded at almost anytime. The store looks like it's maybe cleaned once a month. Name: Walgreens
Address: 1935 N Power Rd, Mesa, AZ 85205, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews: I had the worst experience with this pharmacy. I had an appointment for a Tdap and Flu vaccine. The two pharmacy techs that assisted me were extremely rude and unprofessional. They were very unhappy about having to ask me simple questions for the vaccine safety purposes.... Simple questions such as, "Do you have a latex allergy, have you ever had a reaction?" Etc. The one pharmacy tech said, "Oh my God, can you make this go any faster!?" Then the other responded, "Do you want to do this!? It's how the new system is and it's what we have to do now... Normally they would be the ones filling this out." My daughter was saying, "mom is this how you talk in front of your patients?" And the tech says, "Do you have a problem?" I responded as politely as I could, "No, I don't have a problem.... However we were discussing how unprofessional it is the way the other tech was complaining about the process. I also used to teach medical assistants and pharmacy tech students.... And I would be appalled if they acted this way infront of patients." She apologized but then we had to wait for almost 30 minutes after my appointment time. They seemed to be struggling with identifying the proper vaccines. I would say please work on professionalism and manners. Asking customers if they have a problem is a very confrontational question, and it wasn't asked in a concerning tone but more so to elevate the situation. Employees need to understand that tone, body language, and simple manners are so important when you're working with patients and in customer service.; Christina is the best at customer service. Name: On The Rocks Wine & Spirits
Address: 3050 E Lake Lansing Rd, East Lansing, MI 48823, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Vicinity: 3050 East Lake Lansing Road, East Lansing
Address Components: 3050 (street_number); East Lake Lansing Road (route); East Lansing (locality); Ingham County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 48823 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Warning long but awesome review!!

If you're ever in the East Lansing, Michigan area and in need of an alcoholic/non alcoholic beverage, snack, or anything else party store related, you have to check out ON THE ROCKS WINE & SPIRITS party store! They definitely went above and beyond for me and their customer service was phenomenal so they deserve every bit of this shout out!

Backstory 12-31-23

I had called their location looking for a specific alcoholic beverage but didn't get an answer, as it was one of the busiest Holidays of the year....New Year's Eve. In the mess of calling multiple other places to try to find it (with no luck and losing hope) I got a call that I didn't recognize. I noticed it was the same area code as some of the numbers I had been calling though, so I answered it. Despite the EXTREMELY busy holiday they called back to find out what I needed! 🤯  On top of that they had the beverage that I had been so desperately searching for and it was the LAST bottle they had!! It was quite a bit out of the way (20 mins off the highway) but when I got there it's like they knew who I was. 🤯
I hadn't even said a word, I had just walked in the door and they pulled the beverage from behind the counter and held it up high then put it down on the counter for me. In shock I said to them "How did you know it was me?! They replied with a shrug that they just knew. This was very impressive as they had tons of customers coming and going so it was so crazy they knew it was me upon arrival.
That was SO incredibly awesome that they called me back and held the beverage for me. This was a very sought-after and limited edition beverage so they definitely didn't have to, and could have sold it to anyone. I am sure the story I told them of what had happened earlier that day was a factor but none the less I was ever so grateful.
(What I shared with them ----> I told them how it was my Birthday. That I had been looking forward to trying the Old Smoky Mountain Mint Chocolate Chip Flavored Whiskey because it's my favorite ice cream flavor and I love anything mint/chocolate. I continued telling them how I had dropped it as I was leaving to the celebration I was going to. I almost cried as I saw it shatter on the cement and spill out. 🥺 I told them how I had called nearly every place that sold alcohol between Grand Rapids and Detroit with no luck.) They said they were glad to be able to help me.
Anyway, I wanted to make sure they were given a shout out because the negative is usually what's focused on and these types of stories usually go untold or only told to a few. Exceptional customer service is truly hard to find, as is good people so definitely check this place out if you're ever in the area because they definitely deserve your business.

Photo of beverage below :); This is a very special place whether for top craft breweries (visit the cave!) or fine wines, ports, single-malt whisky. Service is superior in every way.; On The Rocks (OTR) is the place to go when it comes to Spirits.   I walked in and was greeted by the owner who was pleasant and very knowledgeable in all aspects of Bourbon.

I had been asking a liquor store in Owosso, for a few bottles that they have yet to obtain.  At OTR they not only had them but also introduced me to a few other items that are outstanding!

If your in the area stop in and if there are any bottles left of OTR’s Backbone Bourbon they was bottled for them grab, you’ll be very satisfied!; A friend recommended I check out On The Rocks for their selection and I’m so happy I did! Wine, liquor, craft beer selections are all amazing (I even got a fun flavored sparkling wine I’ve never seen before and it was a great price). They absolutely have the biggest hard seltzer selection I’ve seen anywhere. I saw brands I’ve never heard of and tons of flavors.

The staff is also so kind and willing to help. My partner was having a hard time picking out items and instead of rushing him or pushing our stuff out of the way, the staff opened a second register just to give us space and help us. Above and beyond!; This place is freaking AMAZING! Literally floor to ceiling alcohol and a beer cave so packed you have to tip toe around.

They are extremely knowledgeable, helpful, and VERY friendly.
This place is better stocked than Oades and they price everything at state minimum.

They are my new go to for anything alcohol related.

Reviews:
The store has a fairly decent selection for being just a neighborhood market. The staff working the registers are generally very friendly. The issue is the absence of workers in the departments and isles. If you can’t find something, you are on your own. And in the rare event, I do find someone, they don’t know where anything is. I have been sent to the wrong aisle countless times. Management needs to train the staff on where things are.; I walked in wanting to spend about $300 in groceries but left.

Why? I was greeted at the door by a pharmacist saying to me in high volume... "HAVE YOU HAD YOUR FLU SHOT YET?"

This is no different if I looked at a stranger and asked them if they had a pap smear or an STD test in front of everybody in public?!

My medical history is none of your business and I don't want anyone else knowing it.

ABSOLUTELY UNPROFESSIONAL AND A VIOLATION OF HIPPA RIGHTS.

I will be reporting this.

UPDATE: I up'd my stars from 1 to 3 because of how awesome and kind the operations Manager was over the phone. Thank you for listening. I understand  corporate decisions are out of your control. The way he handled my call was supremely balanced. Thank you for pointing me in the right direction.; Unfortunately they were understaffed, so our 3 mile drive was a waste as they didn't have any hot deli food that we went there for. I hope they can hire better staff soon for their own sake. The Mgr said they had a lot of call outs today. Other than that, it was clean and well stocked.; I love the Walmart Neighborhood Markets. They are much smaller than the Super Centers Walmart's but has everything I need. Never too crowded, parking close to the store, staff friendly, never more than one person ahead of me in line. Also has self-service checkouts and handi-cap parking. In and out fast. What's not to like? I recommend it.; My pickup experience today was wonderful! The associate was super friendly, helpful, and understanding of my needs. Also, I have never had a bad experience at this store!

Reviews: After a hefty delicious dinner at La Sombra, a nice cortado here is the way to go… Don’t forget a dessert!  I had ginger crepes mmmmmm!; We happen to find this place by accident driving through the mountains of Orocovis. It was a nice pitstop having lunch overlooking the mountainous landscape. It was appreciated that the sandwiches were made with multi grain bread, and the natural juices were great. In addition, they had a small designated area displayed with artisan crafts to purchase as well as t-shirts of the business. The only setback is that there is a very limited and cramped parking area.; The atmosphere was great, it was very comfortable and good vibes giving. The food is somewhat bad. The drinks were awful, no other words needed. I have come here on multiple occasions with many people and weren't positive either.; Awesome little spot we stumbled upon on our way to Toro Verde. The latte and cake was fantastic. The rear balcony has a great view and the staff was extremely friendly. They even have a little spot to pick up some souvenirs. Definitely recommend stopping by if you're in the area.; When I say they have everything you want for you coffee and more, I mean it. Fresh pastries, service is fast and attentive, food is delicious and the location feels like that cozy cabin you’re looking to stay in while you’re in the mountains. 10/10 highly recommended!

Reviews:
I Love Uptown Spirits The Prices Are Very Reasonable and The Deliveries are fast. I’m on my 3rd Order. I made it a point to order at least once a month; I was very pleased with the quick delivery and excellent packaging to insure my order was not damaged. I understand the secondary market, but wish more online retailers would sell products closer to actual retail price. I have found some retail stores within a 30 mile radius of my home that have a pretty consistent stock of Buffalo Trace products at the actual retail price. I would order a lot more product from you if the pricing wasn’t so inflated. Overall, my purchase experience was very good.; I'd prefer to give zero stars but you must to leave a review.

The "order" hasn't moved in days. No shopping company name to even look. Shop tracking still has the order ready for carrier to pick up.; Everything worked out perfect. Was very pleased with overall quality of service.Was somewhat reluctant at first after reading some of the reviews but the great price compelled me give them a try.
And have just now placed my second order.; I’d read some of the other reviews so was nervous about buying online, but saw they had a hard to find foursquare run. Placed order at 250pm Wednesday, and totally surprised when the package arrived at 350pm Friday (from San Diego to San Francisco). I don’t think they could have got it here any faster - very impressed!

Reviews:
I'm here in Loiza for vacation with family, and wanted to try a couple Puerto Rico 965 cigars.

I picked up two of the 965 Churchils, and two of the Arturo Fuente curly head deluxe.

The young man behind the counter was very helpful. He even went so far as to try and help me find a suitable hard container for my triple home to Atlanta next week.

A word about those who complain that this shop is overpriced:
1. These guys pay usurious rental rates that a mall charges. You, the customer pays more for convenience.
2. There are other cigar shops, but the distance to San Juan nullifies whatever price advantage you might realize.; Friendly service but overpriced cigars. Not bad for Puerto Rico though.; Over price
returns are impossible
I would never go back to those scam artist
$70 for a $25 vape; I love it here because theres alot of e juice and mods; Great place to get cigars if you ever visit Puerto Rico 😀

Reviews:
This is the perfect little shop to provision while sailing in the area. It has a good selection of groceries, wine and beer. All the basics are there plus some frozen meat products, shampoo and a small hardware section.
A real find for sailors! Also go to the restaurant next door!; So handy to have right on the beach, everything you could need.; Very friendly owner/staff! Small market has most things you would need and access via stairs from the water!; Agua Salada Mini Market is a small oasis amid the lack of grocery stores or convenience stores in the area. Because of the inventory it has, it should be called Mini Hardware Store / Mini Auto Parts / Mini Liquor Store. The truth is that they have a little bit of everything.
The kindness and kindness with which Chuíto serves you compares with the variety of products they have. They even have essential medicines.
I wish you many years of success because of your inventory, good prices and because you came to fill a void that existed in the area for a convenience store like this.

Name: Rancho Liquor & Fine Cigar House
Address: 28322 Old Town Front St, Temecula, CA 92590, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:30 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:30 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:30 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:30 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 7:30 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Reviews:
Rancho Liquor & Fine Cigar House is AWESOME. Why, because they care about their customers and reputation. I had placed an order for 4 bottles of wine and was contacted to let me know they only had 2 in stock. They were prompt and very polite. They offered to ship the 2 and refund the difference. Customer service was amazing  and they followed through with the refund in a timely matter. They have a great selection of Liquor to choose from. I am a customer for life now. Thank you, Robert; One of the hallmarks of [Rancho Liquor & Fine Cigar House] is its outstanding customer service. The team goes above and beyond to assist customers, promptly answering inquiries and providing expert recommendations. Their dedication to ensuring a personalized shopping experience sets them apart, making every interaction a pleasure. This huge selection sipirit store is my favorite one.; I've been coming here for  48+  years and never have I seen so much liquor of all sorts. It's a must see if your walking the down town front street.; Good selection of whiskey, I saw a few that I hadn't seen in a while. I went twice but didn't purchase anything. I'll definitely go back when I'm back in the area.; I don't always leave reviews but I had to take a moment here. I was hesitant to order from Rancho Liquors after seeing a number of poor reviews from their online sales. That being said I'm glad pulled the trigger - they were able to fulfill my order quickly and without any hassle whatsoever.

I did take a moment before ordering to call and see if someone would physically check if the rum I was looking for was on the shelf and available to ship. Nicole happily did this for me and was very friendly about it. She was super helpful and I received a FedEx tracking number from CA to NY within hours of that phone call after placing my order. Honestly I'd always call first to insure the availability of what I'm ordering, I wouldn't hesitate to order from Rancho Liquors again though.

Exceptional service, and I thank all of the staff for a great experience.

Reviews:
Staff polite,plenty parking area around n convenient it's a Walgreens like most walgreens.lol; The staff members are usually very helpful. Somedays are better than others.; They should be open at 7am.; Visiting here From Chicago and I have been here 4x’s Already and Im embarrassed that this Walgreens compared to what I am use to has the Worst Customer Service ever!, 1st off Cashiers when checking customers out check them out and keep the line moving its not time to socialize and ask what customers did on the weekend and Hold a whole 5-6 minuet conversation yes I timed it. Second The Pharmacy Dept. Is Very extremely UnProfessional my father forgot his medication and we had the physician call in the medication and on my Walgreens App it showed that his Prescription was ready we get to the Pharmacy and it was partially ready he was missing his syringes, Which I thought If you worked the Pharmacy Dept. you would know that part of the  prescription was incomplete but he didnt till I told him, when he I mean the person who took care of us who i wasnt even sure was a Pharmacy Tech asked the Pharmacist about the syringes he tells him “I don’t know” So I asked him so you don’t have any the Tech Replies the Pharmacist said not till next week no specific day didnt even bother to check when the syringes would come in no effort was made to help us This was medication my father needed daily, I then Asked the Tech if they could call us when the syringes came in he clearly said No we dont do that At this point Im puzzled because Walgreens has a system where they can call you to let you know you prescription is ready the App had failed me so there clearly is a walgreens training error hear or is it Just PR walgreens that clearly employees show ko customer service effort.  I Thank God this was not a life of Death situation,  I then had to call my Sister back home to have her over night us the syringes. Everyone in this Walgreens need to take a class on Customer Service and Walgreens Corporate need to run all there walgreens the same way here as they do in the states Get it together Walgreens!
A Copy of this complaint will be forwarded to Corporate.; Madeline is a great and  a very sophisticated profecional she handles wallgren drug store with great inteligence she is unique she is MADELINE an A+  inteligence and my favorite 🧎 ❤️❤️❤️❤️🌹🧖.🌹especial heart.

Reviews:
Love love!  Was here when we came to PR last time and was happy to find that it was still in business.  Love the local artisan selection.  Nice variety of jewelry and art.  Cigars available.  Complimentary coffee and hot sauce tastings!; Great selection of souvenirs. Cute and not cheap, typical tourist shop stuff. The staff at the store was nice and went above and beyond to make sure our time near El Yunqua was perfect.; This is an absolutely fantastic shop. Visited the shop after spending the morning exploring El Yunque and taking the kids ziplining. Great selection of souvenirs from magnets, hats, shirts, bags, local hot sauces, sugar, coffee and cigars!
The shop was clean, neat and organized. The young man working there was very helpful and willing to answer all the questions we had. Helped me pick out a great cigar and I will be ordering more online.
I can't recommend this shop enough. I know my family and I will absolutely be back next time we go to PR.; Perfect place to stop by and get your family and friends some gifts! They have from pencils to homemade hot sauces. I love that they have a tasting station to try the different variety of sauces. They also have a coffee station to try they delicious coffee. I had to buy some coffee before I left.  I personally think all the sauce were super spicy, but that’s definitely an individuals’ choice. The owner/manager was super friendly. They have a photo prop so you can have fun while other shop. It’s hard to miss. It’s located in Rio Grande!; Found great gifts here! Little pricey compared to other gift shops on the island. However this particular shop had sections with local hand made items which I thought was really cool. The young gentleman was also very helpful, and kind. Gave us recommendations for restaurants nearby and was very kind.

Name: Walgreens
Address: Carretera 3 Km 23.9, Río Grande, 00745, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: Km 23.9 (subpremise); Carretera 3 (route); Urb. Industrial Las Flores (neighborhood); Río Grande (locality); Ciénaga Baja (administrative_area_level_2); Río Grande (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00745 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I have to call this my go-to-store. I live close and it's mostly my store of choice when I have to resupply on first necessity items, and mostly anything else that is not a major purchase. I get good deals on brand names.
The employees are very attentive and friendly, wich is another reason why I like to visit this store.
I'm so glad this store is in my vecinity, I can even walk from home when I have to.
I save money and get what I need!; While on vacation decided to buy beers and few things to have at our hotel room. At the register the cashier ask for my ID because of the beer, which I provided. She then ask for my wife ID as well. We ask why and she said that according to Walgreens policy all people in the party must provide ID. Since our plan was to just do a quick stop and I was the one driving my wife did not brought her ID. I though the cashier was kidding but after scanning everything she refuse to charge the beers. Ask to speak with the Manager and Vicente Ramos, Assitant Manager, shows up. He told me exactly the same as the cashier. I explained to him the situation and also that policies are guides that are made for a particular reason and that he can clearly see that my wife is not a minor. Managers should exercise proper judgment in this kind of situations.  He kept his mind set to not allowing me to by the beers and strictly said that is was policy and that he could not do anything about it. That I could call Walgreens customer service to complain, which I did after heading out. After speaking with representative from Walgreens customer service it turns out that is was exactly like I was telling him, that policy states that they only ask for IDs of all party members if they suspect one of them is a minor. More so their policy says that if one of the person do not have the ID they can just provide verbally their birth date. Customer service told me that the store manager, Madeline Rivera, will call me to apologize for the bad experience Vicente create yesterday (really hope she call). I do not understand why managers instead of using policies to guide them and made customers feel safe for shopping there, turns out they use them to make customers experiences difficult and unpleasant, which at the end will turn customers away. Also if you are going to enforce a policy make sure you understand it well because it seems in this case that they didn’t even read it completely or this experience will never had happened.  Hope this store correct this situation because the actions of Vicente could keep turning customers away from their doors.; Clean location and friendly staff. Conveniently located off the main highway and right next to plenty of eating options. Their souvenir section is less than desirable. However, overall 5 stars!; :P The cashier was so rude while ringing up my purchase.. grabbing everything roughly & slamming items in the grocery bag after scanning them. I literally asked her if she was ok, or having a bad day.. she replied with "im having a good day, thanks.. i just hate my job!" wow! Someone there pissed her off. :( SMH; Touch tone options don’t work. You get stock in a loop repeating and repeating. I am out of state trying to ask a question for pharmacy. It’s sad when your are trying to get info for your elderly parents.

Reviews: I used Uber eats to order two types of alcohol on the website and neither were available and the manager of the liquor store called me and said he did not have either available so I canceled the order. I thought I was going get a full refund and I did not. Apparently I was supposed to ask for it. I did file a complaint with Uber and I didn’t like the response I got from them. So consumer beware of using Uber eats and canceling an order. $50 down the drain; The most outrageously expensive place I've ever seen ... Example: a pint of Sailor Jerry just a few hundred yards down the road, $8.99 - here - $20.99 ... A 5th anywhere else is less than their pint!! Everything in there was CRAZY high prices - massive rip off and normally if I have a super bad review I just skip it but this I had to warn y'all about!; Good select poor management, accused of stealing on my second day of shopping at the same location. The same two brothers with poor judgment accused my water bottle from king soopers of being a product of theirs in my jacket pocket I promptly pulled it out and to my surprise they still insisted something was in my pockets. Even after being profiled and watched through the whole store I was about to pay when the brother started being rude. I got upset and said never mind. When i began to walk out the brother blocked the entrance demanding to see my pockets i pulled everything out fast since it was only wallet and phone. He said get out of my store like i wasnt already trying to. Worst service made me feel like horrible when i bought sometuing yesterday.  So as a tip. Dont show up with a hoody or a water bottle. This is not a high crime area for this to make sense.. just completely stereotyping the way I dressed. I was riding for hours on my motorcycle. Shame.; The coward won't except the court orders for being a thief and cannot repay the loan for his house and store please reconsider ever shopping hear 🤔; Great selection of beer, wine and liquor. All beer stored in the fridge so it's ready to go. Fastest to ask for what you're looking for as the organization is kinda all over the place.

Reviews: They have a good assortment of wines. The past few visits have been disappointing, though, and I won't be back. The prices marked on the shelves (if they even list them), have been a few dollars off from what actually rings up at the register. Price adjustment requests were only honored half the time. The last time I even offered to take the incorrect price sign down for them, but they preferred to leave it. I understand cost of goods increase and prices need to be adjusted, but I don't appreciate the disregard for their own advertised prices.; I was only in here briefly but the staff were nice and SOME of the beer was decently priced. It looks bigger inside than what it looks outside.; Hidden Gem! Don’t be fooled by the intimidating exterior this wine and liquor store has a wide range of beer, wine and spirits. From local brews to Coors, Franzia to Dom,Smirnoff to Belvedere; they have it all..and at the best prices short of a bulk discount store.; This is... one of the best stores i've ver been in. great selection... amazing human beings running the establishment. They are always so kind to me. Even when I get a craving for a snack, they have amazing stuff.; Awesome liquor store, definitely going back again.

Reviews:
Super nice lady.
Offered to help immediately had a wide selection of both wines and liquors a huge amount of already chilled coolers. The only drawback is the parking and is getting in and out of the parking lot.; Place is fantastic as far as liquor stores go.  The management team are great, friendly and funny.  The support staff are a little quirky and oddly attired but friendly.  All sorts of interesting candy and snack things for sale in addition to the staple of booze.  There is an old golden retriever who is super sweet you have to occasionally navigate around and a set of hilarious birds behind the counter you can watch while you pay.; Worst Liquor Store Ever!  Overpriced!  Shopped there for years to get a measly 10% off, which should be the normal price (if not less) anyways!  They like to pack their 12-packs in plastic  like they were 6-packs, so you won't make it to your car after purchase, without your entire selection spilling out onto the parking lot.  Hundreds of liquor stores in the hood.......find another, my friends!  Save your money!; Wine selection is mostly well known decent names. Pretty good beer selection for a small establishment. The owners and their staff are always very friendly. Always willing to show me whats new as I enjoy that!  Ive been shopping here for 9 years and continue to support this small, family owned business.; The Best and super friendly neighborhood liquor store in the area. The owner and staff are very friendly and helpful. Even though they have got great selection to choose from they do not hesitate to special order any beer, wine or spirit if you put in a request and every week they have something new and always promotes local breweries, 'kudos! guys keep up the good work'.

Watch where you walk when going as there's some pretty disgusting critters I'd rather not mention (ladies watch those open shoes) on the walk & the store is old & a bit dirty.; Small and not a great selection but the lady working there was nice; My friends and I came to Vegas for the night and needed drinks. Our experience here was good. The nice lady behind the counter gave us good recommendations for Whisky.

The store that we parked our truck in front of across the parking lot has really high prices and $65 cowboy hats (not worth the price). They didn’t waver on the price when I tried to get it down to $20.

It was great that I walked into Strip Liquor afterwards and was greeted by the warm ambiance and friendly smiles of this establishment’s employees.; mandee was a pleasure. she made my first time in Vegas a memorable experience, thank you for helping us!! very helpful; Leah and Joel were super friendly...they greeted us right away and told us their special when we were ringing up...this place has AC and amazing

Name: Las Palmas Liquors
Address: 714 N Nellis Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89110, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 714 (street_number); North Nellis Boulevard (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89110 (postal_code); 6013 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
I don't know if new owners took over recently or what, but there's a new cashier there (a heavyset balding black dude in his 40's with a beard and glasses) who's a major power-tripping a-hole. A week or so ago he told me I couldn't lock my bike to the front gate (which I've been doing for the 2 years I've been patronizing this store) and today he asked me for my ID, which they've also never done. I'm 54 and definitely look over 21, and when I pointed out that they've never aked me for ID there previously, he said "if you don't like it, you can go to another store" and then when I asked why he always gives me a hard time, he refused to serve me. This guy has a really bad attitude and needs to be fired or else he's going to lose the store business.

In regards to the owner's response, my bike wasn't blocking the entrance - I locked it to the security gate that was swung open and secured to the wall next to the doorway like I've done there dozens of time and no employee there has ever said anything. Also, as I said I'm 54 and don't look under 40. I can understand stores asking for ID - it was the rude way he did it and then him saying if I had an problem with it I could go somewhere else thar was the issue. That's no way to treat customers, especially regular ones.; This store came up in a Google search for Calvados apple brandy from France, so I went to the store, but they had never heard of Calvados.; The woman that was working tonight is the reason I will continue to shop there.; Really good prices on your favorite Spirits/beverages  and smokes. This place even have a discount system setup. Just enter your phone number and you'll receive points on purchases.; Sells to minors.
Caught my kid with a bottle and she told me she went into this store and they did not card her.

Reviews: A nice choice to buy liquor in Las Vegas. It provides a wide range of alcoho($5 to $20k)l. You can get help from the shop assistant if so.; I purchased $20 tickets to attend the Patron Cocktail Lab at Total Wine with my friend on a Friday evening at 6pm.  It was a really lovely experience.  The event took place in a back room that had multiple tables, chairs and snacks set up.  The event began with an in-depth discussion on Tequila and how it is made.  We were all provided with 3 Patron tasting samples as well as mini Margaritas (my favorite)!  I enjoyed the experience quite a bit.  We were also provided water which was great since I ended up with a lot of Margaritas and a cool recipe guide!  I would definitely recommend this experience.  The staff at Total Wine were all very knowledgeable, friendly and open to questions.  The group I was with was full so I recommend booking tickets in advance..; Hubby really enjoyed the free sample stations, and felt like a kid in a candy store when it came to stocking up on international wines. Store employees were super friendly and helpful. Displays were very eye-catching, and made shopping "fun"! Coming from Cali, this was a treat on our vacation weekend to Vegas.; I have always loved Total Wine and More, the first one I visited was in Boca Park. This one is next to Town Square in the best location. I went there the last Saturday of 2023 and was offered samples of an amazing tequila. It was clear, chocolate, vanilla chai and simply amazing. I am not one who drinks tequila; however, it caught my eye long enough to add to cart.; The name says it it all. They have a bit of everything. Prices vary from rare to regular.😉 They have a feature tasting center and a classroom for classes. The have shelf stuff and cool cases. Soooo much to see ...so much to try.

Reviews:
What a great locally owned liquor store.  Such an amazing variety and great service.   I’ve driven by this place so many times and had NO idea what I was missing out on.

I don’t live close to this place but now I will be making special trips for the great selection and the beers on tap.   You can have samples and if you wish then you can get a growler to go.   They currently have 3 different Goose Island beers on tap and that was a A+ move on their part along with 3 other beers to try.

Janessa and Teri are super awesome and helpful.  They helped me get my Thursday off to great start.; The Best Craft Beer Spot in The SouthWest Valley.
Beer from as far as the East Coast, some Chicago brewers, and even Fargo, ND (talking about you Drekker), Wyoming, Montana, and Washington and Oregon Brewers. Overall just a great place to get niche, hard to find, great-quality beer. Top Shelf always has great beer rotations coming through in the forms of single 16 oz mix n match, and draft beer to-go in growlers. This is the go-to spot for beer in the Southwest Valley.; Top shelf wine and sprits are the best, they know their stuff and have the goods! The only place in Las Vegas that has Nooku Bourbon Cream. Old Elk special; Great Local Liquor Shop with an outstanding Bourbon Selection!   Friendly and Helpfull staff, and a lot of hard to find bottles in stock.; Came back from the Virgin Islands with a very specific request - Pussers PainKiller RTD. They didn't have it, but could get it. A couple weeks later, I came in to pick them out of the fridge. Soooo good! Gonna be a repeat customer. Grab a PainKiller while you are here. You won't be disappointed, like your father. J/k... Cheers!

Reviews: Save your $$$ go to Lee's Liquor. All products are marked up. Store is dirty and unmanaged. Cashier will mock you and overcharge.; Best liquor in Las Vegas hands down. prices are great and they are open 24 hours so they are always available for those last minute trips.; Fantastic selection of liquor here.; I am a visitor to Las Vegas and chose to go to Liquor Land because it was was the closest liquor store to my hotel. All liquor is stored behind a long counter to the left when one enters the store. Liquor is stored up to the ceiling which made it hard to find brands and prices. The prices seemed high so I did not buy anything rather, I went to Albertsons Grocery across the street where I had bought scotch last year. The price I paid was $8.00 less than this location. It was recommended by an Albertson's shopper to go to Lee's Discount Liquors on Rainbow St. so I will try there for buying my higher-end scotch gift purchase soon. Liquor Land isn't horrible, there are just better options available.; I have shopped at this store for six months since moving up here .spending twenty,thirty sometimes buying just a couple of beers .today i went to buy millers 16oz cans from the back corner marked at 99 cents a can.i have purchased these same items before no problem ,today i grabbed 3 cans at 99cts & 1 kingsized reeses peanut butter cups 2$ & change the cashier who is usualy fairly cool & easy to talk to.polite,helpful etc.rang up $10.59 which is about double the price for 3 millers & 1 candybar .when i pointed this out he told me that was what he was charging i told him that was the wrong price.he got angry and pulled my items behind  the counter and told me to leave .i did nothing to warrant this treatment. I told him as much  as and he just got angrier and we ended up arguing  as i was leaving he called me a name and at me like he was going to assault me? What kind of customer  service is this .i have spent hundreds  of dollers in this place and did not warrant this kind of treatment. So what's this guy's problem. He even acted like he was going to come outside and attack me when he saw that i was ready to defend myself he thought better of it.now i don't understand why this man tripped out on me like that when normally we interact just fine. Im not going  to spend my money in this store anymore .this man is racist against americans period. I got a bad about this man something wrong with him.michael kennedy

Name: Top Shelf Wine & Liquor
Address: 6795 W Tropicana Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89103, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Address Components: 6795 (street_number); West Tropicana Avenue (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89103 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Their bourbon selection is top notch.  Blanton's, Blanton's Gold, and Barrel Proof Blanton's all for reasonable prices.  Multiple varieties of Pappy's.  Tons of Japanese whiskey.  A whole wall of scotch, but I don't know scotch.  Rare varieties of everything imaginable.  Fantastic customer service.  They were happy to sort through bottles for the letter I needed.; I called to check on a product in stock the girl that worked there said they had both the bottles I was looking for. I get there after a $40 cab ride to find they did not have them it was 2 different bottles. Yikes! I bought another bottle while I was there. Maybe help educate your employees on the products you carry.; Stopped in for the wraps and found these terpene infused shots from the Happiest Hour! They are blowing up tik tok and I had try them.... and wow!

Worth ever single penny. Mever had a better experience with my favorite past time in my life. These really work! Ive tried and love them all!

Highly recommend.; You can find some great deals at this store if you’re a regular. The prices for allocated Bourbon and Tequila are perfect for travelers staying on the strip. It’s a quick Uber ride away and will save you a few bucks compared to strip prices. Mark is the owner and works most week days. He’s very friendly and treats regular customers very well. Lately, the store has had some amazingly delicious store picks.; The store has a lot of products packed into a smaller space making it feel tightly packed or closed-in. Although, that impression could be the result of me usually shopping at Lee's. The employees were nice and the store was clean. The prices are more expensive than Lee's, so I'll only go back for particular items when I can't find them at my usual place. All in all, a decent choice for a liquor store.

Name: Total Wine & More
Address: 5720 Centennial Center Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89149, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 5720 (street_number); Centennial Center Boulevard (route); Centennial Hills (neighborhood); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89149 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Convenient location off 95 and Centennial Pkwy. Lots of parking with handicap parking up front. Carts available at entrance. No masks required. Very neat, clean organized. Large selection from low to high prices. Very helpful, accommodating, friendly customer service. We ordered items for pickup. They called right away when items were ready. The assistant manager was quick in retrieving the items. Cashier was great. We will be returning and or ordering online.

7/5/22 Revisited Total wine today. No masks required. Still maintaining organized neat and clean interior. We were looking for specific items. We found two of them but needed help on the third. Customer service rep was extremely helpful. She went above and beyond locating the item. She climbed up the ladder to the top shelf, pushed aside boxes and found the item at the back.  She was determined to find it and we were very pleased.

Shopped here recently. No masks required. Still neat organized and clean. Shelves were well stocked. Customer service is still friendly and helpful. Checkout was fast.; [Above all, will I be back?]
This place is an adult version of a candy shop! It is as big as Costco, there are several tasting booths. I tried whiskey from North Carolina and flavored cocktails and of course I got bunch of them! I wish I had this brand in my area.. As a Vegas local, definitely I will be back!

1. Ambience
It is huge liquor store with many different section. From Japanese whiskey to brewery beers, you can find most of the common brands here!  Well stocked and organized. Easy to shop. Well lit, high celling and well airconditioned. Decorated sections with theme here and there. I love their wedding selection(champagnes in pretty packaging) with flower decor. They offer consultation for wedding. There is a cigar room.

2. Service
Staff was helpful to find what I was looking for and cashier was friendly.

3. Hygiene
The bottles were not dusty, floor was clean.

4. Location
It is right next to 95 and near In-N-Out burger and La-Z Boy Furniture in Centennial Hills

5. Parking
It is in a shopping plaza so there is a plenty of parking.

6. ETC
- Pick up or delivery available
- Class and event room in this location
- Gift card available
- Reward system
- Dog friendly

** If this review was helpful, please vote :) @juxycat **; Thankful and easy! I'm not really much of a drinker so I went in looking for some gift ideas on what to get a friend. I had a few small ideas in mind but I really had no idea what to pick. It was definitely a huge store with lots of options! Charles helped me find a few perfect gifts. So helpful, kind and very knowledgeable. Much appreciated!; It always smells as if it's a brand new store when ever you walk through the big glass sliders! Super helpful people, and most everything is always in stock. Great pricing that's lower than Lee's for pretty much every liquor brand we buy. Wish they had quicker curbside order availability but it's not a big deal to go through and get your own stuff. Just would be more convenient...; An adult version of a candy store with a fine selection of liquors,wines, beer, whisky, vodka and the list goes on! Good  customer service with good knowledge of  various brands and types of alcohol products. Don't forget to create an account for frequent shopper points earn online or in-store!  This place will knock your socks off once you stroll down the aisles. One must try not to Salivate in public, it's hard but possible! 😺

Reviews:
I love the ABC stores. They always have interesting things to look at and as you can’t get from other places, they have a free gift if you spend over $100 which is normally a cup, calendar or a bag. It’s always a fun place to visit and enjoy coming here to look around.; First time visiting the store. Very nice with verity of things to choose from. Prices were a little high side but nice place to pick some souvenirs up.; Best place to pick up beers and snacks to take back to the room. Don't pay for overpriced stuff in the hotel, it's worth the short walk to stock up your own cooler. Great prices and selection, as authentic as the shops in Waikiki; MUST VISIT!

GREAT prices for bargain souvenir shirts! 4 for $20 ranging from XS to XL. Higher quality souvenir shirts were $15 (still not bad compared to gift shops in the hotels).

The prices aren’t high here at this store for liquor, wine, magnets, beach bags, basic necessities like water bottles & food.

$.99 for a regular bottle of water vs at the hotel, it was $6. Another great deal was a 32 oz bottle of water was 2 for $6 compared to ONE 32oz bottle of water at MGM was $22. I’m a penny pincher so I was definitely a happy camper in this store!!

COME HERE!!!; Located right at the bridge, you can't possibly miss it. This ABC store is right across from Park MGM, Eaterly entrance. Standard ABC Store, don't expect anything different from the others. Just find one that's most convenient for yourself to visit.

She wasn't sure what to do at that point as they didn't even offer to get another soap or recommend an alternative. She was unsure what to do from there as the clerk just kept checking her out. They need a new person that orders the merchandise this one is no good. It's been going on for a long time now n aint right.; Says they close at 11pm. I rushed here after work. I can do the shop quickly but if you are going to stop letting people in at 10:50, post that you close at 10:50, so that I don't waste my time and gas. I live in AZ city, it's a big deal; We had a pretty bad experience with Wal-Mart yesterday. My wife made an order for pickup. When she got home, she was missing 10 items. She tried calling them for over 30 minutes with no answer to let them know so we could come back to pick them up. The older lady returned back to us and said she would get someone. 10 minutes goes buy and still nobody. We eventually stood on a box and got the items ourselves. I hope the store Manager gets this review and trains the employees on customer service and how to do their job.

Name: Walgreens
Address: 7939 E McDowell Rd, Scottsdale, AZ 85257, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 7939 (street_number); East McDowell Road (route); South Scottsdale (neighborhood); Scottsdale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85257 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I went to load my Chime card here. Which I do every two weeks at the nearest Walgreens location.
This is the only time I had a problem.
Chime has a load limit of 1000 per day, which you have to do as two separate transactions.
The manager told the cashier it was a 750 limit. I advised that I am pretty sure it's 1000 and the manager replied back in a cocky manner I'm pretty sure it's 750 and just walked away. As I complained to the associate that this was the only Walgreens I had a problem with he said well there is two other ones you can go to.
So if the limit is 750 then why was I able to go to another Walgreens and load the remaining 250 onto my card?
Talk about not being treated as a valued customer.
I would not recommend going to this Walgreens.
The one on Dobson and Main is better and they treat you with respect and dignity.; Pharmacy is the laziest people ever. No phone call or anything just cancel a prescription sent to them without an explanation. DO YOU'RE JOB!!! It's not rocket science putting pills in a little bottle is not the only thing that comes with the job customer service and actually talking to people is part of it too.; The clerk Jason had both register systems lock up on him. I set my stuff down on one side of the counter. He begins to yell at me screaming at me to leave. Saying not to throw my stuff down. In front of other customers and his coworkers. Turns and screams at shamaya. Jason, you need to learn to take a break and step away from everything, and just breathe. It's not that Serious.  Chill out. I really hope your single otherwise I feel sorry for your wife. And you should be a lot more careful who you speak to like that, I'm surprised no ones put you in your place.; My 16-yr-old-child (who is on the spectrum and wandered away from his bus stop) came into this store today (3/5/24) and they called the police on him! He thought he was supposed to buy adult diapers for his grandpa, who is now deceased. He once went there with his 'paw-paw' and was having an episode and became confused as to why he was there. So Walgreens, in their touching concern, called the police to arrest him! My question to Scottsdale's finest when they phoned me: "so Walgreens called YOU on him but not only was he NOT stealing but also NOT bothering anyone or destroying any property?" Police-woman to me: 'I guess so".

So I'd like to thank the wonderful staff who worked there around 3-4 pm today for thinking the kids of color who come into your store and wander around are there to steal something. (P.S. He had his youth debit card on him that we gave him so was going to make a purchase, that is why he was there.) His disability made it hard for him to focus and choose without his parents there to help him but I do so THANK WALGREENS staff present for being such racial-profiling chicken-craps that my child scared you into phoning the law to help with the no crime in progress. I am sure you were in such peril!!! It is 2024 and you are so deficient and poorly trained in customer service that it never occurred to you to ask him if he needed any help? Just call the cops on a whole kid, right? Now, he is very traumatized cos he does not understand what he did wrong and keeps crying about the police coming to arrest him. Thanks for that. No wonder I prefer CVS. You truly suck and I hope your own kids experience paid adults being too dumb in their own establishment to note YOUR child's distress but instead call the cops on them! You'll enjoy that.; This Walgreens Pharmacy is by far the worst, all employees are rude as hell and when your meds are suppose to be ready, you go to pick it up and they look and talk to you like your a liar. Y’all need new employees and pharmacist. Don’t call just before their lunch break they’ll keep putting you on hold until they go to lunch. Pathetic!

Reviews: It was about 2 months ago the last time I went to Warehouse Liquors and found peanut butter flavored whiskey. As a responsible drinker, I know not to drink this stuff too fast and too quick, it hits without warning...; Warehouse Liquors, located on North Main Street Woonsocket, RI 02895, is the only liquor store within walking distance of that section of Woonsocket, since Champ's Liquors of Clinton Street, moved...I browsed the whole store, every display was neat and clean...there's a few shopping carts available, but no public restrooms, no handicapped accessibility available, including the entrance door...found a peanut butter flavored whiskey nip for $1, and it tasted really good...; Friendly owners and always have what I need. Just today i was informed what would be the best gift for a fellow patron and friend. And knowing i couldn't afford that, i was then provided with a viable option.

First off, their  prices are competitive, secondly,  they have a great rotating selection of discounted beers and wines. Finally,  and maybe most importantly, they have staff that have been there for many years. The Owner plugged it into his computer and also had some great suggestions, they got everything I needed and loaded in my SUV. I was stressing about the quantity of beer, wine, and liquor for the mixed drinks and they took care of all that! The Party was a Great Success! Thank You Kingstown Liquors; Great wine selection , always go in for one thing and leave with a case!; Discount beer shelf!!!

Address: 1896 County St, Dighton, MA 02715, USA
