Reviews: They have a good variety, but are slightly overpriced.  I've also come here, and found out of code beer.  One day the beer was dated for January (2024), but the next time I got the same beer it was two months expired (Sept 2023).  I have checked other places so sometimes this is the case, but I already found another store carrying that same beer with a February stamp, not a September stamp.  Rotation is key.; Not a fan.  A couple of men behind the counter gabbing in a language I don't understand while I browsed the store.  No attempt to assist me.  I shopped this store before Mendoza sold out many years ago.  I found the racks of nips, sold in multi-packs, and the security-themed checkout booth reminiscent of my travels to South-Central LA in the 90's.  Owner:  Dighton is a podunk farm-friendly community, and I'm sure I speak for the masses... tone it down a little!; Tried them for the first time last week, and found my new favorite beer.  Sadly tonight I went back for more before 10 and when I arrived the neon sign is still flashing open and the front door was still propped open.  Told me sorry they are closed.  Thats a shame guess I need to find that same beer elsewhere.  I despise poor customer service.  If your sign says open and your posted hours say you're open then you should be open for your customers.  Guess they don't want my business.; These guys really know how to run a business at Mendoza's Package Store. They thrive on their customers impulses to purchase all sorts of booze. They're marketing skills exceeds multiple surrounding packies. They shoot for excellence as they provide the full amount of customer service. Hands down one of the top competitors in a package store in the northeast region!; Extremely rude cashier in the afternoons. Prices are very high compared to other similar stores only a couple of miles away. It is not a clean place at all either.

Name: El Ancla Bakery
Address: 89R5+4R8, Fajardo, 00738, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM
Address Components: 89R5+4R8 (plus_code); Fajardo (locality); Sardinera (administrative_area_level_2); Fajardo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00738 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This bakery was the closest to where we were staying and decided to order breakfast to go. Let me start by saying the food was amazing. We ordered the French toast breakfast sandwich and it came with fries. There is definitely leftovers for lunch and not too sweet. We also ordered the tripleta and it was delicious 🤤

The young lady at the register leaves much to be desired. Very dry and doesn’t seem to want to be there. As much as we loved the food, we won’t return with someone like that at the counter. Smile more, your day will go by faster and might be more pleasant.; First I was not greeted whatsoever by the cashier as she was too busy chatting on her cellphone and just handed me a menu. My husband and I wanted breakfast and arrived at 11a and she proceeded to tell us they were not serving breakfast. So, my husband order white rice with red beans, and steak and I had maduros and tostones which were cold and old with a orange squeezed small juice of which I was charged $6.50 and total came out to $21 definitely was overcharged for the horrible food and service! Don’t bother!!! Not a typical boricua hospitality; Is rare that I genuine like someone else’s cake. However I must say I loved the cake prepared by El Ancla Bakery. The owner has a hand for desserts and the cake typical of Puerto Rico. The cake was perfect in texture truly perfect. And it was not super sweet or soaked in a overly flavored syrup. It was spongy, soft and with very delicate and fine crumb. Recommended. Plus the prices are very affordable. If you want to know what I am talking about they also sell pieces of the cake. You can try what is a very good genuine Puertorrican cake at El ancla.; 3rd time at this place, today I had lunch for the 1st time. Went in looking for sushi as advertised, but got a tasty and fresh lasagna instead stuffed with ground beef, ricotta, and cheddar cheese inside, with melted mozzarella cheese on the outside; complimented by fried plantains for $13 dollars. The bakery is very clean and of modern design with the classic amenities expected from a bakery that offers breakfast and lunch. Pastries are diverse and  beautifully decorated. Fresh ingredients are key to fabulous food and pastries confection at this bakery. On the other hand I was disappointed with customer service. The 1st time, unlike today, I felt welcomed. Local customers support local businesses throughout the year, and attention to customer service is imperative for business growth. As a Google guide interested in promoting our local businesses, for the 1st time I identified as one and asked permission to take photos of the pastries and the food to be respectful, but was told in a unfriendly way that the photos and menu were already posted, only to find that photos were 26 days old; so I didn't take any photos as for my visit today. Today, the cashier was too busy looking at TV while I was asking for lunch, and the 2nd visit cashier was too busy talking to another person while I'm finalizing a purchase. Food , pastries, and coffee are really good. I'm sure they can improve customer service.; Amazing Food! But the Lady in the front is very rude and bad customer service. Please need be take care this.

Name: Crazy For Donuts Cookies & More
Address: Urb Baralt Calle: Principal I-30 Local B, 28 Av. Baralt, Fajardo, 00738, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:30 – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 4:30 – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 4:30 – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 4:30 – 5:00 PM; Friday: 4:30 – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 12:30 – 4:00 PM; Sunday: Closed

Address Components: 28 (street_number); Avenida Baralt (route); Fajardo (locality); Quebrada Fajardo (administrative_area_level_2); Fajardo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00738 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Crazy for Donuts is a must-visit location for anyone looking for a sweet treat in the eastern side of Puerto Rico. Donuts that are as soft as a pillow, excellent local coffee and even low-carb options for those looking for a guilt-free dessert, it's all there.

Few places have a great combination of food, quality, presentation and variety, but this one has it all. Staff is kind, friendly and willing to fill you in on all the sweet details to ensure you get the donut that's for you. You can feel the enthusiasm for what they do. Take a look at the attached pictures and you'll see they pay attention to both the donuts and how they are presented. Upon entering the shop you are greeted by a beautiful display, containing those sweet carbs. To the side are donut cups and other things that truly pull you into the experience.

Now let's talk about the donuts, which do I recommend? Honestly, start with the basic glazed donut. Have a bite of that and you'll understand why I recommend this place. Just the right amount of sweetness, fresh dough and soft to the touch. I'd also highly recommend the maple bacon donut for that balance between sweet and sour.

I will absolutely make this a regular stop whenever I'm nearby Fajardo, because I have to try out all their other flavors!; Crazy For Donuts is a cute donut and coffee shop. The owner is very welcoming and friendly. My friend told me that the maple glazed bacon chocolate donut was very good. I tried the pistachio donut, which didn't taste like natural pistachio. The base of all the donuts are the same; a soft raised donut. The hot chai latte was rich and creamy. Keto diet friendly donuts available.; The donuts are beautiful and tasty and they serve coffee too! Sergio was so nice and friendly and made my donut for me even though it wasn't in the case.; Really tasty donuts that are made fresh to order! Very well priced too! Owner and staff are very friendly and helpful with their advice on which donuts to order. They have the usual classics and then donuts with fillings and/or toppings.; Donuts made fresh! Inside  waiting area available. It was hard to decide because everything looked so delicious. I will be back to try the strawberry.

If not stocked they will order for you.
Great stop; Went back after a while and had a super friendly and lovely experience. Their inventory is quite extensive for a small liquor store.; They basically have every liquor and wine you can think of in there. It's the same staff for years and they're very polite and nice. And they noticed there a lot cheaper than other liquor stores.; I have been out of town for a few years and stopped by to grab a bottle of wine. They still have some of the best selections in town and always able to walk you through your questions. This place is family owned and run by the same wonderful people who have owned it for many years. It was nice to see the same familiar faces and to be recognized as well.  Keep up the great work you guys do, we appreciate you guys being a part of our community; Great little liquor store with a surprisingly Grand inventory. I had a nice chat with the lady and gent who were working. Had a few laughs, they seemed really personable. I picked up a bottle of nice quality Italian limoncello for a great price. The Jameson was a little more expensive than I usually pay but this place is super convenient and has fun uncommon selections. Definitely swing by and give them a look see. I'm sure you'll be happy you did.

Reviews:
Been here numerous time in the last 3 years, seen my ID each and every  time I’ve came here, without even getting to the counter the clerk stared me down and asked for an I’d. I told him I left it in the car which I did,  he didint even give me a chance to get it, and told me to “never to come back ever again” and to put the drinks back. extremely rude and unprofessional take your business elsewhere; If I could give this place a no star I would. This place has no consideration for its surrounding areas. Open late, loud music, and solicitation every single weekend. It's wash, rinse, and repeat. Cops have been there almost every weekend and yet still this continually happens. Considering there is an entire apartment complex across the street, you would think they may have some consideration some people have work early  the following day and do not want to be harassed by the thudding bass emanating from their very small bar. This place isn't a lounge or a sleek club that it should even entertain the idea of having a DJ, yet it does. Honestly sick of this place.

***Update***
Still loud, now it's getting to be at least twice a week where I have to hear this bar's loud music OVER my television. In regard to the "response" I received for my review...there is no reason for me to stop by to discuss whatever concerns I have. All I want is some consideration for the people who live in close proximity to your bar. There is no reason why you should be blasting music at 12 AM in the morning.  My review states what my issues are.; Went here a bunch of times, but one evening the clerk took my fiancee’s ID and would not give it back insisting it was fake. He then called the police on her, who came and confirmed it was a legitimate ID. Will not go back.; The liquor store guy is shady. Twice I have been in there and both times he tried to short change me. I just can't spend my money in an establishment like this. Be aware!; I like the place met alot of nice people there got like a second family I also worked there and the boss sunny was great

Reviews:
Just a quick positive note on Walgreens photo service, which offers same day pick-up of photo prints.   I have used their service numerous times, and it is very consistently good.  The prices are also great and they run special offers all the time.  The online ordering tool works great and is easy to use.  You pay when you pick up the pictures so there is no sensitive data stored on their server.  For a longer wait, you can have your images printed on coffee mugs and other items.   That service also works really well.   It's kind of an old-school thing, but it's very nice when you want to frame your favorite photos!; I took my laptop and cell phone to Show Low Walgreens to get photos blown up of my African Safari. A once in a life time trip. I am a professional photographer of 30 plus years.
I am not a person of computer savvy in today’s world.
An employee named Cliff who said he was the store manager. I understand why. That MAN treated me with the up most respect. Took time to get my BEST pics blowen up to my satisfaction. This Cliff, MAN is without doubt, the “Employee Of The Year” in the Show Low area.
Give him a raise . A substantial raise. He is an employee that every company wishes they could have.
Robert Dinkel; Linda! Thank you. She made a bad situation better. Then I mistakenly went to pick up a prescription that wasn't ready. She immediately got on it so I didn't have to make another trip! Grateful; We were on vacation and I needed sunglasses for my kids. Walgreens had what I needed and a good selection. I ended up buying 4 pairs. Associates were readily available and helpful.; Pharmacy trips several times, they are rude af! I learned if you call em out, they are quite cowardly 😆

Reviews: Used Apple Pay and cashier/owner ripped me off $24 . Tried showing him the transaction on my phone.  I tried to reason with him without escalating the situation. He refused .; I was on a short trip down from Hollister. When I arrived 45 minutes early I thought I would get a drink.  I quickly remembered that id given all of my cash to the kids right before I left home.   Of course I didn't have any of my cards with me either.   Thinking no big deal I grabbed my parking meter money and stroled in to San Lorenzo Liquor.  The drink I picked out was $5.09  total.  Just about $1 more then  home.  I didn't say anything about the price and just smiled as I pulled out my meter money.  I casher who would not give me his name for the review quickly pulled the drink away and push my meter money towards me and said that my change was not going to be accepted because it wasn't ruled. Last time I checked quarters came in rolls of $10 not $ 5.09.   I left San Lorenzo Liquor thirsty.  I do not recommend this store.   The good side was,  there is a 7-11 right down the street 😊; Great people working here, love they're contagious friendliness.  One thing tho, please do check expectations dates on stuff you buy. Every time I buy drinks its 3 months old and some like coffee or milk are coagulate.  Other than that it's good place.; Pricy compared to what I'm used to in RI; Hands down best selection of craft beers and wines in town!

Name: CVS Pharmacy
Address: 280 N Avondale Blvd, Avondale, AZ 85323, USA
Address Components: 280 (street_number); North Avondale Boulevard (route); Avondale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85323 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I bought several items while I was there, their selection is great. My prescription is always ready on time.
Today I received both the covid and flu vaccinations, the pharmacist was very good! I didn't feel a thing.
Thank you for my pleasant shopping experience.
Carmen

P.S
I received coupons for getting my vaccines! I wasn't expecting that plus at the checkout counter, I received more saving coupons!; The staff in both the pharmacy and the store are terrific, super helpful and professional.  The store is clean and well stocked and they have a good selection of makeup and hair products.; The staff at this location have a bad attitude in the pharmacy. The person that checked me out was nice and helpful (during this visit) but I could hear the staff member attending the drive-window telling-off a customer. It’s was shocking. They were saying, “Is that it, because every time I walk away you need something else. So, tell me now so you don’t do that again.” It was really clear by her tone that she was angry and irritated with the customer. It was really awful to hear her speaking to someone that way. Even if the person was being annoying it’s the staff’s job (literally) to be patient and help. It’s not the first time this has happened. I have been on the receiving end of the pharmacy staff’s bad moods a few times. I was in the drive-up doing a PCR test and forgot to put the paperwork in the bag for the lab. I went into the store to give it to them and the staff member scolded me and said, “that’s supposed to go in the bag” with a super shard tone, and was rude and really disrespectful. I’ve had interactions with the manager who is just overly talk-y and asks too many personal questions and is then rude and weird if you don’t want to engage in business in that way. It’s like the staff is just angry and bitter all the time and they are going to make sure you know how irritated they are with you. CVS seriously needs to retrain the pharmacy staff. It’s a terrible experience dealing with them. And seriously, people that are picking up medicine have all kinds of issues that they are dealing with and not feeling well or have sick family and do not need to be treated poorly by a bunch a discontent, impatient, disaffected staff. If it’s too hard to do the job of interacting with the public they should get another job where compassion, empathy, maturity and professionalism is not required. CVS you need to do better.; Greatest cvs pharmacy went to doctor and send my medication cvs pharmacy on Van buren & Avondale and my prescription was ready like in 10 minutes.; The drive thru is limited to one line, so it usually takes a while to get through. But the staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews:
The staff were very kind and helpful. The pita wrap I got was delicious (super Greek one). My wife loved her bowl as well. I would easily go again.; They have good prices and a wide variety of wine. The cashier went to get a bottle of wine I couldn't locate and gave me a $2 off coupon.  I will be back; Super helpful and friendly staff, gave us some good recommendations as well; Great selection. Super staff.  Wine samples Friday from 4 to 6; I have a complaint about two wine and spirits in the Erie area. I purchased a bottle of wine and I went to return it because it was the wrong bottle. I did not have the receipt so the lady at the Peach Street Wine and spirits could not assist me she did not tell me it was a 14 day policy to return the bottle of wine, so I went home and got the receipt and went to the wine and spirits on 12th Street to return then Bottle of wine. Where I was rudely, turned down because I was past the 14 day window by one week. I could have read the receipt and educated myself however, I feel like the young lady at the Wine and spirits on Peach Street should’ve educated me on this as well, so I did not go home and dig for the receipt for days and then turn around and try to return it and be treated very rudely at the 12th street location.

I understand policy is policy and you have to put a deadline so people are not returning things months after the fact, however, I was one week late and like I stated, I went to another location without the receipt and had to go home and dig for the receipt. A little bit of kindness and communication could go along way. I think from now on, I’ll be purchasing my wine at giant eagle.

Name: Kroger Marketplace
Address: 2051 18 Mile Rd, Sterling Heights, MI 48314, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 2051 (street_number); 18 Mile Road (route); Sterling Heights (locality); Macomb County (administrative_area_level_2); Michigan (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 48314 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I usually don't leave negative reviews, but my experiences at this Kroger location have been so consistently awful that I feel compelled to warn others.

If you choose to shop here, be prepared for incredibly poor service. On my most recent visit, I waited in line for 30 minutes, only to have the cashier close the register just as it was my turn. With only two lines open and a large number of customers, it was evident that the staff were in no rush to assist anyone. This isn't an isolated incident—I've faced similar issues every time I've come here.

Expect long waits, unhelpful staff, and a general lack of consideration for your time and needs. Despite giving this store multiple chances, the service has never improved. I have decided to take my business elsewhere and advise others to do the same. Until this location seriously addresses its customer service and staffing issues, I cannot recommend shopping here.; I purchased several items today (7-13-24) for a boat day. After eating almost all of one of the dips, we noticed it was separating oddly. I checked the expiration date and realized it was two days ago. Not sure why they thought it was acceptable to leave this on the shelf and sell it to me.; I was in the store July 5 at 4PM.  Terrible experience. Understaffed to put it mildly. Waited at the deli for 10 minutes.  No one to help. Asked staff in prepared foods for help. She said they were poorly staffed. Asked to see manager. Never showed up.  Last week supplying banana display told me you get what you see when I asked if he had any green bananas. Today, I asked a stock man if he had the eggs for $1.49.  Told me he didn’t know and didn’t have time to look.
Multiple, probably 75 carts filled with items to be sorted across front of store, room for 1 person to exit emergency exit single file.  In an emergency no one would be exiting in that manner.  This is CLEARLY A VIOLATION and SERIOUS SAFETY ISSUE.
This store has serious problems.
My cashier was Bonnie.  She was very courteous and helpful. Helped me find a coupon so I could benefit from the lower price. She was the ONLY good thing I could say about today’s visit to this pathetic excuse for a store.; Very bad experience with a rude lady named Mariam (a lady around her 40s) and dressed with the least amount of effort. She literally rolled her eyes and complained to other customers for asking a question. I have always got a good experience, especially with a man named Ben. He was great. But the clerk named Mariam was just horrible and rude.; I decided to come on here and review today and noticed that I had an old review from over a year ago saying how great this place was. It was a five-star review. Well, that has all changed. What was the last straw for me was when I came to the door to go in a half an hour before closing time, and they would not let people in because they said they wanted everybody out by closing time. Well, in essence they made a new closing time, because if you can't go in for a box of cereal a half an hour before the store closes, well, in essence they made a new closing time. Not the time in the door.

What is the deal with the milk lately? They don't stock it like they used to.

I just think they're way overpriced, and I have found other places to shop that want my business more. I have been shopping at Walmart since and I've had no difficulty whatsoever. Walmart has a new loyal customer. I used to be a loyal Kroger customer. I do not recommend this particular store.

Name: Kroger Pharmacy
Address: 181 S Hwy 27, Somerset, KY 42501, USA
Address Components: 181 (street_number); South Highway 27 (route); Somerset (locality); Pulaski County (administrative_area_level_2); Kentucky (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 42501 (postal_code)
Reviews:
The worst pharmacy ever.
I called to make sure my script was ready for pick up, I was given confirmation it was ready.
I drove to pick it up and the woman working said it wasn't ready and they didn't have anything in process for me at all. She was frankly really rather rude. I asked if they could process it and if I could pick it up the next day. She said yes.
The next day comes around, I go to pick up my script and a different woman says it's not ready and they don't have anything in process for me. She was not nearly as rude, but it's still very frustrating to call and be told your script is ready, then have to go back multiple times just to get it.
I am officially switching to a new pharmacy; As someone who works in customer service daily. I have patience more than most. Today my son needed him prescription due to an ear infection. After leaving the urgent care office. I choice Kroger to fill his medicine. That will be my last attempt of EVER using Kroger! Amber at the drive thru has very unprofessional and rude. CVS went over and beyond to help us.; The personnel are always friendly and helpful to me. My big complaint like most people is wait time, specially inside. If a person‘s medicine is not ready to pull off the shelf and hand to them right then that person does not need to stand there taking up a window backing up other people whose medicines are ready, they need to take a seat and make way for other people to get on with their business. My last trip and I had a 30 minute wait time, and in that 30 minutes one lady took up one window for that whole time waiting on her medicine. That’s the part I find ridiculous that lady could’ve took a seat and several others could’ve been waited on while she waited for her medicine to be filled.; The past 3 times I've had to have prescription picked up, the wait time is horrible. It wouldn't be so bad if the drive thru was open, but despite being within the correct opening hours (and no where near lunchtime) it's been closed and I had to go in. Which includes holding a toddler for 30+ minutes every time.; I would give them less than one star.  They rarely open the drive thru and now they close for lunch regardless of how long you have been waiting in line.  They need to shut their pharmacy down altogether if they can’t provide any better customer service than that!!!

Name: Sipstirs Fine Wines Artisanal Spirits Craft Brews
Address: 203 Danbury Rd, Wilton, CT 06897, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 203 (street_number); Danbury Road (route); Wilton (locality); Fairfield County (administrative_area_level_2); Connecticut (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 06897 (postal_code); 4003 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Sipsters has excellent selection of spirits and wine. They really know their products and everyone who works there is helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. Great store.; I have been looking for a specific sangria and have inquired at multiple stores. Sipstirs was so friendly and happy to help. They stocked my preferred brand in 2 days and continue to keep it in stock. The customer service here cannot be topped.; Title: Exceptional Service and Selection: A Five-Star Experience at Sipsters Liquor Store

I cannot recommend Sipsters Liquor Store highly enough! From the moment I walked in, I was impressed by the extensive selection of spirits, wines, and beers. However, what truly sets Sipsters apart is their unparalleled customer service. David assured that our clients for our private events would be taken care of and he went above and beyond.

David, the owner, goes above and beyond to ensure that every customer has a fantastic experience. He is incredibly knowledgeable about all of the products in the store and was more than happy to offer recommendations based on my preferences. His passion for what he does is evident, and it's clear that he genuinely cares about his customers.

Not only is David accommodating, but he also goes out of his way to make sure that each customer finds exactly what they're looking for. Whether it's a hard-to-find bottle of whiskey or a special gift for a loved one, David and his team are dedicated to making sure that every customer leaves satisfied.

The store itself is impeccably organized and well-stocked, making it easy to find exactly what you're looking for. Plus, the prices are incredibly reasonable, especially considering the level of service you receive.

Overall, my experience at Sipsters Liquor Store was nothing short of exceptional. I will definitely be referring more clients in the future and would recommend it to anyone in the area looking for a top-notch liquor store experience. Five stars all around!; How can you possibly go wrong... Sipstirs offer amazing customer service and have such an extensive knowledge & selection of fine wines, artisanal spirits and craft brews! A definite winner and my new go-to when I'm in Wilton (taking a cooking class at AMG Catering & Events... ) and in need of excellent wine advice and trustworthy suggestions. Be sure to speak with my new found friend & store manager - Alex DiZenzo. More to come... 😁; Great experience overall! Attentive and very knowledgeable staff, quality product and fair prices, there is a wine in stock for every type of wine drinker! This shop has a charm about it that really sets it apart from you're average wine/beer store. The store felt intimate and I felt very comfortable asking staff for help. Thank you Sipstirs!

Reviews:
Getting a buzz on should be nonpartisan.

However, prepare to be exposed to strong political opinions via the older lady with longer gray hair stocking shelves in the weekday evenings.

Inappropriate behavior from somebody in a service role.; 5 stars for 1 guy who is so awesome who makes you feel welcomed, a friend and a amazing reason to comeback. Tall dude with such a superstar spirit. The 1 star is for the lady serving today around 5, horrible attitude, not friendly, no personality, cold, almost robotic with no soul. As good as the guy is, this girl is a robot with no feeling that will make you never return. We all have bad days but she is cold.; It's a convenient place to buy alcohol with a pretty decent selection. The employees are always friendly and seem to be pretty happy working there. Everytime I've been in there they're always joking with one another. I'm giving it 3 stars because the store is cramped. I also feel like if you're looking for specialty stuff you wont find it. The prices seem a bit higher than other locations as well.; This store is always clean, well-lit and offers a great selection of all wines, beers and liquors; in addition to associated drinks and snacks. The lady who works at the register is always pleasant and easy to talk to. Recommended highly.; Has been there for many years and is a staple of the area. Good service and a good inventory. Still, the building has looked the same for ages. It would be nice to see some form of structural improvement to match with times. The surrounding area is busy during rush hour, but the traffic isn't that bad.

It would be nice to see the liquor store work with the plaza to widen the main road near the entry way closest to the store. I understand that might be placing more responsibility on the liquor store than may seem fair, but improvement is necessary for the community or grow and prosper. We can all do better.

Reviews:
A kind gentleman named Jason assisted me and gave me excellent customer service. He made me want to only go to that store only. Very polite well mannered and has genuine energy which is hard to find…thank you Jason 🫡; This is a very convenient place to stop and get your favorite liquor, it’s not a big place but has plenty of choices,; This is really close to my house and super convenient. They have a big selection of wine, along with some specialty bottles. I have found a couple reds that I would have never tried before but decided to take a chance on them because the price point and the display made it intriguing!

The employees are absolutely fabulous and always friendly! Definitely a big help when I'm looking for something specific! They are also super patient with customers that may come in that have had maybe one too many or that are characters / suspicious.
The location is good because it's on a busy road but also in an area that gets a number of people who aren't as well off. So you may find yourself being asked for money or maybe just stuck in a conversation that you generally did not want to have. Though they mean well it's not always warranted or welcome.
Otherwise, Great Place!!; Very pleasant and helpful staff.; Usually a good place. Decent prices. Friendly staff that also are not afraid to speak their minds. Some of the "regulars" like to talk to the employees so you may either be waiting a few minutes or the cashier will take care of you While talking to the other person. (Not bad if you want a quick in & out)

Reviews: Great experience 👍🏾, they came through with everything we had asked for. Luv my new truck.; I could complain,  but the prices are good, the people are interesting, a lot to look at in a little space, and the alcohol works.; How you gonna have a signup saying No consumption of alcohol on property. No, loitering, and then everybody in the back. Hanging out loitering drinking alcohol on the property. Don't be a hypocrite, take down the damn sign; I've Been coming here since I turned 21, the prices are reasonable. You can walk in through the front entrance but can't park in the front due to the store is on the corner of a main street,parking in the rear is a little tight. They have bottle redemption and the rear entrance has stairs on the left side and a steep ramp on the right side, that in my opinion is not wheelchair accessible. So park in the back and use the sidewalk to wheel around to the front. They have a pretty good selection of Spirits and beers.; Tiny liquor store but VERY well supplied and great inventory.  If you are a top shelf drinker, then this is your place.  Extremely competitive prices.  Do not expect anything fancy, after all the lack of fancy store makes for the great prices.

Reviews:
So this morning I went to the store and was trying to get a scratch ticket, and the lady who is a manager there, was harassing me and calling police, becouse I asked her numbers on couple of tickets, actually it was 4 tickets wich I always buying and I have my lucky numbers.,so she was very annoyed about my ticket numbers and in the end she kicked me out of store without any ticket 😅omg what else I can say or do ,just have a big laugh of how peaple are kind. Have a easy day:); Fully renovate store . And great selection of beer , liquor and specialty wines; Went in with 26 empties. The clerk said he wouldn’t take them because I hadn’t bought them there. It was a case of Mike’s Hard Lemonade. He said we don’t sell those by the case, therefore you didn’t buy them here. I said you HAVE to take them, plus I’m buying something. He said I’ll take the 24 but not the extra 2 as they were Corona Lights. I said you’re gonna screw me out of a dime? After a foreign language conversation with another clerk he agreed to take all 26. So I buy a 12 pack of Corona Lights. The thing is none of there has prices on them, so I could have been ripped off anyway! They’re surly and hostile in there, and I’ll just go to Pride for my beer in the future.; Over priced.  ON EVERYTHING.  if you can choose another package store I would recommend you do so.; When first opened loved going here, was convenient and people friendly.
Lately They have hired younger lazy very rude individuals. I noticed a bit over Christmas and started going elsewhere, came back this weekend because was convenient and never again. Just rude guys who don't care how they are speaking to people. Not just me, there was an older person in store and guy couldn't be bothered helping them find something and acted aggravated.
For the prices they charge, please drive 5 miles in any direction and go somewhere else. No one should be rude to any customer and especially not a senior citizen.
I know the owner has been told this about some of the individuals and they clearly do not care!!

Name: Eddie's Package Store

Reviews:
Very honest and friendly.
Had been searching for the Crown Royal Blackberry for months and waited for it to come back to the stores.
When it finally came out again, I had called in the morning, hoping they had gotten some in their delivery. Was told they had not gotten any in but was more than welcome to call back to check on future deliveries. A few hours later, they called me saying they had gotten some in and didn't know because it was mixed in with another brand. They put it behind the counter for me and didn't overcharge me like another package store did.; The workers are great. I shop here often, and for the most part, everyone across the counter is good to talk to. Prices are good. I would recommend this to anyone; Best people working there if they don't have it they try to get it only place I go; Neighborhood package store, that treats customers with respect and Enjoy the commentary.; Every time I've been here there are no prices for the (already weak selection of) beer. I think this is a ploy to get people to buy no matter what the price is. I would rather go somewhere else where I know what the price is before I walk up to the counter. There's really nothing else special about this store that would bring me in there.

I recommend Allen Package Store to everyone!; They have a decent variety of different beer, wine and liquor. A very nice and friendly staff. Kind of like an old general store kinda feel. Name: Table & Vine
Address: 1119 Riverdale St, West Springfield, MA 01089, USA

Reviews: I absolutely loved visiting this store because they have an endless variety of Strong drinks. I have found it difficult to find stores that serve quality beverages the way this store does. My favorite part of this store is that they have a ginormous wine collection. They also have a section for non-alcoholic beverages. That is extremely appealing to someone like me. I highly recommend this place and I will definitely return soon. I want to remind everyone to please drink responsibly and in moderation. As grown adults, we should be setting the example for people around us, especially the next generation.; I come to this package store often only due to it's proximity to where I live,  and because they generally have a wide variety of liquor and beer here. The staff is usually pretty helpful/friendly. The only thing I wish they would do is add more of their sour and milkshake style craft beers to the refrigerated section cuz it sucks to purchase warm beer that I have to then wait for to get cold once I get home lol; There's a good wine selection and good prices too. However, the staff recommendations could be much better. They have a bias for Italian wines, which are good but let's face it, there are other countries that make wine as good (or even better, in my opinion) than Italy. The last time that I've been here I make it clear that I didn't want an Italian wine and that I don't like acid wines. The staff recommended me a Barolo and insisted me on buying it....I bought it, not very sure about it, and it was sooo acid. And I was so disappointed, as I felt that the staff recommended me something NOT based on my taste but based on something else.; Great selection of alcohol. The only problem is there is no bar supply's really. It's very limited. I was looking for a decent drink shaker. They have 1... and it's really small; Good selection my only issue is they have a ton of good beers that they don't keep cold. They have a " rapid chiller"  but tbh it's just a bucket of water doesn't do much to chill wine or beers ... But other than that they do a good job.

Reviews:
My husband and I have been going for years. There are good kind people working there. Always say hi and greeted with a smile.; The staff is great, very friendly and knowledgeable. Been going there for years and their prices are comparable to everyone else. Not a big store but has a good variety.; I go here to cash in all bottles and cans the Store is having some kind of issue with their distributors and they were not allowing anyone to get cash for their redemptions of cans and bottles but because I go in there a lot they allowed me to get cash. FYI whoever gets their bottles and cans pay this store what they need to be able to pay people what they need because someone coming in there might need the money for food or other personal items and can't use it as store credit. All I'm saying. Great Place; Family owned and the wife and her daughter are great  on suggesting and pairing up wines for your occasion. Place can use a coat of paint and updating to make it look fresh. The prices are reasonable and have a pretty big selection to choose from.; Beware. Expired craft brew everywhere.

What an awful experience. They had a wonderful selection of craft brew unfortunately most of it was expired some even over a year old.

The guy at the counter told me that one variety had just come in and I've had believed him. Unfortunately it wasn't fresh at all and tasted like a combination of feces, Malta goya, and champagne not the New England IPA flavor I was looking for for $16 a four-pack.

On closer inspection The Brew was out-of-date by at least a month meaning that it was around 8 or 9 months old.

Made me pretty sick too I'll never go there again.

While looking through the beer dates the guy in the circle counter kept giving me a hard time. Even to the point of trying to tell me that beer doesn't go bad because it's in a can. I said thank you and kept looking but he kept harassing me.

I picked up the four pack that I bought and he yelled "That just came in! If that's too old for you we're going to have a problem!" which is why I ended up just taking it an leaving and then finding out it was out of date afterwards.

Name: Manousos Wines & Liquors
Address: 398 Silas Deane Hwy, Wethersfield, CT 06109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 398 (street_number); Silas Deane Highway (route); Wethersfield (locality); Hartford County (administrative_area_level_2); Connecticut (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 06109 (postal_code); 2104 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Leave it to a place like this to ruin your day. I've lived in Wethersfield my entire life and have shopped here regularly. It was convenient and clean. Last night I went there to purchase wine, beer, and liquor for holiday giving. The usual guy takes my debit card and gives me a receipt for $125 and change. Note: this place **never** offers or gives a receipt unless the customer requests one. I think to myself, that's pretty high for two six packs of beer, two bottles of wine, and a bottle of liquor. BUT, I think, I'll check the receipt when I get home. When I got home and inspected the receipt I noted that it is NOT itemized, it just says $125 paid. So I go online and see the Connecticut prices of what I bought. I WAS FURIOUS -- I called the store and asked them to tell me what they charge for the few items I bought. The guy on the phone says that they MISTAKENLY charged me twice for everything. So I get back in the car, drive back to the store, they issued a refund and took back their goods.
BOTTOM LINE -- these places that don't give receipts are suspect. I AM NEVER GOING BACK to a place that rips you off, then inconveniences you to make it right. You'll notice in the photos that none of the products are listed.; Good for grab & go! Decent variety.; I only buy alcohol as gifts for other people, so I cant comment on whether their price are reasonable, but the customer service was on point, very friendly and even wrapped the bottle of wine in decorative foil and ribbon for me at no additional cost. It did seem a bit cluttered, like the amount of merchandise would benefit from  a bigger space and everything didn't have prices obviously labeled.; Good prices, the children are very polite; Prices here were astronomically high compared to other liquor stores. Don't recommend at all

My boyfriend & I went to MK faithfully for years when we lived in RH. Even now that we've moved away, we make it a point to stop by whenever we're in town. Sam is incredibly kind & helpful. He's ordered things just because I wanted to try them on more than 1 occasion. 10/10, absolutely reccomend!; I purchased 4 bottles of alcohol from this business. Two bottles of Soju, one bottle of passionfruit liquor and a tiny bottle of Bailey's. Initially I had grabbed a bottle of passionfruit parrot bay. I changed my mind and set it down somewhere else. I'll admit i should have put it back.

Upon reaching the counter and checking out I was embarrassed by a cashier named Sam who reluctantly gave me his name. He made me walk around with him until I found the bottle. I said I never stole anything in my life. He said just trying to put it back. He did this loudly in front of other customers.

I'm never buying from them again He was super rude and I urge you to go spend your money elsewhere.

I tried to call the manager today ( I don't do these things ) and the same cashier said he could help me. He also refused to give me the managers name or even tell me when they would be in. He said he doesn't know anything about the person he works for

Avoid this place!; Arab run- which means you can expect dirty store and rude workers who hoard money but put nothing into the community or into the store. Name: Colmado el Mambo General Store
Address: Puerto Rico, Carretera Destino-Esperanza, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: Carretera Destino-Esperanza (route); Vieques (locality); Puerto Ferro (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Surprisingly good selection! And open after Tropical Storm Ernesto!!

For a small store, this place has a lot to offer.  At first glance, it seems there were only a few items (I turned right and found some booze and a few other items) then passed a frozen goods cabinet and thought that was the extent of the store. But, I turned left and found an entire other side of the store. It’s a bit cramped, but there are a couple of “aisles” to travel.

Great beer selection including local PR offerings.

We were just browsing after the storm (a bit hungry but not knowing what we wanted) and an employee even came and asked if she could help me find anything.
Great spot!; Colmado el Mambo General Store is a charming gem, blending convenience and character. With its wide selection of fresh produce, unique local goods, and everyday essentials, it caters to all needs. The friendly, knowledgeable staff and warm, welcoming atmosphere create a delightful shopping experience. It's a vibrant community hub, perfect for anyone seeking quality products and personalized service.; THE BEST! Try this one for hard to come by products! - I have been going all the way to Isabelle Secunda or Esperanza to shop and Colmado El Mambo is less than 1/2 mile from our hacienda. It is a small store with very narrow aisles, but it is the ONLY place an employee asked if she could help us find something. It is also the best stocked dairy, ice cream, gelato and other frozen treats, drinks of all persuasions, chips and snacks, frozen meat/veggies, AND as it turns out, they had guava paste, which was not available at the largest store in town. I made puff pastry from scratch today to make my half-Puerto Rican husband’s favorite Guava pastries. Colmado Mambo to the rescue!; Best colmado, best prices and best variety. Staff is helpful and welcoming. Beers are about 3-4$, they have a great selection and have hard liquor too.; Well stocked.  Very clean. Very well organized

Reviews:
The store is well stocked. Really enjoy the baked goods. Probably the best in town. Super friendly staff, helpful but not intrusive. Well stocked with some limitations.
Limited staffed checkout. Mostly self checkout, but staff is wonderful if assistance is needed.
Not as big as the Speedway location, but at least your not under constant hassle by the AP staff like Speedway.; This is a nice Walmart the employees are always nice, and helpful. They don't carry a variety because they are so small, but what they carry they usually have in stock. My only complaint has to do with online groceries department, sometimes they say they don't have an item in stock when i know they do because i saw it with my own eyes. For example a 40 lbs bag of dog food. I will shop there, and see it, but because I don't have a vehicle, I will do a delivery, and they will say it's not in stock, the same day I have seen it on the shelf. They have done this more than once to me, with bottles of water and once Tylenol for children. The other issue I have is with the online shoppers, they tend to not be so "choosey" with produce, etc. I have gotten plenty of moldy produce, cut open bags of frozen items, dented cans, and broken packages, lids and containers for cleaning solutions. This may be the carelessness of the driver's, but I just know what has happened to me. Their return policy is great, very easy, and I have never had a problem. This store is still worth the out of the way travel, in my opinion.; Convenient store to get in and out of because it's at a traffic light.  There is always plenty of parking.  The interior of the store and the park8ng lot are clean and well maintained.   Shelves are well stocked, and meat selection is good.  Staff are helpful even if they're busy, busy.  We stop in several times a month and usually find everything on our list.

Great place and excellent food; After many visits, the rating reflects the inconsistencies in service and food quality. On a good night, all is fresh, well-seasoned, and it arrives crispy hot at your table and service is friendly. When not, fritters are soagy and greasy and service is slow. One great thing: On Thursdays, several of their appetizers are .25 per piece.; Great place to get beers and food. Thursday’s are $0.25 wings and shrimp so come hungry! Name: CVS Pharmacy
Address: 6002 N 7th St, Phoenix, AZ 85014, USA
Address Components: 6002 (street_number); North 7th Street (route); Alhambra (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85014 (postal_code)
Reviews: Very prompt and courteous service, acceptable wait times at pharmacy counter and in general attitude of staff is excellent.; This is the absolute worst pharmacy- I loved my previous pharmacy and had to switch to this one because of an insurance change and it has been a nightmare.  The pharmacy is causing me to have health issues - I am so frustrated!  I have been trying to get my regular monthly meds for almost two weeks. Nothing new just what I have used for several years. First, I received a text notice that there was an insurance issue.  They included a link and a phone number with the text.  If you click on the link that said “see full RX status” it takes you to an “error” screen.  If you call the phone number you NEVER can speak to a human.  If you leave a message it goes to nowhere and you do not get a response.  Five days later,  I received the same text with the same malfunctioning links and useless phone number.  After 10 days, I still do not have my meds and when I physically went there the employee told me they have no record of my calls and that the phone number does not ever go to a live person.  He acted as if I called a wrong number and gave me a hand written number which was exactly the same number I had left my previous messages on.  In addition, my prescriptions still hadn’t n’t been filled.  The whole is system is a nightmare and I will avoid using CVS pharmacy ever again.; Love the people who work at this store. Someone always greets me when I enter. Pharmacy staff is always helpful and never rushes me.; Excellent experience...they went over and above to get me my meds a d without them probably wouldn't have gotten my much needed meds. This is the only pharmacy I'm going to anymore. Great Pharmacy staff all around; This pharmacy continues to disappoint. Not sure why I have to remind them to fill my scripts, or which doctor to call and telling me they will have a script filled later in the day that doesn't happen. This time they told me they were out after telling me in the morning it will be filled. I have never had so much difficulty with a pharmacy.  Though they have plenty of excuses.

Name: CVS Pharmacy
Address: 1750 E Broadway Rd, Tempe, AZ 85282, USA
Address Components: 1750 (street_number); East Broadway Road (route); Tempe (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85282 (postal_code)
Reviews:
The manager of this store excels at customer service. This was my second visit to this CVS and he went above and beyond both visits. The store has a good selection of beauty items and toiletries, as well as, great sales. Easily accessible too.; During this visit it was great timing because I was first in line and they waited on me within 5 minutes and had my prescriptions ready they were also very considerate; I do not understand why all five employees must take the same 30 minute lunch break. Even if they did not have a.” Pharmacist” For that 30 minutes, they could at least have a tech or person to allow you to pick up refills.; Worst pharmacy I've ever used. They will screw things up. And they won't care. I feel confident in my opinion here after checking with my insurance, Dr., and another pharmacist.

Mike Sanchez appears to be the issue here. Everyone else, on the other hand, seems quite competent tho, very kind, and didn't play dumb like he. Thank you guys.; As a customer who has been with cvs for years while avidly using my care pass every chance I get, I have never been met with such disrespect and ignorance from a pharmacist named Jessie ray. The first interaction I had with her was on the phone trying to correct a prescription mistake that she messed up. I was given 30 of my 60 pills before the new year and waited til today to fix it. While on the phone with her, she tells me that I have never been to this pharmacy, it may have been a mistake so I give her all of my information and she tells me that the insurance that I gave her isn’t even accepted here? (I just picked up my prescription 6 days prior) so I decide to drive in and bring my prescriptions to the pharmacy where she is hostile from the beginning as I came 20 minutes prior to her lunch starting. I again physically give her my information and she is falsely giving me information that is not on my file. She tells me that I have this insurance I’ve never heard of, than when I ask where it came from she said that they bypassed it to my real insurance which she told me DIDNT exist. So as I’m trying to figure out why I can’t get my prescription she starts telling me to calm down and that I am no longer allowed to get my prescriptions from this location for being rude. I have had nothing but the up most respect for every employee in that facility as I am there 5-10 times a month. Her actions were not only unprofessional, they were unethical, highly inappropriate and misleading. I am not angery at this facility, I am angry and hurt that a licensed pharmacist who has an obligation to do their duty failed so deeply that I felt the need to write this review

Name: Old Village Wines & Liquors
Address: 487 Middle Neck Rd, Great Neck, NY 11023, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 487 (street_number); Middle Neck Road (route); Great Neck (locality); North Hempstead (administrative_area_level_3); Nassau County (administrative_area_level_2); New York (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 11023 (postal_code); 1470 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
The store offers a decent selection of wines and liquors, although certainly not the largest in Great Neck, let alone the North Shore, as claimed. Prices are fair but by no means the lowest in town.

That said, the owner was friendly and took the initiative to give advice on selecting the right wine. The beautiful caged parakeets are a pleasant and unique addition to the store's ambience. The bottle of kosher Chilean Merlot that I purchased turned out to be excellent and was greatly enjoyed by myself and others.

I take issue, however, with the price charged. The owner asserts that there is a sign posted prominently informing customers of a surcharge for credit card purchases under a certain dollar amount. I used a debit card, though, so no fee should have been charged. Indeed, I have never been charged extra for making a purchase with a debit card. I was immediately suspicious that the price was incorrect and specifically asked if that simply reflected the discounted sale price plus sales tax, which the owner assured me it did. I then requested a printed receipt, which I was told was not possible. When I received the receipt by text, I was disappointed to see that it was not itemized, so there was of course no mention of any credit card surcharge. It showed only the jacked-up total without explanation.

Such a practice understandably leaves a customer feeling taken advantage of. This merchant would do well to improve his transactional transparency if he hopes to maintain customer satisfaction and ensure repeat business.; Small but nice; Limited selection of the most generic items. They store the wine upright.; great wine selection and hard liquor.;

Name: Sky’s Beverage Depot
Address: 4635 N Broadway, Chicago, IL 60640, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 4635 (street_number); North Broadway (route); Uptown (neighborhood); Chicago (locality); Cook County (administrative_area_level_2); Illinois (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 60640 (postal_code)
Reviews: Store is always clean, and they carry a lot of variety. Everything is always fully stocked so you're never disappointed they ran out of something. They have a lot of fridge space so you have tons of options for already chilled drinks.; A little overpriced and sometimes the beer is well past the expiration date. My biggest gripe is the store owner is constantly on the phone talking loudly during transactions and never offers any sort of greeting or familiar acknowledgment particularly with how often I’m in here. Purely transactional and unfriendly 100% of the time.; Been going here about a year.  The selection is great, and the staff are always chill and check you out fast.  I feel at ease in the store; I am well versed in wine, beer and some spirits. The prices are stable and fair, it is clean and well-stocked, and yet I have serious issue with this place. I have ABSOLUTELY nothing against devout Muslims, nor against teetotalers, but I am growing weary of people who absolutely do not and will not consume alcohol attempting to sell me alcohol. Their advice is shallow and inaccurate, and their expertise almost nonexistent. People from a culture that swears off of alcohol should not be selling it. Furthermore, I have had several experiences where I have felt judged as an alcohol user. I never appear drunk or unruly, I go in there and quietly select what I want and pay and get out. I have plenty of money in my accounts, by the way. Take tonight, for instance. There was a man sitting there who I had never seen. He sat in the "manager's chair" and did not ring me up. He stared at me with judgment and contempt in his eyes. I am a very perceptive person and could see it plain as day. I looked away, then a few seconds later looked back and he is still staring at me with a clearly negative and judgmental stare. I returned the look and then looked away. I wanted to say something but I am a mature person and bit my tongue. However, I will never forget the attitude and vitriol I saw in his eyes. If there was a closer liquor store to my house I would use it. I can hardly stand shopping there. Like I said, I don't care about their religion, at all, but I can hardly stomach buying alcohol from a staff that in its entirety will not drink it.; Really nice new store. They have a decent variety.. A little more expensive than Target or Binny's, but not as expensive as another boutique liquor store down the street by the Uptown theater. I'm happy to pay a few extra dollars and support local. A bunch of new businesses have popped up near hear recently. Uptown is getting some much needed realization.

Name: Norwood Park Wine & Spirits
Address: 6056 N Northwest Hwy, Chicago, IL 60631, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 6056 (street_number); North Northwest Highway (route); Norwood Park (neighborhood); Chicago (locality); Cook County (administrative_area_level_2); Illinois (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 60631 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Recently moved nearby so I figured I would check it out and get a bottle of wine. I appreciate the convenience near the train and other businesses.
The store is small but manages to have a decently broad selection of wines at various price points, achieved in part by tall shelves and narrow aisles. The wines are mostly arranged by variety. I do not drink beer but there seemed to be a strong selection of beer as well.
On the downside, prices are higher, the wine I bought was $15.99 but a google search showed other places sold it from as low as $9.99 to $16; with the vast majority being about $12.99 - so expect to pay a bit more for that bottle of wine grabbed for dinner.
The other downside, I spent over 20 minutes getting a feel for how the wine was arranged and options and no one once asked me if I needed help, offered a greeting as I entered or noticed me.  Nor was there much guidance - aside from producer generated "guides" here and there, a few bottles said "staff picks" with no guidance - why? is it fruity? crisp? So you will either need to know your wines before you go in or be willing to buy "blind".
For a small local store, more interaction would be nice (visited on a Friday around 5:30 pm); Great place. They worked with me to get a keg, even though they don’t sell them usually, for a party. Great selection too. Can’t beat it.; This is a very nice liquor store in a convenient location with a pretty nice selection of craft beers. I was able to find some one off speciality beers not easily found in most liquor stores. However, the management knows this and prices accordingly. Prices are approximately 20-30% higher than any other liquor store I have come across in the area.; The selection is great and the staff is outstanding.  They are the only place I know that can get me hard to find bottles of whiskey and bourbon. Outstanding neighborhood small business; I haven't actually been here, but I'm sure it's awesome.
Thing was, we came out to Vito's last week, mid day. Sadly, the place was closed. Not only that, there was a wooden sawhorse in front with police tape all over it. On closer look, many of the stores had for lease signs! Further, there were no parked cars! Was the whole block being demolished? Panic washed over us. Where would we get our Romano? Our Parm? It took all my strength not to jump the curb and drive thru a plate glass window. Fewf.

Reviews:
Dear Benny's beverage Depot on Grand Ave, I had a girl incident that happened to me in the store and one of your cashiers, I think her name is Johanna. Please give her a raise. She looked out for me in such a way that only a girl in my situation could understand the dire situation that I was in!.  Y'all don't understand  how much I really appreciated her!!!! And then she helped me push two carts filled with things outside!
- The girl with a $1, 200 order; Very nice store, great deals and lots of verities, if you become a member they will give you points and discount highly recommended.; Great selection of drinks unfortunately I would take your business elsewhere. Staff is very unfriendly. After a purchase we asked if we could use a box (grabbing one from a large pile) and one woman came over and grabbed it out of our hands and said you have to buy the box. We were confused but decided to let it be and leave and they said “yeah keep on walking” ?? It was such an odd interaction when we literally just asked for a box. Needless to say we will not be returning and if you do go steer clear of the boxes.; I could wander around Binny’s for hours looking at the pretty bottles. I usually go to the gigantic Jefferson Street location, but stopped into the Grand Ave location, which is much smaller, but still has a great selection. Free, easy parking. Very helpful staff.; Floor staff was helpful in assisting me to find some NA spirits, syrups, and sparkling "wine" options.

Name: UnCork It Liquor Store
Address: 393 E Illinois St, Chicago, IL 60611, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM

Reviews:
Great selection of Whisky. Some prices are competitive but some are outrageous. I’ve picked up some nice bottles here and added to my collection over the months. I did pick up a Weller Special reserve here for 100$ and found it at 2 different stores later that week for only 38$, I should’ve known better. That being said I don’t think I’ve ever seen a regular Blantons listed for as high as 300$. That’s insane. It’s for sale just down the street at 199$ right now and on occasion you can find it downtown between 90$ and 165$. Whoever pays over 300% MSRP on a bottle of base Blantons is a sucker.; Best. Place. Ever. For N/A Beer Drinkers!

Incredible selection of N/A beers.
Mario, the Beer Manager spent the time and effort to build out a diverse line-up of NA beer favorites with over 17 to choose from.

PLUS if you are seeking one they don’t have, he steps right up and tries to track it down for you. Customer service at its finest!

Whether you live along the lakefront or are in town for a visit, make the effort to visit this oasis for high quality and great selection of NA beers. You will be glad you did.; Placed order, selected delivery time, and everything worked perfectly!   They also have a low purchase requirement for free delivery.  Bottles are HEAVY, so delivery option is AWESOME!  Tx!; Excellent champagne selection and delivery!  Used them while staying at a downtown hotel in Chicago. The prices were competitive and the delivery was super quick, took less than 20 minutes!  Would use them again!; I ordered a bottle of wine as a gift and it was a easy and fast delivery. I was happy with the services. This made my gifting easy as I live so far from them.

Name: Gold Eagle Liquors
Address: 255 Peterson Rd, Libertyville, IL 60048, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM

Reviews: Very nice store with friendly staff. Nice large selection of liquor including tequila and bourbon. Staff were more than helpful in offering recommendations and chatting. Nice bar area in the back of the store to try samples or enjoy one of their masterclass events.  Definitely recommend checking out Gold Eagle for your liquor needs.; The best liquor store in Libertyville: *huge* selection, with a very helpful, friendly and knowledgeable staff--whether for wine, beer or spirits. Their prices are on par with the local grocery stores too, so you can even get your "usual" from here if need be, with weekly sales and bulk discounts. I make it a point to stop in whenever I have other business in the area, and recommend you should do the same.; Great variety, friendly staff and quite knowledgeable. There is a special sent to the store that eventually grows on you :-) reminiscence of whiskey barrels.; An exceptional local, family-owned liquor store with unparalleled hospitality. The staff are notably welcoming, with Drew at the bar standing out for his exemplary service. Their selection of beer, wine, and spirits is both vast and impressive.; Awesome liquor store, loved that they had a tasting bar, AJ is great and served us some good pours.... wish more liquor stores had a tasting bar, no one wants to spend money on a bottle they don't enjoy, glad gold eagle does it right!!

Name: Andersonville Wine & Spirits
Address: 5201 N Clark St, Chicago, IL 60640, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 5201 (street_number); North Clark Street (route); Andersonville (neighborhood); Chicago (locality); Cook County (administrative_area_level_2); Illinois (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 60640 (postal_code); 2101 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Have shopped here for a few years now and love this place, so glad to have them in the neighborhood. Today I went in and basically accused them of a mistake from the day before. They graciously explained how it wasn't really possible and I quickly saw that my claim was silly. At no point did they make me feel bad or anything. I have no doubt that any of the guys working here would have provided the same kind service.

Love how there's always multiple new and interesting things in the coolers (tbh I'm not a wine/spirits person). When I've asked questions on my picks, they always have answers. Surprising, given the selection they have.

Highly recommend this little neighborhood alcohol store.; No need to travel to a big box liquor store. This neighborhood gem is a full service liquor store. Huge wine selection, with great knowledgeable staff. Beer and spirit selection is big and diverse.
If these guys don't have it, they'll order it for you. Also they always have some great sales on wines.; I wouldn't go back again. I've been a civil rights and labor investigator for several years and I know the signs of surveillance. To a degree I get approaching folks to help them shop for wines, it's a dialogue, but being walked to the register and having someone hover over you? Come on now. It made me feel rushed and obligated to make a purchase to prove I wasn't a thief. 2 stars for trying the decent conversation though.; These guys are great! Skip your big box retailers and stop in to support this family-run business. They have a great selection of craft beers, well-curated selection of spirits, and wide-variety of wines (but not overwhelming). The brothers are very helpful with sharing their knowledge and offering up recommendations (and they are not necessarily the high-priced items). They also have a great selection of bitters!

Lawrence recently offered a great Pet-Nat; I'll be going back to pick-up another bottle. Thank you guys!; Nice selection of whiskey at good prices. Most impressive part was a bottle of Wild Turkey Rare Breed bottled in 2016 for a confusingly low price. They might have a reserve of special bottles they put out randomly. Quite the fun find as a whiskey hunter.

Huge spot. There are so many options on food as well as being a cool convenience/liquor store. Stopped in for lunch. Got the salmon bagel, and it did not disappoint. I'll stop the next time I'm in the area; Hidden gem in the neighborhood - especially the deli. Probably best value sandwich I’ve had in Chicago and very consistent. Nicest employees as well. Chicken Club panini A+; This place has everything...love it !!
It has a deli , where I get my sandwiches, paninis,wraps, hot food and salad bar.
And they have a great beer selection.. And wine and liquor.
It's River North's gem..; Owner is complete monster. Shouts slurs at customers, is awful to employees. Not to mention crazy prices and past sell date food. Name: Kroger
Address: 6360 U.S. Route 60 E, Barboursville, WV 25504, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Address Components: 6360 (street_number); U.S. Route 60 East (route); Barboursville (locality); Cabell County (administrative_area_level_2); West Virginia (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 25504 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Seldomly do I leave reviews.. However, I feel the need to say what frustrated me today. After a long day at work I decided to get some beverages.. usually a pretty straight forward thing. I was in line for a pretty substantial amount of time before it was my turn. I hand over my ID, and NANCY is studying it, studying me, and then proceeds to ask for my birthday and the date of expiration on the license. I had to think about the expiration for a few seconds, I’m new to the area and have a new license. First time that has ever happened to me. You can guess what she was insinuating. She then reluctantly went through with the transaction. I tried to brush it off, but I’m still frustrated hours later.; This is the best place in town to shop everything that you would need. All their products are easily accessible and they are neatly arranged. The store's well maintained too. There's a Starbucks inside the store. It was easy to find what I was looking for. They also have a lot of vegan options available. Self checkout process was quick and easy. They are open 24 hours which makes it even more convenient for customers to shop according to their needs.; I really like Kroger in Barboursville. It's usually stocked well. They have better sushi than most places. Prices are like everywhere else... ridiculously high.; The staff is very friendly and helpful. I asked for and received help on several items I was looking for from staff that were doing click list gathering. Even though it was not there job to help! This store has, or can get, most items you look for from a Kroger supermarket. The staff will also help you save money by pointing out items that may be on sale! The location is a great convenience and easy to get in and out of. I greatly recommend the Big K ( Kroger brand soft drinks). They are way better than most off brand soda!
I also recommend the Kroger brand foods are excellent and inexpensive.
The bakery is filled with a variety of treats and breads that are high quality and delicious.
The seafood section is second to none in the local area. They have a variety of fresh seafood, including salmon!
The meat section has a wide variety and a very helpful staff.
I highly recommend this location. It has everything a Kroger should have and the staff is very helpful. Needless to say, it is busy during the late afternoon!; Everybody knows that this Kroger, at least in this area is the bougie Kroger. They're always clean they're always stocked and they always have what I need. And who doesn't love some starbies when they're on a Kroger run!

I can’t wait for the reopening renovations to be completed.
I enjoy the small size of the location because it doesn’t feel like the typical Walmart. The staff is friendly. It is not typically crowded. Making a return has been easy if the item is in stock and if I have the receipt.; Locked up the damn energy drinks, hit the button and no one coming after 5 minutes. Don't have to put up with this shit at Target,   I'm done with this crap.; Store was clean.  Isles were uncluttered and wide enough for me to ride their scooter.  Selection of food items was commendable.  Store was not crowded at 10:00 am which was wonderful.; They had there kickstarters mango with a .98 tab per each.   When rang them up , they came out 1.38...after showing tge manager tge price tag.  He agreed yo only match one at that price, the rest would be 1 38.  We were told they didnt want to lose progit on the item...very bad service.  On 2-17-21 went back in.  Clean store and follow all safety covid protocols.  Plenty of parking and well lit. Shelves are full.  Better visit.  Happy employees.  Will yry again soon. Changed 1 star to 3; I can usually find what I’m looking for here. The renovation they did recently is nice. They gave out a bag with some goodies during the grand re opening.

Address: 7450 W Glendale Ave, Glendale, AZ 85303, USA

Reviews:
I will start off by saying a few times I have had bad experiences here. I had a younger version of myself who was not familiar with the importance of customer service and giving them a good experience while in my line as a cashier. But, as I matured and learned the value of treating people and their experience as you would want to be treated, I evolved.
And with that being said, my overall experience here has been amazing from the helpful employees to the store manager and I am now a regular customer in their pharmacy department. I get my groceries delivered through them and at first it did not go so well❤️‍🩹, but have not had any problems since my very first online order. This location 75th Avenue and Glendale location is awesome and very glad to have moved into the neighborhood.
All smiles 😁 on this end. Keep up the good work. The write-up that I have noticed does not do you justice to the hard work and dedication and team work that I personally have experience while coming here... awesome job and well done ✅; I lost my phone at this Walmart and These 2-4 amazing employees helped me find it! I was only able to catch one of the employees name and I believe it was Jesus. HE was friendly and incredible customer service. I hope this Walmart values these employees. AMAZING!!; They need more employees on them check out  more cashiers; No customer service today? When did Walmart begin picking and choosing to open up customer service? I still like this location.; Don’t go here the workers don’t know what there doing all young and just there for a check I worked there for 1 month and was fired for using my PPTO protected paid time …they don’t train properly and is very unorganized . NEVER AGAINNNN
