I frequently visit this store; I usually find shirts and shorts for my husband, although I usually don't find them for me 😁. It has a variety of stuff. I  love all they have for the kitchen; pot, pans, bowls, and other. They are so cute and sturdy. The only thing is the long waiting lines; although it has improved and the last time I visit the store I didn't wait too long and the cashier was friendly and helpful.
It's a nice place to go shopping.; Update. There is no more lines outside. Inside, the line at the cashier moves pretty quickly. Also, masks aren't being required to enter or purchase in the store. Saturdays tend to be more busy, so have that in mind when visiting.; I'd give it 5 stars if there were hand soap available at the women's restroom. I don't know about the men's restroom, though. I told an employee yesterday, and she just said that the restroom ran out of hand soap a long time ago. That's ridiculous. Soon, there's going to be a health emergency thanks to you people; Good clothes at good prices... What more can be said.; Great prices, as expected on a Marshalls, and relatively well organized. Employees are always nice and eager to help, cashier service is fast. It's way more peaceful than other Marshalls closer to the metropolitan area, yet keeps high inventory levels and variety.

Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: Humacao (locality); Cataño (administrative_area_level_2); Humacao (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00791 (postal_code)
Reviews: We pulled in here at almost 5 pm. We were immediately helped by Eduardo Figueroa. We needed two tires, which he was quick to install. He then checked and aired our other two all with a smile and respectful attitude. His customer service was excellent! If he's not a manager, he should be.; I had a blow out on my rental car and the two gentlemen that helped me were kind and efficient. They replaced my tire and had me on my way in less than and hour. M. Ramirez was our point of contact. Please give these guys a raise. They are the kinds of people you want working for you.; Did not have basic item in stock transmission fluid, what's the point in buying on line and then go to pick up items and item was not in stock, they thought it would be just fine for me to come back tomorrow, after all its just a one hour round trip and added fuel costs, Pep Boys is closer and they had what I needed in stock, Car Quest in the states is much better than any here in Puerto Rico, maybe Puerto Rican's don't know any better but with over 45 yrs of purchasing auto parts I know what professional is and IS NOT!; Fully stocked store ,employees  too busy talking to each other to help out customer. Instead of help a customer they point to a general area of what you're looking for  and they tell you is over there. Customer service need way more improvement; I would've given it 5 stars because they do have a variety of hard to find parts, but their staff were all hanging around in between the racks behind the counter and the only cashier kept calling for assistance as the line grew and help was slow to come. Not very customer conscious at all.

Name: Loose Smoke & Liquor Store
Address: 300 Ca. de la Tanca, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM

Address Components: 300 (street_number); Calle de la Tanca (route); San Juan Antiguo (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); San Francisco (administrative_area_level_3); San Juan Antiguo (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00901 (postal_code)
Reviews: I am on vacation in Puerto Rico with my sons, one of whom was celebrating a 22nd birthday, and we decided to get a spur of the moment tattoo. We asked around old San Juan, and many recommended this shop called Loose Ends. There were other options for tattoo shops, but these guys seem to be favorites in the area so we stopped in, and I am glad we did. Walk ins are welcome! Carlos tattooed my son, while the lovely Jacquelyn did mine and it came out absolutely perfect! One thing I can’t stand is an artist who rushes through the process, this was not my experience here at all. She took her time, and did an amazing job! I am coming back in July to see her again for a second tattoo. If you find a good artist, hang onto them! The price was fair, and the place was clean. I highly recommend Loose Ends for your next body art piece. Both Carlos and Jacquelyn were really great 👍🏽; Was in Puerto Rico for family vacation and work. Would highly recommend this small business to anyone looking for a haircut, tattoo, or vapes! These guys take their time and Pride their work. Wouldn’t have received such service stateside. Must stop shop in Old San Juan!; Five of us saw this shop walking around. We all wanted to get small tattoos. It was around 6pm. They accepted walk-ins. The employees were helpful and answered all our questions. The process was clean and quick.; Got tattoo shots  best service  played my music great customer service; The best mojitos! Specially the coconut mojito!

Name: Don Collins Cigars
Address: 59 Calle del Cristo, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Address Components: 59 (street_number); Calle del Cristo (route); San Juan Antiguo (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Mercado (administrative_area_level_3); San Juan Antiguo (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00901 (postal_code)
Reviews: We passed by Don Collins in Old Town San Juan and were drawn in by the rum and coffee and the look of the place (we're not smokers but could see people, especially from the cruise ships, making a b-line to Don Collins for their special cigars).  Christian was great - we decided on a half-pound of coffee but the free sample of rum - first passion fruit, then their aged rum, made a sale on the passion fruit rum.  I hope we don't regret not getting the aged rum too now. We've never tried passion fruit rum at all, or like that and had to get some. Then decided on a pound of coffee instead.  All in all, a great find in a great part of town - thank you Christian!; We wandered in after exploring Old San Juan on foot from our cruise ship last week. We don't smoke, but came in for the rum and coffee. The shop was captained that day by Christian, a wonderfully friendly and welcoming young man who let us try mango, pineapple and passion fruit infused quality rums. Then we sampled the aged flagship rum which was so incredibly smooth. It was excellent. I enjoy coffee daily, but we are light drinkers, so we purchased a pound of coffee beans, and a bottle of the passion fruit infused rum. Now home in CA, I tried the coffee this morning and it is excellent! We are saving the rum to enjoy with dear friends. Discounts are provided to military and public safety personnel/members. This shop is a not-to-be-missed authentic experience in Old San Juan. If you are a cigar aficionado you will also feel welcomed and will enjoy a nice cigar smoking experience here from my view. The aged rum was really great, bourbon-like in taste and aroma. Until next time - cheers!; Great vibes! I heard Cuco playing while walking down the street so I had to stop in. The espresso martini was an excellent bonus. Can't wait to try some of their coffee beans when I get back to Cali. Much love!; Small and cozy. Rum infused cigar was delicious. I also had the coconut rum coffee and I loved it. My husband ordered an old fashioned which was uniquely prepared in a barrel, was the best old fashioned I’ve had so far. Overall a nice cigar lounge to just relax and enjoy a cigar.; Highly recommend checking this spot out. Friendly staff, great cigars and rum. Didn’t try to coffee, but smells delicious. Aesthetic and music brings good vibes.

Name: Dizzi Puerto Rico
Address: 205 C. de San Justo, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

Reviews: Very funny experience. The ice cream was perfect and very strong. Tasted light and so delicious. The server helpful and has awesome music taste! Everything is a reasonable price. I would definitely come here again.; Dizzi has the BEST adult ice cream and sorbet! It is a welcoming environment and everything is delicious. I cannot brag enough about the delicious, amazing flavours !!! The workers are also really friendly and welcoming. The conversations flowed endlessly and freely. A definite stop when in Old San Juan 🫶🏾; Stopped in here before leaving PR and fell in love!! I tired the strawberry margarita & cosmopolitan popsicles and I LOVED them. Also chatted with the bartender he was cool as hell!! Definitely a must try!!; Such a cool store with amazing ice pops!!! Lemoncello and Stawberry Margarita was strong and very yummy! Music and vibes in the store were amazing with charging ports which was clutch!; Jovanni served us and had great convo. Very good stuff! A happy experience to say the least. We had the Mojito Sorbet and it was refreshing and good 🥰

Reviews: One of the best Cigar shops in the world! A deep deep variety of Cigars. Authentic! Open bar. The best hospitality you can have for a business. Family owned. Easily one of best places to relax in puerto rico! If you love cigars and peace of mind, come to this place.; One of my favourite places in San Juan, huge variety of cigars and very knowledgeable staff, amazing atmosphere and lounge is so good highly recommend this place.; I visited while on a recent trip.  Made a special trip to this shop because I had heard great things about this store.  They did not let me down.  I bought some cigars to bring home to Arizona.  My husband says it is one of the best cigars he has had!  Thank you for a wonderful experience!; Hands down, this is the best cigar shop and lounge on the island. The selection is incredible, and the environment to chill out and enjoy a cigar is great too. If you like cigars, this is the only place on the island I recommend.; This place is always amazing to visit. The owner (Rita) is always so welcoming and the staff is so knowledgeable. Sometimes it is difficult to find someone available for drinks but for the most part its no big deal. The Humidor is huge and they have such a great selection of cigars. Looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews:
This is a great Fry’s location, inside they have small extras like the cheese stand , Starbucks , and the bistro. Fry’s meat department has always been a trustworthy source in my book. Customer service is excellent, all staff are well kept and professional. Unlike Walmart, when you have trouble finding something or the lines are long the staff is always there to help.; Deli slicers are always filthy. I don’t wasn’t fresh sliced meats coming from a dirty slicer. Especially today 8/22 at 5pm. I walked out mid slice when I saw how gross.

Update:  everything has been looking much cleaner. I saw Brenda actively cleaning between customers and the whole deli looked spotless. Much better than before.; This branch is fantastic and amazing. Love the assortment of delicious food choices, always amazing customer service and hospitality this whole store emits an amazing vibe of quality and outstanding! From produce to the pharmacy thank you for delivering wow.
🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟; Conner that was at customer service around 8.30 on 6/28/24 is literally amazing. I dropped my baby shower cake and he helped me find a quick replacement. Note to the Fry’s big bosses, give him a raise; The store is slow at 8:30PM, but the worst time to go shopping because the clueless night crew is on. Michael in the gray shirt was extremely rude. Asked him for a simple price match with the app and he refused, whining about getting a manager. Then the manager comes over and accuses me of not knowing how to use the app for a digital coupon and rips my phone from my hands! Warning to fellow customers, if you have any issues with your Fry’s app they will blame you like it’s coming out of their paycheck to price match a simple item! Beware!

Address Components: Ste 100 (subpremise); 4815 (street_number); East Carefree Highway (route); Desert View Village (neighborhood); Cave Creek (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85331 (postal_code)
Reviews: I could not be more dissatisfied with this store.  I got home from picking up my online order and there was two different gallons of milk spilled all over my trunk.  When I called to ask what I could do about this, they told me I needed to come back to the store, which was 45 min from me - I work in this town part time on a semi annual basis but don't work or live there regularly.  I told them I would not be coming back, as that would take time and gas money, and they proceeded to tell me that my driving must have been the cause of the milk spilling, then asked why I would place an order 45 min from my home.  That is none of your business, Crystal.  You could refund my entire order for the damage to my car, you could ask to see photos, you could do so many other things - but you did not.  Then this woman suggested I leave the milk in my car for a week and when I am back in that town, show her the damage.  You seriously think I can leave milk in my car for a week in June in Arizona, are you an idiot?  It would smell. I have been buying groceries from you for three years. Never again - you are horrible.; Always feel this store is just mediocre.  Nothing special.  Employees are friendly, but the store seems dismal due to dark flooring perhaps?  Only ever go here when it's convenient or a great bargain is to be had.; This place just hasn’t been the same since my favorite florist Amanda left (not me totally different unrelated other person also named Amanda). I cry every time I walk in and don’t see her here anymore. It’s a great store and there’s many lovely people here, but Amanda’s gone and it’s just not the same.; Very nice store, friendly staff store wasn't crowded at all found everything we needed okay prices; Nice and clean store. They have rr. They employees are nice.

It’s like a Baby Walmart and they don’t  obsess over COVID like the rest of the stores who keep their doors locked while they signal for you to put on your mask ..  lol COVID is over just give up.

Name: D's Garden
Address: Flamenco, 8P54+GPH, Culebra, 00775, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 PM
Address Components: 8P54+GPH (plus_code); Culebra (locality); Flamenco (administrative_area_level_2); Culebra (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00775 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I recently visited D Gardens in Culebra and was thoroughly impressed by the quality of their fresh produce. The variety of fruits and vegetables available was exceptional, and everything was incredibly fresh. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly, always ready to offer helpful advice and recommendations. The overall experience was fantastic, and I highly recommend D Gardens for anyone looking for top-quality produce and cheeses on the island.

Recommend the mango frappe for a hot sunny day.; The place and ambience:
This place is well kept and very beautiful. It has a garden, a small market where you can buy fresh produce (plants, eggs, fish etc.) and a smoothie stand. It's hard to describe the ambience but the pictures I have shared will give you a good idea. It's hot in PR but there's plenty of shade here for you to enjoy a smoothie, frappe, jugo or acai bowls if you fancy any of that.

Price and value:
The smoothie stand is on the edge of being pricey (about 9$ for a smoothie, 7$ for a frappe) but I would say it is worth the money. The produce market seemed to have average farmer's market prices. The value here is from "freshness" and the ambience.; Great produce. I filled my fridge twice from here during my trip. Thursday is the day they get there fresh items in. Biggest, sweetest pineapple I've ever eaten came from here. Next time I'm back, I'll definitely be stopping by. Check them out. Oh, fresh smoothies and bowls too.; Delicious! I got the coconut based fruit bowl for breakfast and it was amazing. I grabbed a couple bites for the beach in the shop and I was set until dinner :-); Amazing fresh produce at reasonable prices. Loved the quality of the fruits /veggies available here. Had a mini brunch here with their wide choice of smoothies and fruit bowls. The folks at the desk were also very friendly. Must visit if you're in Culebra.

Reviews: Great selection available! Nice customer service and awesome store hours!; It was my first time visiting the store, and I was greeted as soon as I came in by the employees, They were very helpful, and the store was very well stocked. I highly recommend this store.; Aaron and Jessie always go out of their way to help me find what I'm looking for.   I have very particular items that I look for, they don't always have it, but they always help me find them.  Even so far as to save some in the back for me.   The service is so far above and beyond, that I continue to go to them even though it's now completely out of my way due to my recent residency change.   You just can't pass up that kind of service.; Broad selection. Lake liquor offers many options for whiskey and craft beers. Friendly workers will help you locate anything on the shelf you might need. Great store!; Great selection. Friendly staff. Taxes have gone up significantly for the local area. Seems to effect the liquor store more than the grocery store.

Address: 30601 Eureka Rd, Romulus, MI 48174, USA

Reviews:
They need to paint the outside to make it more inviting. I wouldnt have gone there but i needed a money order. Lady was nice but on the outside looks like the owner doesnt care about the property.; I been coming to Romulus Liquor since 2000 when my father and I moved to the neighborhood.
It’s always been the same family running the store, Sam and Lee.
They have always been extremely friendly, always treated me like family.
If they didn’t sell a certain product and you wanted it they would order it for me just so I didn’t have to drive to another store to purchase it.

My 6 year old daughter lives coming here because they always talk directly to her and make her feel comfortable when she wants to buy chips or candy lol

I most definitely recommend stopping here if your in the area.; Very unwelcoming and ripoffs who take advantage of the public. This is THE worst place to go. They take advantage of the fact that they're the closest corner store and have everything double to triple the prices of what it should be. Not to mention, most of their food is expired so WATCH BEFORE YOU BUY. Oh, and if you're a person of color other than whatever this store owner is, you best believe they follow you up and down these aisles like you're a petty thief or criminal. What's criminal is what these people do. I'm surprised the city hasn't come in and shut this rat hole down.; Prices are getting lower now. The customer service is better. this store has been here 30 years and I have never had a problem with this store the owners are very cool. People make problems with them for no reason they are really cool people to know. My family has been shopping here for years I love this store!!!!; Tons of expired food. Buy old bread and charge full price. Take advantage of the people who live close and can't go to better stores. Usually don't charge state minimum liquor prices, though they advertise that they do. Don't waste your money in their store.

Name: Buster's Liquor, Fine Wine and Beer
Address: 2811 W Walnut St, Rogers, AR 72756, USA

Reviews: Clean and well stocked!  We can always find a good selection here.  We really appreciate beer from the Pacific Northwest area and get our fix at Busters!  Drive thru is available and a walk in cooler too.  Check it out!; Top notch professional and personable staff.. love being able to chatter and laugh with these guys Management's pretty cool dude sisters we have behind the counter awesome it's just a really cool place to go to get whatever you need for the evening and a place where you'll feel warmly welcome to every time; Folks here are friendly, and so is the service.  And, they are very helpful if you need help finding something.   This goes for walking into Buster's as well as going through the drive through!; This shop has a pretty large liquor selection along with lots of beers, including many local breweries. I was looking for cider and found their selection pretty small, but they did have Black Apple's Strawberry Cider, which I've been wanting to try. My husband scoped out the beers. The one major frustration was that there were almost no single cans or bottles, most everything is in a pack, which meant we couldn't buy much because we were on a brief visit to the area. It would've been nice to try a wider variety.; It's well organized and well stocked with a pretty good variety in each category of spirit.

Name: Liquor & Wine For Less
Address: 3075 Goodman Rd E # 5, Southaven, MS 38672, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: # 5 (subpremise); 3075 (street_number); Goodman Road East (route); Snowden District (neighborhood); Southaven (locality); DeSoto County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 38672 (postal_code); 6358 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Don’t go here unless you want to pat unfair prices and be treated like a criminal as soon as you walk through the door. Me and my brother were closely watched on the tv screens the whole time we shopped for no apparent reason. When we confronted the sales rep about it he immediately responded with COMPLETE DISRESPECT & unprofessionalism. RACISM AT ITS WORST! We “as customers” were told to “shut up” after he admitted to discrimination. AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS NO GOOD !! Terrible RACIST PLACE !; We recommend this place.
Over the last 3 years we have been going to this liquor store. The reasons we keep going back...
1. They ALWAYS have been friendly, from the moment you walk through the door.
2. If you need some help they are more than happy to provide assistance. Most time they ask us if we need any help.
3. When you get to the register they ask if you found everything your were looking for.
4. While at the register I never feel rushed and have a little chat with them.
5. While paying for your items they ask if you need help taking your purchase out to the car.
6. Prices and selection are more than adequate.
Going there is always an extremely pleasant experience.; Upon arrival I was watched like a hawk as if I were attempting to steal , But I continued to shop not paying any mind to it until I heard one of the coworkers say to the other to watch me because people “like me “ steal . I was upset and offended by what I had just heard so I decided to put the bottle I was going to purchase back as I was followed putting the bottle back I politely asked do all of your customers get this treatment and the man which I assume was the manager replied “why does it matter this is my buisness “ I didn’t understand why he was being so rude to me I told him you shouldn’t treat well paying customers this way then he called me a racial slur and told me to shut up ! I then left and told him I would post a bad review and he told me nobody would care . I advise ANYONE who is a good person and stands for equality to not support this buisness any longer !; Horrible staff extremely racist towards black people specifically. I went in there and didn’t even purchase anything because the whole time I was being watched on the big  screen. Very unethical behavior towards their customers. DO NOT SHOP AT THIS STORE unless you like being watched.; This place has a nice sized selection. One of the most obvious places where they choose what to sell at MSRP and what to sell at exorbitant prices, some above secondary market. They are helpful though and will point you in the right direction.

Name: The Hive Wine & Spirits

Reviews: The Hive apparently has a “no return policy” which makes sense in theory. I bought a few bottles and my friend wanted to show me another liquor store which had cheaper prices. I bought the same stuff at this other store and decided to come back to The Hive to get my refund on the overpriced bottles. Even though I had only been gone for 15 minutes and the bottles were still sealed, they would not let me get my money back. However, the other store told us they would do so. So….Just letting y’all know, there are better liquor stores around….; Best place to find what others don’t; Great selection! Way over priced. However, since there are only 2 places in town they have you over a barrel.; Great selection of wines and spirits, excellent service,and willingness to help.; Nice place with a good selection. The lady was very nice and she was more than helpful.

Thank you for the recommendation to tootsies blue eyes. Krystal is awesome too; I love they're prices and selections.  They are so nice to you!; The staff are knowledgeable in their products. Everyone is friendly and helpful. I won't shop anywhere else for my spirits.; I love their wine. The prices are great and the atmosphere is pleasant.

Name: Causeway Wine & Spirits
Address: 1040 Spillway Cir, Brandon, MS 39047, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 1040 (street_number); Spillway Circle (route); Brandon (locality); Rankin County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39047 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Just left there and I felt moved to leave a review. This business is always so clean and well organized with staff that are friendly and knowledgeable about their products. An elderly woman in line ahead of me, perhaps in her 80’s purchased a case of wine and was ready to tote it out to her vehicle herself when an employee jumped in to help her and carry it himself. Bless it the little old lady was surprised by this gesture from the employee and I thought “ what ever happened to this being the standard in customer service that she would be so surprised??” Anyway, well done and you have a raving fan in this customer!; This is the only place we go to for liquor after Spillway Wine and Spirits treated my sister and me so poorly. We're so glad to have made the change as the service here is far better. As an added bonus, the man we checked out with is a stand-up guy and is a fellow truth-seeker like we are. If you're looking to buy liquor in Brandon, my suggestion is that you bypass SW&S and come here instead!; Great locally owned establishment.  I came in, found the liquor I wanted, and decided to check out.  Then I realized I had forgotten the previous Jaegarmeister, and the attendant was fantastic enough to grab it for me.  Excellent customer interactions overall.; Great selection and friendly staff; The selections are good and the store is nice
is the only reason why I gave it two stars vs none. . The people behind the counter need lessons in dealing with the public. I was Never spoken to or asked if I needed assistance (which I did). I only bought a few items and will go back to my store on the Madison county side for the. We Year items. I felt like I was intruding on the ballgames they were watching. Geeze.

Name: Colonial Wines & Spirits
Address: 11200 W Markham St, Little Rock, AR 72211, USA

Reviews:
They have a huge selection and I'm not just saying that. Every now and then they will come up with something harder to find if you're not asking for the moon.

Staff is friendly and very helpful anytime I need to find anything. They also offer a rewards program, so that gives me another reason to shop with them. If there's a time I don't want to run around all day looking for something, I hit them up as my one stop shop.; Wow - this place has everything! Fantastic selection including a great national and international craft beer section with products in-date and refrigerated. An absolute breath of fresh air for beer lovers with excellent customer service and super-clean bathrooms. Wine and spirits also brilliant.; I stopped by on a tequila hunt and was really impressed with the selection! They had many choices of additive free tequilas and they staff was very friendly.
This will be a regular stop when passing through.; Excellent store. Great selection. Chris and all the staff are very helpful.; The loss prevention efforts are so extreme at this store. It made me very uncomfortable. The staff weren’t there to assist just to watch me like a hawk. I know Little Rock is ghetto but my goodness. The liquor stores in my hometown are 3 times the size of this and the employees take the time to at least greet me when I walk in. If I weren’t from out of state or low on time I would have found somewhere else to shop.

Reviews:
After spending a decent amount in this store and chatting with the very kind front desk lady, I showed my husband a mini can I said was cute. After putting it back where I got it, we left. While getting into our truck, a male employee ran out of the store and aggressively approached our truck yelling at me “Where did you put that can?!?” Accusing me of stealing.

We will NEVER shop here ever again. Absolutely uncalled for and rude.; Decent selection of sprits. Spent $40 on scratch off tickets and $9 on a little bottle of rum. Some little man ran after us as we got into the vehicle assuming we stole a $3 can of premixed cocktail. Would appreciate if you’d check the cctv before approaching like that. Won’t be back to this establishment.; Been going here for years and the new staff has been great about shooing regular customers away. Today, on a Sunday, I offered my government issued DL through my Apple Wallet, which is scannable, and was rejected and told that she just “wasn’t going to scan it,” by a broad with a bad bleach job. So police accept them as proper forms of ID but this place won’t.; Awesome place and great staff.  Large selection and good prices too; Matt disrespectfully confronted me about parking in handicapped parking. He didn't bother to go outside and look at the license plate which wasn't visible from inside the store. Had I actually purchased what I came in there to get. He would have seen on my driver license that I am infact disabled. Either way he's not the parking police and isn't any of his business wheather or not I'm permitted to park in handicapped spot. After that rude interruption I decided to take my business elsewhere. I won't be back.

Name: Sullivant's Liquor Store
Address: 8122 Cantrell Rd, Little Rock, AR 72227, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: Closed

Reviews:
I’d give a 0 if I could, the store isn’t the issue, it’s the new lady they have up there, she gotta be a racist. She had such a nasty ass attitude, didn’t pay attention was always on her phone, this is a place of business, not your free time. I’ve always came to the store and never had issues, do better.; Highly recommend!! Food was phenomenal, wine was good and Krystal provided amazing service! It was my first time, but definitely won't be my last!!; Would rate it at 5 but damn are the employees in the morning rude and unwelcoming. Night employees are always a joy to be around.; Great neighbourhood liquor store with everything you need. Even some organic wine and friendly and knowledgeable staff. They now even have an organic wine section with a good selection from all over the world.; The guys at Sullivant’s are always super friendly and helpful. They make great recommendations when I don’t see what I’m looking for or decide to try something new. You can tell they really enjoy being there and are knowledgeable about what they sell. They’ve got a great beer selection, with plenty to choose from by way of craft, local and domestics. Not massive like Colonial but not tiny either.
The vibe of the place is really cool and the drive thru is great for when I don’t feel like getting out of the car. It’s a little out of my way, but I regularly make the drive when I’m looking for a seasonal or something specific because I know they’ll have it nine times out of 10.
Sullivant’s is one of my favorite liquor stores in the Little Rock area.

You could pick up a 6 pack that’s priced anywhere between $9 - $25! This has been standard practice since management changed hands a few years ago.; The people are pleasant, but the cigarettes I bought from them were several months out of date. The inside packaging was changed several months ago, but their's still have the old packaging and taste extremely stale. For nearly $16 a pack they should be fresh. The rum was standard, but I smoke when I drink, so it was pointless.; Best store ever they have almost anything you want for good price and need staff is super nice and sometimes they have tastings too.; Prices are fair and the store is clean. I did come by Wednesday evening at 1045pm as it said it was open till 11pm. The store was not open.  I recommend adjusting your hours accordingly.; Super friendly staff, but for wine lovers,  sadly most of their good wines are corked, top shelf Bordeaux, such a shame, been burned too many times here

Name: Target
Address: 10404 N 43rd Ave, Glendale, AZ 85302, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews: What can you say about Target? Target is a wonderful store with  superior Customer service, I can't complain. There's been incidences, but for the most part-at least 90% of the time -They're quick, convenient and always ready to help. I really enjoy their drive up pickup service where they bring your items to your car. What a Time Saver-so convenient and helpful! Thank you to Target For being a good retailer with great deals, a good selection of products and awesome customer loyalty rewards/coupons and for giving back to the community!; The store is clean and well lit but expect an extremely long wait at the register. The self-checkout lanes were closed, and they had ONE cashier. When I walked up to the register, a woman was filling the conveyor belt with party favors and knick-knacks and had separated everything into two orders. The cashier was making small talk while she scanned each item, then scanned them again with a second device then discussed the price for EACH item. Four more people walked up behind me, so six people are now in line while the cashier takes her time and continues chatting. Finally, a second register opens, but the cashier fails to say, "I can help the NEXT person in line."  Consequently, all four people behind me rush to the next register, and the man who got there first was out the door, while the cashier in my line was still scanning the items for the woman in front of me.  The long wait and poor customer service was not worth the ONE item I stood in line for.  The staff could definitely use training in customer service.; Checking out was fast and easy how it should be. Ronny was friendly and quick at the checkout section. Things seem in order; Bad service i purchased item I see on the app I go to the target on 43 Ave and Peoria the store have not same price as the app show even though it’s pick up do I have to go back waste my time and gas and the manager there is worthless and tell you should tell us the price why do you have different price then target app very disappointing; Great costumer service , very shining store parking lot out Is medium,  business area , prices are OK and depends on quality of product

Name: CVS Pharmacy
Address: 855 E Elliot Rd, Tempe, AZ 85284, USA
Address Components: 855 (street_number); East Elliot Road (route); South Tempe (neighborhood); Tempe (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85284 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I was happy with this pharmacy until this experience.  I had a prescription for 90-days of medication.  They made a mistake and only gave me 30 days.  They fixed it, but in doing so, messed up their computer records.  When the next 90-day refill came along, they only gave me 60 days.  One of their associates promised to fix it.  When I called back in for an update, I got someone else who told me it was my fault for signing.  A second person told me it was between me and my insurance.  I'm taking my business elsewhere.

UPDATE:  I contacted the executive office of CVS.  I received a prompt reply.  They escalated my concerns to the field leadership team overseeing this store location.  Someone from that local team drove to the pharmacy and had them package up the missing pills for me.  I was very happy with the corporate response.  However, when I picked up the order, the pharmacy staff member simply said, "Here you go."  No apology whatsoever.; Update: this CVS location has come a long way in the past few years. They seemed to finally be fully staffed. Which is great because it’s still always busy in the pharmacy. Several of the employees have been super friendly and helpful. They make an otherwise daunting task quite doable now thankfully.

Always busy. Takes forever to get a scrip filled. If it’s called in, it won’t be ready until the following afternoon. Very difficult to get  someone to answer the phone without being on hold for at least 10-20 minutes minimum.; The wall says open 9am-8pm today, but they are currently on "lunch".  Everyone is still working but the gate is shut lol. You can see and hear everybody working while on "lunch" but keep out ppl picking up medicine.

If you're gonna be on lunch, fine... please update hours on the wall then.  But if you're gonna keep working, let us pick up our prescriptions.; Not buying their previous reviews as authentic. I have a controlled substance that needs to be filled. I get an automated call saying it’s filled and ready for pick up, then 12 hours later I get a text saying it’s out of stock—so you gave my Rx to someone else? Next day they not only refused to acknowledge what happened, they refuse to tell me nor the doctor what’s available so the right dosage & quantity can be filled… despite several calls of me putting up with their conflicting info & massive waste of my time (days going by) i always politely end the call with “OK well thank you for your help”, John says as little as possible during the call and makes it a game of 50 questions to try and figure out how to get your Rx filled, then when you express polite appreciation (despite his anti-social service) he simply hangs up on you 🤮🤮🤮—straight up mommy issues. I have multiple chronic diseases and was thinking about moving all 16 of my prescriptions here. Not now! John is a nightmare for women. Don’t be surprised when glowing reviews from women “randomly” show up after this—they’re likely paid for…; These guys were very professional and friendly. They were able to take me in early for my rescheduled appointment after another nearby CVS cancelled my Covid test.

Crystal is so patient and kind. She made the experience great. Thank you!

Conveniently located to my house so I'm biased. I go here often. Beer and liquor is reasonably priced. Never had an issue.

A lot of reviews on here are pretty biased based on mask usage. Well that doesn't really matter anymore.; The people next door do drugs outside and the owner at this liquor store sells I think! He offerered me drugs when I was buying a Gatorade! What the hell man.. someone needs to check this place. Already notifed authorities.; This place is useless! Twice I've order on DD and theh haven't had stuff or canceled. What a joke. Also if you knew basic match (2) 375ml bottle for $8.99 x2 is $17.98 .. they are charging $20 for the 750ml bottle... same ML as (2) 375...; Very rude individual was the older heavier Caucasian male 60’s. Immediately gave me trouble when I entered due to my mask not fully covering the nostrils. While explaining my breathing problems he began to yell at me and I felt discriminated in this store. No sympathy you’re nothing but a number here.; Bought some Guinness and opened it up immediately at home. Tasted flat, old, and a bit dusty. Was charged $11 for a 6 pack and it all tasted terrible. I’m sure they use to same beer for decades before throwing it out, definitely skip this place!

Reviews: This place is a hidden gem! Best tapas and cocktails. We tried the hummus made with "gandules" and pistachios it was amazing! Also the pork buns were excellent! Staff is super nice and they accept dogs♡.; La Juntilla is a hidden gem that nails both charm and character. This intimate spot felt like stepping into my favorite speakeasy mixed with someone’s living room. The cassette-tape bar tables are a nostalgic touch, and the red lights and quirky baggie-on the floor themed decor in the bathroom add a playful twist. The appetizers were tasty and the drinks hit the spot, making it clear this place has mastered the art of ambiance and flavor. If you’re looking for a small location to literally just chill La Juntilla is your go-to.; Great place for a chill hangout. Grab some finger food and drinks with friends, a date or just by yourself. The place is not to big, not too small. They open Wednesday to Monday only closing Tuesday's, I call that a win!! You can go on weekends and have a blast with the crowd or find yourselves a table during the week and enjoy the most relaxing ambiance in the area. 👌🏾; This chill spot is somewhat hidden in Santurce and doesn't show up on Uber maps, but is definitely worth the hunt! There is often a DJ on the weekends playing a variety of electronic and salsa vibes. There is room to dance or sit in a lounge atmosphere. The bar counter is a work of art enclosing cassette singles.; Excellent place for partying with friends

Reviews:
Walmart is a good provider of products, but I do find the staff to lack a lot of needed knowledge.. I realize employees are getting difficult to come by , but I don't find that as an excuse, that being said , not all employees are lacking some tend to be very helpful. Walmart should set a standard!; Super nice Walmart with actual  cashiers, not just self-check lanes. Unfortunately, they did not carry rubber boots, which we were looking for.
Just a side note:
The exquisite view of the Santa Catalina Mountains is a nice surprise as one exits this particular Walmart.; There were quite a few workers there who didn't understand much English, and they weren't mexican either, they were females from India of all places. It's curious because a bunch of responsible smart high school seniors from our local Oro Valley neighborhood have applied there and never hear anything back.; DO NOT USE PICK UP!!!!  They have no signs indicating where you're suppose to park.  I have a broken bone in my foot and had to go in the store to find out where to find Pick up. I wasn't even sure they had it!   I feel like suing the damn store ,and my foot is killing me.  NO ONE PICKED UP THE PHONE IN PICK UP!  I will surely purchase all these things from AMAZON going forward.  FIRE THE MANAGER!!!!!; This Walmart was clean and well organized. The parking lot was even groomed. Friendly people here.

This store seemed to have a smaller, but adequate inventory than some Walmart stores.

Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Address Components: United States (country); Downtown Mesa (neighborhood); Mesa (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); 85201 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This place is pretty good. I've got a pretty decent selection but the place that used to be here was far superior.
This place has a giant basement that they're not even using for retail customers anymore.
It's an absolute shame since they can have a speakeasy or a dozen other other things down there.; Remember when stores used to have walk-in humidors? This one still has one! Don't expect prices like Walmart or Costco for your beer and liquor.. this isn't a cheap store, it's a convenient store. You may pay a dollar or two more than the others, but you'll also find things like moonshine with fruit still in it, odd flavors for whiskey and rum that aren't available conveniently elsewhere. I didn't need to use the restroom, so I don't know if there is one for the customers... There is access for wheelchairs, and the aisles are wide enough to get through. It seems like a small store when you go inside, but the selection is pretty good for what it is. There is also a drive through for your easy purchases! There is also a small section for bartending tools like jiggers, shakers, muddlers, and spoons. Also many straw options like glass, metal, and silicone. Take a look, at least.. and see for yourself.; Bad Habits is a Liquor Store on 2nd Place of North Country Club Drive in Mesa AZ. It used to be named Sun Devil Liquor. The name change happened recently and I recently visited the new ownership for a bottle of wine, Pinot Noir, to go with my spaghetti dinner.

The staff was pleasant, helpful and provided me with this selection in the video to choose from. I used to buy kegs from the prior ownership and the quality, cleanliness, and location is just as great as always.; Sun Devil Liquors.
235 N Country Club Dr, Mesa, AZ
It's an awesome local, full service, complete shop with tastings and events. Unassuming and welcoming. Staff makes sure you find what you need.; This place was awesome as Sun Devil Liquors. However, as "Bad Habits," they have made some regrettable changes.

1. Beer can no longer be bought by the bottle or mixed into custom 6 packs. Their selection is smaller with less variety.

2. If you make the mistake of bringing a single beer to the checkout, be prepared to be spoken to like a child when the cashier explains the policy change.

3. The pros are there is still a liquor store here. And the selection, though not as varied, is still better than most.

Reviews:
Went to pull off $15 off my card like any normal store will do after buying a candy for a dollar something with cash and I was told that I would have to pay 13 something dollars as I'm trying to pull off $15 from my card if you're not some homeless guy on the street trying to buy liquor this place is really not a good spot to pull money from your card. If you go to circle k buy a candy bar that's a dollar something you are able to pull cash back without them charging you a fee of 1314 something dollars ridiculous.; They advertise cheap prices, but they charge you a different price, STAY AWAY!!!

Go to beer world around the corner on McClellan and country club by circle k.; Super Stop Mesa Liquor Store is the place to shop! They carry a large variety of beers, wines and liquors. They even carry all your snack needs. The owner and staff are always helpful, very knowledgeable and are willing to offer recommendations. You can't beat the prices, excellent service and great selection. I refuse to shop anywhere else! Check them out, you won't be disappointed!; I love the team at Super Stop. It’s rare to find a liquor store/drive-thru that makes an effort to get to know their customers, even going above and beyond and remembering your order(s). I’m going to miss this place when I move! Thanks for everything, my dudes.; I asked for a semi even mix of their western son vodka shooters, I was buying 20.. There are three flavors. Previous to this I hadn't tried any of the three. But two of them are way better Than one... I got 15 of the lime (the gross one). Even though I asked for a mostly even mixture between 20.... Clearly they gave me the least popular because I hadn't tried them before (and the little wasn't great.) And clearly the salesperson either didn't care to count or gave me the least popular on purpose! What a disappointment, I was taking these out of state to visit family! Never coming here again! I actually made it clear I was taking these out of state and wanted a mixture. 15 limes out of 20. When I asked for an even mixture of three flavors! Ridiculous! Selfish! Just wanted to sell the ones that weren't selling! So dishonest!

Reviews: Had a great first experience at this liquor store. The bourbon selection was great. The owner was very knowledgeable and helpful as I was making my selection. They had a nice store pick MM (Gator Juice) which I plan on going back and getting. He also had some 1792 Sweet Wheat that just came in and I picked it up before it was gone. I will be back to stock my bar from this shop.; Best liquor store in Brevard County hands down. If you’re into bourbon this is the place to go. Dev, the owner, his service and selection are the best in the county. He does awesome store picks and has great prices on allocated. Anytime someone new moves to the area or if someone is passing through looking for a good store, this is the place I send them. Thanks, Dev!; Has a great selection with great prices and frequent sales. That's our one stop shop for liquor, tobacco products and lottery. They even will bring in a product if you request. They also have a liqour raffle so whenever you buy a bottle you automatically enter according to how many bottles you buy. And the customer service is unbeatable!; Great clean store with an awesome beer selection. Owner said he is having a grand opening w free samples on 12/17.; Love this liquor store. Too bad Google says they close at 11 on Sundays. Hustled there after work and they were already closed.

Name: Plaza Liquors & Fine Wines
Address: 2642 N Campbell Ave, Tucson, AZ 85719, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 12:00 – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 2642 (street_number); North Campbell Avenue (route); Campbell Grant (neighborhood); Tucson (locality); Pima County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85719 (postal_code)
Reviews: We were in town for a UA graduation and stopped into Plaza Liquors Tucson. Wow, the staff there was so friendly and helpful. They are very knowledgeable about their products. They explained what wines would be appropriate for a particular occasion. Also, their knowledge about their bourbon and whiskey was excellent. We let them know we were from out of town and they even gave us some advice on the best local beverages. It was all around a very pleasant visit to their store.; Packed with well-known brands and hidden treasures, staffed by knowledgeable and friendly people, this is a great local business you have to see. Sure, you can use the drive-thru, but walk in and discover your next new favorite libation.; One of the best liquor stores to go to in tucson. Find Emilie. She's very knowledgeable and intelligent about different types of alcohols. It's a mom and pops store so buy local.; I was visiting from out of town and wanted to try some local brews. Plaza was the best place to go, they have several refrigerator cases stocked with local beers, sold individually so you can make your own 4-6 pack. I was able to try 6 different beers made in Tucson! While that is a little pricier, I was not in town long enough to get several 4-6 packs of each beer, and honestly there were a couple I tried that were not my favorite and had I bought more than 1 I would have felt like I wasted my money. If you live in Tucson, it's a wonderful place to try out different brews to get larger quantities elsewhere, if you're on vacation like I was, definitely stop in to experience more of the Tucson beer scene than you normally might on vacation.; What a great experience my wife and I had at Plaza Liquors and Fine Wines.  We were visiting from out of town for an extended and Emily the manager, (such a wonderfully nice and knowledgeable person), spent a considerable amount of time getting to know what we liked, what food we would enjoy with the wine and (very importantly) how much we wanted to spend.  We even came back a second time to stock up for the second leg of our extended trip.  Great selection, great prices and friendly and knowledgeable staff!  We will certainly stop in again when we are in Tucson!

Reviews: Westside Liquor has a surprisingly well-stocked mid to high end whisky/whiskey selection and comparable pricing to Total Wine! The selection at Westside may not be as comprehensive as Total Wine as it is a smaller, locally owned store but what is there has clearly been hand-picked with care.  Also, the sales associate (Nick?) was very friendly and helpful, we will definitely be going back.; I haven't been to this store but have ordered Doordash orders from them. I love the staff. If there is ever an inventory issue, they call you on the phone to work out a solution. Great Customer Service!; Came here for the craft beer and there is absolutely NOTHING. This is essentially a gas station without gas. I was at Safeway before this and had decided we needed a better selection, only to find the exact same selection of craft beers as Safeway. They also advertise “200 craft beer brands” on their sign, I counted a total of maybe 15 different brands. What a joke. Friendly cashier though.; Awesome selection of craft beer: LaCumbre, Revision, Breakside; Probably should be on your top 5 of convenience stores in Tucson with an awesome selection for your weekday or weekends; with a variety of i.p.a.'s, lagers, stouts, wine, local brewed beer, non-alcoholic, along with tequila, rums, gins AND MOST IMPORTANTLY SOME OF THE BEST BOURBONS, WHISKEYS, AND CUSTOMER SERVICE you'll find here on the west. 😉And for everything in between, smoking apparatuses, hats, bandanas, tobacco, and date night, U-Hauls for moving day or a phone plan if you need cell service; theyve got you covered too. WEST SIDE LIQUOR STORE best on the west

Name: Better Business Bureau Serving the Pacific Southwest - Phoenix
Address: 1010 E Missouri Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85014, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Saturday: Closed; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 1010 (street_number); East Missouri Avenue (route); Townhouse Terrace (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85014 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We were locked out of our account due to a dispute with our travel company.  They were holding us ransom for repayment of money we had been refunded.

As a last resort I contacted the BBB actually expecting a long drawn out process  The submission was easy and the result was very timely and efficient  There is also post settlement follow-up to ensure satisfaction  I cannot say enough positive things about their service; I don’t know what I would do without the BBB. They’ve helped me many times resolve problems that I’ve had. It seems like when I do it alone by making several phone calls, or sending letters, I don’t get results. But the minute a person or company receives correspondence from the BBB, they take immediate action to contact me and resolve my issues. Communicating with the BBB is very easy online, and whoever I’ve dealt with has been so nice, and they’ve always kept me up-to-date with my complaints. if I have a problem that I cannot resolve on my own, I’ve always contacted the BBB, filed a complaint, and every single time I’ve gotten results quickly. Believe me, businesses, and people, take the Better Business Bureau very seriously. Do not hesitate for one minute. If you have a problem you can’t solve by yourself, get online and file a complaint.; BBB is great!  I filed a claim against my mortgage company “Servbank”.  I paid my homeowners insurance direct to the insurance company and advised Servbank. I also provided proof, filled out forms to have the escrowed amount removed from my payment. I continued to call, send emails and they continued to say they would make the change but nothing happened.  Finally 4 months later I contacted BBB.  I had no idea what the process would be like but I was at my wits end.  Within a week or so, BBB contacted them and within days, Servbank called me, they refunded my overpayments and removed the insurance portion from my monthly payment.  I am so grateful that BBB exists!  So very helpful :); I filed a complaint with the BBB at Pacific Southwest in Arizona against EOS Fitness Gym for  a refund that I was owed.  The gym ignored my request that I was entitled.   The BBB obviously connected with the proper people from the headquarters of the gym and I received my refund.   I was amazed that I received the refund.  The personnel I spoke with at the BBB were friendly, polite and obviously trained well. I am extremely pleased with the service I received.   A professional organization due to the people they hire.; Wow! Great thanks again for your help with getting the refund. The Better  Business Bureau Serving the Pacific Southwest is the place to get help with problems associated with purchases made online. After getting the runaround from the company for several months, I  contacted  the BBB with my problem. I followed their prompts and gave them the information that was requested. In a matter of days I had my refund. Thanks again for the excellent customer service and honesty.

Name: Bodegas Compostela
Address: 106 Condado Ave, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 12:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: Closed; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 106 (street_number); Condado Avenue (route); Santurce (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Campo Alegre (administrative_area_level_3); Santurce (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00907 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Over priced menu for average food. Seriously the ones that keep giving 5 are you serious? I wouldn’t pay half the amount for that food. I know food trucks and stands with more flavor. Only wine menu by the bottle. No menu for wine by the glass and no cocktail menu. No ambiance. I rather spend my crypto elsewhere. Sorry, chef suggestion less paprika and just a little S&P.  The ones that say beat restaurant in PR doesn’t even make too 50 for me.; A very special and refined dining destination. The owner/chef partners are very conscientious and careful to ensure a refined and customer-focused experience, and as a result I have been told that this restaurant is a frequent and favorite spot for many of the local businessmen and women of the San Juan area. The menu selections for our party of four, although a bit on the pricey side, were outstanding in preparation , presentation, freshness, and seasoning. I had the Bronzino, a special for today, which was expertly cooked moist on the inside, and with a seared crunchy skin. My wife had the octopus which was soft but not mushy. Our tuna appetizer was super-fresh and all dishes were nicely sized but not at all overwhelming. The wine list is extensive, and our waiter recommended an excellent Spanish wine that was a very nice blend that mated well with our entrees. Evidently their wine importing was the original core of their business and they expanded to add a Spanish dining experience over the years. If you want to experience a low-key, refined and  high quality restaurant focused on good food and good wine for the local area (with no attempt to cater to the tourists only), then this is your place.; Absolutely mesmerizing and gorgeous food,  service and overall experience.; This place have a very special place in my heart cause it use to be one of my mother favorites.   She was a spaniard and she always mentioned the how faithful to the spanish heritage was the selection they presented.   Maximino had imprinted a personal and intimate touch in every corner of this beautiful place.
It's diffucult to separate the superb stadard of the cuisine from the friendly elegance of their staff.    Its like a family with high end manners and empathy wich nowadays give them a very exotic added value on this industry.
Wine selection beyond description begining with my favorites from Vinedos y Bodegas Ponce!!
Maximino and everyone at Compostela thanks so much for being there!!!
See you soon!!!
JSanchez; best Spanish restaurant in Puerto Rico, they have been in business for 40 years and they still manage to be revelant and up to date, service is efficient and amicable at the same time, wine list is very interesting and at reasonable prices, it is a fine dining experience with a casual atmosphere

Name: La Cava de Serrallés
Address: CV7V+PHV, C. C, Guaynabo, 00934, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: Closed

Reviews:
La Cava de Serrallés is a distinguished gem for wine lovers, offering an impeccable selection of wines complemented by service that goes above and beyond.  From the moment you enter La Cava de Serrallés, you are swept into an atmosphere of elegance and warmth. The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between luxurious and welcoming, making it an ideal spot for both casual drinkers and connoisseurs.

The wine selection at La Cava de Serrallés is truly exceptional, showcasing a thoughtful curation of local and international bottles. Whether you are in the mood for a robust red, a crisp white, or something sparkling, La Cava has something to suit every palate. The highlight, however, is not just the variety but the quality of the offerings, with each wine chosen to reflect both character and complexity.

What sets La Cava de Serrallés apart is the knowledgeable and attentive staff. Their expertise in oenology is evident as they guide you through each selection, offering recommendations that are tailored to your tastes and preferences. The staff's passion for wine is contagious, making every visit educational and enjoyable. Their recommendations are always spot on, often introducing diners to new wines that perfectly complement their meals and personal taste.

Moreover, the service here is seamless. The staff are not only experts in wine but are also committed to providing outstanding customer care. Every request is met with promptness and a smile, ensuring that each guest feels valued and well cared for.; Great experience! Nice wine selection.; Wonderful. Great customer service. Good prices on the wines. Excellent for small group gatherings.; Amazing service, wide range of wines and rums. Loved the customer service. Great prices, too.; Wine and liquor store, the offer wine tasting and other activities during the year. Good quality products.

Title: A Hidden Gem for the Frequent Explorer

Review:

I recently stumbled upon a hidden gem that has quickly become my go-to spot near the places I frequently visit. Nestled in the heart of the city, this cool place offers a delightful blend of vibrant ambiance, delectable treats, and a refreshing respite from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

Upon stepping through its doors, I was immediately captivated by the stylish decor and cozy atmosphere. The place boasts a modern yet welcoming design, with comfortable seating arrangements and tasteful artwork adorning the walls. The lighting creates an intimate and relaxed setting, perfect for both solitary visits and social gatherings.

Now, let's talk about the food. This place knows how to tantalize taste buds! Their menu offers an impressive array of options, catering to various dietary preferences. From mouthwatering appetizers to hearty mains and delectable desserts, each dish is meticulously crafted with fresh, high-quality ingredients. Whether you're a fan of comfort food or crave something more adventurous, their diverse culinary offerings are sure to satisfy even the most discerning palates.

The staff here are not just attentive; they exude warmth and genuine hospitality. They go above and beyond to ensure every visitor feels welcomed and well taken care of. Whether you need recommendations from the menu or have specific dietary requirements, they are more than happy to accommodate your needs with a smile. The service is prompt, and their knowledge of the menu is impressive, making the dining experience all the more enjoyable.

What sets this place apart is its strategic location. It's conveniently situated near the places I frequently visit, allowing me to seamlessly incorporate it into my routine. Whether I'm exploring nearby landmarks, shopping in the bustling district, or catching up with friends at the nearby cafes, this cool place serves as a cozy retreat and a much-needed escape.

In summary, this hidden gem has become my personal sanctuary amidst the urban chaos. The charming ambiance, delectable food, and attentive service create an irresistible combination that keeps me coming back for more. If you're seeking a cool place to unwind and indulge in delicious treats near your frequented destinations, look no further. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.; Very nice quiet place, lot of Friends and the frigid Heineken you could ever drink; CARJAKERS..THE BEST RUN IN THE WORLD; My place. Lot of friends.; Love it

Seeing other reviews I will share my experience with the service.  I live in the Cupey/Caimito area and order at least twice a week and so far the service has been amazing.  Yes, sometimes they dont have the complete order and they call me to switch some items which I dont really have an issue with.  The rare times in which they are delayed I call and they promptly check and give an answer, maybe they dont have enough delivery people or are actually overwhelmed by the orders, but then again this is a local service, its not uber, lyft or whatever other service you can think of.  And still the longest delay I could remember was around 2 hours, maybe 2.5.

All and all its a great service, maybe not  perfect but they do respond; and regarding refunds Ive never had an issue either.  In my case I order paying through ath movil and the refund is instant especially if you call them with an issue and they do the refund over the phone.

Overall I gave it a 5 maybe its a 4.5 but never a 3 or below.

Thats my 2 cents.; Terrible customer service. 72 hours no response from an incomplete order. Emailed customer service no response. No refund was issued. Now they don’t even respond my phone number, but I called via another number and they quickly responded. Every time we call it’s a new excuse and delay. They keep giving us the runaround about how they’re gonna add a new note in the system to have it settled the next day and nothing is getting done.; My order was placed 3/20/21, 7:45 never delivered, not a text, not a call, absolutelly ...disapointed; It's a Delivery Shopping on line Store and Groceries. Fine Service, Fine Inventory, Nice Customer Service Attention.; My experience so far has been excellent. They even called me because there were some products that were not available and they gave me the option to choose substitutes.

Lots of employees not doing much but talking. Ladies room was in horrible condition. Only one register open.; Self check out is 15 items or less would be fine but have more than 2 regular check outs open!  Sending people over that have 20 items to non self check out and make them wait in a long line is ridiculous.  Good thing Fry's hasn't adopted this stupid rule, they will have my business for now; The person at the bike racks argued with me for 10 minutes. 3rd trip of him messing up and refusing to give me what I asked for. Manager has been notified. I’ve biked to this Walmart three times now in order to get bike tires yet the employee would rather argue with me about him losing his job than let me grab what I need, walk to the front registers, and proceed to check out by myself. It is completely unacceptable for this to have happened. Yet another fail with Walmart and their aggressive employees. I’d love to share a several minute video I took of the employee arguing with me, acting clueless, and not taking any responsibility for his actions. He hides his name tag because I bet he’s reported often.

Trying to order stuff online and your picker failed to allow us replace items. It’s so bad our entire order is messed up. This Walmart is INCOMPETENT. Can’t even cancel our order. They mess up so badly and don’t care it costs us money.

Restrooms are messy every time I come in (pictured below). Staff isn’t productive enough for this high traffic of a store. Here’s some of the more common issues I’ve been noticing.

Today my visit was one of the worst. There were absolutely no bags for self checkout and even though EVERYONE was complaining, no staff brought out more. There was a young man working at self checkouts and refused to do anything about the bag situation. (Pictures below)

Stocking issues especially for deodorant. (Also pictured below) Go to frys instead and use a fuel points card and you’ll get these 6$ deodorants for 2.64 at frys, and they always have it in stock, unlike Walmart, which has been a constant battle. They never have the deodorant I need. I’ve switched brands multiple times but every time I switch, so does Walmart. It’s getting quite annoying.

This store is an honest nightmare. In a previous visit we needed to get some money orders, well nobody knows how to use the money order machine took our money and then wouldn’t print anything so had to waste my time to go to another Walmart to get it printed. We spent approximately 45 minutes at this Walmart just for them to send us away after failing to operate the money order machine.

I will continue to update my review on this Walmart until I’m satisfied as a customer. I think they need to prioritize cleanliness and organization, and we could definitely work on professionalism.

Garden is rarely stocked with any plants don’t even bother checking.; Purchased new tire here. Reasonable prices and good customer service but Cody forgot to put my rim cap back on. I get that the store is in the midst of remodeling, but still. At least the cashiers and greeters were great. That's why I'm giving three stars.

This might be the cleanest Walmart I have ever been in. The staff was all over the store organizing, stocking,  and cleaning. Self checkout is quick and efficient.; This Walmart has undergone a remarkable transformation, and I'm genuinely impressed. What used to be a practical choice for grabbing essentials turned into a more enjoyable experience. The revamped aesthetics have significantly improved the overall shopping environment. Can you guys make sure that your machine works fine so that we don’t have to waste a lot of time just for refilling!; This particular store is clean and spacious. I stopped shopping at Walmart for years but a few items my husband needed and this walmart was beautiful, massive and just so clean. Yesterday I bought chicken and there was not a lot of chicken because it was in the last hour before closing. I discovered that it had expired two days ago. June This is completely inappropriate behavior; I understand it was 11 minutes before close, but I knew exactly what I needed. I have to say thank you you to 2 people who took the time to help me  Jonathan and Amy. I greatly appreciate your help and time. I hope you have a great week!!!; Holy Christmas music, Batman! The music in store was obnoxiously loud, and when I was getting into my car I could still hear the music from the lot. Last but not least, the prices are great! This is the only store I shop at now; This company has closed more than half their self checkout registers so you get to wait around before you check out.
When I commented there must be a supply chain problem getting parts to fix cash registers, the attendant said, "No, corporate decided to close all but 4 registers so PEOPLE WOULD HAVE TO WAIT to encourage them to shop online."
Hideous !  I am boycotting Walmart as of this minute.; This Walmart treats people like trash… unbelievable—- when you strategically approach the rotten employees to make sure you are friendly and cooperative THE EMPLOYEES STILL treat you the worst they can… absolutely unbelievable … I have seen them treat older people good and with laughs to go around… I guess I’ll have to dress up like and old grandma to be helped with respect…: wow,  that will be too much work… I’ll get used to be treated poorly… FOR   NO   REASON.  Think about it-  treating people poorly FOR NO REASON….i hope the employees turn off the “dislike” before they get home after work.; Super favourite place for shopping. Wide range of variety available in all categories. Grocery, pharmacy, clothing, meat and rest all categories are very great. Loved shopping here and very happy with purchase made. My 4 year old loved the Barbie cycle we purchased here. The staff helped us in choosing the best cycle for my kid and checked the condition of the cycle for us. Strongly recommend this store!; Once I’ve arrived and continued my shopping I had been kindly stopped by Kellz, one of the most best Walmart Employees throughout the store, as giving samples of protein shake drinks which was the biggest plus since I was currently in the market for some protein products and didn’t want to waste my time going to GNC, Kellz was the most respectful promoters while giving samples, kept it simple and easy! Which we need a lot more employees like him and his customer service skills is one of the greatest!

It indicated that my order was accepted and yet nothing happened. Very disappointing. How fortunate am I to have the folks at the pharmacy go out of their way to assist!; Refill rules met. Like the drive-thru option. Limited friendly staff and hours of operation. Will go back. Convenient distance for walk-in.; I've never had a problem having my prescriptions filled on time here and I've used them for around 5 years now. Prescriptions wouldn’t get filled, or they’d fill but wouldn’t communicate when it’s available. When I told them you lost a customer they just said “OK” and didn’t try to make up for the constant issues I voiced. Terrible customer service and poor management.

Address: Industrial Tres Monjitas, 207 C. Manuel Camuñas Suite #205, San Juan, 00918, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Saturday: Closed; Sunday: Closed

Address Components: Suite #205 (subpremise); Industrial Tres Monjitas (point_of_interest); 207 (street_number); Calle Manuel Camuñas (route); Hato Rey Norte (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Martín Peña (administrative_area_level_3); Hato Rey Norte (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00918 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This was a last minute addition to our itinerary due to a boat tour cancellation & it was honestly one of our favorite parts of the trip! This spot is small but oh so cute!! We did the tasting experience which included a taste of all the sangrias and THREE full glasses of sangria and a souvenir cup. We ended up getting a glass after the 3 cups because we liked the sangria and vibes so much! It rained a little while we were there but they have a very cute outdoor space. They sell snacks & we got the chicken salad with basil & it blew our socks off, ha. Talked about it the whole rest of the trip. Add this to your next trip to San Juan!!; Booked a Sangria tasting through Airbnb and it was amazing. The Sangria is superb and is only fabricated in Puerto Rico not the mainland so it’s definitely worth tasting and purchasing a bottle to take home. There’s 4 sangria flavors; Stop what you are doing now and go to St. Gria for a Sangria Tasting and snacks! St. Gria was a last minute add-on to our trip to PR and it was by far one our top experiences on our girls trip. Bonus- amazing photo ops as well with fun neon lights and bottle displays. The server Kelis and owner were both so friendly and inviting. But the Sangria is truly something incredible. I had 3 glasses of the Vodka Ginger Sangria and I'm still thinking about it. Please ship to the continental US soon!; Great vibes.
Great flavor.

Hidden gem to have a chat; Excellent; Great taste on every natural flavor.
